review_body: I love this charming little hotel. It is perfect if you want a place that is close to the Broadway district and Restaurant Row but don't want to stay right in the thick of things. It is quiet and on a charming side street. It reminds me of the smaller boutique hotels in Europe. No large scale amenities, but perfectly fine continental breakfast with cappuccino or espresso. Very easy and staff were friendly and helpful.

This gem of a hotel is very well located. Friendly, welcoming staff. Cozy, very clean, comfortable and safe. I will go back and will recommend to others looking for a European style refuge. So happy with my stay.

Super staff with clean rooms and a good shower. We'll placed for town and theatres with plenty of restaurants on the doorstep. The breakfast is limited but adequate. Tea or coffee available all day and cheese and wine served early evening is a nice touch.

My husband and I were looking for a small hotel (no offense, Hiltons of NYC) close to the theater district to celebrate my birthday. We chose Hotel 414 and can’t imagine having picked a better place. We have been coming to New York City for more than 35 years. Hotel 414 is a small, boutique – style, beautifully appointed, cozy venue. The staff truly care that their guests have the best New York experience ever. A thoughtful continental breakfast greets you in the morning, and in the early evening a delightful wine and cheese, all set in a charming communal area by a fire. A quaint little courtyard joins 2 historic residential homes that have been converted into this delightful 22-room hotel. We WILL be back!

My daughter and I have stayed 5 nights in the 414 Hotel. The hotel is only two blocks from Times Square in the Hell’s Kitchen area. Lots of restaurants nearby but the street was quiet. The room was simple but clean and the bed comfortable. You get a simple complementary breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon. There’s no resort fee or deposit of any kind. Friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely stay there again.

This was the 2nd time my husband and I stayed at the hotel and I'm so glad to say that not only did they not disappoint, but that we actually enjoyed our stay even more! The location is very convenient. (Beware, the property does not have an elevator since it is an old tenement building, which, in fact, makes it so much more charming!) Our room was clean and comfortable, we had everything we needed.The atmosphere is very homey, breakfast at a communal table and social hour in the afternoon give you a chance to talk to other guests while sipping your espresso or a nice glass of wine. The staff is remarkably friendly and helpful. Thank you, Ashley, Emmy, Rachel and Jacqui for all the advice and for making our stay very comfortable! An additional special thanks goes to Jacqui for great tips on what and where to eat. We hope to be back soon!

The location (near Times Square but in a quiet street), subway really close.People who worked there are really nice, friendly and helpfull with good advices.The room is clean, the bed is confortable.The atmosphere is so good. You share with the other clients.

great location, very nice and helpful staff, morning breakfast and evening cocktail hour very nice touch. our room would have benefited from a fresh coat of paint and a new carpet . it is a great location!

I do not recommend staying at this hotel. Very loud. Bed uncomfortable. No elevator. If you are looking for a nice place to stay with character or a boutique hotel feel then this is not the place to go. Online reviews not accurate.

My son and I enjoyed an amazing NYC weekend at Hotel 414. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful. The lobby area and room were clean and charming. Delicious coffee and a wine and cheese social hour where we met interesting people from all over the world. What a gem!

This place is so cute. Perfectly located near Restaurant Row and Broadway. It's a great spot - even though it's walkable to Times Square, the block still manages to feel quaint. The room is comfortable and the shower/bath stays hot and has good water pressure. The staff is outstanding. Plenty of options for breakfast, and a little espresso machine. The small lobby has a living room-meets-sidewalk cafe vibe. Would definitely stay again!

We visited NYC for a shopping Bday. We stayed at 414 Hotel and this was clutch. The staff was extremely helpful and made our stay extra special. We would absolutely stay here again. The hotel was conveniently close to the subway. The breakfast was great and the coffee espresso was exceptional.

Fantastic hotel in a quiet location, but still close to everything, with really helpful and welcoming staff. Also liked the little garden in the back and the benches in front.About the stairs: baggage was brought for us in the room by hotel staffI and we could leave luggage after checkout.

Stayed 26th December 2019. The hotel is a good location about 10-15 mins direct walk to Times Square. Very quiet location and you wouldn't think you were staying in a major city at all! Staff were so friendly and extremely helpful. Porter on duty all night so come and go when you ease. A nice hotel to stay!

It is our fourth time in this hotel. Great in all parameters. Friendly. Family like atmosphere. Comes with good breakfast and excellent happy hour and all occur in a small intimate dining room around one big table where u meet and chat with tourists around the world. Being a small place located in a very strategic area of NY is a superb option that u don’t find elsewhere. But most important is the staff - who gives u all these wonderful recommendations and are always for u. We always stay in a deluxe room so I recommend it. Next year we r there again. Already booked

The rooms are comfortable and functional rather than stylish; the foyer is rather cramped; breakfast options are limited. But the welcome is friendly and the staff knowledgeable and eager to please. Fresh coffee and snacks are always available, and the location is superb, in a quiet street only a stone's throw from the action. There is an enjoyable happy hour every evening during which to share experiences with other travellers over a glass of 'free' wine and cheese and biscuits. Fresh coffee and tea are on tap 24/7, and the front desk is staffed through the night. Prices are reasonable in this ridiculously expensive city and excellent dining options abound within 5 minutes' walk. We always prefer small hotels for city breaks. No elevators or long corridors; quick and easy access to the bedrooms. We could hardly have found a better base in NYC.

Great location. Close to everything. Can't say enough about the staff. They were great. Room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The towels were nice and thick. The only con; No elevator. We will be back.

If you're looking for a lovely little hotel, this is my favorite in NYC. Within walking distance of the theater district, many excellent restaurants and easy in-out from Lincoln Tunnel. Great staff, friendly and professional. Nice size rooms for city, good beds and great showers.

Had a lovely stay at 414. Emmie and Jackie were so friendly and welcoming, very refreshing. A few things we noted could be improved on. We believe that most guests overlook these things due to the hotel being unique in its little extra things it has, which is a positive.

We love the 414. The location just steps from Broadway and Times Square plus so convenient to other sights and transport. A quiet street in a safe neighborhood with TONS of food all around. We’ve been coming now off and on for about 5 years. Emmy is an angel and Jacqui is just as fabulous. Any time we have questions, they know exactly where to direct us. They are like family. Clean and quite rooms unlike some major chain hotels in the city where you pay more! Breakfast includes pastries, bagels, espresso, coffee, juice, cocoa, yogurt, cereal, juice. Then there is a free happy hour which includes alcohol! Guests mingle in the lobby from around the world sharing their day. It really is like home here. We love it.

We had the pleasure of staying at this small boutique 414 Hotel in New York City - it's an excellent location in Hell's Kitchen with a 5 minute walk to Times Square. The staff are amazing, incredibly helpful and friendly and couldn't do enough to make our stay fun. They offer a social hour late afternoon so you get to meet other residents which makes the experience even more relaxing. Highly recommed you stay there.

Good location near Times Square. Rooms clean and comfy. Staff excellent. Lovely social hour each evening for guests with free wine and snacks. Breakfast provided. Relaxed atmosphere and a help yourself policy.

First time in NY and this hotel was recommended to me. So glad I listened! Super cute hotel, amazing location, comfortable bedding and room and the people who work there are fantastic. Shout outs to Rachel, Emmy and Jackie. You guys made my trip that much sweeter!

My wife and I came to NYC for her birthday. After spending numerous days trying to find the right hotel (price, locations, reviews) I came across 414 Hotel. What can I say ....... one word ..... SUPERB! The hotel isn’t the most glamorous or the newest, but what it offers are clean rooms with very comfy beds that has all the amenities you need (including a great shower), great continental breakfast that is free and plentiful, social hour including lovely red wine with cheese and crackers every evening, superb location and the most welcoming staff you are likely to meet. Hospitality is second to none. Honestly I would only ever recommend here and I’ve been to NYC four times now. Thanks to everyone who made our stay perfect, including the very kind bottle of champagne for my wife’s birthday. It was truly an amazing place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone!!

My wife and I stayed at his hotel and walked everywhere! Right beside the theatre district and surrounded by restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen. Staff was outstanding and friendly. It is an old hotel the rooms are clean and provides a very social atmosphere. The webpage fully disclosed there is no elevator but beat go with an open mind with the rooms as previously mentioned the hotel is very old which is reflected in the accommodations. Other than that we enjoyed our visit.

Hotel staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the city. She gave us a bunch of great eateries to try and we tried most of them. Great accomodations as well. We would definitely stay here again.

Believe the reviews--the 414 is perfection! We managed to score an amazing deal on our room for a long weekend, and now I don't ever want to stay anywhere else in the City. The location in Hell's Kitchen is spectacular--literally across 9th from "Restaurant Row", and within a very short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and so many other places. The hotel is a traditional walk-up--so not suited for everyone, but the extra exercise is probably not a bad thing after the included (!) wine/cheese "social hour" (or more like a couple of hours)...and sitting by the fireplace, chatting with other guests, was also delightful. Breakfast is included, too...and a great cappuccino machine always at the ready. The rooms are huge (per NYC standards), clean, and surprisingly quiet. They even provide a mini fridge with a few sodas/water, plus a small selection of snacks, replenished daily--for only $1 each (which is practically free, especially by hotel norms)! All of those amenities are wonderful, but the real pleasure of staying at the 414 is the staff! Everyone we met was beyond friendly and helpful--they obviously care about ensuring their guests have an excellent stay, and they're quite knowledgeable about the area. There's truly nowhere else we'd rather stay in NYC than here...and frankly anywhere else we stay in any other city is going to pale by comparison!

We loved the location of 414 Hotel. Our room was quiet, the hotel staff was very helpful and attentive, and the cappuccino machine was a nice perk. We enjoyed the wine and cheese each evening before going to Broadway shows and dinners. While the bed was not very comfortable, the sheets and bedding were fine, the towels and amenities were great, and the room was a decent size for NYC. We'd definitely stay there again!

We were looking for a place to stay in Hell's Kitchen, 414 is in the center of the action!! Charming ambiance and spacious room. Bed was comfy and everything very clean. The continental breakfast and wine happy hour are really nice touches. There is some construction going on with a nearby building, some noise in the morning. Highly recommend!!

Room clean, within a few blocks from anything, decent neighborhood - no shortage of good places to eat. The hotel seemed to have a European flavor to it - on the smaller side with bed/breakfast type atmosphere with a late afternoon wine/cheese social hour where you could chat with other people staying at the hotel and compare notes as to fun experiences. The hotel hosted many from the UK and France in addition to the US, which made for lively conversation. The staff was very nice and helpful. It was probably as close to having the experience of living in NYC as you can without actually paying rent. For those in the US used to chain hotels off freeway exits, just a few caveats that shouldn’t dissuade you from picking this hotel, but that you should know. Some rooms are slightly smaller than your average Holiday Inn Express. We had three in our room and things where just a little tight. Also - no elevator. Staff will help with your bags, but people with trouble transversing steps should be aware. Absent those two points, we had no problems, would recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

Small, friendly hotel with terrific amenities; great location; great value. Room was clean; bed comfortable; and staff very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the happy hour and breakfast gatherings in the lobby where we enjoyed meeting guests from all over the world while enjoying the warmth of the fireplace. We had a lovely stay.

The hottie is in a great location. Staff members are very friendly and helpful. Complementary cheese and wine from 17:00 to 19:00.Continental breakfast. Complementary coffee, tea, espresso and cappuccino around the clock.

5 Stars to this awesome little jewel of a hotel. The rooms are extremely clean, white and fresh. It's close to the Theater district and restaurants! I will return whenever staying in New York! the staff from exceptional and very friendly. Thank you so much for your hospitality!

I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location was ideal for us. The staff was so helpful. The room was very sizable for New York, and very quiet (we were off the street past the courtyard). Lots of good selections for breakfast. We were even provided with a Via ride voucher by one of the staff (thanks, Emmy!). All for a very reasonable price. We look forward to returning soon.

Arrived for a 5 night stay for my wife's 50th birthday. We chose this hotel based on other reviews and were not disappointed. The location is two blocks (5-10mins) from Time Square and convenient for many attractions and the Metro. We were in Room 305 which was in the back of the building, which made it a very quiet room, with no street noise. Although considering the proximity to Time Square you are actually in a quiet residential street. The light breakfast set us up for the day and the cheese and wine hour was an excellent way of socialising with other guests and obtaining hints on what to do when visiting places. Staff were all very friendly and were happy to give you recommendations on restaurants and how to get the best out of your visit.If visiting New York would certainly use this hotel again.

My wife and I celebrated our honeymoon in New York. The location of the hotel was great, close to the theatre district and convenient to get the metro uptown or downtown. Very warm, friendly welcome at the hotel and the daily social hour was a really nice touch! Our room was quite spacious with good amenities. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel generally quiet so we had no trouble at all sleeping. All in all a great experience, would definitely recommend.

My husband and I spent a few days in NYC so that he could attend a photo convention and to visit relatives. The 414 was located near theaters and walking distance to the convention center as well. The king bed room was much larger than any Manhattan hotel I have ever stayed at. The complimentary breakfast was a great addition as well as the wine and cheese happy hour. We would definitely stay there again when we return to the city.

Greaaaaaaaat place!!!!!”In a quiet and safe neighborhood, just ten minutes walk to Times Square, bus stops and subway very close, a friendly and great place for a stay in New York. Rooms are quiet, very clean and I fell in love with the extremely comfortable bed! Friendly staff. Thank you one more time to Jacqui, Emmy, Rachel and everybody: you love, know the city and are always ready to share this with your guests! The only issue? No lift but very helpful staff to bring my luggage up to the room.

All the staff is super friendly. Always with a smile and well predisposed to any query. Making very good recommendations. In the afternoon they offer a happy hour with wines and cheeses.The location is fabulous !!The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms comfortable and clean.But overall the experience was very, very good and without hesitation we would return on our next stay in NYC.Special thanks to Jacqueline, she made us feel at home as well as all her staff.

I've stayed solo in hotels plenty of times but this is the first time I've felt like a part of a little family. Each night there was a social hour where guests could put up their feet in the lobby, have nibbles, and chat. Most people participated on most nights and it was a great way to meet people. The room was spacious for New York and in great condition. The bathroom even had a tub! The staff were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful on where to go in the city and how to get there. It was a wonderful stay.

My husband and I came to the city for a couples vacation. 414 hotel was recommended to us by some friends. We really enjoyed this cute, charming hotel. It was very convenient to everything that we were planning to visit. We walked to all shows that we attended, Time Square, Central Park and restaurants. This is a great hotel if you want to be close to everything but not be in the hustle bustle of Time Square. It was very clean and comfortable.

We had a clean, light, front-facing room (avoid the smaller rooms out back), with healthy light breakfast and endearing wine and cheese ‘social’ evening welcome, all of which make this a good choice. They even offered umbrellas when those North Easter winds brought heavy rain. The little hotel is well situated close to Times Square but not to the noise, tourists and traffic. Staff gave good tips about local interest spots and allowed us to take coffee up to our room (no tea making facilities en suite). The bathroom products were nothing special, but we travel with our own hair products so that was no big deal.

Lot of restaurants and bars in the street’s hotel making noise.The location is good to access the attractions, is close to Times Square. The building is nice and the staff very friendly. The breakfast could be better.

We stayed at 414 Hotel in New York City the night before our cruise. Location was excellent as it was on a side street, so 'NYC noise' was minimized. We were 'welcomed' and I DO mean welcomed by Jackie, who was always very pleasant and helpful, giving our plenty of recommendations for local places. The wine tasting in the evening and breakfast were quite nice also. Bed was great too!

It is the second time we stayed here.The place is clean, the service is great, the location is less than 10 min walk to the Time Sq.I have only two small complaints.1. This year we booked a Premier Queen Room because we needed to a roll-away bed.The roll away bed was a bit flimsy, and the room was not bigger than a normal Queen Room.2. The breakfast room/lobby is very small and because a large group of German tourists occupied it for long periods of time, there was not enough space for tables and chairs for the other guests during the breakfast or the happy hour.All being said, we recommend this hotel for location, service and being good value for money.

The friendly, personal and attentive service creates a warm and welcoming atmosphere that is, in our experience, rare in a big city. The hotel is relatively small and the lovely touches, such as the evening social time with cheese and wine, create a great sense of community with guest from different countries. The location is excellent, just 10 minutes from Times Square. We wouldn't now stay anywhere else if we return to NYC!

Loved our stay here at the 414. Hotel is in a beautiful old building and has lovely staff. The social time is a great opportunity to meet other guests and is a great idea that other hotels could do with. Great location, close to Times Square, theatre district and Central Park. Thanks especially to Rachel and Emmy who were so friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend it here

414 is in a perfection location for visiting theaters, restaurants, and sites in NYC! The room are comfortable and quiet. The 5:30 wine/cheese hour is nice and the morning cappuccino and bagels for breakfast are great.

We had a wonderful time visiting New York and staying at the 414 Hotel made a big difference. The staff was always welcoming and very helpful. Emmy went beyond the call of duty by taking our 2 suitcases upstairs when it arrived late (it arrived a day after we arrived in New York due to the airline messing up). We loved the location because we could easily walk to the plays we saw and it was also easy to get to the metro and Times Square. Many of the people we met in the lobby during Happy Hour were from the UK. So it felt like an international experience. The beds were very comfortable too. We would definitely recommend it and would stay here again. It is the best.

The 414 was recommended by our travel agent and it was fantastic.It is a small place but right in the heart. The rooms are a good size. The breakfast of cereal toast pastries and coffee was great.The staff were excellent.My only negative comment is there is no lift. We were on the four floor and this was the beginning of a month long trip so we did have a lot of luggage but the staff helped carry it up and down when we checked out. I highly recommend the 414, we will be back to stay again

I loved this hotel! Small, and with staff who were friendly and warmly welcomed you. The hotel is ideally situated for the theatre district, Central Park and Times Square. Buses, subway are all nearby. The hotel is clean, rooms are bright and have great amenities as well as being quiet! The happy hour was such a lovely way to meet up with fellow travellers and find out more, especially being a solo traveller. The daily bulletin of what was on was also really helpful. Loads of restaurants and bars nearby, it really was an idyllic oasis. Go and enjoy!

Amazing nice small hotel in midtown. Very good service, good breakfast. Nice rooms, which were big enough for NYC. Amazing friendly staff. After check out we got all the time to work and drink coffee etc.Really a little gem.

WE stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September 2019 and had a great time. The hotel is situated in a nice area with only a ten minute walk to Times Square. Other attractions are also within walking distance. You wont go hungry as there are dozens of restaurants and bars in the area. Make sure you are back at the hotel for happy hour where there is wine and cheese and crackers supplied and you get to meet and talk with your fellow guests. This was the favourite part of my stay. I recommend this hotel highly.

Loved our stay here, very friendly staff, great breakfast, clean rooms, perfect location to go to broadway shows or enjoy the quieter areas at the river. Small details like a great selection of complimentary teas, a small book exchange or the get-together with wine and cheese make the stay perfect.

This is a small independent hotel in a great location for visiting all the attractions in NYC. The staff could not have been more helpful. The continental style breakfast was enough to get you through a morning of sightseeing and the complimentary evening cheese and wine socials provided a great opportunity to meet other guests and exchange advice and experiences. The room was bigger than we expected having been told that NYC hotel rooms were notoriously compact and although the decor was a bit worn it was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend to friends.

We stayed in the 414 for four nights to complete our USA trip and another great choice. Small, clean, friendly great located hotel in Hells Kitchen area of NYC, ideal for Broadway theatre's, Times Square, subway transport and surrounded by restaurants and bar's that came reccomended by the hotel staff and they did not disappoint. From our arrival at 2am to leaving, you couldn't ask anymore from any of the helpful friendly staff, rooms are large and very clean if somewhat a tad tired looking, breakfast is adequate but cramped, wine and cheese evening is a great touch to unwind after a hard day out or before venturing out again and, getting to talk to other guests from all around the world. Would i stay here again, yes and would recommend rather than larger corporate hotels I've stayed in before in NYC. Thanks for making our stay great

What a fantastic place to stay, Jacqui and her staff go that extra mile to make sure everyone has a fabulous stay in New York. The hotel is situated in Hell’s Kitchen, close to Broadway, restaurants, bars and all of New York’s main attractions. It was raining on the first night of our holiday and as we were about to leave, in walked Rachel to start her shift. Rachel immediately offered my wife her umbrella due to the rain outside, from that moment on, I knew we had chosen the right hotel.We stayed in room 205 in the back courtyard. The room was a decent size with a large bathroom and was spotlessly clean. The bed very comfortable, ensuring we got a good night’s sleep, after all the walking to the attractions this brilliant city has to offer.Jacqui and her staff are very courteous, friendly and knowledgeable. They will offer advice on which attractions to see and the best time to go to avoid the queues, and help with reservations.The free continental breakfast has a variety of fruit juice, cereals, toast and jam, bagels and yogurts and the social evening from 5.30pm – 7.00pm offers craft beer, red and white wine plus a selection of cheese and biscuits, all free of charge. Everyone is encouraged to go and share their tips and stories of their day with the other guests of the hotel. We are already planning our next visit New York and without doubt, we will be staying at 414 Hotel.

So glad we stayed here for our 6 night city break. Cosy, independent hotel with fabulous customer service, good size rooms and such a comfortable bed!Nothing was too much trouble and they really seem to enjoy interacting with their guests.This small hotel is in a great location for exploring the city and feels that it’s located in an authentic part of New York with so many restaurants and bars surrounding it. We will definitely be back and will recommend to friends and family.

We liked staying in a smaller hotel in a quieter street but close enough to the subway for getting round. We were aware that the hotel didn’t have a lift/elevator but it was tiring walking to top floor after a busy day sightseeing in NY so I would urge people to remember that when requesting rooms on 3rd or 4th floors. The breakfast was much better and more plentiful than many I’ve experienced and the wine & cheese evening is a lovely touch. Our only comment is that the communal space where breakfast and wine & cheese are served is too small and it can be difficult finding somewhere to sit. We would consider 414 Hotel again for future visits

Jacqui, Emmy and the team were excellent hosts..very friendly and welcoming..great ideas on things to do in New York.And the evening cheese and wine provided a fabulous time to get to know other guests, unwind and share experiences.

We stayed in room 206 which overlooks the inner courtyard and is one of their premiere queen rooms. The room was very clean and comfortable and is exactly as presented on their site. (No surprises) It was so nice to have that break from the noise and hustle of downtown even though you are a short 5 minute walk away. For people visiting New york for the first time you will love the time the staff will give you for restaurants recommendations, directions etc etc. They are like having your personal travel agent on site. The common area gatherings in the evening and mornings are very enjoyable and you will enjoy a very family like atmosphere. It is kind of like a B&B plus. Would not hesitate to return

We could not have been more pleased with our stay. We made our reservations 9 months in advance, based on the location, perceived value and reviews on TripAdvisor. We were in touch with the staff a few times before our visit as they were extremely responsive to our questions, offered suggestions and even made our reservations for a car to pick us up from the airport, and get us back after our stay. From the moment we walked into the lobby, the staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay. The cozy feel of the lobby and courtyard created an inviting atmosphere to get to know the other Guests while enjoying the breakfast or wine and cheese in the evening. While neither of these offerings are meant to replace a meal, we found them to be a great option that allowed us to better budget our other activities throughout the week, as we didn't need huge meals (which get expensive). The proximity to Restaurant Row, the Theatre District, Times Square and the Hudson put us right in the middle of almost everything we wanted to do. Traveling to other areas, such as Battery Park and the 9/11 Memorial was a quick ride via Lyft/Uber/Juno/etc... or a subway ride. Central Park is within walking distance as well, which also put us close enough to walk to the Lincoln Center and The Met.We stayed for 8 nights, but by the 2nd day we were already texting family and friends to recommend they book their next visit at the 414 Hotel. The only consideration for some, is that there is no elevator so be prepared for stairs or plan far enough in advance that you might be able to request one of the first floor rooms.We will be back!

Staff are friendly and very informative and caring. Location cannot be better. We prefer the smaller size and more cozy atmosphere and we certainly didn’t mind the stairs. This is a hotel with a heart.

I prefer comfort to charm so this hotel missed the mark for us. We had no daylight in our room. It was old and adequate for one night. Staff was exceptional. Wine/cheese reception and breakfast were a bit lacking. It's possible that another room would have been better.

Awesome and amazing Hotel with regard to Location ,Service , Friendly and caring staff ...Nice breakfast, 24x7 Amazing Complimentary coffee and wonderful Happy Hour . Simply AMAZING. Thanks very much . You are all wonderful and made our day .Lovely and caring and ever helping staff and host

We needed a reasonably priced hotel for a last minute trip on a busy holiday weekend. We found the 414 which is very different from the typical hotels that we usually stay at in the city, but from the moment we walked in, we were very impressed. They had all the basics down, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was huge by NYC standards. But what's special about 414 is that hotel is small, and the level of service that you receive reflects that. Every staff member that we encountered was attentive, friendly and helpful. You really get personalized service. They have a lovely little courtyard that is quiet and comfortable, it was a perfect space for me to get some work done. The free continental breakfast offered a good variety of food and there was honest-to-God good free hotel coffee (a true rarity). They had had snacks and sodas in the room for only $1 each which is a huge plus when traveling with a kid. The location is wonderful (a less than 10 minute walk to Times Square) on a lovely little block with a playground that my son really loved. We will definitely consider the 414 the next time we visit NYC.

After activities in the city it was nice to come back to a quiet, comfortable hotel for a wine and cheese social hour before heading out to dinner! And only a few short blocks from all you want to do! Friendly, welcoming staff at a quaint boutique hotel!

14 room hotel - perfectly located close to Times Square on Restaurant Row and at the entrance to Hell's Kitchen. Walkable to the Highline and Central Park. Clean decent sized rooms - we were on the third floor in a deluxe queen room. We arrived about 10am and checked our bags. No elevator but our bags were in our room when we returned. Continental Breakfast included an espresso machine. Happy hour with limited wine and been was a great way to talk to other guests and trade recommendations. Desk Staff - particularly Jacquie - were very helpful and friendly. It felt more like a bed and breakfast than a hotel. Off the main path but close to everything you want to see in Midtown.

Stayed here for a couple of nights in July, and I'm so glad we did. Welcoming staff, a wonderful breakfast/happy hour, and a PERFECT location. You're steps away from wonderful restaurants, Broadway theatres and Times Square. The rooms were large for NYC, and the complimentary champagne was a nice touch. We'll most definitely stay again! :)

Location is perfect! Convenient walk to anywhere or the subways.Jacqui and the staff go above and beyond to make certain everything is perfect from the moment you walk thru the red door. The room is very clean. Social hour is fun & inviting. The light breakfast provided is a great start to the day. The happy birthday personal touches in our room were very much appreciated. Looking forward to our return to 414!

Wanted a hotel close the the Al Hirschfeld theatre to see Moulin Rouge. This was a great spot. The staff was friendly, helpful and even took the bags they were holding for us to our room when it was ready. The room and bed were very comfortable, and the shower had nice water pressure. They did offer a happy hour but we had to miss it, although we did partake in the light continental breakfast they provided in the morning. Very relaxed atmosphere, which feels like coming home to a sanctuary after the hustle and bustle of a busy NYC day.

I have stayed in many hotels in NYC but none of them were like 414 Hotel.Pro's: Close to Times Square but far enough to remove yourself from the crowds. * Within walking distance to the subways and public transportation. * Customer service is outstanding, everyone was so friendly and helpful.  *Smaller hotel with rooms that are good size for NYC * Free breakfast, amazing coffee. * Happy hour with white and red wine, and assorted cheese and crackers. * Backyard courtyard during the warmer seasons, sitting area in lounge, and benches in front of the building. * Great rates Cons:  * No elevator if steps are a problem for you, but the staff will carry your bags to and from your room.I will be back at this hotel again next time I visit NYC!!!!!

This was a perfect stay. My daughter, friend and myself stayed 5 nights. First location -The hotel is in a perfect location to go anywhere in NYC. It is on a neighborhood block so it is very quiet.  Second atmosphere - You walk into a quaint sitting area where guest gather for breakfast and happy hour. Guest and employees share stories and advice on where to go in NYC. The hotel is old but it is extremely clean and welcoming. The stairs are narrow but the staff is happy to help you if needed. The room was very comfortable. The ac worked perfectly. The extra bed cot was comfortable as well. Third hotel staff - I have never met a hotel where everyone on the staff was cheerful, helpful and made you feel important. I noticed a lot of guests were frequent return guests and often got hugs and a welcome back when they came in.  I highly recommend this hotel!!

Love staying at 414 because of the comfortable atmosphere. The location is perfect for shows, and eating out. The staff treats you like an old friend. The breakfast saves you some $ and we always enjoy the afternoon wine and cheese. Our go to in NYC.

Obviously, 414 Hotel is situated within easy access of everything New York. The professional staff is ready to help with any needs. Truly, we can’t stay enough about the staff. Collectively, they will go out of their way to accommodate visitors needs. A wonderful breakfast and a friendly happy hour are provided daily. Rooms are spotlessly clean, very quiet and relatively small but perfect for a short term stay. You will feel right at home at 414!!

We loved the location, the staff, the attention to details. The room was spacious and clean and well-appointed, and the morning coffee was terrific. Loved it and I can't say enough good stuff about 414.

We stayed at the 414 Hotel for 4 nights in late July 2019. The hotel was fantastic, and the staff were wonderful and very helpful. We really enjoyed the complimentary drinks and appetizers during happy hour each night. The hotel is located right on restaurant row, and you can easily walk to many NYC sights and landmarks. We'll be back!

NO ELEVATOR - There, you have been warned . If you book there and complain about no elevator you are an idiot !It is a 3 star with only queens and good window AC's . No gym , business or meeting rooms and the stairs are steep . Now the rest - PERFECT !Ideally located just a couple of blocks from the craziness of time square , this boutique hotel (24 rooms total) was an urban oasis . Rooms are comfortable , breakfast is included and the staff couldn't be more welcoming . We arrived at 10 and they offered us bottled water and stored our luggage . When we returned at 2 , they had placed our bag in our room and we checked in . Staff was always helping guests get tickets , reservations or dispensing travel advice . By NYC standards , very reasonably priced . Now the best - Social hour ! Every day at 5ish they serve up wine , beer , drinks as well as cheese and nibbles at no charge . The guests gather and traded stories and NYC tips . A wonderful shared experience . Lovely !

Location is great, just a 3 minute walk from Times Square, a 4 minute walk to train, subway, and bus stations. All around are great nightlife options, food joints for any budget. Breakfast is simple, with cereal, fruit, and juice. Room is much larger than the average Manhattan size.Staff is helpful for transportation, food and nightlife recommendations.You can leave your luggage at reception after checkout

A great location. You can walk to a lot of entertainment and a short walk to the river . Bring comfortable shoes!! You will enjoy the staff ,breakfast and social hour .This is the 2nd time we have stayed at 414, We brought our daughter and husband this time and they loved it too.

From the moment we walked in, we felt like honored guests. This is not a new hotel, and not modern. But the earnest and welcoming nature of the staff was exceptional and set the tone for a great stay. They were helpful, accommodated a variety of requests we had, and gave us great recommendations for new things to explore. We had arrived before check-in and went out for lunch, and upon our return we were touched to find our luggage and previously-shipped formal dress waiting for us in our room. A small gesture but above and beyond your typical experience.The standard rooms are bigger than most NYC hotels I've enjoyed in this price range. Being able to put luggage in one part of the room and still have a clear path to walk around cannot be understated. Didn't feel like a hotel room. Bed was too firm for me, but your mileage may vary. Quiet and cold A/C, nice TV and cable channels, large bathroom. Complementary sparkling wine and SNACKS FOR $1. Yes, a mini-can of Pringles for one dollar in a New York City hotel. Breakfast was modest but sufficient, the free happy hour had nice booze and great snacks. For comparison, we stayed at a newer hotel later that week for a similar price. Rooms were super modern but so very tiny. Like, "there's no place for my luggage and we can't get to our clothes and I'm angry" tiny. I missed our room at 414 Hotel :) We'll go back.

We loved our stay at 414! Great location, quaint place, and outstanding service. The hotel is so close to so many things but is also nice and quiet. The room was very clean and comfortable and everyone that worked there was super friendly and helpful. We’ll definitely stay there again.

Not impressed. Avoid the ground level rooms near the back patio. They are marketed as deluxe on the website, but are actually slightly below ground and smell musty. There is no view or sunshine. You can't even open the curtains, unless you want people looking down into your room. The room look dated and had a very depressing motel vibe.

This was our first stay at a NYC boutique hotel which we booked because of a deal on Travelzoo. Our room was on the 3rd floor, and the hotel has no elevator. This was an issue when we had walked 10+ miles a day around the City and then returned to the hotel exhausted! Our room was small and old, but very clean. I prefer new hotels, so it wasn’t my style. No counter space in bathroom. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast in the morning and cocktails at night were a nice touch. Not real close to a Metro stop. The best part of the hotel was the staff. They were so friendly and accommodating.

The 414 hotel is a cute and friendly hotel. Staff was friendly and so helpful. Check-in was quick and easy. The room was clean, modern, and had a mini refrigerator. Location is in the premier gay neighborhood and is convenient and safe! Close to transit, Restaurant Row, and the Theatre District. Will be back!

I feel like I'm in a small town at the 414. The staff is incredibly helpful ("How's your day going?" "Did you like that play?" "Do you need help with anything?") They offer free continental breakfast (great coffee and scones included) and wine and cheese in the afternoon. Socializing with other guests make for some great suggestions of things to do and connections over travel, the arts, name your passion. The only drawback is most of the hotel is up a flight of stairs, but the staff always offers to carry my bags, so it's not really a problem. My room has always been incredibly quiet, has great air conditioning and really comfortable beds, real pluses for NY City. It's 1 1/2 blocks to Times Square. We love it there and will return to the 414 Hotel next trip.

Found this gem of a hotel on a Travelzoo special. It’s a small boutique hotel with no elevator. I knew I wouldn’t get the best room because of the special, but I got a nice room, except for the location, which was by the front desk, which made it rather noisy. Our room abutted the adorable little I courtyard, which was only a problem when the really loud people decided to sit out there and yack after 11 pm. The front desk asked them to quiet down. I thought there should be signs asking people to keep it down out there after a certain time. I don’t mind noise till 10 or so usually, but I was tired from traveling. Pros on the hotel: wine and cheese hour 5:30-7 was great! Continental breakfast and champagne in our room, great. Staff was outstanding. Room was very clean, great water pressure and plenty of hot water. Good location in vibrant neighborhood. Great temperature control in room. Cons: suggest you try and get a room not on the first floor. Room very small, so might not be for anyone used to a large hotel room.

Booked this for my husband and I. Rooms are large by NYC standards. Air conditioner in each room which guests control. Staff is extremely friendly and so are the other guests. Met wonderful people. Great location - close to Times Square, broadway shows, but without the crowds and noise. Free breakfast in mornings with coffee, teas, bagels, pastries, fruit etc. wine hour in evening was great before heading to a play. Any question we had about NYC the hotel staff had excellent recommendations to guide us. Super comfortable bed and pillows. For real. You won’t be disappointed. Note there is no elevator and rooms go up to the fourth floor. Do not bring a lot of luggage. Thank you to 414 Hotel for the amazing accommodations.

Stayed here end of July 2018 with family as daughter was getting married they had stayed here before. Staff couldn’t of been more accommodating and nothing was a bother to them. Rooms immaculate, great A/C. Refreshments available 24/7, wine and cheese evenings. Great selection for breakfast. Front of hotel was a great place to sit and people watch. Great location. Staff made everything personal and made sure everything went to plan for Jodies special day.

Want convenience in Mid-Town Manhattan? A staff that makes you feel like family and are eager to help with everything possible to make your stay an experience you won't forget? A lovely well air conditioned lobby with snacks and good coffee and cold water all day long? A personal concierge service for getting anywhere you want to go? If you are ok climbing stairs to your clean and comfy room, than you want to stay here.

We found this boutique hotel to be all that we had expected.The room was great for our 2 night stay. It was very clean and comfortable, including a large bathroom with bath/shower, a perfectly adequate breakfast was provided also.All staff were very friendly, knowledgable and helpful.As this was our first trip to New York, we found that the location made it very easy to find our way, and so managed to visit most of the main attractions on foot during our short time there.Highly recommend.

Wonderful personalized service ice typifies this property. Everyone went out of their way to be accommodating. Small rooms but great AC and plumbing, things you don’t alway find in a NYC boutique hotel. Good location. Add good prices for NYC and you have a wonderful value.

This hotel exceeded every expectation. Starting with the staff who do everything they can to make their stays great. Shout outs to Adonis and Emmy especially. The room was spotless, the bathroom well appointed, the bed comfortable. What takes it over the top? Wine & cheese hour, a kitchen fully available to guests, and a serious NY breakfast- all included. But honestly, the staff alone makes it worth the price. Can’t wait to go back!

This was an unexpected surprise having stayed mostly in high rise logo hotel's. The staff, Adanes in the morning and Emmy late afternoon and evening, could not be more helpful and friendly. A Continental Breakfast and Social Cocktail (wine even though I saw some Vodka) event every was a plus. The coffee and espresso machine was rewarding The room was perfect for our 2 night stay. I would have given this review an additional plus if it was not for the loud air conditioning unit in our room. Some might find the stairs a little difficult, but after all the food we ate, it was perfect exercise and not that bad. Definitely will return.....

Had parents coming in traveling from the Midwest and could not have had a quieter and more quaint hotel in the middle of everything. Service was excellent and the rooms were a good size for NYC. Has free breakfast, cocktail hour and a wonderful cheese plate. Will definitely stay here again!

Great little hotel on a quiet street. 1.6 mile walk on the high line to the Chelsea market and just blocks from the theater district. Cocktail hour and breakfast are included, room was comfortable and very clean. Could not have asked for a better place to spend the night. We will be back!

As much as we enjoyed NYC finding 414 Hotel was the icing on the cake. Location, staff, common room, and the espresso machine! WOW! We met new friends in the coffee area, exchanging experiences etc....We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Excellent botique hotel! Quiet yet in heart of midtown Manhattan. The breakfast selection was decent and the happy hour quite nice. It was like having your own apartment within the hotel structure. Would love to stay there again!

What a wonderful little gem of a hotel in a great location, within easy walking distance of the Theatre District, a multitude of restaurants with a nice range of prices, MOMA, Central Park, Grand Central, Hudson River attractions, etc. The hotel itself is like something in Paris, convenient to so much and yet a feeling of being away from the crowds and bustle on a quiet block near Hell’s Kitchen.

A friend of mine suggested we stay at 414 Hotel during a recent visit to NYC and I owe that friend a gigantic "thank you" for the suggestion. I could tell from my first telephone call to the hotel that this was going to be a different experience from a usual NYC hotel stay. The staff person who answered my call was absolutely lovely and extremely helpful. Upon check-in that same amazing level of hospitality and attention to detail was evident during our entire three day stay. Our room was off a very cute interior courtyard. The bed was comfy and the room was spacious and clean. The location of 414 can't be beat, as it is near the Theater District, but just far enough off the beaten path in Hell's Kitchen, to be away from the sometimes maddening crowds of Times Square. It is now our go-to hotel in NYC. Amazing.

414 Hotel is a good alternative to larger chain hotels. It had a European feel and the included breakfast in the morning was a plus. The location was good, the room was very clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. We would return here.

The hotel and rooms were simple but comfortable. The location is wonderful- situated close to Times Square and lots of activity in central Manhattan, but a couple blocks away where things are much quieter and less busy. The hotel staff we met, which was about five different people during our three day stay, were ALL WONDERFUL! They were so welcoming, hospitable, helpful, and attentive. Breakfast is simple but gets the job done! Wonderful happy hour each night!

This is an older property with no elevator. We were on the first floor so it was not a problem for us. If we visit New York again we will stay here but get a room with a king bed. We felt a bit tight. Social hour is a nice touch.

Had the pleasure of staying at 414 after a Broadway show and couldn’t have been more pleased. This is a small boutique hotel that feels like a bed & breakfast. Welcoming staff, clean, comfortable bed with fresh bathroom. The added wine & cheese social hour, continental breakfast, and free WiFi make this a favorite! Close to restaurants and Broadway shows, we will definitely be back! Thank you!

Great location, great room, but the 414's best asset is the staff. They were so friendly and helpful. Recommended places to visit and eat, booked trips for us and encouraged us to use the subway which enhanced our overall experience. Included in the room price was breakfast which really set us up for the day ahead. There was also cheese and wine every evening where guests can meet each other. The best thing we can say about the 414 is that it was home from home, just perfect.

Check in was a breeze. Breakfast was clean, fresh, and easy. The room itself was spacious, clean, updated, and quiet. The bed was comfortable as well as the pillows. The bathroom likewise. There are only a few rooms in the hotel, so you're not dealing with a bunch of hoodlums.

We've traveled to New York/Broadway for more than 35 years and not found a more pleasurable place to stay. The staff is always friendly and caring AND they go out of their way to make sure that every need you have gets taken care of. We LOVE the 414. Thanks for making your home OUR home every time we visit.

Very pleasant small hotel with a B&B feel. Kind staff. Nice amenities. Well located. Good value. We enjoyed the complimentary wine and cheese and complimentary breakfast. Was nicely positioned between Hell's Kitchen and the Broadway theatre district.

This charming hotel is a gem on the best block in the city. The staff is the friendliest I've ever experienced in NYC or otherwise. The room was clean and much larger than expected. When I asked for a roll-away, it was immediately delivered free of charge. The breakfast - that is included - was perfect as well.

I absolutely love this hotel! The staff is attentive, welcoming and very hospitable. My wife and I were looking for a "home away from home" which is hard to find in the heart of the city but 414 was just that. The complimentary breakfast was a delicious touch to the overall experience. The concierge was great, he recommended several things for us to do and booked our Circle Line Sightseeing Cruise. We will definitely be back.

The 414 Hotel has been our favorite hotel in NYC for several years. It’s great because of its location, amenities, and perhaps most importantly, their friendly and over the top service oriented staff.It’s located in the middle of Restaurant Row, a few blocks away from the theatre district, with close access to the subway.

This lovely hotel is in a quiet street, ideally located close to Times Square and USS Intrepid / Circle Line River Cruises. The staff are incredibly helpful, the rooms are spotless and the vibe is quirky. We loved our stay here.

This hotel is our favorite in Hell’s Kitchen area. We can walk to most sites. The staff and visitors are fun and engaging. The rooms are comfortable and linen an soaps lovely. The happy hour and breakfast are a plus.

The room was clean, comfortable and the bed was very comfortable. No tea or coffee in rooms and the water is charged. Walls were paper thin, so was disturbed by the couple upstairs on the top floor having rampant sex - it was more like a voyeur show hearing every word, bed banging, full conversation in the shower. Not pleasant. Even with the TV on loud! The hotel does give great service and the wine in the evenings is a nice touch. Breakfast is limited. A few cereals, few bagels etc. Having seen this hotel rated as one of the top 10 in New York, well no it’s really not. But if the walls were not paper thin, this would be a pleasant and comfortable stay besides the criticism. Complimentary water and coffee in the rooms would have made it better. That said, their service was excellent and they do try to make you feel very at home.

We really enjoyed our stay at 414. The room, the wi-fi, the TV, the continental breakfast, the afternoon wine and cheese, the staff (especially the staff), the location, everything, all excellent. Oh, and did I mention they had a Jura machine (espresso maker) in the common area. So good. Highly recommended.

Nice small hotel in Hell's Kitchen, convenient to Theatre District. Rooms are basic and very small (not unusual for NYC), but staff's kindness and service makes up for that. Some nice perks - continental breakfast included in room rate, free WIFI, and beverages/snacks are only $1 each to re-stock. (no price gouging here). Only sour note was affiliated garage on 45th refused to honor the discounted rate for hotel guests, despite our voucher and attempted intervention by hotel staff. This could have been a miscommunication between hotel and garage, or more likely just a rip off by the garage manager. In any event, if you're planning to park at that garage, we recommend getting discount rate approved/clarified before you check out.

This hotel was a great find. The room wasn’t big but I believe a very good size for New York. It was comfortable and (included) coffee in the lobby all day, along with breakfast and the wine and cheese hour was a huge bonus. The room was simple but really clean and well looked after. The staff were really helpful and friendly. A free tour was being run to Central Park which looked great but unfortunately it was the day after we left. The room (102) was a bit noisy for me- a restaurant next door played loud music late into the night, but other than that the road was quiet, so probably a lot quieter than other New York hotels (no traffic noise). Our room was downstairs so probably one of the noisier ones- I would definitely stay again but request a quieter room. Overall a great stay!

We stayed at 414 Hotel for an overnight in the city. It was more reasonably priced than some of the other hotels in the theater district and had positive reviews, so decided to give it a try. I liked the fact that it was a more intimate accommodation than a big chain hotel (more like a B&B), and yet was in a perfect spot to hit the theater district and area restaurants. All staff members we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The front door is locked at night for security, but the lobby is manned 24 hours/day and someone is always available to buzz you in. Our room was clean and comfortable, but had a couple of drawbacks. It was located on the ground floor across the courtyard (which, by the way, would be a nice spot to sit on a pleasant day, but it was too cool, cloudy, wet during our visit to do so) and upon entering, we noted a strong damp, musty smell in the room (this might not be an issue on the upper floors, or perhaps the wet weather contributed). We could also hear the people upstairs walking around, but on the upside, there was no street traffic noise. It was a good sized room with a very comfortable, firm, king-sized bed outfitted with crisp white linens and plenty of pillows. While the furnishings were basic, it had everything we needed--plenty of closest and drawer space, a roomy bathroom with tub/shower combo (the sink/vanity was outside the bathroom--also convenient), good lighting, easily controllable heating/cooling, mini-fridge, ironing board/iron, and a safe. They include breakfast in the rate, and there's a selection of baked goods (scones were very tasty), cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc., offered. They also have a cheese and wine available in the early evening. Coffee and tea are available throughout the day. You can park on the next block over and get a $10 discount off the rate when the hotel stamps your parking ticket. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay and wouldn't hesitate to return to this property, although I'd probably choose a different room for the reasons stated above.

Great service, friendly staff, flexible to the varying needs of the customers, welcoming atmosphere, and an excellent location in the heart of Manhattan.Would definitely recommend the 414 Hotel to other travelers headed to New York City.

No elevator. Be prepared to carry your bags up and down very steep (15 step) staircases. We were assigned the fourth floor with no offer of assistance. The location is good for walking to attractions. Breakfast and social hour were a plus.

The Hotel is not big, but cozy and sweet in the middle of Manhattan. The location is perfect, just a few blocks away from the Times Square with many nice restaurants and cafes nearby. The hosts are friendly and helpful, they organize weakly a free Central Park tour, which is also very near, guided by a real CP ranger, a must! A lot of things within the walking distance, the rest is easily accessible by the subway. Nice and sweet breakfast room, they help find a good Broadway Show and other things. Highly recommended!

414 Hotel is a lovely place to stay in New York. Ten minutes from the busy Time Square, you can enjoy a peaceful and charming place to stay in the city that never sleeps. The staff is really nice and here to help if needed. I would certainly come back to this place if I go to NYC once again.

Chose this place as it looked like a traditional New York building. The price was good and the reviews great. We arrived to find friendly people who wanted to help and assist you in a personal manner. The room was nice with a good shower. The hotel also provided breakfast, this was mainly round one big table. If you want a hotel where you are invisible and no one talks to you then this is not the place for you but if you want a friendly reception, advice and a great location then look no further.

What a fabulous hotel! We had the most fantastic time in New York, travelling with our grown up children.This hotel is clean and very comfortable. It has every amenity; lovely showers, plenty of hot water, good sized rooms and bathrooms and really comfy beds. Good free WiFi connection.The staff are really friendly and knowledgeable; nothing is too much trouble.There is a selection of breakfast items provided each day with plenty of choice; and a cheese and wine get together for guests in the early evening if you wanted to participate.We loved the fact that the hotel is small and very traditional looking, and our two rooms were close together.It is also in a great location, being a short 5-10 min walk from Times Square depending on your pace.We would definitely return to this hotel if ever we are lucky enough to visit New York again. This was a trip of a lifetime and we loved it!

We are infrequent visitors to NYC, planning a trip every 3-4 years. In the past we have always stayed in large hotels located between Central park and Times Square ... no more, We have found a new home! The best way to put things is staying here makes you feel like a New Yorker, or at least a guest with inside knowledge. It is on a quite street just outside the Theatre District. The staff guides you to local restaurants for some of the best, unique meals - just what we were looking for. Their advice for activities and entertainment options were priceless. We love the $!$ and will return!

Great hotel great location great staff. I highly recommend it! it is located within a five minutes walk from time square and the neighborhood is really nice and cozy. The staff is very friendly really try their best to make sure your visit to New York is perfect. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family that will travel to NY.

This was our first stay. We'll be back. We love the location, guidance for touring the city offered by the staff and the continental breakfast (and awesome coffee). The stairs to rooms are a climb but well worth it. Overall, it was a fabulous trip and the 414 Hotel only made it better.

Great hotel for the money. Friendly staff, clean rooms and free wine and cheese late afternoon treat. One of the best locations regarding access to the Broadway. Room was clean but clean and well kept. Only drawback is having to climb 4 flights of stairs to get to our room. Would recommend a back courtyard room as there is a lot of street noise at night. Also it appeared that one staff member is running the place at all times other than maintenance staff.

This was the perfect place to stay for a quick get away to NYC. The Hell's Kitchen location was excellent for Times Square, Broadway, Central Park and more! We were greeted with happy faces and wine upon arrival even though we had missed the wine and cheese social hour. Our room was quaint and had everything we needed. This may be a little-known hidden gem that we will most definitely visit again.

We stayed at 414 Hotel for 4 nights, in fact I am writing this review during our last night, so we are still here as I type. The hotel is located in a converted 4 story rowhouse on a residential part of 46th Street between 9th and 10th Ave, half a block away from the heart of the Hell’s Kitchen district of Mid-Town Manhattan. Great location about a 5-7 minute walk from Time Square 42nd street subway station or Port Authority Bus Terminal if arriving by public transportation. Check in was smooth and painless, and the room was a generous size for NYC standards. The room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was functional. Queen size bed was above average if not the best I’ve slept in. Strong wifi signal in the room and in the lobby was free of charge. Continental breakfast was included in the room rate and consisted of unlimited coffee/tea/espresso, orange juice, toasted bread/bagels with butter/cream cheese/jelly, a good selection of yogurts, scones, cereals, and assorted fruits. A basic but nonetheless satisfying way to start the day. The staff was extremely friendly and engaging, and was instrumental in assisting hotel guests with useful suggestions, trip planning, booking tours and reservations. I have been to coming to NY for the majority of my life, in fact growing up, I used to spend all my summers at my grandparents’ house in Queens, so I consider myself well versed on what to see and do and how to get around the City, but Jaqui was able to give us some useful tidbits that even I did not know about. Don’t hesitate to ask the staff of you need any advice or assistance to maximize the enjoyment of your stay. The only negative I feel I should point out is that there can be quite a bit of street noise that can be somewhat of a nuisance, especially in the middle of the night, from people (homeless or drunk) talking loudly, sirens, garbage trucks, etc. We stayed in room 404, which faces the street, but I imagine if you get one of the inside facing rooms, this may not be a major concern. This is not the hotels’s fault, and I don’t hold them responsible for what happens outside of their building, but I only bring this up in full disclosure. All in all, a great hotel in the best part of Manhattan, and at a very reasonable rate. Without equivocation, I give 414 Hotel my highest recommendation to anyone in search of a great hotel in the enchanting metropolis of New York.Dr. Kingstone Shih and Laura MenesesLos Altos, California USA

We have stayed at 414 before and still find it to give a lovely stay with so many benefits. The rooms are clean and the staff is extremely personable and helpful. There is a complimentary breakfast and a complimentary wine and cheese happy hour. The location is quite central to get to any place you would like to go in NYC. Broadway and a Times Square are within walking distance. Free WIFI works with ease. They have water and treats in the room with a mini fridge that are only $1.00 each. You can pick up more at the front desk at any time. Some one is at the desk 24 hours a day and while the front door is locked, you will never have to wait to be buzzed in. While the hotel is far from modern and certain conveniences not evident, it still is a great place to stay. The only issues I found is that the courtyard had scaffolding that is in place for a reno next door that has been on hold and the staff office needs to be cleaned up since that is open to the lobby and eating area. They need to really give their staff clean carpeting and make it look like ownership cares about the staff. Such a wonderful staff and the access to them is key to the needs of the guests. It is a home away from home.

My second time in the 414 Hotel and I have to say that the experience has improved. The hotel is very cozy, clean, even if you are in the middle of everything in New York. Their great asset is their staff: Jackie and her team are extraordinary, always available but discreet at the same time.The location is one of the best in New York, but the strong point of the hotel is that it is an authentic oasis where you can relax and make friends. It's a unique experience.

wonderful small hotel in perfect location for theater going as well as close to numerous great restaurants; nice walk on a nice day to various museums, Hudson Yards and Central Park as well. Great service, nice rooms, great daily breakfast and happy hour w/beer, wine, cheese and crackers as well. Very friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend the 414!

Fantastic service from the hotel staff. Great location. Kinda old hotell, but very charming. We would recommend this hotel to others travelling to New York Hope to visit this hotel again some day.....

Stayed here recently for a night while in the city with my husband for a concert. This hotel is unlike any other experience we’ve had in New York. Has a small town, bed and breakfast feel, with great personalized service and accommodations. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff as well as a complimentary bottle of Prosecco waiting in our room with a birthday card for my husband (which we received for booking from their website) a great perk! The hotel was clean and rooms were spacious for a small New York hotel. They also provide a social hour each night with wine and cheeses and a breakfast each morning with coffee and pastries. This hotel is in a great location away from the chaos of Times Square, while still being walkable to most locations. A great find, and would definitely stay here again in the future!

Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by "Emmy" as we entered into the warm dining area during the complimentary cocktail soiree! The fireplace and seating arrangement invites conversation between guests from all over the globe. The staff readily and seamlessly conversed with the guests offering advice and recommendations for activities in NYC. The staff is warm, genuine and ready to help whenever needed. The location is very near Times Square and Restaurant Row but on a street that seems like a family neighborhood. We will be back!

Front desk was very nice and helpful, they allowed us to check in earlyRoom was a nice size, but not very good upkeep.There was caked dirt on the base boards and other parts of the room. Sheets and towels were clean.

This is a lovely hotel nestled in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood. It was converted originally from tenements and a lot of nice details still exist. Our room was spacious by any standards and especially by New York standards. We had a comfortable queen been, plenty of room for luggage, and a huge bathroom. We faced the "inner" side (not street side) so it was very quiet. Did not mind the stairs one bit. There's a small but comfortable lobby with a huge fireplace. It's really like visiting with friends in the city. The staff is stellar, very kind and helpful. I would recommend this hotel and would also like to stay again on a future visit.

One of NY’s well kept secrets. Small, intimate, friendly. Staff go out of their way to help. Location is excellent for theater, dining. Having been there previously, Emmy recognized me as soon as I walked in the door. Staff is very accommodating very to your needs and requests. The courtyard between the two buildings is lovely. Because of the size and intimacy guests talk to each other and share their experiences. Feels more like home or a guest home.

The service here is excellent, the rooms are serene, the beds fluffy, and the wine/cheese happy hour seals the deal. Also many great restaurants within a two block radius.Continental breakfast was a nice add on for us as we could eat and get out to start our day quickly. The scones are delectable.

Great scones and food, breakfast was great- comfy lodging, FUN Happy Hour with the cozy fire and unbeatable customer service. We loved this place, and everything about it, especially the professional staff - each was SO helpful, pleasant, and kind. Thank you for such a gem in a big place like NYC! Anne&Rick Biddle

A great find in Hell’s Kitchen. Close to Restaurant Row and the Theater District. Room was small, but clean and comfortable. Staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful with directions, restaurant advice, etc. Daily breakfast and happy hour was a nice bonus perk!

I was thrilled with the accommodations at this hotel. Not only was it conveniently located, but it was a unique and refreshing departure from a standard hotel. Will certainly be booking a room here next time I visit!

My husband and I visited New York for 8 days in early March for our honeymoon and we stayed at the 414 hotel. The location of the hotel is really awesome, it was near the theatres with a 10-min walk (we watched several broadway shows) and there were great restaurants around for any occasion/cuisine too. The nearest metro is also located in Times Square/Port Authority Bus Terminal which is also a 10 min walk away but that’s really no issue because those are the central stations and it can get you anywhere you want pretty quickly! There were few occasions we headed back in between shows/shopping trips to catch a nap or drop our stuff because that was how convenient it was!15 mins walk to Grand Central Park, it is also walkable to rockerfeller center which takes about 25-30 mins but that shouldn’t be a problem with nice weather. Staff were extremely friendly and it really felt like we were home every time we stepped into the hotel. They were warm and extremely helpful to answer your queries or give you tips. They arranged car services for us to and fro from Newark Airport which was extremely helpful since we stayed in central area and Uber fares are usually skyrocketing. Free walking tours to Central Park are organise every Saturday I believe. Breakfast was simple with bagels, spread, toast, cereal and yoghurt. The social hour with wine, cheese and beer was a very heartening touch and seemed extremely popular with guests! Room amenities were what you need to have a fantastic stay. A big shoutout to Rachel from 414 Hotel too who was of a big help prior to our stay liaising for the car and concierge services. She was always extremely friendly, greeting guests with a big smile, it was just heartwarming to always see her and speak with her.Thank you staff of 414 hotel for a great stay, we will be back for sure!!

My wife and I could not have been more happy with our three night stay at 414 Hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly from the time we called with questions prior to the trip until the end when they notified the parking garage that we would be picking up our car and carried our bags down from our third floor room. All of the staff great, particularly Emmy. The hotel is close to many good restaurants and taverns and midtown activities. We particularly enjoyed hearing Jazz at Birdland which was about 3 blocks away. Our third floor room was clean with nice paintings on the walls and a good view of the street. There was a free bottle of wine in the room to greet us. The only thing I would mention that is remotely critical is that it is a small four floor hotel with no elevators. If you have problems hiking up stairs ask for a room on the bottom two floors. My wife and I are 70ish and the stairs were only a tiny problem. Staff readily helped by carrying our bags up and down the stairs. The next time we are in New York this is where we will stay.

Enjoy time together for spring break  To see harry potter Cher show along with frozenTried several new restaurants ribbons shake shack Frankie steakhouseWalking distance to Times SquareWill plan a trip back when the weathers nicer much more to see

I arrived one cold winters night and was personally greeted by name at the door by Emmy which was the start of a wonderful 9 night stay at Hotel 414. This was my first time in the NYC and all the staff were so helpful with tips and local knowledge about my outings. They were also very interested in how I was enjoying my time which was especially nice as I was travelling alone. The hotel is centrally located, very clean and has a lovely feel (not to mention drinks and cheese every night) but I think the main thing that sets it apart is the wonderful service. Jacqui and all the team were always willing to go above and beyond expected service levels ... in fact Emmy arranged a transfer for me from another hotel back to the airport (I spent the rest of my holiday in lower manhattan) after the 2nd hotel quoted an extremely high transfer price. Well done gang, I hope to come back and visit you all sometime in the near future.

Would definitely stay here again! The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the location is perfect. Breakfast and social hour are extra bonuses with an opportunity to chat with guests and learn tips that are beneficial to your time in NYC.

We loved our stay and wished it was longer. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, across the board, even the other guests that we encountered were warm and welcoming. The room was spacious and well appointed. This hotel has real character and we'll definitely be back!

So we get there on a Friday at 11 pm and the lady that opens the door calls me by name and says she was concerned as it was getting late. This is the kind of service you get!The place is lovely, an interesting building, very nice breakfast, and decent wine & cheese at Happy Hour. Fabulous location - just walk to everything! And the service is top of the line!! They will look into anything and everything for you to make your trip a delight. We will be back!!

The hotel is a small building without elevator, but wonderfully located at 46th St., between the 9th and 10th Avenue. It is very close to Times Square, MoMa, Central Park, etc. We did a lot just walking around. The room with bathroom is sufficiently comfortable. The strong points of the hotel are the kindness and promptness of the staff, and the friendly environment. We arrived in New York early in the morning, and as our room was available, we were allowed to make our check-in, what was very convenient. In the morning and at the end of the afternoon, the guests may meet in the living/dining room for breakfast and some cheese and wine, respectively. I was there with my 17-year-old son, and we really appreciated the environment, and the attention we received. Definitively, we will stay there when we go to New York again. Perhaps it will not be good for all tastes, but it is certainly great for those who enjoy a more personal environment.

I’ve stayed here twice. Great location, small, comfortable with warm helpful staff. The room didn’t have a desk so I had to sit on the bed to work. Not a big deal, just FYI. Also, the only US hotel I’ve ever stayed in that has Marmite for breakfast!

My son and I stayed here on our first trip to NYC. The staff (shout out to Emmy, Fernando and Ashley) were awesome! Very knowledgable and personable!! Was wonderful after being out walking in the cold all day to come kick back by the fireplace in the lobby and chat with other guests or sit quietly by myself in the courtyard! Location was wonderful! Lots of things within walking distance or close to subway if you prefer. Was much quieter than I expected and great to stay on residential street. Felt like home away from home!! was so nice to not have to pay all the extras you have to pay with larger hotels- nice little breakfast and coffee or great bakeries nearby. Wonderful restraunts all around. Ask the staff for locals favorites -- Loved Kiabaccas for pizza and beer! Close to all the theatres! Loved that they let us keep our bags there while we ventured on last day til our evening flight. Was great to get in at 11pm drop bags and walk three blocks to WOW Times square. Rooms basic and CLEAN!!! Thankyou 414 I hope to come back again soon!!
