It’s a cute hotel, very friendly. I think I just prefer bigger hotels but it’s cute. I would have liked some protein at the breakfasts, an elevator up to my third floor room, and better body wash type things in the bathroom, but it was clean, cute, friendly, and homey.

We celebrated our January 2019 wedding anniversary in NYC with an extended weekend stay at the 414 Hotel. This was a return trip for us and we've been at the 414 Hotel before several times. We love the location and enjoy the amenities including breakfast; wine, cheese and crackers in the evening; comfortable and spotlessly clean rooms; and a friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful staff who offer suggestions for restaurants, theater, museums and other attractions. We met some really interesting people in the lobby/breakfast area. It is laid out such that you naturally meet other guests and have the opportunity to talk to them - always a great experience.Emmy, the Guest Relations Manager, and others on the front desk staff are always around and add to the overall atmosphere of friendship and warmth.We'll surely return in the future.....Norm & Ellen Weingart - Syosset, NY

Loved the location in Hell’s Kitchen. Restaurants everywhere, social area downstairs was a delight with lots of friendly guests. The staff is absolutely superb. Beds comfy and I personally loved the 4 flight walk on the quaint stairs to my room.

I wanted to get some information about car service for our October trip. I called the hotel and spoke with Emmy. From the moment she answered the phone until she hung up, she was amazing. She booked our car service for us and sent me the details. Emmy said if I have any more questions before we get there to give them a call. I haven’t stopped talking about the great service we had gotten just over the phone to family and friends. We have a week booked in October and I know its still a long way away we are so excited about staying here. I worked in Customer Service for over 26 years and I know for a fact that employees like Emmy are quite rare, you can actually hear the smile in her voice!

This is our third visit to the 414, and they do not disappoint. Ownership changed last year and we were concerned that we wouldn't have the same experience, however the new owners have kept the high standards. This hotel has the best front desk staff anywhere. They are really more than just reception - they are sort of European innkeepers. Part concierge, part hostess. They are friendly and welcoming, and always go out of their way to make suggestions. They service a nice continental breakfast, and a pleasant happy hour. The new owners have simplified what they serve, but there is always something nice - more than enough. You will most often find international guests here and an opportunity to strike up a conversation. Location, location, location - this is a great place to stay if you are coming in for Broadway plays. The rooms are immaculate. They always smell like a spa when you come in - fresh, crisp and clean. Warm, comfy beds. Quiet. You will not be disappointed.

Well lets start with all the good points, the staff are all amazing especially Rachel, there was nothing too much trouble from a demanding family. The location was perfect as just far enough away from all the hustle and bustle but ideal for restaurant row, the recommended restaurants for our requests of Mexican, Indian and burgers went down well with both adults and teenagers. We loved the social hour and meeting guests from all around the world, the fire was so cost and the big table was another plus. Breakfast was ideal as the amount of food in the rest of NY was so much I gained too much weight whilst walking over 70 miles in 5 days.The room was spotlessly clean and the bed was so comfy, it was a little noisy as we had a room at front but was quieter than when we stayed in Times Square previously.There is no lift but staff more than willing to take bags up stairs.When we go back we will be staying here, thanks to all the team

Three generations from our family stayed at the 414 and, to a person, thought it was just delightful. The location is ideal--and relatively quiet for NYC and the rooms were quite comfortable. They have a very nice breakfast every morning and a very welcome happy hour every evening. But the standout feature of 414 is definitely the staff. They were professional, helpful, knowledgeable, and wonderfully engaging. I would go back in a minute!

My family and I stayed at hotel 414 for 5 nights and we were absolutely thrilled with our stay.I can’t think of any other word to describe our experience apart from outstanding. Everything was just perfect. The location of the hotel is ideal, with nice bars and restaurants around, less than 10 minutes away from Time Square, the rooms are clean and very comfortable. The breakfast is lovely and the communal space is a real bonus, allowing guests to have a nice chat while enjoying the breakfast or the complimentary cheese and wine in the afternoon, next to the fireplace. This made was feel as if we were in someone’s home but what topped it all was the absolutely amazing staff of the hotel. We have never felt more welcomed in any other hotel and we cannot speak highly enough of the way we were looked after and how lovely and helpful everyone was with us. You can be sure that any question you might have or guidance you might need they will be there to help you. Thank you ever so much Jacqui, our amazing Rachel, Adanes, Fernando, Emmy and everyone else for making us feel so wonderful and for such a great memory of this trip. We will recommend hotel 414 to everyone around us and we would certainly love to come back there one day.

414 is a really nice hotel. It is small, has a perfect location, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are huge , especially for new york. I love the (free) breakfast with the communal table. It is nice to speak other guests. Next time when I will be in New York, I will choose without a doubt for this hotel.

Cant sopeak highly enough about this hotel. It was perfect for us, our Queen sized room was welcoming, very clean and tidy. The location is perfect, breakfast really good and the social hour is nice, but its all topped by the staff, who are friendly, helpful and genuinely want you to have a good time. Next time we are in New York for us there is no doubt its the 414 for us. Highly recommended. (PS nice touch complimentary bottle of wine, that was really appreciated)

We arrived at the 414 which is on a residential street, 1 block away from the main Hells Kitchen "strip" and 2 blocks away from Times Square.On arrival, our room wasnt ready but Emmy took our luggage and gave us information of places to eat and things to do to keep us occupied until our room was ready, as well as a map of the area and things close by.When we arrived back, our luggage had already been taken up to our room and the team had left some champagne and chocolates as we were there to celebrate my partners 30th birthday, which was so lovely!The rooms arent super modern and there isnt a lift, but they were exactly what was needed after hours of being on your feet and walking around the City.The rooms and bathroom were clean and spacious, we felt completely safe at all times and each morning there was a brilliant newsletter that was put under the door with a weather update, local things to do and a general update of hotel events which was so thoughtful!Each morning, there was a complimentary breakfast served (with the best bagels and choc chip scones in the world) and all guests sat down and chatted together whilst they ate which was so lovely! And again, each evening there was cheese and wine served for all guests in front of the fireplace to get everyone chatting together too.Emmy and Rachel were absolutely fantastic. Really took the time to get to know you, give you information and recommendations and always had time for you no matter how busy they were. We had some of our favourite afternoons just sitting with them whilst warming up after being out in the cold all day!Overall, i could not recommend this hotel more. It really is a home from home and unlike anywhere i have ever stayed before. I have never felt more comfortable and looked after in a hotel and we cannot wait to book again and see everyone on our next trip :)

Although it was in a perfect spot, the room was ridiculously expensive , was considered a “premier” room, it was bland and poorly appointed , uncomfortable and hot. The front desk person when we arrived was lovely and welcoming but I would not return unless the room was hundreds of dollars less.

We couldn't have been more pleased with our selection of 414 hotel. Great location (near everything but set just far enough away it is a little quieter) and a more authentic feel to NY than your typical hotels. Great at Christmas time too as they had decorations and a fire going at all times. Rooms very comfortable and everything you need. Staff extremely friendly and accommodating. Enjoyed the extra touches such as the sparking wine and social hours. Would definitely stay here again if returning to NY!

Thrilled to have stumbled on this seeet oasis in Hells Kitchen that boarders the Theatre District in NYC. Can’t say enough about the kind and knowledgeable staff & adored the wonderful social they provide every evening for guests to get to know each other over complientary beer and wine. I’ll definetly be coming back!

This place is cute and clean and the staff is wonderful! We were always met with a smile and helpfullness and they always offered suggestions of things to do and see in the city!The rooms were clean and very comfortable! We loved the morning newsletter!

We loved the wonderful warm and friendly athmosphere, the whole staff was helpful.They treated us like best friends, always a good advise or a smile.The Hotel is ideal located to walk by foot in the heart of NY. we felt safe and comfort all the time.

Stayed as a couple in this lovely boutique hotel in the Hells Kitchen area of New York City. Fantastic location for walking to theatres or for visiting famous sights or for shopping. The room we had was large compared to other hotel rooms in New York with a good sized bath and very clean and comfortable. Despite it being New York the location of the room was very peaceful during the night. The small buffet breakfast in the mornings was lovely and the ‘happy hour’ every evenings with complimentary beer, wine and cheese is a nice touch and a great way to meet other guests and talk about New York experiences. They arranged transport from and to the airport which worked perfectly. I think what makes the hotel a special place to stay is the staff who are all really, really kind and helpful - especially Emmy who went out of her way to assist us on our trip across to Staten Island to visit an old friend. All in all a lovely, intimate hotel in a great location. Best wishes to all the staff for the New Year.

I took my sister in law into Manhattan to see “Christmas”! I booked the 414 Hotel based on reviews and price. It is a fabulous little hotel in Hell’s kitchen! It is small but the rooms are huge ( by NY standards!) Our room was spacious with a FULL bathroom, a queen aize bed and a mini fridge! Located about four blocks from Times Square on a quiet street. The staff is friendly and goes out of their way to help you! Water in snacks IN YOUR ROOM are $1.00!!! Unheard of in NY! Loved it! Will definitely go baxk!

Needed a place to stay before getting on a cruise ship the next day. This fine boutique hotel is 2 blocks from Times Square, less than a mile from Rockefeller Center and just steps away from restaurant row. The hotel, though no elevator, is quaint and very nice. Staff members can help you get your luggage to the 4th floor, as they did with me. Or, you can store large luggage in the manager's office, which is staffed 24/7.Everyone was so nice at the hotel and personable. This is a small hotel in a nice area close to everything. You don't need a car, and the staff will help you with directions, what subway line to use, what you should see as a tourist and give you restaurant recommendations.The room itself is so large, not the norm for NYC hotels. It wasn't a hotel that broke my budget, either. i would stay there again in a heartbeat, and if coming to NYC not for a cruise, but just sightseeing, I would most definitely stay.Outstanding and you should definitely check it out.

The location of 414 Hotel is near Restaurant Row in Hell's Kitchen neighborhood and easy to walk to dinner, shows, and the subway. They staff is all very friendly and helpful (it would be helpful to have the daily newsletter the night before). We especially enjoyed the social hour and meeting people from all over the world. It was a great way to kick off vacation and take a break each day.

Loved the location, just off restaurant row and theater district with access to lots of good restaurants in hell’s kitchen. Room 204 was good sized with excellent shower, although careful of the step down to the room. Reasonable continental breakfast and very generous happy hour (beer, wines, spirits, cheeses, etc.). Eating area and lobby has a bit of a B&B feel to it and guests from at least eight countries were here ( with I think only 24 rooms). Staff were all super friendly and helpful and a special shout-out to Emmy for her thoughtfulness and cheer. Room heating took a bit to get adjusted but not problematic.

414 Hotel is a perfect Manhattan hotel. The staff, pre-trip and during the trip, could not be better. Pre-trip they were very helpful in suggesting restaurants. They provided clear directions from the airport to their location. Upon arrival it only got better. The staff is fantastic and first rate. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very quiet. I cannot imagine staying elsewhere in Manhattan. The perks are great. The social hours in the evening and breakfast are great and you can exchange ideas and things to do. I don't think there was any negative from any guests the 4 days we were there. The rooms are spacious, the beds comfy. Overall the staff really seem to care and want you to have the best experience not only at your hotel but overall vacation as possible. Thank you for a great get away!

We had a wonderful time at 414 Hotel. Every employee we encountered, no matter what time of day, was so helpful and friendly. We arrived in NYC on a very early flight and they held our luggage while we went about the city. They told us how to get places, gave restaurant recommendations, asked us about our day and were genuinely interested in their guests. Breakfast was available late enough for those of us who are not early birds and the environment is warm enough that guests feel comfortable talking to each other. They had a social hour and a walking tour available, but we were so busy we didn’t get a chance to participate. The room was very comfy and cozy. The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Just a great stay at a reasonable price. Thank you for making our first NYC trip a wonderful one. Highly recommend.

We were greeted by Emmy after a long and tiring journey. She immediately made us feel at home and looked after us well all week. This is a small but friendly place where everyone meets round a big table for breakfast or happy hour after a day's sightseeing. We weren't sure what to expect in the Big Apple but loved the hurly- burly lifestyle - mainly because we had this oasis of calm at the end of each day. The hotel is well-placed for Times Square and close to transport links to get around the city. We walked a lot too, and ate much more healthily than we expected. Big thanks to all the staff at 414, especially Emmy for all her kindness and information

A perfect base for exploring New York, the 414 is close to Theatres, restaurants, museums etc. A comment below says the rooms are small, they are fully equipped and certainly not small by NYC standards. Breakfast was very social, our only gripe was that it was slightly carb orientated. Happy hour was also a lovely social opportunity and we made some new friends from across the globe. Our room was always spotless and there was always an abundance of hot water, whatever time you chose to bath or shower.The staff were the friendliest we have encountered in all our times in New York. They were very knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble, whatever the time of day!Will we return - without doubt that’s a yes from us!

Great staff and location. Room looked over the street, very clean and was bigger than we expected. Loved the social area, wine and cheese daily, met some lovely people from around the world. Thank you 414.

Jacqui who oversees operations is fabulous as is the rest of the staff. They have great suggestions for restaurants, activities, and transportation. Wonderful location near Hell’s Kitchen and theaters. This is not fancy but makes you feel as if you are home. Guests are from many countries and we have enjoyed all of our interactions. Simple but nice breakfast. Rooms are small but more than adequate. If you want a bellman and room service then this is not the place for you. But if you want friendly and comfortable then this is the place. We will certainly be returning.

Excellent stay in the 414, great location and friendly staff. The social hour and a half gives you a great opportunity to mingle with other guests to exchange stories and tips on what to do during your stay. Would 100% recommend.

They are extremely helpful with any questions you may need. The place was plenty clean and light breakfast or happy hour was sweet. Location is in a very quiet part of NYC, but you are still close to the theatre or times square or restaurant row or the subway. We even walked to Central Park from here.

A great little hotel, close to the centre but on a quiet side street. Staff were very friendly & helpful. Lots of restaurants/bars close by. Walking distance to most major attractions & close to the subway.Complementary buffet breakfast, tea & coffee all day & happy hour drinks in the evening are all a nice touch. Rooms are large & clean. Would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 days in September. First and foremost, the staff are absolutely incredible. We had a warm welcome and because the hotel does not have an elevator, they offered to carry our bags if we would like. They also provided a very comprehensive listing of their recommended restaurants nearby.The location is fantastic, walking distant to restaurant row, broadway and times square. It is an approx. 15 minute walk to the highline. It is very close to the subway as well.The room we had was clean and more spacious than we were anticipating it to be! We were the top floor, which was floor 4 (and they were shorter floors).The breakfast they serve is nothing fancy, but it was wonderful and everything you would need. Great coffee as well!! We also enjoyed the Happy Hour where they had wine, beer and cheese available in the lobby.I cannot recommend this place enough, if we are to return I would 100% stay here again. Great place, amazing service!

My daughter and I stayed at the 414 Hotel for 3 nights during Thanksgiving. The staff are extremely helpful and nice. Love that they have free continental breakfast and in the evening they have beer,wine and cheese and cracker and dessert. They even offer free tours,however we left the day of the tour so we didn't get a chance to take advantage of that . Location is great, right on restaurant row,plenty of restaurants around and within a short walking distance to train and times square

Stayed at the 414 for a birthday weekend with a couple of friends and couldn't have been happier. The rooms, while not big or luxurious are comfy, with nice amenities and, at least in the back, are very quiet. But it's the staff who make the place sing. You are treated like family and the congenitally that they (and especially Rachel) create in the combination reception /breakfast-happy hour area is almost magical. Complete strangers open up to each other in the blink of an eye. As someone who has literally traveled all over the world I've never experienced such instantaneous camaraderie as the 414 creates. The staff also bends over backwards to make your stay great. We found a wallet outside the hotel on the way back fron dinner one night and while it had the owner's driver's license and credit cards there was no address or telephone number. What to do? The staff took over and went on Facebook to track him down and by the next morning reunited him with his property. Try getting that kind of service at a Hilton. Also, had the best coffee I've ever had at a hotel. Did I forget to mention that the rates are incredibly good for such a well situated place and your room rate includes free breakfasts and wifi. You're right on Restaurant Row and a stone's throw from all the Broadway theaters and lights. One caution, there's no elevator in this three story hotel, spread over three repurposed tenements, so that could be an issue for some.

We stay here every year prior to Thanksgiving and always totally enjoy it. Jacqui, Rachel, Emmy, Mark and the rest of the gang do it right, from super friendly service, a great mid-town location, clean, comfortable rooms, plenty of hot water, an excellent happy hour each evening, and up-to-the-minute info on all the latest happenings around town. They are like family to us - a home away from home in NYC. If you have never experienced a B&B in the city that delivers in every way, give these folks a try - you won't be disappointed.

Very well located, in walking distances to the attractions of the Mid-Manhattan and close to a subway station. Very clean, and very good bed.The location of the ac unit, at less than 1 meter from and at the level of the bed is not the best.Sound proof windows would be beneficial.The breakfast is minimal but the happy hour is a great idea – it gave us the chance to socialise with other guests of the hotel. The price is very competitive for the area.Most of all we enjoyed the welcoming staff, their restaurant recommendations, their smiles and helpfulness. Even the daily newsletter was full of useful data.We would like to come back some day.

Great small boutique hotel in a fabulous location. Wonderful service with lots of info given and all questions answered with a smile. Nice continental breakfast. This is a renovated tenament building so it has lots of history and character. It has been restored and renovated and is in excellent shape and very comfortable.

Staying at this hotel is an opportunity to experience a great mid town location in a historic building (including walking up 3 flights of stairs to your room). We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and social hour, as well as advice on where to go and patience from employees when providing direction on how to use the subway. Also appreciated the nominal charge for soft drinks and water.

We booked our room in early 2018 based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. Location, hospitality, and personal touch from the staff made this a wonderful stay. Check in/out was hassle free, the room was as described, clean and comfortable. Highly recommend for any couple looking for a hotel that isn't a chain.

My wife chose this place for a 5 day trip with her sister and b-i-l. We had a slightly larger room off the small courtyard and they had a smaller second floor room. First, location is fabulous. About 4 blocks off Times Square and near several Broadway shows, it’s a great location. Despite that, it was very quiet and we all slept very soundly. The rooms are smallish, comfortable and reasonably appointed. Not luxury but perfectly adequate, clean and everything worked well. The real secret of this place though are the little “extras” that are not always typical in NYC. There’s a daily continental breakfast included that’s a good start. The room has beverages and snacks, all priced at $1! (Yep, $1, not a typo). There’s a fun happy hour each day from 5:30-7 with beer, wine some liquor and cheese. We had fun mingling. And finally...the staff. They were truly the crowning jewel. Just plain friendly. Willing to help, answer questions, chat, whatever. Special nod to Emmy who was great. We’d definitely go back.

Lovely small hotel in a great location.Having stayed in large mid town hotels before we loved friendly, personal service . The social hour is a nice touch and an excellent breakfast is provided. We had a wonderfully warm welcome from Emmy and all the staff couldn't do enough to ensure we enjoyed our stay. A great experience. Can't wait to go back.

This is a rare find in NYC! The room was very comfortable, in a perfect location, with extremely friendly service. They provide a great breakfast and unique touches all around. Looking forward to our next stay!

I hate to write a review because it's already so hard to get a room here. But honestly, this is a great hotel in a great neighborhood. And it feels like a neighborhood spot. BE FOREWARNED: if you like glamour, luxury, shiny gold and elevators, run away. This isn't the spot for you. This isn't the New York of Chanel and Prada. This place is a neighborhood vibe, it's comfy, homey and feels like the New York of my childhood. And there are stairs. If you don't like stairs, this isn't the place for you. Honestly though, this hotel is perfect for what I want in a hotel and I love the neighborhood.

Well.. were should I begin? The 414 hotel is amazing!! The location is good, right at the midtown contest, very convenient to get everything. Foods, shopping, public transportation.. but above everything the staff (girl power..(; ) was incredible!! Helpful, and super informative. We will definitely be back!

This little hotel is absolutely smashing. Great location, friendly and helpful staff that go out of their way to make sure that the guests habe everything that they need. Really nice rooms with plenty of space. Nice breakfast and wonderful socializing hour in the evening with cheese and wine.

All the positive reviews are true - a cute, personal, friendly boutique B&B in the heart of NYC just a short walk from Times Square and the subway lines. Loved the complimentary daily cheese and wine social hour. Plenty of storage in the modestly sized rooms (we were in 406 - the steep climb to the top floor was our choice, to get the peace and tranquillity we craved in a room facing the inner courtyard). Comfy beds and good showers - what more do you need!

Booked the 414 for a quick trip to NYC for my 50th birthday. I researched what was in the area and am glad I went with this hotel. Our room was clean and quiet and the bed was comfy. There was complementary wine and cheese in the evening. The breakfast service was basic, but really we just grabbed coffee in the morning to head out and visit one of the great restaurants in the area. The 414 is close to everything but is situated on a side street so it feels like your own little neighborhood after a while. My advice, book a room in the back, the street side may be noisy. And there is no elevator.The staff was great, the room was quiet and clean. There is a fridge, tub, and safe. Wi-Fi is reliable. Would absolutely stay here again!

My son & I stayed for 3 nights at the 414 hotel and we had such a nice time. I booked a Premiere Queen room. This room was in the back of the building, excellent for a bad sleeper. Other than hearing some of the guests coming home at night I didn't hear any street noise, amazing in NYC!We only made it once to the social hour at night, that's how busy we were each day. It was great though when I did to hang out with the other guests and have some wine & cheese.At breakfast it felt like I was sitting in someone's kitchen talking, we met so many nice people. Breakfast was great for a hungry teenager who had a big bagel and OK for me who just wanted some coffee & yoghurt.The room was a good size as well as the bathroom. Snacks and water/soda all $1, such a great idea and so helpful.Location is great, easy walk to the subway for a direct ride to Battery Park to visit Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty. Really all was easy to get to with the excellent direction that the staff would give me each morning, they were all so wonderful!Loved staying here and added the hotel on our list of favorite places to stay, thank you!

A lovely small boutique Hotel in a fabulous location!!! Nothing but wonderful things to say about our stay here. The location was ideal for us close to subway and Times Square and just 10mins walk from the theatre district. Also after a big day walking, plenty of dinner choices was just round the corner in 9th Ave with plenty of restaurants!! The strange thing about the hotel location was how quiet it was when just up the street was the NYC action!! We enjoyed the social gatherings at happy hour each night meeting many lovely fellow travellers from all over the world. I would recommend this hotel to solo travellers too as a great way the meet other people!!All the staff were really friendly and extremely helpful. Big thank you to Emmy who was always giving us great advice and also recommending some more local eats/shows etcI have done a lot of travelling and this is one of my top hotel experiences ever!!! In NYC who would have thought!!

Cannot recommend this hotel enough - 4th time to NYC and this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. We chose an inner courtyard room - the front road is busy but that’s New York for you! The staff are brilliant - everyone is so friendly and helpful. Thank you everyone for making our stay so brilliant! If you are thinking about booking this hotel - just do it!! ❤️❤️

Best service we have ever received at any US hotel. (We live in Japan, so we are spoiled :) All the managers and staff, including Jacqui and Apollo, seemed to anticipate our every need while remembering to give us personal space to decompress from the world outside. Manager Garcia and her professional team create a culture within the hotel that allows for authentic guest interactions. We saved hundreds of dollars and hours of time learning that a show that had been top of our list was probably not the best fit for my family. Aside from the quiet and convenient location, the property itself is nothing special, and some guests on this site complain about the lack of an elevator. All true. But if you are looking to be hosted by real people who treat like you a human being and not a walking credit card, we highly recommend the 414. Perfect location. Superior customer service. Our best overall NYC hotel experience. Ever. Thank you, 414!

Just stayed at this lovely little hotel in Hell's Kitchen. The room was cozy and clean and quiet! Such a welcome retreat at the end of long days of sightseeing. The staff was great, always hot fresh coffee in the mornings and tea service. There is complementary alcohol in the evenings, but we were always out to dinner during this time so unfortunately we did not partake. Would definitely stay here again, really comfortable bed.This place is close to anything you need...subway line, great pizza, shopping, restaurant row.

Location and hospitality can’t be beat in Manhattan. Just stayed for second trip and overall experience was top notch. Staff is always friendly and knowledgable about food and city and beds are very comfortable. The location is off the beaten path so you feel like you are living in part of the neighborhood, rather than fighting crowds around Times Square. Morning breakfast and nightly social time just add to the experience. Despite lack of elevator, give the 414 a try. It’s our favorite place to stay in NYC!

Just got back from a fantastic stay at Hotel 414. Great location and the staff go above and beyond, particularly Emmy, who is a fantastic asset to the hotel. The hotel is 2 houses which gives it great character and sets it aside from the other commercial chain hotels. Happy hour is a great idea and we picked up many tips from other guests.Thank you 414 for a fantastic stay and if we return to New York you will be the only place we will stay now. Carl Baker - stayed October 2018.

If your looking for a great Midtown Hotel alternative to Large chain brands, look no further. The 414, located on 46th street between 9th &10th is a refreshing alternative. Large (By NYC standards), well appointed rooms, Excellent location for midtown activities (Shows, Dining, sightseeing) and easy parking on 45th street if your driving.Very service oriented staff, very clean with great touches like a PM social and AM Continental breakfast as part of your stay.

This hotel is an easy walk from Penn Station and is right in the middle of tons of bars and restaurants in a gay-friendly area. Every imaginable food type is available just outside the doors. Plus it is a short walk to Broadway. The staff is super helpful and friendly. The hotel is a walk up so not great for handicapped or elderly but awesome for others.

Location is great for access to midtown and Central Park. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable, lots of nice touches from toiletries to mini-fridge. Complimentary happy hour was perfect before we went to dinner. Continental breakfast had good selection, healthy options. Coffee was very good.

This boutique hotel deserves its high rating, the staff are exceptional, friendly, helpful. and welcoming.Rooms are of a good size for New York and certainly big enough for us. Our room was at the back on the fourth floor, which cut down a lot of the noise from the local streets. Rooms come with fridges and safes, a continental breakfast is provided along with an evening wine and cheese social hour and half ish, which was great for socialising with other guests and staff. The location is excellent, located on a relatively quiet street in Hell's Kitchen, close to Restaurant Row and only a few blocks from Times Square and the theatres with great subway links a couple of blocks away, where the subway can take you to and from JFK airport.This hotel being a boutique, does not have a lift, but did not cause us a problem and we are retired.For New York hotel prices, this hotel is an excellent place to stay.

Nice hotel, friendly staff and a really good location.Because of a reservation error (which they handled fast and with care) we changed rooms a few times.All the rooms were clean and had enough space for the two of us.Social hour was a nice extra touch.The staff can tell you all abouy the city and gives you tips on where to go.

It is a cute little hotel with lovely interiors. The location is excellent, close to theaters and cool restaurants, although the street is fairly quiet. Our room was spacious enough (considering you are in Manhattan), comfortable, very clean and with a nice street view. The AC was a bit noisy, but overall it wasn't a problem. The staff was super nice and helpful! The breakfast was all right, there could have been more variety, but it wasn't bad at all. (There is a little kitchen you can use to prepare some basic meals, I guess.) Overall, we really enjoyed our stay!

This was our first visit to New York and we could not have picked a better hotel and location. The staff were brilliant, always made you feel welcome and they were all very helpful. The hotel was very clean & although it was not one of your modern style hotels, it certainly catered for all your needs. The breakfast was simple but adequate and it was a great time to meet and talk to other guests.

This small hotel helped make our visit to New York memorable. If you're looking for Jacuzzi's and lots of chrome and glass then go elsewhere. What you will find here is a family-style B&B where the staff know who you are and are interested in not only your well being but are anxious for you to experience the wonders of the city and advise on where to go and what to do. I recognise many of the recent review on TA and remember the authors fondly; it's this familiarity that makes the stay. Everyone is encouraged to join in breakfast conversation, which is taken at a large table in the reception area. There's also a free Happy Hour between 5.30pm and 7pm every evening where cheese, beer and wine are all provided and enjoyed by all the guests.The real highlight and the secret of 414 are the members of staff; they're all out of the same box, helpful, smiling, caring and welcoming. Jacqui, Adonis, Emmy [from Hull] and Rachel cannot be faulted; their advice is top notch and they are happy to organise anything to make your stay pleasurable such as theatre tickets and cab rides.It's a wonderful opportunity to also meet travellers from all over the world, gathering for breakfast and happy hour. We spoke freely with guests from France, Germany, Holland, England, Ireland, the Middle East and, of course the USA. Interestingly, a number of guests were staying for their third visit so 414 must be doing something right. My wife and I would happily stay there again.

If you are considering staying at the 414 Hotel...do! We just got back from staying for 5 nights and would happily go back again. This was our first trip to NYC. Not knowing were to stay, I turned to Tripadvisor. And the reviews were right on the money. Location, location, location is everything in real estate...but in hospitaly it's about service, service, service and location! And this place had it all! Thanks to Jacqui, Emma and the rest, we were treated top-notch. They gave great advice of what to do, what to see, directions to attractions, encouragement to try the subway, and the list goes on and on. Loved the intimate atmosphere...it was like staying in a bed and breakfast in the heart of the city. We spent time with others from Belgium, Australia, Germany, Canada, and across the US and got to visit with them and learn about their lives, family and what they did. Its was AWESOME!!! As the reviews indicate, this is not a luxury hotel as in high-rise, modern, etc. You can get that anywhere it the world; even a few blocks down the very quiet NYC street. But why would you? It felt like we were living in Hell's Kitchen for the short time we were there. The rooms could be described as cozy and comfortable. Bottomline, would we stay there again. YES! As in duh? Thanks, 414 team for a great visit! We'll be back!

Stayed here for 5 nights and it was amazing. Close to great restaurants, Time Square, subway. Just a note that hotel does not have an elevator.. We were lucky to be on the ground floor but it would not of been a problem if we had of been upstairs. They have a social hour every day with wine and cheese and this was wonderful way to meet lots of people from all over the world. We met many returning quests and now we would definitely recommend and stay here again. Staff friendly and extremely helpful. Wonderful hotel.

Just back from a weeks stay in this wonderful hotel. The friendliest hotel we have every stayed in. The staff are exceptional - they are so friendly and go out of their way to chat and help the guests (especially Jacqui and Emmy). Complementary breakfast and social hour are great to meet and chat with other guest. We loved sitting around the ‘big’ table talking to the other guests from all around the world and getting tips on where to visit and eat. Great location - there are numerous restaurants, bars in the local area around the hotel. The hotel is close to the subway and Theatre district. The hotel also offers complimentary tours of Central Park - Tina the guide was very knowledgeable and showed us some secret places and shared many interesting facts about Central Park.Don’t stay in a hotel where your just a guest - stay here where they know your name, ask about your day, give you tips on what to do and where to eat and give you complimentary wine and beer to top it of.Thanks for a wonderful stay.

We just spent 5 nights at this hotel and absolutely loved it. It was our first time to NYC and staying at the 414 Hotel was perfect. The staff were the best. They are helpful and caring and go out of their way to help you with anything you might need. There is a happy hour every evening and continental breakfast in the morning so you get a chance to visit with the other guests. Hotel is centrally located and lots of great restaurants within walking distance as well as theaters and subway.

Exceptional atmosphere, very pleasant and attentive stuff. Perfect location in the middle of theater and entertainment area. Good breakfast. Happy hour. Plenty of dining options, right next to the restaurant raw. Perfect if you wish to explore Midtown on foot (few minutes walk to Times Square). Very clean room, good housekeeping. Reasonable price for the area. Next time will definitely stay here.

We stayed for 6 nights at this great little hotel. Rooms clean and a good size, very comfortable. There is a nice breakfast included every morning, with Happy hour provided in the afternoon. A great way to chat with other guests and the staff and find out different ways to spend the days in NYC, before venturing out for dinner. Location is fantastic with short walks to Restaurant row and Times Square, also conveniently placed for the subway. By far, the best asset at this hotel is the staff. They are happy to assist with anything you need, restaurant reservations to subway info, to Broadway shows, nothing is too much trouble. A special shout out to Emmy, who went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. To the owners - you have a great hotel, but your biggest asset is your staff, they make the difference between a good hotel and a great one.

We (my wife and I) were pleasantly surprised by actually everything regarding the hotel services and location. We were even able to book Broadway tickets there. And we were offered a free Central Park Tour which was awsome. This stay will certainly be remembered as long as my memory lasts:)

God service and helpfull whit all bookings and suggestions . Nice and nice people at the desk . Location was perfect for shopping and event and piecefull area . The garden was very nice to eat breakfast

Came in for a show at Carnegie Hall. Was immediately checked in & we had a few moments to chill in our room. They had a free happy hour going on in the small lobby, but had no time to partake. Room was very clean, not a bad size for NYC. Plenty of towels in room. Bed was comfortable. They also offer a nice continental breakfast but we chose to go get a NYC bagel & coffee breakfast, but it did look awesome. Would stay here again.

This was our 3rd trip to NY and our third stay at 414 Hotel. We cant say enough good things about the hotel and the employees that work there. Everything about 414 is top notch. Everyone there is friendly and goes out of there way to ensure you are looked after. Location is as good as it gets. A couple blocks from Times Square, the Theatre District and many restaurants.We enjoyed the happy hour which was new from our last visit. Was nice to relax and enjoy a beverage after a day out on the town and visit with other guests that were there.I would recommend thus hotel to anyone travelling to NYC.

This small friendly hotel was a treat. The staff were efficient, informal and friendly, making us feel very welcome. The free cheese and wine social every evening was great, with staff and other guests making it feel like a party. A continental breakfast is part of the deal. Our room was well appointed and comfortable with one of the biggest beds I have ever seen! We visited on our anniversary and we found a bottle of fizz with chocolates awaiting us on our return - a lovely touch. The hotel is located in a quiet street, very well placed for a huge range of restaurants, both on Restaurant Row and other nearby streets, and Times Square. Also in striking distance of a good range of public transport options. I heartily recommend 414 Hotel.

The 414 Hotel is a small hotel in Hell's Kitchen that offers travelers a very personal and enjoyable place to stay in a great location. The hotel is situated on a relatively quiet street that is in very close proximity to Broadway theatres, most being within a 2 - 4 block walk. There is a wide range of dining options nearby. The rooms are small but comfortable, and really all you need when you are out seeing the city for most of the day. We particularly enjoyed the meeting place in the "lobby" of the hotel where we regularly interacted with other guests from around the world, and with the exceptionally friendly and helpful desk staff. We took advantage of the complimentary tour of the High Line area offered by the hotel and would highly recommend the tour to anyone as it was very interesting and informative about the city generally and this new development in particular.

This was the first trip we have taken where the hotel was an integral part of the stay without being a resort. The staff interaction was personal and sincere. The cocktail hour in the evening was a large part of the experience. It was fun to visit with the international visitors and share dining and sightseeing experiences . Be prepared for the stairs, no elevator, but that was the only negative I can up with. The location was wonderful for walking to a variety of different restaurants. Easy walk to theaters, Times Square, Rockefeller Center all within 15 minutes.Where you stay is the most important decision for us and this was one the best choices we have ever made!

Loved the hotel and it's wonderful staff. Home away from home after a crazy days running around NYC. Jacquie, Rachael and Emmy you were so kind and helpful. You know the city from all corners. Loved happy hour chats with other guests. Breakfast was great. This place a must if staying in NY

Great location on quiet street not far from Theaters & Times Square. Easy access from Lincoln Tunnel if driving. Large room by NYC standards. Clean, well appointed, comfortable beds/pillows, great reading light sconces near bed you can actually read by! Entire staff is very friendly & helpful. Nice continental breakfast & Happy Hour a bonus. A GREAT value. Small European hotel type ambiance - no elevator but a very minor inconvenience

As we were leaving the 414 Hotel and turning the corner from the picturesque brownstone - lined street and onto the bustle of 9th Avenue, my wife mused out loud, 'I think that just may be the best hotel in the world.' She does not give praise lightly.From the moment we booked over the phone from the UK, Jacqui and her staff were friendly and helpful - we knew this place was going to be different. A daily newsletter every morning with the weather report and suggestions for sightseeing opportunities helped with our daily planning once we were in New York. When we had to cut our visit short and fly cross country to attend a funeral, the 414 team held onto our luggage and welcomed us back like family when we returned to catch our homeward flight back to the UK. Whether we were trying to get to the airport or to a location across town, there was always a detailed set of instructions ready to be printed out; the hotel 'where-to-eat' guide is a must-read for its wit and scope. The daily social hour was a delight; billed as a wine and cheese tasting, there was a broad selection of refreshments on offer. An international clientele ensured stimulating conversation and made for entertaining evenings. We felt that every member of staff was interested in making our stay pleasant. During our week-long stay, we witnessed on countless occasions how the 414 team responded to the needs and requests of their guests with imagination, care and humour. Hotel 414 strikes the balance between being a haven of calm and a jumping-off point for adventure. We will be coming back.

I love this hotel!! This is the second time I stayed at 414 Hotel. I find the staff to be so helpful, curteous, and quickly respond to any emails I sent. They were able to help me with a box I had shipped ahead of time. They were helpful on the phone and provided great customer service in person! The hotel itself is centrally located. We found two excellent restaurants right around the corner which I would go back to another time and my son just loved. The hotel is decorated with charming red accents. The beds were super comfortable and clean. One can enjoy sitting outside on a bench in front of the hotel or in the private courtyard between the two buildings. We loved the morning breakfast with a nice selection to choose from. One night when we returned to the hotel there was a father and son playing chess, which just added to the charm and comfort of the hotel.

Service is welcoming and friendly. Coffee and treats available throughout the day with wine and cheese in the evening. Very intimate setting with a chance to get to know the staff and fellow guests. Truly a charming hotel in a great location.

I love that this place is only minutes from Times Square and yet a world away from the noise and hustle. Cosy and clean, great breakfast and social hour, welcoming and courteous staff - everything you need to provide a comfortable and relaxing base from which to explore the city (or work hard at a conference all day in my case)!

I wanted to give the highest rating possible, but the hotel just does not make it. The positive: The employees, 5 star all the way. All were kind and helpful and totally sincere in their efforts. We felt welcome at all times. There is not enough good that can be said about everyone we met who worked at the 414 Hotel. The building is lovely and historic. An old late 19th to early 20th century tenement from the working class days of Hells Kitchen. So much nicer to stay at a building with character vice another same old, same old Marriott. The location is so convenient, just a short walk to Times Square, shopping, theaters and restaurants. Subway is near by for trips up or down town. I read a few reviews where a guest said they felt unsafe in the neighborhood, not so. Not once did I feel unsafe walking day time or night. I am a 60 year old woman and was with my 15 year old granddaughter, no fear. Certainly one must remain cognizant of their surroundings and walk with confidence, but that is the best advice anywhere, not just in NYC. Our room was very quiet. We were in a garden room (partially below grade) in the back building and it is a very quiet location. Though the courtyard is right out the door for other guests to sit and enjoy, we never heard anyone being loud. Our bed was very comfortable, sleep was easy. Breakfast was continental, and satisfying. An assortment of bagels, breads, scones and english muffins with various jams and butter, cereals, juice and fruit, coffee and tea. All good. Now, to the negative: The room smelled of mildew. Not overwhelming but noticeable at all times. Now, I think this was because NYC had just received days of heavy rain, way above normal, and with this being a below grade room, it would take time to resolve. The in room ductless air system temperature was turned very low when we entered, to 62 degrees, and I think this was in an effort to try to dry out the dampness as fast as possible, but to no avail. The room was small, but this was expected and perfectly fine. We had enough space. It has seen better days and is in need of a in depth cleaning and update. Surface cleaning was being done, meaning, the tub, toilet and sink were clean, and the linens, but every where you looked you noted dirt. Baseboards, not wiped in months, heavy dust. Even the tops of each wall and outlet plate, never wiped, evident dirt. You could feel it, you could see it. The I assume granite counter tops were beyond help. Possibly because they were never resealed, but ring marks and high wear evident. An overall dog eared appearance. It would seem that for not a very great cost, management could reinvest some money to update (and deep clean!!!) and have a true gen in the heart of midtown. It is very reminiscent of bed and breakfasts that I stayed at in Europe, small and intimate, and if only given a bit of TLC (and again, cleaning) well it could be a WOW! Thanks to the staff for making our stay a welcoming one, you were all so hospitable and gracious.

Everything at The 414 is outstanding, especially the staff who can't do enough for you, they made our stay perfect from start to finish & we wouldn't stay anywhere else in New York.Thank you guys for making it a trip to remember! We look forward to our next visit x

Neat little hotel handy to many restaurants ,short walk to Times Square and Central Park is walkable. We had a room on 4th floor and although there is no lift,at 74 we managed our bags o k. Very friendly helpful staff,nice free happy hour.over all an enjoyable stay. Breakfast ( included) gave a chance to meet other guests more so than larger hotels which was good. Would recommend a visit.

I searched & searched for a good hotel in midtown. 414 did not disappoint! Convenient location, courteous staff, clean room, and individualized service. Great extras - breakfast, drinks, & a bottle of sparkling wine after we mentioned it was our anniversary.

I'm used to hotels with expansive lobbies, so I was a little thrown when I walked into a small room which was more like a motel office. But the person there was very friendly and accommodating, as were the rest of the staff. And when I got to my room, any concerns I had disappeared. It was clean and comfortable and the A/C worked phenomenally on this extremely hot humid New York night.

414 is in a convenient location in Hell’s Kitchen. There is no elevator so visitors must be able to climb stairs with luggage. Nice happy hour every night so meeting other guests is encouraged. Rooms are well appointed.

We stayed overnight for the weekend. Found the hotel quiet, comfortable, all the desired amenities (except a formal lobby), delightful staff. Great coffee and scones! Near good restaurants and plays....all within walking distance. Would stay again, and recommend to friends who appreciate a good price, and can forego penultimate luxury surroundings.....though we felt that we lacked nothing we would want.

We enjoyed this small, attractive hotel with very personalized service. The staff all went out of their way to be helpful and engaged with us and other patrons. Breakfasts and happy hour around a shared table with other guests was enjoyable. This was a very good New York experience.

Two blocks from Times Square, one block from restaurant row, a short walk to subway and buses, and in the heart of everything, you'll find yourself staying in a european style boutique hotel. Breakfast and afternoon drinks and cheese are included in the lowest price you can find for a hotel in NYC. What else can you ask for?

414 Hotel is a real delight. The friendly and helpful staff make this hotel a joy to stay in. The rooms are on the small side, but have everything you need - including a refrigerator and safe - and lots of power points. The beds are very comfortable. Continental Breakfast is included, as is free WIFI. The hotel is close to the subway and Times Square. There is a long list of recommended restaurants and bars, which we found very helpful. Each afternoon there is a social hour for guests to get to know each other, with free wine and cheese. Once a week Tina, a city guide, leads a very informative guided tour of The Highline. The 2.5 hour tour is free for hotel guests, but tips are welcome. 414 Hotel is an incredibly homely, friendly and well located base for a visit to New York. We will certainly be back.

European-style hotel with friendly and personal service. The rooms are simple and small, but well appointed and comfortable. The shower pressure was outstanding. Happy hour is a nice touch and a great time to share stories with other guests. Fantastic location and value!

Great location and service. Accommodating and friendly staff. Reserve early; there aren't many rooms. Many good places to eat nearby. It's fun to meet guests from foreign countries. Having breakfast at the hotel is very convenient.

I stayed with my wife for a week and I have to say that this hotel was amazing! Amazing location, great clean room with enough space, very nice and always smiling service!If I am back in NYC then the 414 would certainly be my first choice!!

I stayed at 414 on a solo trip to NY. It was everything I was looking for - located a short distance from the madness of Times Square on a fairly quiet side street, easy walking distance to everything I needed including theaters, and amenities like breakfast and happy hour. Though I didn't need staff help with any of my logistics, they were very willing to assist with anything I may have needed. I was cheerfully greeted every time I walked through the door. Rooms are not fancy, but they are a decent size and clean; mine had a small desk and a comfortable chair for reading or watching TV. Bathroom amenities included everything I needed and hot water was quick and plentiful. Be aware that there is no elevator and if you are on an upper floor you will have to use the stairs several times a day. It is nice to be able to get from the front door of the hotel to your room in under a minute though! Nearby attractions include Restaurant Row (just across 9th Avenue), Starbucks (3 blocks), Pret a Manger (1.5 blocks), and Schmackary's (1.5 blocks).

The room was immaculate, the people were always friendly and helpful, the location is convenient and quiet, and the restaurant recommendations and daily newsletter were so helpful! The only thing not perfect is that they didn't serve eggs or bacon with breakfast...I've never seen that before. They had plenty of bread/pastry options and awesome coffee though.

We loved this hotel. The staff was incredibly helpful and did a great job accommodating us. They offered continental breakfast, a nice happy hour, and recommendations on restaurants & things to do with teenagers. The rooms were nicely appointed & had plenty of room with 1 roll away per room for 6 of us. It was also centrally locates. They even offered complimentary tours. We took the one of the High Line. Tina led us on a 2 hour tour with lots of interesting facts we would have missed if we’d walked on our own. After the tour you may tip her what you feel the tour was worth. What a nice offering this hotel has! I look forward to staying here again in the future!

Great staff. Very conscious of helping you with whatever you may need. Comfy rooms. Decent price for New York. Friendly atmosphere amongst guests is encouraged by social hour. Even offer tours of NYC from their own staff.

It's been 2 years since my last visit and I wouldn't change my review at that time. It remains a warm and welcoming small hotel. For me it's in a great location, easy to get to the subway, and Hell's Kitchen gives you that 'New York experience'. The guest are international (5 countries + US while I was there), so breakfast and the Happy Hour can be quite interesting events. Some reviewers have experienced minor irregularities - they have a point, perhaps, if that's what is important to you. For me those imperfections are insignificant compared to the personal atmosphere that the staff and owners have created.

This boutique hotel has a great location and friendly front of desk staff. it's not the flashest place a round, but it's clean and tidy and the helpfulness of the reception staff and the location more than make up for any shortcomings.

I stayed at the 414 in 2012. I'm not sure when they opened, but I imagine they were still a young boutique hotel. I thought fame, excellent location, and a high ranking on TripAdvisor would change them - it has slightly, but the charm of being a small, personable hotel are still there. I remember during my first stay, my main complaint was not many outlets for my electronics. There was one on the opposite wall, but my charger kept falling out of the wall. It's now updated with many working outlets! Also the breakfast and social hour are still there and still pretty good quality. And the rooms are still a fairly big size compared to a lot of other New York hotels. My only complaint is the stairwell in the back. I had to walk up to the fourth floor, which was tiring enough after a long day of walking, and it was just so warm. I'm not sure if this is because of the sky window or if there's actually no air conditioning up there. Also I agree with another review, the garden needs some work. Felt like calling my mom; she'd have that place blooming in no time. Overall, the location and friendliness of this hotel is what had me coming back again, even 6 years later, and I would certainly come back again!

We stayed at the 414 Hotel for 8 nights in July. The hotel wants to be an upscale boutique hotel, but it needs to do some work to attain that status. For example, the first time we used the toilet, it would not flush. The bathroom had no fan, and in a tiny hotel room this is something that should definitely be in place. The hotel provided Q-tips, but after the four days they were gone, but never refilled. One morning, housekeeping left two conditions instead of a shampoo and conditioner. The patio could have been an inviting place to sit and relax, but no plants were growing in the numerous pots around the patio. The scaffolding on the patio was in place because of construction next door, but it would have gone a long way to making the patio inviting by simply putting some shade loving plants in the pots. I had a couple of questions for the staff, but on two different occasions they never got back to me when they said they would. We did love the social hour every evening from 5:30-7:00 where they provide wine and cheese for the guests. In addition, most of the staff were nice and polite.

Great hotel/great people. When we checked in Jacqui was tremendous in giving us ideas on where to visit based on my daughters age and our interests. Neat little hotel hidden amongst the other brownstones. A real home away from home for the 2 of us who weren’t regular visitors to NYC! Rachel gave input on transit and even gave me her metro card to use. Emmie - delightful and full of advice. Adonis helped get our bags up the stairs (no elevator only downside I saw to 4 story unit.) and was also very helpful in printing my boarding passes! Rooms clean, air conditioning ran perfectly and easy adjustment of temp control. Great continental breakfast and amazing cappuccino/espresso machine for your use 24 x 7! We will be back!

The intimate scale of this charming hotel was perfect and the staff were, all genuinely welcoming, friendly and helpful. The hotel has the feel of an English bed and breakfast inn and at the same time meets all the standards of cleanliness and amenities you expect from a big fancy hotel. They offer a very nice continental breakfast spread and afternoon wine and cheese offered as well; guests seem to feel comfortable saying hello and chatting-- it is a lovely atmosphere. overall. The location is a couple of blocks to the west of Times Square, so it's convenient to all the shows and lots of great small restaurants in the area, but you don't have to contend with the craziness and crowds of Times Square at all-- it's relatively quiet and feels safe. This was my best hotel stay in NYC ever.

AWESOME location for Broadway, using the Subway, and wide choice of cuisines...Wonderful staff...Very clean, safe and quiet hotel especially if you stay in the back building...Needs a good update from the mattresses, to the rugs and towels, the color choice of both the rooms, bedding, window treatments and common areas especially the walkway past the garden area to the back building...Would I stay here again - Yes,because of the location and staff...Genuine and caring toward their guests....I had a FABULOUS three days....

We loved our weekend stay at 414. The location was perfect and we couldn't get over how quiet the room was, never hearing any outside noise from the street. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, making good suggestions and helpful tips to get around the city. We will definitely be back!

My daughter and I stayed for a few nights as a last minute trip to NYC. The location was perfect, right in the the middle of the action. We walked, took the subway and taxi's so conveniently from this location. It was a short stroll to dinner and a Broadway play. We had a wonderful dinner at a neighborhood Italian restaurant called Becco (recommended by the staff). The food was amazing! The smaller boutique nature of the hotel was the perfect place to come 'home' to after a busy day of sightseeing. The staff (Emmy, Fernando, Rachel and Adeanis) was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. The light breakfast in the AM and happy hour at the en dot the day was perfect. Nothing like having friendly people and a glass of wine waiting for you after a long day sightseeing :) The room was clean, we had plenty of space and the bathrooms were nice. Thank you 414 Hotel!! we hope to stay again!!!

Had a fabulous time. The hotel looked proper authentic New York rather than a high rise without character. Breakfast was self serve and informal but had a good selection. Staff very helpful and location felt very safe and secure.

This hotel reminds me of ones I have stayed in around Europe. It’s clean and simple. The staff are great and there is free cappuccino from their machine at any time of day. There is also breakfast and a social hour both of which I missed due to my schedule. I would stay there again, especially if you want to see some shows

We recently stayed in the 414 Hotel for six nights during our vacations in New York City. Everything was very clean. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We had a ‘Premier Queen’ room in the upper floor in the backyard house. The room was small and simple, but all was in good conditions. Thinking about that this Hotel is in midtown Manhattan, it was relatively quit. However, I can imagine that this is different in the rooms to the front street. The breakfast was also simple, but enough for us to get ready for the day.Considering that it is just a 3-star Hotel and the price is moderate for New York City, I rate it with 4 points. If we come to New York, we would choose the Hotel again.

A small hotel that turned out to be a real gem in the hustle of Hell's Kitchen. Great service and amenities. Wonderful staff and very friendly fellow guests. Rooms were cozy and clean. Had a truly wonderful visit and plan to stay again.

Here’s a great place to stay in Hell’s Kitchen in NYC. Close to theatres and restaurants. Fantastic staff who provided us with invaluable travel tips....sights to see, how to get there, where to eat, discount theatre vouchers. Also nice to meet with other guests at the communal breakfast table and at Happy Hour in the afternoon. Room comfortable, clean and cool. Just a lovely simple friendly hotel. Would stay there again.

Room was a little smelly; can't really put our finger on what the smell was but we needed to buy some Fabreeze and spray down the room a few times. Room is very noisy from other guests moving around upstairs. Room is basically an efficiency apartment so the vanity is in the room rather than behind a wall and door. This is a real problem if there are two of you and you want to wake up at different times. The towels are meager at best. Staff was mostly nice. The lobby is very similar to a European hotel in that it is very small and communal.

I can't understand why this hotel received positive reviews. It is a sketchy place. The positive thing is: the room was clean. The AC was very noisy and ran constantly. I would not recommend this place and won't return.

the hotel is intimate, charming, and perfectly located for theatre-going, and I can hardly say enough about the staff - warm, welcoming, helpful & gracious, and made you feel as if you were a guest in their home.

My daughter and I traveled with an A.C.T. Broadway theater tour in June. This hotel was perfect. The staff is especially warm and helpful, especially Jacqui, the concierge, and Adanes. Our group booked the entire hotel, and the leader could not have made a better choice.

This was my fourth or fifth stay at 414. It continues to be a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are comfortable, the atmosphere is cozy, the breakfast is terrific, the happy hour is fun, and the staff continues to be exceptional.

414 is a fine hotel and excellent value for money for NYC. And, as the reviews indicate, the staff are indeed very friendly and helpful. However, its astronomical Trip Advisor ranking, like an Indie movie that gets nominated for an Oscar, may lead one to believe it's one of the great finds in the world. This is not the case; it's important to appreciate the 414 for what it is. The rooms are fine, but will not knock you out. The continental breakfast is fine, but not anything special. The little courtyard is nice, but this is not Seville or Marrackech. So, enjoy the location, friendly staff, reasonably priced rooms and opportunity to meet other guests, but temper any unrealistic expectations.

This hotel is great, similar to smaller European hotels. Excellent service. Very helpful staff with restaurant recommendations & sightseeing. Breakfast & happy hour. The perfect NYC location, near Restaurant Row & theatre district.

Great hotel! Helpful and friendly staff, room was clean and well taken care of. Breakfast was a great bonus!! Would highly recommend for anyone looking to stay in a smaller hotel. We will return next time were in NYC.

Located on a quiet street just north and west of Times Square was a good location. We appreciated the courteous staff, breakfasts, wine and cheese offerings and all day availability of coffee and tea. I question how comfortable our room on second floor would be in hotter months as night table blocked flow of air from air conditioner.

414 Hotel made our first time experience in NY the best. They were very friendly, always making sure our needs were met. 414 Hotel is now the only place I would stay at next time I go to NY. Great Location BTW.

414 Hotel is in an vibrant and safe neighborhood. Staff members, especially Ashley at the front desk, were most accommodating. We were given helpful tips regarding use of mass transit, restaurants and attractions. Room was well appointed with a nice note, champagne and chocolates upon our arrival. There is off street parking at a cost of $30 per day which is inexpensive by NY standards. Breakfast and a happy hour nightly are included in the cost of the room which is unusual in NYC. Newspapers are available for sharing in the entry room area. You can also sit on one of two benches in a gated area in front of the hotel. Tourist information in available in office area.

I can honestly say I’ve never stayed anywhere quite like this little hotel. It’s not luxurious or glamorous but it is spotlessly clean, comfortable, rooms are a good size and they provide absolutely everything you could need for a great stay. It’s totally unique in the way it manages to create a sense of family and belonging. Apart from the staff being very welcoming, the free drinks around the table in the foyer all times of day is great. I much prefer it to having drink facilities in the room. The free breakfast, although only basic, is a nice touch and a great way of chatting with your fellow roomies. They invited us to the daily social gathering and we couldn’t believe it when we went on our second afternoon and there was wine, beer cheese and crackers laid out for all the guests. Safe haven in a crazy place.

A very convenient location on 46th Street 9th Avenue. Lovely people that encourage social events at breakfast times and late afternoon with other guests which is really nice. I would definitely come back here and recommend to anyone else looking to stay in downtown New York

Hi,Stayed here late May to early June.It is the staff that make the 414 stand out.So friendly and helpful. Every single one of them.One example, Ashley researched multiple options and price points for a car service, organised a reservation at a wonderful restaurant; Dos Cominos and provided all sorts of other advice regarding timings for various trips and best subway lines.When I tried to offer her a tip, she refused.Also, the social hour is the best. Very generous spread laid out which really promotes interaction with the other guests. Everyone is from somewhere else and so the conversation are so wide ranging and informative.Hotel 414 . You can't go wrong.

A fun experience that began a little apprehensively.When we arrived in a busy one way street, double parked & totally stressed out by impatient NY drivers we were greeted by our calm hostess Rachel who managed to wrestle 2 golf bags, 2 large suitcases & various other bits of luggage into the Hotel. As my hubby raced back to the car & return it to the car hire, Rachel had given me our room key & put all the bags in the room. She’d told me to relax & make a cuppa.And that’s how our week went.Nothing was too much trouble for our lovely hosts & hostess; Rachel, Ashley & Adonis.The Hotel was in a great location, walking to Broadway, underground, shops & I’d say to most places.The room was clean & neat. Enough room to house all of our luggage. The bed & pillows comfy.The one thing we weren’t prepared for was the scaffolding in the courtyard which was glum, dark & run down. We had to keep our curtains closed at all times. The other thing was the immediate musty smell when we entered the room which we got used to.I did look at changing rooms & decided it wasn’t worth the hassle & as it turned out - it wasn’t.

Just arrived from 414 hotel, really liked it, i was in the premier king, good space for NY with space for bags, clothes,etc. Its a small place but you never feel that. First i need to thank Emmy, she is so great, helped a lot and she is very educated, my kind of person to be at the reception of an hotel, always with a smile, she could even been the RP, manager etc.Breakfast could be a bit better, just some ham and cheese? No need for hot food but ham and cheese would improve a lot the breakfast. The location is great 10m from theatre district. To be fare all the staff is very nice! Rooms and bathroom were very clean and the sleeping quality is great, you don't hear anything from the noise outside. So, go with no worries and enjoy it.

This review is rather belated but incredibly well deserved. My wife and I stayed here in April on our honeymoon to the United States, and were drawn to 414 by its location within the city (Hell's Kitchen - well placed for getting around), and for the excellent feedback that it had drawn in its guest experience.We were not disappointed in the slightest - a warm welcome from Emmy and the team was followed by the delightful surprise of a bottle of sparkling wine and some chocolates in our room - not only had the hotel been able to fulfil our request for a top floor room, but they'd also marked our anniversary date and we were touched by their generosity.The room itself was pleasant and more than adequate in size, we found ourselves able to sleep comfortably there, with little disturbance whatsoever by any noise from the city, or from other guests. As a top floor room, it might be troublesome for those with reduced mobility or lots of luggage (no lift in this townhouse building), but we managed well enough.Before we ventured out into NYC, the hotel was able to give us advice, information, a transport map, and even respond to our queries about different experiences or ideas that we'd seen or considered prior to arrival. They even pointed out a serviced laundrette about 5 doors away (after a week of travelling this was welcome), and the same day service offered there was both affordable and convenient.Breakfast is also a real treat at 414, and whilst not a 'hot' offering, it is substantially provided for with cereals, breads, bagels, preserves, yoghurts, and fruit - accompanied by tea, coffee, juice and water. All included in the room rate, of excellent quality and much appreciated - only advice would be to avoid 8-8:30 as limited seating makes it a squeeze! Another little touch, and enjoyed by ourselves on our return from forays into the city), was the ability to make a coffee in the hotel foyer - no facility in the room, but I think I actually prefer this option, as you end up with a better drink, and a chance to socialise.On departure, we were concerned on getting to our airport hotel at JFK, and didn't fancy trying public transport for this, as we weren't too sure how easy it would be for the last leg at least. 414 did us the courtesy of approaching a private hire firm (sadly I've forgotten their name), and booking a car to come and pick us up - with an indicative price offered there and then, so no taking a chance with NYC taxi cab meters in traffic (a good job, as there was a lot of traffic!). Just another example of what the team at 414 are willing to do to make your stay stand out - they really did go the extra mile for us, and we won't forget them. Thank you.W Turton

The Rodgers & Hart song from "On Your Toes" is fitting for 414 Hotel. "We'll thank the small hotel" a lyric form the song. Thank you for a wonderful stay in April. (24th-25th & 26th). Having stayed here in September of 2016 I was eager to return. This time I chose a courtyard room. How disappointed I was to find out that the courtyard was covered with scaffolding due to construction next door. Also the previous owners Susan & Andrew were gone. However Susan popped in while I was there and it was nice to see her. The staff is always welcoming and helpful. Thank you, Jacqui, Emmy and Ashley. The room was a step down on the bottom floor but because of the scaffold no light was able to get in. I would recommend a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor of the back unit. Excellent location close to Time Square & Broadway and Restaurant Row and the subway. Nice to mingle with the guests from many different nations and the USA. A basic breakfast is provided and there is also a happy hour.

414 Hotel was fantastic. The people that work there, especially Emmy and Ashley, went way above and beyond. Always happy to help and offer advice, with a smile. The hotel is small, 22 rooms, which is a bonus, it's like a home, not a hotel, as you can see in the picture, it's lovely and quaint. They have happy hour every day from 5.30-7pm and there's cheese and biscuits, wines, beers, spirits, soft drinks, it's a great extra. It's on a lovely little street, which is busy, but just busy enough to sit out the front on the bench seats and watch people go past. We got to talk to some locals just from sitting out the front, it was great. The breakfast is just average, nothing special. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, this is very important to me and I wasn't disappointed at all. Room 203 can be a little noisy, as it's on the street and just above a very small bar, and a couple of times I couldn't get back to sleep as people were out the front talking at 3.30am, which was a bit annoying. Would recommend this hotel highly!

The hotel was terrific. Helpful staff, great location, well maintained. Close to all the action yet in a relatively quiet area near Times Square.Every one of the several staff we encountered were most helpful and knowledgeable.

The rooms were very small but clean. Brochures talked about being remodeled, but it looked DIY as the paint job was power, but that did not effect the stay. Convenient location with easy access to foods and transportation. Most staff was friendly, but didn’t blow my socks off.
