Very homelike feeling in the heart of the city. It was our anniversary and they sent champagne and chocolate to our room. We loved it so much that we already booked 3 days in December. Oh, no elevator so 4th floor can be a tough walk.

414 Hotel completely lived up to the hype. I took my daughter for a 13 year old birthday trip and 414 Hotel was the icing on the cake. It was convenient to many of the sites and restaurants. The bed was sooo comfy and we slept wonderful. The friendly staff was super helpful. It truly felt like coming home each night. We would definitely stay again.

We have just returned from an 8 week trip to the USA and Canada. During our trek we stayed in many hotels ranging from 3 star to 5 star some costing up to $1000 per night. Our stay at 414 was by far the best. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the location was great. Best of all was the friendly staff. Susan and Andrew and all the staff made us feel very welcome. 414 Hotel made our visit to New York very special.

Have had to think about this review a fair bit. I don't have anything overly negative to say, but I honestly am not sure why this hotel is rated this high on TA. But here are my thoughts.....Good- 1)Hotel is conveniently located near broadway, so that was a plus for sure. 2)The staff is very personable. I think this may one of the main reasons why this hotel is rated so highly. All the staff were helpful and there to do anything for you. They always had a smile when you walked in the door. The staff was outstanding.3)No street noise. We stayed in the back building and never heard any street noise. We could hear footsteps above us but luckily for us it wasn't bad at all. 4) room is fairly plain, but functional and clean.The rest:1) I guess my expectations were higher as the hotel was so highly rated on TA. We have been to NY on 4 other occasions and I wouldn't by any means rate this as the #1 hotel we stayed at in NY, and as I mentioned thats only comparing it to the 4 other establishments we stayed at. So not sure how its rated #1 or #2 in the whole city. Not the hotels fault at all, but I suggest you temper your expectations.2) The room was clean, but it was in no way the least bit luxurious. Just a basic room with some areas that looked like they could use some minor repairs or paint. Nothing that didn't work etc, just cosmetic items, but again not really what I expected.3) Although close to times square, I didn't care for this area of town. I was expecting the neighbourhood to maybe be a bit quieter, but the streets were very hectic and it was not a quiet area at all. We stayed in the mid town east area on a previous stay and found that area of manhattan to be very quiet in comparison. ( but not as accessible to times square)Thats about it. Again, I would in no way say not too stay here, but I am very surprised its rated this high on TA. I would say perhaps I could see it being rated highly for value perhaps? Maybe? but overall one of the top 2 or 3 hotels in NY, my opinion is no.

We have been staying at the 414 twice a year for several years. It keeps getting better. Great location and a wonderful alternative to big NY hotels. Susan, Jacqui, and the other 414 people are great hosts.

Second time at this boutique hotel in the center of the universe, two blocks from Times square. As last time Drew met us and made us feel welcome. We really appreciate the breakfast " help yourself" and the happy hour when you meet people from all over the world for a nice chat. The hotel manager Susan is a fantastic person who cares about everyone. We will return every time we come to NY.

Enjoyed our visit to the big apple very much. Did loads of the sights and the hotel made it a wonderful experience. The rooms we had were very well equipped and quiet which in such a city must be quite an achievement.

There were two things that brought us to the 414 Hotel, great location and the hopes for a B&B feel. We were not disappointed! One additional thing will bring us back...Susan's amazing in-depth knowledge of NYC and her willingness to share it all with her customers. This hotel is within walking distance to all of Broadway and plenty of good restaurants. Make sure and take note of Susan's recommended places to go for we tried two and they were fantastic. Easy access to the trains and bus lines and free happy hour plus the nice central courtyard were great amenities.

I simply can't say enough about this hotel. I've stayed 4 or 5 times now, and it's my first place to check when I travel to NYC. Susan and Andrew are wonderful, remembering you from previous stays. The staff is incredible, always friendly, helpful, and offering suggestions for your visit. The rooms are very nice and quite roomy compared to other places I've stayed. The free breakfast and wine and cheese in the evening is not to be missed! You really can't go wrong. The benches out front are great for relaxing and people watching, or take your wine and cheese to the inner patio area for tranquility. I recommend this place to everyone visiting, and look forward to many more visits.

We were so pleased to stay at 414 Hotel in Hell's Kitchen in Manhattan. We found the hotel on Trip Advisor and it didn't disappoint. The advantage and strength of the hotel is the staff. We had extensive interactions with Susan, John, Drew and Jacqui and they were superb. You are personally greeted each time you enter the premises. The staff has extensive knowledge regarding site seeing attractions, things not to miss, transportation, restaurants, festivals and if they don't know they will try to find out in a timely manner. Jacqui was able to find me hairspray in a matter of minutes in a semi emergency situation. The hotel location is perfect for walking access to Broadway shows. Just a couple of blocks walk to the Hudson River where we were able to see some Fleet Week festivities. We enjoyed interacting with our fellow travelers (international clientele) at breakfast in the morning and wine, bourbon and cheese in the evenings. As mentioned in other reviews there is no elevator but there are ground level rooms if not able to climb stairs. There is a small outdoor area in the front and also between the townhouses. The public area has guidebooks including NYC walks plus umbrellas. So great to know so you don't have to bring your own if you don't want to. This is more of a home atmosphere then a hotel vibe and we excited to feel included. FYI, mostly adult clientele but there were children who were welcomed and treasured. The room we stayed in was larger then the normal NYC hotel room. We had a front facing room that was double window paned so the street noise was not intrusive. We will absolutely return to 414.

I knew it was going to be difficult to write this review as it's all been said before.This was our first trip to New York, we stayed for 5 nights, and couldn't have asked for more from a hotel in terms of friendship and hospitality. Susan and her team have created an environment within this 22 room hotel, which works perfectly for any visitor looking for the antidote to the typical big, brash skyscraper option. You're on first name terms with the staff and many of the guests by day two, mainly as everyone feels relaxed and happy to share a story or an idea over breakfast or the late afternoon 'happy hour', which are both included in the price.Not everything was perfect and our room at the front of the property was noisier than expected. However, Susan listened sympathetically and managed to resolve the issue with an alternate room, with the minimum of fuss.She and team will happily offer advice and ideas, but equally take a note of places their guests have found, which weren't on their already encyclopaedic list. They even provide a welcome postal service, for those of us who still send postcards. So if you've read this far, bet you'll be contacting the 414 very soon.

Thank you Susan, Jacqui, Emmy and other staff members for the great stay.The best thing about this hotel is they actually care to learn your name, where you're from and why you're in the city, what your plans are for the day and how they turned out at the end of the day.You will not be treated like guest number 1,602, in room 812 of 935, here for days 162 to 165 of 2017. No, instead you will be a part of a small 22 room hotel that will feel like a community thanks to the staff and the hotel guests you will meet during the free breakfasts and happy hour. It will start to feel like home. Throughout the trip, I would say things like "When we get back home" when I meant to say "When we get back to the hotel."During breakfast, Susan and her crew will ask you how your prior day was. They will ask you what you have planned for the day, and if you tell them what you plan on doing, they will offer general tips and guidance on how to get there. For example, we told Susan we were planning on going to Central Park, and she told us she recommended taking the blue line to 72nd Street and then gave us her recommended route through Central Park. It was fantastic!You'll have a daily newsletter at your door giving you details on the weather, as well as tips on what to do on that day. For example, Friday's newsletter said the Museum of Modern Art is free on Friday evenings. On a sunny day it recommended walking the Brooklyn Bridge and on a rainy day, the newsletter had museum recommendations.A few weeks before arriving I asked Susan for Broadway recommendations and she recommended a musical called Come From Away, which my wife and I both loved. Susan was also aware that my wife and I were traveling to celebrate our wedding anniversary and they provided us with a free bottle of champagne and chocolates. On our last day at the hotel, another couple celebrating an anniversary was there and the couple's children brought out a similar gift provided by the hotel and the entire room of people having breakfast sang them a happy anniversary version of the happy birthday song. Another time, Susan asked one of her employees to make 7 more eggs as the eggs were running out and a different employee said that it should be doubled to 14 as multiple guests had still not come down for breakfast. It's the attention to small details like this that make the hotel such an awesome place to stay.You're not going to get a luxurious hotel room, but the room we stayed in was clean,quiet, had a comfortable bed, nice tv with multiple cable channels, and functioning AC. What it won't have are outrageous prices for daring to take a bottle or water or candy from the in-room refrigerator. Just $1 for whatever you take.My one gripe with the hotel? The door to our room was tough to close. Maybe it's because we didn't want to leave.

I have highest praise for this boutique hotel ideally located in the heart of the theater district. The owner and staff went beyond gracious to meet every need. They gave us directions, suggestions, critiques to help us make the best use of our time. Best was the opportunity to meet new friends from across the USA and across the ocean as we shared a common space for breakfast or wine or just to chat.

My wife and I stayed at the 414 over Memorial Day weekend. We were in NYC to sightsee as well as to see several Broadway shows so this location near the theater district was ideal for us. We had easy walk to the various theaters as well as short walks to the Subway stations. We also loved being in more of a neighborhood setting.The staff at the hotel were amazing! Each of them made an effort to talk with us and get to know us. They were more than happy to help plan our days and give advice for getting around. They also took care of arranging our airport transportation.We enjoyed having the included breakfast with bagels, toast, etc. available in the mornings and the happy hour every evening is a bonus! Nice to sit and relax after a long day of sightseeing.We were on the 4th floor in a Premium Queen bed room. The room was very spacious, especially for NYC. The room has a nice sized TV, a room safe, dresser with drawers, mini-fridge, closet, free wifi, and a window AC unit with a very handy remote for changing temps. Our only real drawback was we found the mattress to be overly soft, at least for our tastes. Just a heads up, the hotel does not have an elevator in the event someone is physically unable to navigate stairs. The staff was more than happy to carry luggage for people though!Overall, a great location with a really terrific staff. We look forward to our next NYC stay here.

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying four nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This was our third time in New York, having previously stayed at the more corporate hotels. The 414, as it clearly states, is not your typical hotel. It's not high rise, it's not corporate, it's not even that hotel-like in many respects.What makes this place is the hospitality. During our stay we were looked after by Susan, Jackie, John and Drew at different times and all were fabulously friendly and welcoming.It was like having our own personal trip advisors on hand to tell s the out of the way places to visit and eat at.Each morning, a news letter was popped through the door with little tips on where to visit that day - and we took a few of them up.Don't expect luxury in the sense of what the big hotels offer. The rooms are quite basic in many respects and not what you'd call modern or polished.IN fact, when we were first shown to our room, a premium suite on the courtyard, we were both a little underwhelmed. There was a musty smell that was very noticeable when first entering, but which wasn't after a few moments. The bed was large and comfortable. There was air conditioning and a heater, an iron and ironing board, plus a TV and fridge.The bathroom comprised a shower over the bath tub, plus a WC. The sink was outside the bathroom, in the bedroom, which is a little difficult if you need a little privacy (even after 28 years of marriage).But all of that said, it didn't in any way detract from the experience.We've stayed in the big hotels in New York - 56 floors up, but never have we felt like it was returning home each night. It's hard to explain how they achieve this, but i think it's just that everyone takes an interest in you.A continental breakfast is served in the lobby each morning and this is where it gets interesting. You find yourself talking to people - not only the staff, but the other guests. You share experiences, get to learn more about the places to visit.Not once did anyone say to us, go to the top of the Rock, or the Empire State Building. Instead, we took a less travelled path and visited the High Line - a park made from the old raised train line that ran through the meat packing district.We went to the Tenement Museum and ate at places we'd never have dreamed of going if we hadn't shared our experiences in this way.I emailed the hotel on the morning before we arrived and asked if they could arrange some flowers for my wife for the following morning.Not only did they do this, but they also played along with the moans and groans of the other guests when my wife jokingly complained that I hadn't got her an anniversary card. Then they produced the flowers and made the moment all the more special.The 414 Hotel won't be for everybody. It's clean, it's central to everything, but it lacks the bells and whistles that might be expected by some (including me usually). But I think it's all the better for it.It's the people that make this place special, so thanks Susan & Jackie in particular for all of your assistance and care during our stay.

Everything I read on Trip Advisor to help me choose Hotel 414 was true. You can't get better service for twice this price in Manhattan. Susan and her team help you feel like it's your home away from home. The place is extremely clean, well maintained and bed was so comfortable. Modern conveniences like strong wi-fi, nice tv and well functioning air control. The continental breakfasts are good and the evening happy hours are great. Also appreciate coffee, espresso and tea all day long. In good weather, the small courtyard is lovely. Just as important, the location is fantastic - 2 short blocks to Broadway, 15 min walk to Columbus Circle, 30 minute walk to Chelsea Market, as well as easy subway or cab accessibility to most of NY. We even walked to the upper east side on a nice day.Note that there are only 2 rooms on the ground floor and all other rooms are walk-ups and noise can be an issue on the first floor. I only have accolades for Hotel 414 and it's hard to imagine staying any place else for my yearly trip to NY.

We recently stayed for three days and wish it could have been longer. Susan and her dedicated and welcoming staff made our visit to Manhattan an even more memorable one. The location could not be better, the daily happy hour, the ample bathroom and immaculately clean room are all important but what really takes this Hotel "over the top" is everyone who works there. Their "team" is attentive to their guests needs in a way I have not seen in years. If you want to really feel welcomed, safe and cared for while in NYC look no further than the 414 Hotel!

We really enjoyed staying here! The location is great for shows and amazing restaurants. Susan is so helpful along with her staff! She gave us great recommendations for dinner and the best ways to get to places. The continental breakfast was so nice along with great coffee. And we also enjoyed happy hour where we got to visit with other people staying at the hotel.

We spent an entire week at the 414 Hotel, and everything about it was wonderful. Susan and her entire staff are the nicest people we've ever stayed with; the location is unbeatable; and the other guests (from around the world) were friendly and interesting as well. We have already booked a full week for next year !!! David and Carol Abelson, Sacramento, California.

I took my girlfriend for her birthday and stayed here for 7 nights ,the service was outstanding and the staff were very helpful and we got that personal touch including a bottle of champagne on arrival.We enjoyed happy hour on a few occasions and the choice of drink and cheese was very good.We had an amazing holiday and now my girlfriend is my fiancée When we go back we would definitely stay at the 414 Massive thank you to Susan and her team

This sweet little hotel is amazingly intimate and so close to the theater district. It's much more like a European bed and breakfast than any hotel I've seen in New York. The staff was so friendly and excellent at recommending activities and helping us get tickets to tours and exhibits. The small lobby doubles as breakfast room and a place for afternoon wine and cheese. We enjoyed our morning and afternoon chats with the interesting guests from around the world. We were there as a family of four with our college aged kids, but I can see that this would be the perfect hotel also for solo travelers and couples who might enjoy meeting other people. Our courtyard rooms were quiet, not fancy, but pleasant with operable windows.

Stayed here for six nights and enjoyed every moment. 414 is like a cross between a really good B&B and a hotel, with all the best aspects of both. Our room was lovely and spacious, more so than in some Manhattan hotels. But what really sets 414 apart is the atmosphere of warmth from the staff and friendship among the guests. At breakfast, and at Happy Hour, people gather around he fireplace and just chat, exchange New York tips, discuss plays and exhibitions and politics. I met really interesting people over a relaxed wine and cheese; and how often does that happen in a New York hotel? The staff are also incredibly lovely. They seem to know everybody's name and are themselves rather interesting people too. Now that I've stayed here once, I can't imagine staying anyplace else the next time I'm in New York.

I can't say enough how much we love 414 Hotel! We just stayed there for the second time in 6 months and will be back asap!Incredible staff! Even during a booked weekend we feel like their only guest by the personal, thoughtful attention we get. We feel like we have "our place" in NYC! Lots of love to the 414 family!

Traveled for 3 nights and wished I had stay longer. My experience in this hotel was really great. From the entrance, to the check in station, until check out, all the hotel staff warmly greets you. I totally recommend this hotel. It's not just a typical hotel but like a second home to me. Till our next journey, my friend.

Stayed at 414 Hotel last week for the second time. This visit was just as wonderful as the first. Susan and her staff make you feel at home and welcome you like family! It's safe, comfortable, roomy, clean and in a fabulous location. Walk to most things and a short cab ride or subway ride to others. Will never stay anywhere else!

First time at the 414 and it was a great experience. It was like a taste of living in New York without actually having to actually do it. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the location was very convenient. We enjoyed the happy hour, meeting the other folks that were in the hotel. The people attracted to staying there are the kind of people you want to have a glass of wine with. Been to NYC a number of times but this was the best stay, strongly recommend.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel! The employees went out of their way on a daily basis to ensure we felt welcome and at home. It felt like staying with friends! They helped us with everything from choosing shows to go to (with discount pricing to boot!), how to catch the subway to get to our intended destination as well as great restaurant recommendations. Many of the guests we saw arriving were being warmly greeted, most had been there on previous visits to New York. The little extras like the surprise wine and goodies to help us celebrate our anniversary, the awesome New York bagels at breakfast (among other great breakfast items including fresh fruit), the spectacular fully automated espresso machine we used morning and night and the complimentary wine and cheese each evening made our trip a special one to remember.Yes, it's a traditional walkup hotel without an elevator but the staff helped us up and down with our luggage at their insistence and there are plenty of first floor rooms that I am sure could be requested. Our room was roomy, clean and had a lovely vaulted ceiling. the street was quiet compared to others we walked down but yet it was so close to everything! Just a couple of short blocks to the theaters and Time Square and of course shopping :)Thanks for everything! We WILL be back :)

As repeat visitors to 414, we continue to appreciate the excellent/ideally located facilities. Rooms are cozy/comfortable. Breakfast/afternoon wine & cheese offerings are a plus. Susan is a superb source of information/recommendations for some of the more unique sites in NYC. Walking distance to Broadway, a short jaunt to the subway, & many excellent local restaurants.This year was our third annual week-long visit and we've already booked for next year.

The 414 is near restaurant row, Times Square, and broadway theaters. The staff is professional and the hotel is very clean. It is rather small but intimate. Interactions among staff and guests were warmly encouraged.

My home when visiting NYC! Superb location, excellent accommodations, enthusiastic hospitality, daily happy hour, generous continental breakfast, the most caring staff all included at very favorable room rates. Cozy atmosphere and international guests create a welcoming and convivial environment as you savour one of the most exciting cities. Staff are also great resources for all tourist questions.

I'm sorry to share this review, because now everyone will want to stay here and I might never get a reservation again! : ) Seriously though, this is the BEST HOTEL EVER! 414 is in a great location and run by by amazing people. Feels just like home - super clean, lovely breakfast and again, 5* staff!

Location is fantastic, staff and owner are super friendly and helpful, rooms very nice, breakfast is excellent. Happy hour is an added bonus. All of the customers that we met seemed to be very pleased. It was like one happy family. Even found a nice kosher restaurant nearby.

Stayed there a couple of nights for business. This boutique hotel is ideally located in a residential/ restaurant area, only minutes away from Times Square and Central Park. You feel like in a Woody Allen movie when walking 46th street from the 9th. Residents seem to have been selected from that same movie, all easy going and sociable. The staff makes everything they can to make your stay one to remember.Definitely recommend it and will come back!

Really helpful staff and a homey base for what is an amazing city. Convenient to theaters, restaurants and transport. Small but comfortable rooms which are well equipped. Avoid higher floors if you have much luggage as there are no lifts.

On previous trips to NYC we have stayed at large chain hotels- and while they were always 'fine' they can't beat the charm, location or helpfulness of 414. Centrally located in the theater district and near to many sights (Central Park, Times Square, the High Line etc.) this little hotel (I think there are about 20 rooms) is fun to stay in. A better than average continental breakfast is included as is Happy Hour. This is a good opportunity to interact with other guests and to get information from Susan, the manager, who not only remembers every guest's name, but is a wealth of information on things to do, restaurants and how to get from the hotel to anywhere in the city!Staff are pleasant and helpful. Rooms are large (by city standards) and clean. If you want a hotel with its own restaurants and bars and concierge service this is not for you! But if you want to be out exploring the city with a comfortable hotel to return to- try 414.

This hotel is a wonderful place to stay for a number of reasons. First and foremost, the owners ( who are always present) and their assistants go out of their way to be helpful to their guests' every needs. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfasts and cocktail hours can't be beat. The hotel's proximity to Times Square, the theater district, Penn Station, ethnic restaurants, and Rockefeller Center make it a tourist attraction. The hotel attracts both international and national visitors, making for interesting conversations. The 414 is an oasis of calm in a very busy city! Look forward to returning!

Small, reasonable price, really good owner and brilliantly located, would strongly recommend 414 Hotel in New York. So many central places are within easy walking distance of this hotel. Help yourself breakfast works really well as do afternoon wine and cheese sessions. Had some great conversations with fellow guests while we were there. Staff went out of their way to assist througjout our 4 night stay.

Stayed here 5/11-5/14 on a very picturesque street. Susan & Staff(Jac, Emmy, John, Kyle) were very accommodating, really attentive to requests & info...They went above my expectations with some of the personal touches for my wife & I on our Anniversary & Birthday Celebrations...The Hotel is a converted Brownstone. The rooms were clean & comfortable with all amenities needed. They have breakfast provided & a Wonderful Bourbon, Wine & Cheese Happy Hour in cozy courtyard. Location is spectacular, very close to all major attractions(Times Square, Theatre, Restaurant Row, Shopping) Perfect Weekend! Thanks to Hotel 414...Book this place over hotel chains...you will have a better time!

My husband and I stayed for three nights. I am always happy to find a small hotel with a room where I can open the windows! Susan and her staff are so personable; such fun to meet other guests at breakfast and happy hour and exchange show and restaurant recommendations. Can't wait to come back!

Susan and her staff at the 414 just really know how to make their guests feel welcome. I cannot possibly say enough good things about the 414 Hotel. I've been a guest there many times and I would never stay anywhere else in NYC.

My wife, father in law and I recently spent a week at the 414 Hotel. I can honestly say that Susan, Jacqui, Emmy and all the rest of the staff made this my best hotel experience ever. I have never been met with such friendliness and hospitality at a hotel before. Everything from the greeting when we arrived, the daily newsletter, and the happy hour to the arrangement of a car when we left made our stay at the 414 hotel perfect.We also highly appreciated our conversations with fellow guests at breakfast and happy hour. We met some very nice travellers from Sweden, Australia, UK, and Belgium and of course from different places in the US. This was a nice opportunity to get some ideas on what to do and where to go for dinner.Susan and her staff has managed to create something very special in Hell’s Kitchen. On a quiet side street not far from Times Square, they have created a gem of a hotel that deserves all the praise it gets on TripAdvisor. We would never consider staying anywhere else when we return to New York.

We had a fantastic time on our getaway. The hotel was quaint, clean and comfortable. The hostesses were great to help us navigate and made us feel at home. We are from the south so that is saying a lot! Highly recommend this little gem.

My husband & I recently spent 3 nights at the 414 Hotel. We were both bowled over by the level of sincere, caring attention that we received by each and every member of the hotel staff. Yes, a good hotel will help set up your itinerary if you like but the staff at the 414 were genuinely excited to share their expertise and suggestions each time you met!414 Location is central to all activities in NYC and yet is in a quiet spot just a block away from the hustle and bustle. We could not have been more satisfied with our stay and will definitely return in the future!

Dear SusanThank you so much for our stay in your hotel. We will have long-lasting happy memories of our stay. Mostly because of you and your staff’s hospitality and your unique way of making people feel relaxed and able to socialise with each other. In fact we would often pass a large hotel where we could look in and see the guests neatly placed on individual tables for breakfast, and notice how unfriendly and austere it all looked and were very grateful we were going back to 414. We were also very grateful for the morning newsletter, not only advising us of what was going on, but also the weather, which was a great help when deciding on what to wear for the day!With regard to the room, it suited all our needs and most importantly, the bed was extremely comfortable. This was a real plus for me as I have a chronic back problem. Mind you, the amount of walking we did each day, I think I could have slept propped up in the corner somewhere. Happy hour(s)!! What a very special time that was. After a hard day of sight-seeing, it was such a lovely welcome to come into a friendly atmosphere where you could relax with a drink and recount the day’s events with other guests and gain ideas for the following day. Also, the fact that it was free just blew us away, New York is rather expensive, so it was nice just to think we didn’t have to worry about paying and tipping as soon as we came back. It was like coming back home! It was at this time that our friendship with an Australian couple began and hopefully it hasn’t ended as we have already exchanged emails and have invited them over to us next year when they have finished their travels. Thank you again for thinking of us re the theatre tickets for 'Oslo' and sorting out the discounts for Come From Away which was extremely well executed with amazingly talented actors! We would love to come back to New York as we didn’t do everything, although I’m not sure when that will be possible. I really wanted to visit the jazz bar you mentioned but unfortunately we had to leave. I was very envious of Tracey and Brad as they were staying longer, and later they emailed us to tell us they had visited Harlem where they found beer at $3 a bottle! Not that alcohol is a major concern, but it would have been nice to celebrate the fact together!So hopefully, we will return to the amazing 414 hotel in NYC where the vibe is great, the staff are super-friendly and the Happy Hour is awesome! (to coin an American phrase).Lots of love to you and all your staff who made our stay one of the best we have ever encountered.

We just spent five days here and loved it. The rooms are clean and well appointed but simple. Comfortable beds too but the thing that makes this place great is the hospitality and location. Susan and her team really make you feel at home, providing great recommendations, booking tables and shows for you and doing whatever is needed to make your stay even better. The location is great too, on a reasonably quiet street only a few blocks from Times Square and Broadway, with lots of great restaurants within strolling distance.

We recently stayed in this darling hotel for 5 days during our first trip to NYC. We can honestly say it made our visit so much easier, having the guidance and advice of Susan, Emie and Jackie. The hotel was so comfortable, so clean, and the best part was getting to know the other guests from 10 different countries! Fabulous, we will be back.Terry & Candace

My husband and I took our daughter to NYC for spring break. I had read some of the other reviews on Trip Advisor, and it sounded like a place that we would enjoy. From making reservations for our stay, recommending restaurants and shows, directions to places we were going, to the car taking us to the airport----Susan and her staff were outstanding! Breakfast in the morning was what you expected----pleasant and nothing over the top. But the conversations with other travelers, learning about their experiences, was what we were there for! This cozy spot was our home for the week!The room was plenty spacious for the 3 of us (we had a rollaway/cot/bed for our daughter). We were only there for sleeping and bathing. Susan was able to get us a discount code for what ended up being our favorite show of the week, Come From Away.The hotel is within easy walking distance of practically everything. And we weren't shy about using the subway either---felt fine/safe all week! If you don't get enough walking in, the stairs to the top of the 4th floor finished our cardio workout for the day. Because we were busy in town, we never made it to any of the evening cheese and wine gatherings. I'm sure they are lovely too! Emmy was usually there to let us in at bedtime with a smile and warm conversation about our day.We've found a diamond in the middle of the Big Apple. We hope to be back sometime!

I stayed at 414 hotel for 3 nights and booked here based on the such high quality reviews on trip advisor. I arrived around 7pm on Sunday evening and was great by a very helpful guy named John. My room faced the street which was nice as it gave me a good feel of the neighbourhood. The room was immaculately presented and very clean which is important to me. The bed was amazing and cable TV on large flatscreen made everything very comfortable. Breakfast is like being at a relatives house as everyone is chatting to each other and Susan the manager is the loveliest person who you can tell genuinely cares for her guests like they are family. Having stayed at 5 star international hotels all over the world this was certainly a different experience and one which I really loved. Also apart from the location being perfect and walking distance to Times Square etc it was very reasonably priced. 3 nights was around $1000 USD total which represents excellent value in my opinion. All in all this place is great and I'll definetly be back.

Very clean room; friendly, welcominng staff; simple but good (free) breakfast; and ideal location for attending Broadway shows made for a great stay over Easter. The subway was nearby, but 414 is also within walking distance of good shopping; Fifth Avenue browsing, and Museum of Modern Art, and great restaurants. Our room faced the street, which was, as expected, somewhat noisy, but the a/c in warmer weather would likely help drown out the street sounds.

We have just returned from our first trip to New York and booked 2 rooms for ourselves and our 2 adult daughters. This is the most fabulous boutique hotel and Susan ( the owner) and her staff lead the way in every aspect of customer service which you would never get from a hotel chain or large hotel. From my initial enquiry a year ago to booking airport transfers the week before arrival Susan provided the most efficient and professional service but with the most lovely human touch.Hotel 414 is in the most perfect location .... in the thick of everything but with the benefit of being in a quiet residential street. The rooms were clean and spacious with a large bathroom and complimentary toiletries. The continental breakfast was generous and the coffee delicious whilst the wine and cheese happy hour was a lovely gesture from a small hotel which made guests feel that they were enjoying a glass of wine in their own home.What was fabulous for NYC newbies like ourselves was the brilliant advice, tips and help Susan and all her staff offered. Restaurant recommendations, help with navigating routes and public transport as well as suggestions which were invaluable in making our 5 days so special. Susan went beyond the call of duty when she discovered we had been disappointed with one of our sight seeing trips and arranged for tickets to be reissued for us to go again. Huge thanks goes to Jackie, John and Emmy for their fantastic help and friendly welcome to us. Should any of us return Hotel 414 would be our immediate choice and we unreservedly recommend this fabulous Hotel to you all.

We just returned from our second trip to New York and our second visit to Hotel 414 and we had a wonderful time both in the city and our favorite hotel. We don't usually take the time to write a review but our experience at this hotel on both occasions is second to none and we travel a lot. Susan (the hotel manager) is a warm and welcoming hostess, as are her lovely staff, and they all work hard to run a home away from home for all of the hotel guests. The hotel is centrally located for a walk home from the theatre but on a quiet, tree lined street outside of the noise and frenetic energy of midtown. The Hell's Kitchen neighborhood is full of great food options and there is more of a neighborhood feel than central midtown could provide. The free breakfast is excellent and the happy hour with a wide variety of alcoholic drinks and cheeses/crackers is an added bonus that you just don't see at chain hotels. The rooms are spacious and very clean and on both visits we never had any issues whatsoever; although I feel confident that if we did, the staff would have addressed it promptly. Because of the small size of the hotel, you have an opportunity to connect with like minded travellers from all over the world during breakfast and happy hour and Susan and her staff take the time to produce a daily newsletter which you will find at your doorstep each day with helpful insights into the city's tourist hotspots. We are somewhat reluctant to spread the word about this hotel because we are afraid in future that we won't be able to get a room! But we are prepared to run that risk as we feel the Hotel 414 deserves this recognition. Search no further. These folks should put on courses for how to run a hotel!

My husband and I enjoyed a lovely 6 day stay at the 414 Hotel. The staff, Susan, Jackie, Emmy and Kyle, made us feel like family during our stay. They gave us subway, bus and train information in the morning to help us maximize our time to see the many sights of New York! The breakfast was great and the coffee machine is awesome. Our room was clean and comfortable and even had $1.00 snacks and water/soda available for midday snacks. This hotel has bathtubs which are a challenge to find in the big Apple! The wine and cheese was a good way to relax and meet other guests in the evening. The location is close to a myriad of ethnic restaurants , time square and the subways. I spent a lot of time before our trip looking for a hotel and this one was everything I was hoping for. Hope to visit next time we are in NYC.Thank you 414 Hotel

We could not have been more pleased. We marveled at the fact that this hotel is near Times Square with all of the noise and traffic, yet the 414 is quiet and residential. We slept well with no noise and enjoyed the free cereals and yogurts in the morning. Susan and her staff are very welcoming and happy to answer questions. We took the subway everywhere we needed to go and this hotel was a great starting point for us. Highly recommend.

First off, if you are looking for value on the money-look no further! Lavish breakfast spread is included with your stay. For example: oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, pastries, bagels and cream cheese, all sorts of cereals, juices and the ultimate Mercedes of coffee machines! This machine is like a human barista-she makes cappuccinos, lattes and espressos. She is named Gigi. You will fall under her spell if you are a coffee lover. You are served drinks with crackers and cheese in the evenings. (The REALLY GOOD stuff)The hotel is a lovely historical building. (which means no elevator) We stayed on the 4th floor and it wasn’t bad at all-and we are in our fifties! The staff is more than happy to jump in and help with the luggage, no questions asked! The rooms are spacious and lovely. Spacious is hard to come by in NYC!Susan has chosen her staff with care-that is obvious. They all have a gracious attitude and are more than pleased to help with anything you need. Be it an explanation of how to navigate the subway, where to eat, where to shop or how to get tickets to something. Whatever you need: you only have to ask. I am so glad that we chose the 414 for our week long stay. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else! Compare prices and do your homework like I did. You will not be disappointed! We already miss our new friends from the 414: Susan, Jacqui and Emmy. The entire staff was fantastic and I wish I could remember all of their names. My husband and I had a wonderful stay.Thank you 414! <3

The staff at this hotel are absolutely wonderful!!! It is obvious that customer service is the only objective and that is so rare. We were treated as though we were almost family. The location to Broadway, Time Square and restaurant row without the endless elevator rides and noise makes the 414 Hotel the place I will return and the place I will suggest to anyone traveling to New York !!!

My wife and I stayed here for 9 nights in March/April and were blown away with the service and atmosphere. Susan, the manager, was a wonderful and charming host and we felt right at ease from the first morning. This small hotel was like a home away from home with the communal atmosphere at breakfast and the evening happy hour. We met people from various parts of the globe during our stay and this is part of the charm.The team at this hotel are knowledgable, helpful and extremely friendly. We were given tips on restaurants and places to visit. Nothing was too much trouble for Susan and her team and when we changed our plans she said "leave it with me" and when we returned in the evening it was all resolved. We were given advice to visit a small club in Harlem for a unique Jazz experience and it was a different and unique experience.The team at 414 made our stay so enjoyable that we were sad to leave. I hope to return to NY in the future and 414 will be the first place to look for accommodation. Robert

We stayed at 414 hotel for 6 nights and felt lucky to have found this 'home away from home'. We arrived late at night and were welcomed by Emmy. She explained the points of interests in uptown, midtown and downtown of Mahattan, how to get to them and what to see. Breakfast and happy hour were included and the room were quite large considering the location. The hotel was walk-able distance from Time Square, Grand Central Station, Broadway, 5th Ave etc. A block from the hotel is the 9th Ave, which is foodie heaven and the restaurants open late! Most of the days, we return to the hotel around midnight but the staff always greeted us with a homecoming smile and asked if we needed anything. One day our toilet was plugged and five minutes after it was brought to their attention, it was fixed. We will definitely return to 414 Hotel on our next trip and recommend the hotel to everyone.

I stayed at the 414 Hotel for 4 nights in April. I was there to help my daughter and roommate shop to furnish their new apartment on East 25th Street. The hotel is unusual for the U.S. and NYC in particular for being small and in a quiet location (West 46th street is mostly residential except at the avenue intersections). My room was very good sized and faced the courtyard. I was able to open the windows and enjoyed hearing the birds in the morning (I actually heard a white-throated sparrow several times, something we regularly hear in Maine). The bathroom had good counter space, bath tub and was tiled. I slept well. Breakfast was a nice buffet that included hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, and breads. Susan or other managers on duty were at breakfast and helped with guests' plans for the day. They were also generous with tips for getting around and had some coupons we could use. Each morning there was a one-page newsletter with the weather and some ideas for things to do. Major tourist areas (Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue) were all within walking distance (you need to bring good walking shoes to NYC!). The subway is also several blocks away. The staff were flexible about letting me work in the morning and leaving a bit late. I found a great salad place up 9th Ave, and was able to eat it downstairs in the breakfast area. Also, enjoy the wine and cheese offered in the evening! All in all a very relaxing and comfortable stay for very good value. I was able to recharge from the hustle and bustle of the city.

My daughter and I planned on spending a night in the city after seeing a show. We checked into the hotel and our room was ready early. The room, although small, was fine for us for one night. After the show, we came back, and as I turned on the lights, a light bulb blew. I went and told Wes, who was working that night, and he noticed two light bulbs were out. He went to look for new bulbs. When he went to change the bulbs, something happened, and the overhead light and the lights in the bathroom didn't work at all. After checking the bulbs and the circuit breaker and calling Susan, the owner/manager, she offered to put me up at her other location because the hotel was completely full that night. It was already late, and my daughter and I were tired, so we decided to stay, and Susan voided the charge for the room for the night. The bed was really comfortable, and my daughter and I both slept great. The next morning, the super was there and fixed it immediately. At breakfast, Susan was so lovely and again so apologetic. That all being said, I wouldn't hold the unfortunate event against staying in the hotel again. Everyone on staff was so lovely and willing to bend over backwards. They were so knowledgeable about everything in NY, as I heard them telling other guests where to go, what to do, where to get free wi-fi, etc. This was a lovely little boutique hotel that really allows you to feel that you're a part of a NYC neighborhood rather than staying in a big corporate hotel in Times Square, which is only a few blocks away. I would highly recommend this hotel not only because it includes a lovely continental breakfast, and there's wine and cheese for happy hour every night, but it is really cute and homey and it's nice to be a bit off the beaten path in NYC. It's a quite escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

This weekend was our second stay at 414 Hotel and it's like coming home. Many of the staff remembered us and Susan greeted us like long lost friends. The 414 is perfectly situated for a theatre/dining weekend as every theatre is within easy walking distance and it's in the heart of restaurant row. The rooms are immaculately clean and the beds are very comfy, good amenities like free wifi, USB ports at bedside, a small fridge and a goodie basket with items nicely priced at only a $1. The atmosphere overall is very European - the lobby is tiny, the rooms are not plush and there is no elevator. There is a happy hour every night with wine, spirits and a cheese plate and it's delightful to visit with other guests in front of the fireplace, many visiting from other countries. We look forward to making 414 our "NY home base" again and again.

My wife and I recently celebrated our 1-year anniversary at this little gem. We are actually from Astoria, so it was more like a staycation. Needless to say, 414 surpassed ALL of our expectations! The staff were so insanely friendly! We felt as though we were part of the 414 family. And it's worth mentioning that this 'family' really hits a homerun by offering daily complimentary Happy Hour! Wiile it may be called 'happy hour,' it's much more like a casual gathering of friends, and makes for a nice addition to an already heart-warming experience.The room was wonderful!We met the afternoon staff at check-in, the late-night staff after our date night, and then topped it all off with a nice, long, and sincere conversation with the owner, Susan, when we checked out. She was so genuinely interested in our story, and we were more than happy to share it.We've officially decided that this is our #1 recommendation for family and friends when they come to visit! I could seriously go on and on!In short...you need to stay at 414!!!

I come annually for a convention at Jacob Javits Center. The 414 Hotel is convenient to the venue. Of course, many hotels are close so it is all the other aspects of 414 that attract me back each year. Friendly, generous, and kind spirits for staff, diversity of guests from many parts of the world, sitting at the group table from which many lively conversations spring, enthusiasm abounds for the daily activities and shared experiences which lead to new opportunities for adventurous souls. The Happy Hour is a launching point for many into the evening. Wines and whiskeys (and whiskies) for those who prefer a little Worry B Gone with new found friends. The selection of cheeses in the evening is good. The breakfast fare is satisfying, in a continental context. Give 414 Hotel a try!

We spent three very nice days and scheduled to leave from JFK. We arrived at the airport to find our flight canceled due to weather. We could only get a confirmed flight two days later. Went straight back to the 414 where we knew they would help us. We spent two more nights at a reduced rate! We thoroughly enjoyed our "bonus" days. Both rooms we occupied faced the street. One was on the second and the other on the fourth (top) floor. No elevator which could be a problem for some. The staff is eager to help with your luggage. It could be noisy at times with traffic and conversations and a jackhammer or siren in the distance....typical city noises. However things always got quieter at night and we never lost sleep due to it. Nice little continental breakfast in a rather tight area. We had several nice conversations with other guests from England and France. I personally would prefer fresh croissants rather than the muffins. Great little happy hour too. Especially if you like whiskeys as well as wines.

We spent 6 nights in 414 Hotel. Price is very competitive compared to the hotels in Manhattan. Very well situated, around 5-10 min walk from the Subway, and the Theaters (Time Square and TKTS not much further) and many nice restaurants all around. Neat rooms, beautifully decorated, extremely clean, great breakfasts with very good bagels, happy hours... Susan and her staff made us welcome in New York. As if we were staying at a friend's house, we benefitted from their advice and their everyday friendliness. When we come back to NYC, we will stay there.Thank you!

Literally the most courteous hotel staff that I have ever encountered. I had a perfect experience with 414 hotel and would highly recommend it. Best hotel I have stayed in in New York City. A+ grade!!

Is very clean and a very relaxing ambiance. Good breakfast include better than most. Lovely happy hour an oportunity to meet fellow travelors and share with the hotel personnel who were superb friendly and generous guide.

NYC is a lot. I can become overwhelmed with the pace of the city. Staying at 414 reminded me of a quaint and friendly hotel I visited in Paris. The room was great. The guests were all friendly. And the morning cup of coffee was delicious! I was happy to come back to the hotel after a busy day in whirlwind that is New York.

This was our first trip to New York and we are so glad that we found the 414 Hotel for our stay. The staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly and the location is great! We enjoyed the breakfast each morning when we had a chance to talk with other guests and get helpful hints about what to see and do.

We stayed at the 414 for the second time and we loved it as much as a couple of weeks ago. It offers probably the best value for your money in NYC. Great location, decent size quiet rooms. But the best is the friendly B+B style atmosphere, especially during breakfast and the afternoon happy hour. Also Susan and her team always have the best recommendations for activities in the city. We just love it and would always come back.

I loved my stay at 414 Hotel. This hotel is like no other, due to the owners Andrew and Susan Yates. Their genuine love for people is refreshing. I enjoyed visiting with them at breakfast and for afternoon coffee. The picture is of us with my dear friend Mustafa Dag at the Turkish Kitchen for lunch!

Fantastic. No more words needed! All the staff were welcoming and so helpful with suggestions on what to do in NYC. I would definitely recommend and look forward to going back soon. So close to Times Square and a home away from home after a long day of sight seeing. Thank you for such a memorable stay

414 Hotel is one of the best hotel's I've ever stayed in. It is quiet, clean and well organized. The hotel is located on a sweet, tree-lined street, just steps away from "Broadway", a perfect location if you are planning on attending the theater. I can't say enough good things about the people who work at the hotel. The staff, Jackie, Emily, and, especially, Susan are 3 of the nicest people I've ever met. Their knowledge of New York City is encyclopedic. No matter what you want to do, they will have been there, know how to get you there and will go out of their way to provide anything you will need. They work very hard to create an intimate ambiance. Breakfast and Cocktail Hour are well supplied and generous. Guests are encouraged to engage in conversations and get to know each other. This hotel attracts really interesting and well-traveled people, too. I look forward to my next stay.

Wow, after a incredible 4 night stay in Manhattan the other week, we just can't stop talking to everyone about how magical our stay here was, it was the highlight of our trip! Like a lot of other reviewers, we too felt it was like staying at a long lost friends house! If you're after glamour and glitz, luxury spas, inflated mini bar prices, and impersonal service, then this is not the place for you, but if you like wonderful warm hospitality, good sized clean rooms, and getting to know amazing people from all over the world in a great location, then stay at the 414! We feel we've made life long friends there. Susan is an inspirational lady, and nothing is too much trouble. She and her staff genuinely care about their guests and are helpful beyond belief. It's the personal touches that make it so special..the daily newsletter, the help yourself breakfast buffet, the sociable layout, and the wonderful Happy Hour where you are treated to a glass of wine and more, while relaxing by the open fire; we couldn't wait to get back every day for this and share in everyone's adventures; what a wonderful thing to break up the day, before sprucing up and heading off for a night on the town!It's a short walk from Times Square and the subway, yet quiet for NY! Only 22 rooms, so very homely indeed. We will be staying in touch with Susan and her team, and the first opportunity we get, we'll be back, without a doubt! Thank you 414, for making our holiday of a lifetime truly memorable!

This is a warm and welcoming small hotel located just near Hells Kitchen and 5 minutes from Time Square. Susan and her team make you feel incredibly welcome so the feel is more of staying with a friend than a hotel. Breakfast and Happy Hour create convivial social opportunities for guests to mix.Their knowledge of the City and many recommendations mean that visitors get the chance to experience many unusual gems as well as more standard tourist activities. There is a genuine interest in all visitors and pleasure in opening up the possibilities of the city which they are proud of. The amenities are simple and clean with enough space but that's not why you would go to this hotel. It is the people and the warmth of the welcome and the care as well as the location. I would highly recommend it.

Very well located near Time Square, 414 is different than any other big city hotels I have visited. With their open kitchenette and big table + fire place in the lobby and by providing free breakfasts and happy hours (Wine, liquors, drinks and cheese) they favor frequent exchanges (guests to guests and guest to staff and owner). I really enjoyed the many discussions I had with fellow guests, great friendly staff and Susan the owner. They are also quick to give great and out of the beaten tracks recommendations (food, drinks, shows, etc.). If you like familial/ friendly & casual atmosphere, don't miss 414 for your next stay in New York.

We first visited NYC and the 414 last June, and gave it 5 stars. We decided to treat ourselves to a return visit to the city, so there was only ever one place we were going to stay, and that's the 414. It really deserves more than 5 stars, Susan the owner is simply brilliant, you are treated like royalty, nothing is too much trouble. She made sure we had "our" room from last time, with a lovely hand written welcome card and flowers waiting for our arrival. Communal breakfast & happy hour (or 2) enabled us to chat to interesting people from all around the world, ranging from Australia to someone who lives 10 mins from us in the UK!Location is ideal, near all the action but rooms are quiet at night.The 414 isn't the No.1 rated hotel on tripadvisor because of being posh or having a uniformed doorman, it is No1 because you are treated as an individual, and they really care about you. They are "our family in nyc" and we hope to return again in the future.

Susan and her staff were welcoming and professional. Their knowledge and insight made our trip enjoyable. Our day started with a light breakfast and planning our day with her staff. Their tips enabled us to pack many activities into each day and to choose the best mode of transportation (bus, subway, taxi , or walk). The hotel is located close to the theatre district, Times Square, and several restaurants. We appreciated the quiet retreat to our room at the end of the day. We will certainly stay at the 414 Hotel our next visit. Highly recommend.

Truly enjoyed our 3 night stay at this charming hotel! Susan and her staff are friendly and accommodating. They immediately learned our names and provided us with exceptional service. The free daily continental breakfast and happy hours are a bonus. The hotel has a perfect location if you are seeing a Broadway show. We highly recommend 414 Hotel! We will definitely stay here again!

My husband and I spent 4 nights at the 414 Hotel during a "Back to the City" trip. We'd lived in NY over 20 years ago, and had been back for an occasional night on business, and many times as day tourists, but had never come to the city and spent multiple nights during a vacation. We have traveled extensively, and typically select 5 star hotels, choosing 414 because of the excellent rating on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. The accommodations are simple and clean, and the location is excellent. The continental breakfast is plentiful (bagels, muffins, cold cereal, hot cereal packets, fruit, coffee and tea), and they never came close to running out, even though we lingered once breakfast was over. It was wonderful to be able to interact with other guests, both during breakfast and during the evening wine and cheese, where guests were so friendly that they shared the cheese that they'd purchased during an outing that day. The true highlight was the staff. Emmy, Jacqui, John, and Drew were friendly and helpful, attending to our every need. They were truly interested in our plans for the day, and often had recommendations regarding a more efficient way to get where we were going, what to see on our way, or how to stay dry on a cold and rainy day. They were equally attentive to each guest, making us all feel that we were right at home. We had a minor glitch with our room, and the way that both the staff, and Susan the manager responded was absolutely amazing. Highlights of our trip included a recommendation that we see the new Broadway Play, "Come from Away", which was excellent, as well as watching the taping of a scene from Blue Bloods, two doors down from the hotel, late that night on our way home. The icing on the cake was Susan's kindness in walking with us to Port Authority, as she was leaving on our last day, helping us to get our luggage to the bus. Susan and her team are amazing, we truly had a wonderful experience, and will certainly be back!

I'm a frequent traveller round the world and this is one of the best most welcoming hotels I've stayed in. Perfect for first time visitors to NY which can be a little intimidating and for old hands. Wonderful hospitality.

This was our second stay at 414 Hotel and it definitely won't be our last! 414 Hotel is reasonably priced (for NYC) and super convenient to Broadway shows and most NYC sites. We especially love being able to walk to/from Broadway shows without having to worry about finding cabs or if the subway is running on time. Rooms are simple but a nice size. Breakfast and evening happy hours are also included (you can get a latte or cappuccino without going to Starbucks!) Best of all, you feel like you are staying with dear friends. Everyone who works there is incredibly nice, outgoing and helpful. I'll never forget our snowy NYC morning two weeks ago where guests and staff sat around the fireplace drinking coffee, chatting and sharing tips while the snow fell outside. Wonderful!! Thank you Susan for another memorable trip!

Great location to explore the city, the staff is wonderful at giving advice and recommendations. And the breakfast is included. The rooms are basic but you're in New York. Good deal for NYC. They accommodated me with a request for a room change. Ask for a room in the back, it's quieter.

Great location, Close to theater district but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The staff is fantastic and it's a lot of fun sitting in the lobby interacting with other guests from all over the world. I highly recommend Hotel 414. We have stayed in hotels all over Manhattan and this is our favorite.

We spent 6 nights at the 414 last week. We loved everything about this inn-style hotel. The staff and owner, Susan, were absolutely outstanding and gave us excellent advice for every question we had. The hotel is in the best possible location; on "Restaurant Row" in Hell's Kitchen, a few blocks from Broadway theaters and Times Square. Subways were close by. An absolute highlight was the daily Happy Hour gathering of guests. We met other Canadians, people from all over the States, and many U.K. and European guests. It was a melting pot of wonderful people who shared their daily travel experiences and excitement of the City. We can't say enough great things about this small hotel experience and the incredibly caring staff who look after the guests so amazingly! We'll be back!! Doug and Ann

Unique experience in NYC. Tiny, clean, absolutely adorable hotel that feels like visiting dear friends. Friendly owner and staff that know your name and are willing to help any way they can. Wonderful breakfast spread included in price, plus a wine and cheese spread each evening, also included in price. Rooms are not fancy, but beds/linens very comfortable. Small dining area/lobby encourages guests to get to visit with each other. We really loved this place. You must be able to climb stairs if you stay here.

The 414 Hotel is the best hotel we've stayed in...ever. Why? We always try to stay in small, boutique hotels so the 414 meets our criteria in that sense. Susan is beyond helpful. The front desk people, whether at breakfast, midday or evening; run a close second. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff...Susan!... even hauled our heavy suitcases up the stairs for us! Everyone was so helpful in giving advice on how to reach our destination, what sights to see on specific days and the best restaurants in the area. We're from California, we were petrified of NYC and thanks to all the advice from the 414 staff, we didn't make even one blunder. We had a great time, we even took the subway back to the airport, under their direction and it was so easy. Thank you, Susan and the staff at the 414 Hotel. We'all be back.

We can't wait to go back! The staff was extremely hospitable and the evening cocktail hour just perfect! The rooms were clean and cozy and the location excellent! You may have to walk a few stairs to get to your room (there's no elevator) but it's great exercise and you'll have a cold drink waiting for you downstairs when you're finished unpacking!

Myself and my girlfriend stayed at the 414 Hotel for 5 nights in Feb 2017. Overall we had a wonderful trip and were very happy with our choice but I will just note down a few pros and cons for other visitors:Pros: LOCATION: Hell's Kitchen is ideally located for many of the keys NYC sights and particularly for those interested in visiting a Broadway show. The hotel is 5 mins walk from two subway stops and there is a frankly ridiculous choice of restaurants with cuisine from all around the world within a couple of blocks. Anyone slightly apprehensive about the area based on its former reputation needn't be worried as its heavily gentrified and we felt perfectly safe throughout our trip.SERVICE: Coming from London, it was refreshing to see how much better the Americans are at service generally but the staff at 414 really go the extra mile. Susan the owner is extremely friendly and personable and both Emmy and Wes were fantastically helpful and chatty (as were the other staff who's names I didn't catch!). As the hotel is relatively small, the staff do get to know you (and vice versa) and were great when it came to moving restaurant bookings, arranging cars and recommending place to eat and sights to see. ROOM: By NYC standards our room was very large, comfortable and equipped with useful extras such as a universal charging point for our phones and ipad. PRICE: New York is very expensive, especially for the British right now but compared to other hotels we looked at, 414 presents very good value for money. Cons:NOISE: Its not really the hotel's fault given the location and no one comes to NYC expecting a restful vacation but we did struggle to sleep on each of our nights there. We had a room at the front looking down on to West 46th St and although they have double glazing and secondary internal glazing, it was still very noisy with the usual sounds of NYC throughout the night. Suppose that's just the price to pay for being in the middle of the action but it would be something to consider if you are a light sleeper. BREAKFAST: Difficult to put this as a "con" really but the breakfast is fairly basic. No hot food but does the job if you're grabbing a quick bite before heading out. Overall we had a wonderful trip to NYC and would like to thank all at 414 for their work. Noise would be the only reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars and would be happy to recommend to anyone.

414 Hotel is almost like a very high-end backpackers. Staff is not only friends but personable; they spend time chatting with you and really get to know their guests (even recognizing people who visit regularly). There is a common area and basic kitchen available for use and a nightly happy hour with wine and cheese. Because of this, you end up meeting other guests, hence the backpackers-esp feel.I came here for a working vacation: working morning and afternoons, shows in the evening. The location of the hotel is perfect for attending shows (more theaters just a few blocks away) and close to many nice restaurants (and staff is great about making recomendations). I can't wait to visit again in the future.

Absolutely fantastic!!! Small and intimate with breakfast included and happy hour every night. Our room was wonderful with plenty of room. Susan and her staff were sensational and extremely helpful and supplied us with a list of places to go upon our arrival. Staffed 24/7 made it super easy to come and go as we pleased. Being from Melbourne they knew coffee was important and sent us to an amazing coffee shop around the corner. Location was brilliant with a short walk to Times Square. We had a special connection with Drew who had lived in China as had we so we had a lot to talk about. If we ever get back to NY would most definitely stay there again.

The 414 has it all: central-yet-quiet location, service, comfortable beds, breakfast and happy hour...AND the most welcoming and helpful staff imaginable! Manager Susan sets the tone for this lovely hotel. She greets you in the morning, is genuinely interested in you, will ask if she can help with sightseeing, show tickets, restaurants, transportation, etc. Her entire staff follows her lead; guests feel like they are members of the family.

wonderful stay in a wonderful hotel...staff very kind and gentle...very very good room clean and big...also good continental breakfast and nice area very good to visit new york city... also the rapport quality pirce was incredible. i strongly recommend to everyone

I don't think I would choose to stay anywhere else in New York. We were so well taken care of and welcomed. Friendly, considerate staff! Susan not only accommodated my daughter's special diet but made her breakfast utterly delicious as well. a huge array of breakfast items were on display every morning and then, every evening great selections of wine, cheese and crackers for the guests to relax and chat before heading out to town. a little thing I forgot about are the snacks and drinks in the rooms. every vacation I've ever been on those items are overpriced, you can expect to pay $2.25 for a bottle of water but here the prices were lower than normal. I think that is a really sweet touch. my friends in Pennsylvania were taken back at the value of 414.

I went to NYC for a friends going away party and this is where we decided to stay. I have to say it was nicer then I thought. (ive never been to NYC) But this is a really good first hotel experience. If im ever in need to come back I know exactly where im staying

stayed here overnight, top floor, very quiet, clean. the hotel was not busy, but I could hear people in the hallway and conversations in rooms. wonder what it is like when more rooms are full. breakfast was good, but not great, with basic carbs, that do not spoil. pastries were bland., location great and safe,. staff helpful. would stay there again.

Picking a hotel for a short break holiday is always a bit scary - will it be ok? Will it satisfy all my needs? I can definitely say that from the first moments when we were greeted by Susan we felt at home - at that is a key for me - feeling comfortable when trying to relax from the everyday rush for a few days. Yes, the hotel is small, yes it is relatively simple, but that's its charm and advantage. It's super quaint for NYC being right in the center of the action, just steps from Times Square and Broadway. Staff is excellent, helpful and friendly, providing this personal touch and experience that large, chain hotels can't. This is not a place for people who expect five star rooms with 'golden faucets', but it's a definite must for everyone who wants a five star service and escape from the crowds after all day of crowds in the city. Very, very well done Susan and entire staff!

Took another mother/daughter trip to NYC and stayed at the 414 again. I've concluded that it's the only place I'll stay in the city. I initially hesitated because the only available rooms were across the courtyard, but the rooms in the back building were really no different than those in the main building. Our room on the 4th floor certainly met my desire for a quiet room! The addition of a high end cappuccino maker since our last stay was the highlight though! Susan and her staff were so welcoming it truly feels like coming home. Once again there are only positives to say about the 414!

414 Hotel is such a truly wonderful hotel. The minute you walk through the door you are made to feel welcome. Susan and her excellent team take time to get to know you as a guest, you know instantly that this is more than just a hotel, they are genuinely interested in making sure you have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Breakfast choices in the morning are delicious. You can socialise with other guests, discover NYC recommendations from Susan and meet new friends. Or if you enjoy solitude which I do from time to time being an introvert, then you are welcome to enjoy the facilities of the hotel, relax in your room or admire the beautiful front lobby whilst reading a book in front of the fireplace. Each evening 'happy hour' is provided, it's a great way to socialise with other guests whilst enjoying a glass or two of wine and a selection of cheeses to accompany. The words cosy and heartwarming come to mind, however this is not an exaggeration, it truly describes the 414 Hotel experience. The rooms are delightful, the bed is one of the best I have ever slept in, it was so comfortable. The shower is hot and extremely powerful, toiletries provided are of the highest quality as are the plentiful towels. I opted for a front facing room as I enjoy watching the world go by, however it was a quiet experience. Finally, I have been visiting New York City for over 20 years and have always opted for the same hotel, which up until recently, when it changed management, offered me warm and welcoming hospitality. I thought I would never find the same experience elsewhere, how wrong I was and how thankful I discovered 414 Hotel which from now on will be my 'home from home' in New York City and an establishment which I truly recommend. Kudos to Susan and her excellent team.

414 hotel is special due to the nice staffs. They are kind and patient, greeting guests with smiles more like family rather than being polite only. This is warm for travelers.During my stay, I received a piece of paper every morning, on which tips of weather, transportation and activities were listed for guests reference. When I had difficulties in ticket booking, they volunteered to help, although they don't have to. I really appreciate that.I've stayed in many nice hotels but 414 is most thoughtful. I had good memories in NY, and 414 Hotel is part of that.

Susan and her staff as well as other guests are the highlight of this property. As advertised, 414 Hotel offers European style accommodation in the heart of the theater district. Rooms are simple, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast and happy hour afford you many wonderful conversations with other guests and the warm staff if you so choose. We loved our stay in all respects and will visit again!

My husband and I escaped to NYC for a birthday weekend. Susan and every single staff member warmly greeted us, knew our names, wished my husband a happy birthday, and made us feel welcome. The small rooms weren't an issue at all- they were clean and quiet. The location, the staff, and the special touches make this place a gem.

This is a great place to stay, I loved my time here. I would go back in a heartbeat. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and while the rooms are small, they are very well appointed and clean. The light breakfast in the morning and wine in the early evening added a warm and social side to the experience which was especially nice for someone traveling alone. The location is fantastic for getting around, right in the midst of the theatre district. Thanks to everyone at the 414 Hotel.

This lovely boutique hotel isn't for everyone - just people who want to feel like a local, feel welcome to NY and be treated like a friend! A stay at 414 is like going to visit a dear friend of yours that lives in a beautiful home in a great location! Susan and her staff are friendly and knowledgable about the city and it seems like they are as excited about your daily adventures as you are! They welcome you to sit down and share your day or enjoy some quiet, private tine with your loved ones or friends with a glass of wine by the fire. They find the right balance! The rooms are lovely and 'NY Intimate' and if you think the rooms are too small then you are spending way too much time in your room in a great city in a great boutique hotel! Well done Susan and staff!

The intimacy of this lovely B and B allowed us to sit around a table morning and evening with new friends from around the world. We were made to feel so valued and welcome. We loved this place and will return.

A wonderful return to the 414 Hotel! Susan and her team are so very welcoming and helpful. The daily newsletter is full of great suggestions. We all had such a relaxing stay and thoroughly enjoyed relaxing in the lobby with a glass of wine after a days sightseeing. A great hotel in a great location with a wonderful team of staff.

This place was awesome. I would highly recommend it. Great staff and super accommodating. Susan and everyone who works there will make you feel right at home. They also suggested certain restaurants and things to do that we loved. We definitely will be back!!

Great midtown location and very clean, but what made this hotel far above any others that I've stayed in is the warm and friendly personal service. Everyone that we interacted with referred to us by name and gave us great recommendations on where to visit and eat. I highly recommend this perfect little boutique hotel.

Just had my third stay here and it gets better each time. Excellent location within easy walking distance to subway and Times Square. Susan and the staff are so welcoming and helpful. It is like coming home. The continental breakfast is nice as well as the nightly happy hour. A neat way to connect with other guests from around the USA and the World. Will definitely stay here on all future trips to New York.Give the 414 Hotel a try, you won't be disappointed.
