I booked 5 nights at the 414. This is such a sweet spot with world class customer service. I have stayed at 4 Seasons Hotels and this Hotel did it better. The location in midtown is very centrally located and small, ethnic restaurants are chock a block on 9th Avenue. You enter into an inviting lobby(especially on a wintry night with a fire blazing in the fireplace), which is the place for the free breakfast and a generous wine/alcohol/cheese & crackers happy hour. My room was serene, quiet and clean. The bath is large and also very clean. The BEST thing about the place is the customer service. I felt so welcomed and catered to. SUSAN and her wonderful staff are so accommodating and full of suggestions. There were great restaurant recommendations, news about museum exhibits as well as discounts for Broadway plays. This is an awesome hotel, deserving of the praise they have been given

We loved the warm hospitality to us and every guest over the long weekend we spent with you.I am a reluctant traveler, to say the least, as opposed to my daughter who loves an adventure, so I had no involvement in choosing a hotel in New York or even choosing New York, that was my husband’s gift to us. But, I feel blessed, yes, blessed, to have stayed there and met you all while discovering that I LOVE NY.So, it’s official, I’m a walking cliché. It sort of felt like we were staying with cousins who took very good care of us while we were in town.Thanks again, I hope we get to come back soon.

We enjoy the small hotel experience, especially in New York. This was our second stay and couldn't have been better. Complementary continental breakfast and happy hour are an added bonus, along with a knowledgeable staff.

Hotel 414 was the perfect place for our NYC stay. Great people, wonderful service, and met or exceeded expectations in every aspect. If you want something different than a chain hotel experience....this is the spot! Thanks you to susan and the rest of the crew at 414!!!

A great place to feel welcomed and top notch service. You feel like family when you stay at the 414! Easy access to everything you would want in New York. Will definitely be back! Susan and her staff will take care of every need and will give fantastic suggestions.

What a gem of hotel! We spent 2 nights here, and it was just an absolute treat! The food is great, the location is fantastic, the room and staff top notch! Susan took time out from her very busy schedule to give us many tips about what to do in New York which were highly appreciated.

Susan and her staff make you feel so welcome and at home. Nice, clean rooms, good beds and all you expect in a hotelroom. However, it is the atmosphere and high service that makes this hotel so special. They do all in their power (and then some) to make your stay special. Also the location couldn't be better. almost everything in walking distance. There is no doubt in our mind that we will stay at 414 hotel next time we are in NY.

Clearly, the reviews here on tripadvisor intrigued us into checking out this unique hotel. From the moment we arrived, Susan and her staff made us feel as if they had waited their entire lives for us to walk through the door. Not just the usual hotel welcoming smiles, but true sincerity of their intent to make us feel comfortable in their home. The property consists of two 4 floor walk-ups between 9th and 10th on W 46th...22 (or 23?) rooms tops. The 2 buildings are separated by a courtyard that was in sleep mode (we stayed for an overnight this past weekend--a wildly warm couple of days in February) but we can see from the photos that it is just beautiful during the warmer seasons. We had a room in the second building with a queen size bed overlooking the courtyard. It was clean and perfect for our needs. The continental breakfast was perfect for our needs. We didn't take advantage of the evening happy hour as we had a bit of a walk to the restaurant for dinner that night, but what a terrific perk to this incredible hotel! Walking back from the broadway show later that evening took 10 min tops, and it was so nice to know we didn't have to drive back to the Island (Long Island)! We have stayed in B and B's and we have stayed in traditional hotels. 414 Hotel has the best qualities of both, and then some. We've already told Susan 'We'll be baaaack' :-)

I stayed at 414 Hotel for two nights to celebrate my birthday. This hotel was perfect - the location, the staff, and the room were top notch. The staff is so wonderful, they really make the hotel a special place to stay. All were friendly, helpful, and just really nice people.When we checked in, there was a sweet surprise in our room - a mug full of chocolates and a sweet birthday card. We got in around lunch time and asked Susan for a recommendation for Thai food. She sent us to the cutest Thai place that we would not have found on our own. It was wonderful. Do get suggestions from Susan and the staff while you're there!Our room was clean and large (especially for NYC), and very comfortable. There is a happy hour in the evenings, and a nice breakfast in the mornings. The other people who were staying at the hotel were obviously taken by the friendly vibe - breakfast was like sitting around with friends, enjoying each others' travel stories. When I go back, I'll have to be sure to plan around happy hour! This is definitely not your run-of-the-mill, faceless, huge hotel. The hotel is perfectly located. There are a ton of great restaurants on 46th (restaurant row), it is a very short walk to the theatre district and Times Square, and about a mile walk to Central Park. The neighborhood is really cute, and you don't feel like you are in the middle of the city. My only regret is that I wasn't there for longer! I will definitely go back to 414. I can't wait!

Do yourself a favor and stop looking at other hotels and book your stay at the 414 Hotel. I have traveled to NYC many times and have stayed at a variety of properties throughout Manhattan. Now that I have found the 414 Hotel, I am not even close to being slightly tempted to try some of the other top rated TripAdvisor hotels. I dare you to find another hotel with a staff that will greet you with as much courtesy and hospitality throughout your entire stay. The staff was friendly, engaging and helpful with any requests from suggestions on nearby restaurants, which subway or bus to catch and the staff even suggested a running route (that took me to the High Line which is not to be missed). The 414 Hotel is the PERFECT mid-town location. My girlfriend and I walked from Penn Station to the 414 Hotel so as to familiarize ourselves with the neighborhood. During our three night stay, we found the 414 Hotel very convenient to walk to Times Square, the Javits Center, a Broadway show and a NY Rangers game at Madison Square Garden. A short walk to the nearby subway took us directly to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum. Of course, the 414 Hotel is located is the super trendy Hell's Kitchen neighborhood and is chocked full of great restaurants and bars. Central Park is an easy jog from the 414 Hotel and I had a great second run there during our stay. The 414 Hotel has the BEST complimentary happy hour of any hotel I have ever stayed at. Don't expect to see a large bottle of inexpensive wine. Of course, the happy hour and the complimentary breakfast were both great times to meet other guests many of which were international travelers. Our room was very clean, very comfortable and the bathroom amenities were very nice. The free wifi worked great throughout our stay. I will note there is no elevator in the hotel but the staff was very kind to offer to help us with our bags. Given the great food I had in the restaurants in Hell's Kitchen, I was thankful for the extra stairs to work off a few calories.Needless to say, although I do not know when my next trip to NYC will be, I know exactly where I will be staying. I can't wait to get back to the 414 Hotel.

The hotel was in a fabulous location. Susan and her team did an outstanding job of making us feel welcome and gave excellent recommendations for places to eat. The room was very comfortable. I will definitely be staying here again.

My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at 414 Hotel. The location is great and everything was super clean. Our room was large for NYC standards. I read some of the other reviews and am somewhat confused. They don't advertise themselves as a huge resort with restaurants etc. If however, you want something very nice with a perfect location this is it!

This was a wonderful hotel choice. The staff was friendly, helpful and engaging. Our room was clean and had all the amenities as a large hotel. The front was warm and inviting with a great continental breakfast in the morning and a wine cocktail hour in the afternoon by the fireplace.A special thank you to Susan Bernstein for tickets to Birdland and advice on where to dine. We enjoyed the show and appreciated your hospitality. Hope to see you soon. Bob & Cathy, Ogunquit, Maine

Quiet personable hotel close to Time Square on quaint street close to many dining options and the Hudson. Staff knowledgeable and friendly. Room had all we needed and was quiet!!!Walked everywhere. Did not use subway or bus or taxi!Happy hour was relaxed, Breakfast was self serve and fine!

First off let me start out by saying that I was a little concerned about the location and the building itself. Boy was I surprised!! Best little hotel in the absolute cutest and best location for seeing Ney York City. A 5 minute walk and you're in Time Square. The Intrepid Museum is 5 minutes in the other direction. Great little restaurants and venues all around and the staff is by far the nicest group of people! Talked to Susan, the Owner and she is great. Definitely staying there whenever I'm in town!!

Just returned from NYC after my first but hopefully not last stay at the 414. Perfect location, good amenities and of course the amazing helpful friendly staffI would recommend staying here for a memorable stay. The rooms are basic but very clean and comfortable beds. No elevator so keep in mind if limited mobility ask for main floor room. Overall great stay and lovely weather for Presidents' Day weekend.

From the awesome greeting by Drew, to the wine and cheese happy hour, nice accommodations and coffee in the morning, we couldn't have been happier with our stay. It was very convenient to walk to MSG and Times Square with so many restaurants and bars to choose from. The courtyard was kind of packed up for the winter but we still enjoyed a cocktail during a unseasonably warm weekend for NYC.

Came here for business for 2 nights, I was surprised this is a top rated hotel. Very average, gives you a jack of all trades master of nons vibe. Lobby and service were above average, the room decor was not impressive though

Me and my wife wanted to plan a special weekend in NYC. We usually stay at Ritz in Central Park or Battery Park being the service is always over the top. When searching TripAdvisor we found some Great Reviews of the 414 Hotel. So I took the chance and decided to investigate further. Well let me tell you the experience of this property was OVER THE TOP AND THEN SOME. I already knew from the initial phone call and chat room experience that we were making the right choice. They were extremely accommodating providing restaurants to dine and things to do and all of this was done in an e-mail immediately after making the reservation.  Once we arrived the hospitality was Exceptional to say the least it was like being greeted by family and they also knew it was my wife's Birthday and had a special surprise in the room that would have cost over $100 anywhere else. The morning Breakfast was nice and the Happy Hour time with Fireplace and interaction with other guest was also enjoyable. This location is hidden and a must stay for those that want service with a smile and then some. We liked it so much that we decided that whenever we stay in the city in the future we will call 414 Hotel our home as that is how they made us feel during the entire visit. Great Staff, Clean Rooms and Great Location.

Wonderful hotel, great location, but the best part is the staff. Very helpful, a wealth of information, always friendly and very accommodating! The room was nice, of course New York size small but beds were comfy and had TV and wifi so we were very comfortable. Would def. stay again!

I love this place. I stay there all the time when I'm in NYC now, primarily for work since it's in such a great location. Soon I hope to take my family though too! Just a great little boutique hotel with everything you need for your stay, without going over the top; good rooms, tv, showers, breakfast, and boom - just what you need. And the staff is awesome! So nice and sweet and accommodating! You can't get personalized service like this from a big hotel chain.

Great staff, great Management, and all around friendly and comfortable Hotel! I have been staying at 414 hotel for business for the past 7 years, and I have always felt comfortable and welcomed. Thank you!

Our trip was a surprise gift for my husband's 60th birthday and I was keen to stay somewhere that was more personal and authentic than a large anonymous hotel.Having seen 414's reviews it was impossible not to be curious and on seeing that it was perfectly situated in Hell's Kitchen only 10mins walk,if that, to Times Square this was just what I was looking for.Looking really inviting from the outside;situated on a quiet leafy street but in the midst of an area that is heaving with restaurants of all prices,bars,takeaways,delis,diners etc it was perfect.We had a stressful trip out from England-weather causing us to miss a connection- but as soon as we stepped inside 414's lobby and met Emmy on reception all was well.She immediately offered us a glass of wine (wine and cheese everyday 5.30pm till 7pm!) and we felt cared about.We continued to feel cared about throughout our 5 night stay and that, in a nutshell, is a huge part of this hotel's success - all of the staff care about what you are doing or planning or how you are feeling and if they can help in any way they will, without making their guests feel awkward.We mostly dealt with Emmy who was so lovely and Susan,the owner/manager,who was equally as warm and friendly.We were in the building across the courtyard and our superior queen room was great.The bed and pillows were the comfiest we have ever experienced in a hotel and we awoke refreshed every morning ready for another busy day.Breakfast was fresh and filling with a great choice-the bagels were "proper" bagels! All in all everything about this little star of a hotel was genuine and added to our special experience in New York City.Thankyou to everyone and we sincerely hope to return in the future; we have sung your praises constantly back home!

Lovely hotel. Gracious staff. Always ready and available to answer questions and give directions and suggestions. Friendly guests. Coffee machine wonderful. Rooms a good size and vey clean. Good location for theatre district Home away from home

Wonderful place. Very, very friendly. Nice location. Helpful with all our questions. Close to theater district. Close to subway. Close to Times Square. The breakfast foods are very adequate. Beds were good. Very reasonable!

This was my second stay with Susan and her wonderful staff. Family joined me this time and agreed and have decided that this is now our NYC base for future visits. Cannot say enough about the gracious staff and guests!!!!!!

Probably the best hotel in New York I've ever stayed in. Best service and accomodation! Staff were so cheerful and helpful. Good breakfast and cozy arrangement. Rooms are good and are always clean. It feels so nice to have a home even when you're out of your home.

Traveling with a group of friends who chose the 414. Loved everything it had to offer, great location, customer service and clean. I will stay here on future New York travels for sure. Thanks for the great experience 414 ;-)

I would just like to express our sheer pleasure of staying at the 414! This was our 3rd stay and we are still amazed at the level of service we receive time and again!! The rooms are always spotless, the staff always have a smile and the location is within walking distance to any activities you may choose. A special shout out to Mary,Jacqui,Drew, Emma?, and last but not least Susan. Can't wait to return!!

A terrific place to stay. The staff are focused on making your visit to NYC great. Rooms are comfortable, free WIFI works well, recent upgraded TV was a nice addition. This was our second time at the 414 Hotel, and it remains our home away from home. Kudos to Susan and the team

My wife and I stayed here for a weekend recently to celebrate her birthday. The location is perfect. An easy subway ride and walk from Grand Central and just a few blocks from Broadway and the theaters. Yet you feel that you are in a quiet residential area. Great restaurants abound nearby. We loved hanging out with the other guests at the happy hour and sharing our experiences. Susan, Andrew, and the staff were fantastic. You feel like you are at home among friends. We really appreciated the restaurant suggestions and the daily newsletter. The breakfast was decent. We had a room on the 4th floor with no elevator, but didn't mind the exercise to work off some of the great food we ate over the weekend. When Susan found out it was my wife's birthday, she left her with a nice surprise. We plan to be back next year. We would not think of staying anywhere else!

I just returned from an overnight stayAt the 414 Hotel. Its located a few short blocks from the theater district.My wife and I stay here whenever wego into Manhattan for a show.We live on Long Island and could easilyCommute back home after the show. We choose to stay in Manhattan and the 414 offers us a respite from the daily grind.We usually arrive shortly before Showtime and always make the curtain.  More importantly, after the show the hotels proximity affords use time to pass all the restaurants and literallyDigest the experience and reconnect.The owners and staff are supper friendlymaking the experience that much more enjoyable. The upside is when you wake up at the 414 it is like being at home.The complimentary breakfast and atmosphere is as comfortable as my ownKitchen and eat in. We usually end ourNight stay with a museum visit or sightseeing the following day and scoot home before rush hour.They 've gotten reviews from long staying return guests.I just wanted to relay to anyone thinking of dinner and a show . The 414 Hotel is a City Oasis just off 9 ave and 46.Thankyou, Susan and Andrew.You and your staff make everyTrip into Manhattan more memorableSean and Diane

Hotel 414 made our 12 day stay in NYC as easy as possible.The location is outstanding, in the middle of Hells Kitchen, walking distance from Times Square and the shows.Susan, Emmy, Drew and the rest of the staff were ready with advice, suggestions and a glass of wine at the end of a big touristy day out.Rooms are very comfortable and have all you need.Breakfast and the happy hour with the other guests and all the staff added immeasurably to our experience. Helping other guests with restaurant suggestions due to our experiences, feeling like a local, 414 hotel leaves you feeling like part of a New York family.The big hotels cannot give you this feeling, or even go close.We will stay again, I couldn't stay anywhere else.

This hotel is two blocks from times square, literally, walk out the front door, turn right, walk two blocks and your there. You would NEVER know though. The street is tree lined and mostly residential. It was a very nice peaceful space to return to after spending a day in this crazy city!They give very personal attention. They will great you as you are leaving and as you arrive. They gave my husband a very thoughtful mug filled with treats for his birthday! So nice!

I don't usually do reviews, but this hotel was quintessential New York, and the owners couldn't have been nicer. Stay here if you truly want to live like a New Yorker, and enjoy the company, community, and great food nearby.

Nice place with very personal touch. Good location in Hell's Kitchen too, close to a strain of restaurants, theaters, etc.Hotel had everything we needed, people who work there are very nice, nice breakfast.

The perfect 5-star hotel to stay in New York City. Susan and her staff go out of their way to make you feel as though you are their only guest. We arrived at the 414 at 2 AM after encountering multiple flight delays traveling west coast to east coast. We were greeted at the door by Ike, the weekend night manager, who was clearly more awake than the four of us. Ike promptly checked us in, carried the bags to our rooms, and then served us a night cap while filling us in on the 414 and current events. Our first morning started with a community breakfast in the lobby featuring a self-serve espresso machine you will want to take home. Every afternoon around 5:30, the 414 sets out a generous assortment of wine, scotch, bourbon, and liquors. It becomes a focal point of the day. Guests gather in the lobby to enjoy the assortment, discuss the day’s events, and plan for the night. Every evening, after returning from touring the city, we were greeted by Drew, another of the 414 night managers. Drew was always willing to share in our experiences and offer us another night cap. The hotel is a short walk to mid-town and the theater district. Rooms are spacious, cozy, clean, and inviting. What more can you ask for. The 414 is everything they claim to be and more. Each staff member made us feel as though we had a second home in New York.

Got a great last minute deal on this place after I decided to stay in the city after a Javits center conference. It had high ratings so I decided to give it a try. We were welcomed by a super friendly staff who after a few minutes felt like old friends. Our room was clean and fresh. The deco was modern and bright. The bed was super comfortable and cozy. The bathroom was as clean as could be. Overall I was very pleased. The only possible negative would be the stairs - it is a walk up which could be an issue for some. for me it gave me an excuse to overeat at the yummy Italian restaurant down the street. I would return - the combination of hotel staff and coziness was a win!

We had the pleasure of staying here for 2 nights. Susan the owner is very kind and accommodating. The hotel its self is not very glamorous but it is very practical and clean . It's like staying in a relatives home......To me in this situation the customer service exceed the glamour you would get else were. Location is great ,on a nice quite street. We were so pleased we booked our next stay for next year before we left.Kudos to Susan and staff!

This is a wonderful little place on the edge of the theater district. The rooms are small and plain but get the job done. What makes this hotel the find that it is are the location and the staff, who are the friendliest and most helpful people I have ever met in a hotel. They take time to get to know their guests individually and provide custom advice and recommendations. They seem to know every single thing going on in the city -- current art exhibits, music playing, which parks and roads are under construction, restaurants with exciting menus. The free continental breakfast is quite good, and at 5pm, a good selection of cheeses, crackers and drinks are laid out. You could easily walk right by this place and never know how terrific it is -- but don't miss it.

Susan and her staff are exceptional! The rooms are comfortable and clean, the beds are just right and the small lobby with fireplace is warm and welcoming - we sat and chatted with other guests over lattes while light snow fell outside the tall windows. Perfect location for a weekend of theatre and dining, everything is a short walk away. We booked our next stay at checkout and cancelled reservations at a larger hotel.

414 is a small, neighborhood hotel that is the perfect location if you're coming to town to see a show. The rooms are nice, comfortable and very clean. The staff is very friendly. It was a pleasure staying here.

A buddy of mine and I booked this hotel for two nights in order to visit a friend in the city. The first thing that was apparent to us was that the staff not only cares about the customer's stay, but about the customers themselves. During happy hour, we sat in the lobby with a few other travelers, and an employee (I believe his name was Drew) remembered what everyone told him they were up to that day and asked about it. Even if your itinerary is largely away from Hell's Kitchen, the 414 is a nice "Home" to come back to at the end of the day. (Also shout out to the tall scruffy employee who owns a pink beanie... wish I could remember your name)

We spent some time at the hotel between Christmas 2016 and New Year and I cannot recommend the hotel enough. The rooms are not exceptional but what makes the hotel stand out is the level of care exhibited by the staff and in particular the owner Susan Yates. They genuinely want you to have a good time in their hotel and in New York and take the time to chat with each guest and to give personalised advice, be that what sites to see, where to eat or where there is a good sale on. We spent a few nights at the Hilton Doubletree just before staying here and left early because the rooms were so dirty and the staff rude. Hotel 414 is a far, far superior experience. I would, and have, recommend to this hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying there again the next time we are in New York.

After spending 5 nights at this B&B property in the Hell Kitchen area of NYC, I can certainly understanding the high ratings on TripAdvisor. The knowledge of the staff led by Susan Yates is extremely helpful for their guests. We have been to NYC a few times over the years and we were looking for new places to eat and visit. Suggestions were aplenty for both local restaurants and sightseeing options. It is really helpful that Susan has provided a 3 page listing of local restaurants and then assists guest to refine the list further. With respect to sightseeing, they recommended some of the usual sites, but really helped get us to the right ones at the right time. In addition, they provided directions for both bus and subway (including maps) directions to and from the hotel. As it turned out we used the bus (get the 7 day unlimited pass for the metro at $31) more than the subway as it was at time more convenient and required less steps up and down stairs (knee issues).Our room was at the back of the courtyard and included a king size bed, dresser, etc. It was comfortable and warm for the cold days and nights. I would recommend the addition of Directv HD service given the money spent on large screen tv's as the cable quality was poor and several channels flickered and sound buzzed, but I have to say we only used the tv for late evening news.Perhaps the best part of the stay at the hotel was getting to know the hosts and the other guests at the hotel. We met couples and single travelers from the UK, Australia, Baltimore, Boston, Wisconsin, Orange County California and Indonesia. The conversation at the morning continental breakfast and evening happy hour (cheese, wine and spirits) was very engaging. Yes, the stay includes an happy hour from 5:30-7:00 pm.I highly recommend the 414 hotel for your NYC stay and we will definitely be back.

"Hotel" in quotes because it is more like a bed and breakfast than a hotel. If you demand services don't stay here. No elevator, but eager help with luggage, no room service but LOTS of friendliness. The rooms are clean, we had a regular king room. Very comfortable for sleeping and seeing NYC. Susan recommended restaurants and places to go and see like the native New Yorker she is. Drew, Marie and Emmy at the desk were congenial and conversational. The BEST part is the big friendly table in the lobby for sharing coffee and the continental breakfast, and the wine and cheese in the evening. Good conversation and congeniality. The hotel is on 46th street which means restaurant row. There must be 100 or more good to great restaurants within a 10 minute walk. We walked to the theater for the show we went to see. AND the cost is substantially less than for almost any "real" hotel. Courtyard doesn't have room service and how many times do you use the valet laundry at a big hotel. I'll bet Susan and her staff could arrange ironing, laundry and any other service necessary. This wonderful little hotel is a gem. Try it you will like it.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the 414 Hotel in NYC. It is located in a excellent location on W. 46th Street near times square, many restaurants, shopping and Broadway plays. Susan and her hotel staff were extremely courteous, professional, and helpful. They gave us advice on sites to visit, restaurants, and travel arrangements. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the breakfast and happy hour was first rate. It was an exceptional experience and we would stay there again.

This hotel is a gem! Went to New York to get the Christmas mood and celebrate my birthday, they made it extra special! So friendly and helpful! Food was great rooms were gorgeous fabulous location!! Highly recommend! This is my new go to when I visit the city!

Susan, Andrew, and the staff were wonderful. Very accomodating and friendly. Knowledgeable about all the local attractions and could give directions to anywhere you wanted to go. Felt more like family than staying at a hotel.

This was our first visit to the hotel, but will not be the last. Wonderful staff, who were very accommodating. The communal gathering space provided a wonderful opportunity to meet fellow guests during breakfast and happy hour. Marrion and Tom

Great location, oustanding personal service, fun atmosphere. Susan and the entire staff make everything perfect and welcoming. It is now our "go to" hotel for when we visit New York. Absolutely outstanding!

The hotel was great and the staff was awesome. I really understand why it has been ranked in the top ten hotels in NYC :) It is not a fancy place but it is sweet and confortable, homy. The strength is the staff and the big oak table were everybody seats and tells about their trip around a glass of wine or whisky. They always have good tips to give you to improve your trip in the city. And what's best than a New Yorker to tell you where the best places are? So drop your Lonely and go to the 414 for a great stay in NYC!

My wife and I selected the 414 Hotel from TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. A great location off Restaurant Row and a couple of blocks from Time Square. Susan and the staff are the friendliest in NYC, making us feel quite at home in the comfortable settings and room accommodations. Self serve breakfast in the morning and afternoon happy hour provided the opportunity to visit with other guests. We had a great 4 days and will definitely stay at 414 Hotel again. Thank you Susan and staff.

My husband and I could not have asked for a more wonderful hotel experience for our "mini-moon". Susan and her staff were so helpful and friendly. The location is wonderful and in walking distance to many attractions and subway stops. The happy hour and breakfast each day were phenomenal. I can only hope to return. I could not say enough great things about our time at 414.

I am torn. I don't want anyone else to know about this gem right in the middle of the theater district. But it is not fair to keep it to myself. A B&B right in the middle of Manhattan. Won't stay anywhere else from now on. The location, the staff, the rooms, the happy hour, the breakfast, the service...all wonderful. Congratulations to everyone associated/working with this hotel. Top notch.

My wife and I stayed in 414 Hotel 3 nights in late December 2016. From the welcome, to the service, to the rooms and beds, housekeeping, to the big breakfasts and wine and cheese toward dusk, it was restful and felt like home.No dishes or housekeeping chores.The innkeeper is special. She appears. Gets to know the guests - from the U.K. Australia, New Zealand, Sweden, Canada, and US. It was a party. Treat yourself to a fine hotel. You will want to return. My wife and I are planning a return. Hope these is room when we attempt to book.

My daughter and I were travelling to New York for the first time so having read the reviews of Hotel 414 it sounded ideal and it certainly was. It surpassed all expectation. Susan and all her staff were exceptional, nothing was too much trouble. They provided lots of advice to help us make the most of our trip - they knew about everything. The cheese and wine and the cosy fire was very welcoming on our return at the end of each day. A tour of Central Park with Susan is a must. Thank you. We'll be back.

Everybody is so helpfull and ready to give a hand at any time.Room was very clean and the bed perfect.Do not miss the happy hours which will allow you to enjoy wine, whiskies and ...... while chatting with ôter residents.

We enjoyed staying at 414 but it's probably not for everyone. It is very clean, very friendly, and very conveniently located. The room was small, but typical for NY. Very nice bedding and towels. No elevators, and the lobby is small, and feels a little like a hostel.I would stay there again.

We prefer smaller hotels with personality. 414 is perfect. The staff was very friendly and gave us great ideas for things to do, places to visit, and good food options. Wine tasting in the evening and breakfast were fun times to meet the other guests and compare notes on the things we've seen and done. Got some great tips. We will definitely stay here again.

If you want to be near Times Square but not in the hustle and bustle, this hotel is a great value and option. Cozy and quiet; convenient and amenable, and even had a happy hour with wine for customers.

Spent five nights at 414 Hotel, 46th Street, NY, NY December 2016. Hotel close to Times Square, Hell's Kitchen. Small boutique with a family atmosphere. Owner Susan was so accommodating and very nice. After complimentary continental breakfast we were out all day exploring. Evening complimentary cocktail hour with cheese was just the thing to top off a wonderful day. Room was comfy and quiet. We will stay again.

When I arrived at the 414 I was greeted like an old friend and throughout my 9 day stay I feel like that's what I've become. The Hotel is well staffed by the most fun loving individuals you could possibly hope to meet, you would struggle to meet this many lovely people travelling the whole world let alone in one place. This is all fuelled and radiates from the amazing Susan who owns the 414. The hotel itself is 22 rooms of joy which injects itself into every guest that passes through it's door. It offers rooms that are clean, practical, well maintained and comfortable. In addition you are free to help yourself to a daily continental style breakfast, all day tea, coffee etc and of course the 414's very own evening coming together of wine, spirits and cheese board where all the guests from around the world soon become friends for life.The hotel is perfectly located just a couple of blocks from Time Square and all the amenities of mid town Manhatten but far enough away to facilitate a quiet and comfortable stay. It's a little piece of magic in the Big Apple.I visited throughout Christmas with my 15 year old daughter and we were made to feel so welcome by Susan, her fantastic staff and all the guests. It was like having a Christmas at home with all my loved ones. An experience like no other and I will never forget you all. I will be recommending to all my friends and colleagues that the 414 is the only place to stay when visiting New York and hopefully I will be back soon too.Thank you so much Susan and Andrew for making us feel so special, especially on Christmas Day. Thank you to all the staff for all the kind care, information and hard work you do to help make the 414 what it is, you know who you are. Thank you to all the worldwide guests we made new friends with from New Zealand, America, Australia, England, Sweden, France and many many more. Love to you all and wishing you all the best New Year ever.Lots of love From Simon & Chloe.

What a gem! My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in December and we fell in love with this charming hotel. Just like a B&B, guests wander down from their rooms to share breakfast in the morning and sip wine by the fireplace in the evening. The owner and staff are incredibly warm and welcoming. The location is ideal; a quick walk to Times Square, plus there are many fantastic restaurants, theaters, and attractions nearby. This is not a fancy, ritzy resort. However it is clean, comfortable, and the personal attention from the staff is truly special. I have no doubt we will stay there again!

We were thrilled when the Uber dropped us at the inviting doorway of the 414 hotel. The lobby was welcoming and comfortable and the staff were more friendly and helpful than we ever expected! The breakfast was fantastic, and the location is perfect. My friend and I always take a girls trip to NYC in early December to kick off the Christmas season and this year's stay at the 414 definitely added to our wonderful experience. I highly recommend this hotel!

If you close your eyes for a minute and picture a little haven in a big city, a place you can call home everyday where fellow guests become family, where smiling faces will greet you, where staff are willing to help you in anyway; a place that provides daily continental breakfast & happy hour drinks with cheese & crackers where guests congregate from all corners of the world like family to interact, a home away from home - you are picturing Hotel 414. Our lives have been enriched because of this place! We have made life-long friends here which we now consider as family. The care and attention given by the owners Susan and Andrew is outstanding, it reminded us of home - New Zealand; open, sharing & kind. Susan is like your hotel Mother, your aunty, your genuine friend who is always providing love, care and support for all guests, making each person feel valued and appreciated. Susan and the staff at 414 helped map out daily trips for guests if they needed, giving advice on restaurants and attractions individuals might like to see. The bedrooms are good, bath, shower, very comfortable bed, mini fridge and well priced treats. Very clean. The staff are awesome, they genuinely are interested in your day. We feel so blessed to have found such a gem in a big city and meet family and friends for life. This place will always hold a special place in our hearts. Thank you so much to our Hotel Mum Susan, Andrew and the staff at 414 Hotel. We hope one day to return not because of the city but the Hotel.Lots of love from your New Zealand family - Robyn & Glen.

Planning for a holiday visit to NYC, found this hotel in mid-town for a great rate. To say this is excellent is an understatement; from location, to accommodations , to service-oriented employees, etc., etc. Very personal atmosphere. Reminded us of a European boutique hotel. Wouldn't stay anywhere else. Also, great value: nice breakfast and super happy hour provided.

From the moment we walked through the door I felt like I was with family... a warm welcome, something to drink, snack kitchen tour. When Susan heard I had a cold she went straight to her herbal dispensary and got my on the road to recovery, if not from the L lysine and airborne, then the TLC.Anything you need or want is not too much for the entire "Can Do" staff.What a joy to share stories and laughs with so many sweet people, staff and guests seemed to be one big family!This will be a Christmas me and my family won't forget.... away from the chains of traditional meals and gift extravaganza. Here our gift has been the company of the people around us.We will definitely come back again and again to our new home away from homeThe location is excellent.... a couple of blocks from so many theatres and Times Square. Also many great restaurants all aroundYet it is quiet at night and the beds are very comfy and clean.

Love this hotel. Absolutely amazing hotel, The staff was super friendly and very helpful.Cozy breakfasts and happy hours chatter make it feel welcoming and homey. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and very clean. Will visit this Chrismas

This was a hidden gem for our stay in New York! It was almost like staying in a little bed and breakfast in the big city. We stayed on the 4th floor and street noise was very minimal. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to get to know us and help make our stay fun. The rooms were roomy and clean. The location is close to everything and close to a subway station as well. I would stay at this location again.

I have been raving about the 414 Hotel for 2+ years. We just came back from our fourth visit there and it's a wonderful place to stay. The location, the rooms and especially the staff make this a five star place in my book, and deserving of their #1 status as the best hotel in New York City. Not to repeat myself, but the 414 is on a tree-lined, quiet street, but it's only a few blocks away from Times Square (the self-proclaimed center of the universe), the Theater district, and Restaurant Row. Everything you need to have a great vacation is within walking distance or a short cab ride away. Our thanks to Susan, Jackie, and Mary for making it a great stay for us. Congratulations on your #1 status, it's well deserved.

First time staying at the 414 in NYC and couldn't be happier. After much online searching for the perfect surprise long weekend getaway for two I found this gem in Hell's Kitchen. Don't let the location name fool you, it's a wonderful area of the city. Location is perfect @ 9th & 46th for great restaurants, shopping and Broadway theatres, it's also much quieter than other midtown hotels.Susan and her team treat EVERY guest as family, no matter if it's for one night or four like we had. It feels like your own secret hideaway and I would highly recommend to anyone interested in a more intimate stay.Will go back again and again! Thx, Chris & Lin

We travel to NYC about twice a year for pleasure. Whenever we plan our trip, we schedule dates based on availability of a room at the 414 Hotel. The room rates are reasonable and fair based on the convenient location in Midtown Manhattan. The rooms are clean, immaculate, and comfortable. Attention to detail is evident, down to the hair and body products. The continental breakfast is tasty and always fresh. The Hotel staff is personable, friendly, and knowledgeable about their city. They will help with transportation needs, reservations, dinner recommendations, tickets to events and plays, or advice about a "walk in the park". Susan, Mary, and Jacque know their city well and only recommend activities that meet their high standards. You will enjoy your stay at the 414!

We are repeat guests at the 414 and we have a wonderful stay everytime. You could stay in a chain for the same price but why would you when you could stay in this wondeful place with genuine warmth and character and where the staff learn your name quickly and your story a bit more slowly. It's like staying with friends for us now.Staying here makes a trip to NYC even more special!

Whenever we travel I would always favour a smaller boutique style hotel because of the personal service you receive and this couldn't be any more evident than at the 414 hotel. On our last trip to the USA we were on the west coast and one thing we really enjoyed was the cheese and wine happy hour which was a big factor for choosing this hotel but when only actually made it once as we were too busy sightseeing! The thing that makes this hotel is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and the ease of meeting fellow guests around the breakfast table. We had a courtyard facing room in the rear building across the courtyard and it was a good size for NYC and couldn't hear any noise from the city at night. This is surprising for saying how close it is to Times Square...you can literally walk there in around 5 minutes. Lots of nice bars and restaurants near by so you don't even have to travel far if you don't want to. Broadway walk-able too and subway is close by too. Susan and her team really are great and try their best to provide as much information as possible to make your time in NY as enjoyable as possible. The rooms are practical more than luxurious but you don't got to New York for the hotel room! Breakfast had nice options - we both loved the granola and cream cheese on bagels / muffins. Great to get lots of local knowledge from Susan and her staff.

We stayed here at the end of November for our first stay in New York City having found the place on Tripadvisor. It is a small friendly hotel with about 20 rooms (on four floors and no lift) in a relatively quiet street considering that it is only about ten minutes walk to Times Square and theatre land. Our room was an adequate size and clean and tidy with windows onto an internal courtyard and an en suite bathroom. Slight niggle that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, but there were always hot drinks available at reception. But there was free WiFi.The staff were very friendly and helpful, with lots of tips of places to see and eat, and things to do. The breakfast which was included in the price was a cold buffet with cereals, toast, bagels(assorted types), and hot drinks. Breakfast is served in the hotel reception which has one large table and several smaller ones, it could get a little busy but it works.The unique selling point which sets the 414 hotel apart from the more typical offering is the "happy hour", actually longer than an hour when a selection of wines and spirits together with cheese and biscuits are set out in the reception area for the guests to help themselves and to sit and socialise with the other guests. A really good source of useful information both about things to do in New York City, and a great chance to meet people from around the world and other parts of USA.All in all a really homely place to stay whilst exploring New York, and good value for the location, inclusive breakfast and WiFi, and of course the "happy hour", we just need to think of an excuse to come back.

Stay here only if you want a comfortable, safe, small, friendly, personal-touch, close-to-everything kind of place. The owner and her staff are incredible at making you feel welcome and really care that you have a good experience while staying in the city. Helpful, not pushy, informed. Breakfast is good and happy hour a perfect way to end a busy day (or start to a fun evening). I wouldn't stay anywhere else as long as Susan and her team are running the place. Thank you for being such a lovely part of our New York vacation.

Where to begin, I wish our stay didn't have to end! We recently had 5 nights at 414Hotel and I cannot praise Susan and her 414Hotel Family enough. I am a Travel Agent in Australia and I chose this hotel for my first visit to NYC. It was the smartest thing I could have done for us. The hotel is in an advantageous position - so close to many great eateries, the theater district, Times Square and the subway. We chose to walk (we are walkers!!) and found most "to do's" able to be reached by foot which really made us feel like New Yorkers. We used the subway from JFK to the hotel - I had contacted Susan prior to our arrival to seek transport options this option is highly recommended! Ike greeted us around midnight like it was 9.30am and could not have been more helpful. Yes the hotel is all stairs (no elevator) and we were on the 4th floor (courtyard facing) and Ike carried our luggage to our room. It's really no issue. Our room was really comfy, quiet and welcoming. We immediately felt right at home. The next morning we had the absolute pleasure of meeting Susan - she is hospitality personified. I could write a whole paragraph just about her! We loved seeing her each morning as we discussed our options for the day and relived the day before with Susan and other hotel guests. What a treat - so many like minded people to share stories with! A "newsletter" was left under our door on a daily basis with hints and did you knows - such a great idea. Drew greeted us late every evening with his beaming smile as we returned from our adventures, never too busy to hear what we had achieved - he was genuinely interested. Most of all we felt valued and not like a number (generally that's what you are in a large hotel). We shall return to NYC again and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. Susan is a rare gem as is 414Hotel in the Big Apple!

My oldest friend and I wanted to do something special for our 50th birthdays and decided on a trip to New York. I found 414 hotel on trip advisor. The reviews were positive and it was the sort of small, family run hotel I like. The room was comfy and clean. It is also very central for the majority of what you want to see and do in NYC. The staff were amazing, from Susan (the owner) to Mary, Emmy, Ike and Drew. They really couldn't do enough for us. Because the hotel is small, the communal area in reception was great for catching up with other guests, we got some great tips and ideas.  I could wax lyrical about 414 but I will let you find out for yourself. We both loved it and will be back again as soon as we can arrange it

Susan (the owner), Drew, Jacqui, and the rest of the staff made our week-long Thanksgiving stay in NYC absolutely perfect. 414 Hotel is lovely and the staff cater to your every need. We really enjoyed meeting the other guests in the 22-room hotel, and made several new friends and were thrilled to run into them during the day while out and about. Rooms are comfortable, breakfast is simple continental but filling, happy hour is a great way to unwind before going out again. Courtyard was lovely. We were on the second floor in the back building, and it was very quiet even with the window open. Perfect location, close to the subway, Times Square, Broadway, restaurants, and the parade route, but very quiet. Susan even left us a bottle of prosecco for our anniversary--lovely welcome. Fireplace in lobby was a warm welcome every night. No elevator, but not a problem for us. Staff was extremely helpful and cheerful. We will definitely return!

Just spent three great nights at Hotel 414. Location was great near the theater district / Times Square and the room was cozy, but what made it great was the people, both staff and guests. Drew, Ike, and Susan were all focused on making our stay great and there were people from 6 - 8 countries staying in the 22 rooms. Great experience talking with them at our included morning breakfast and afternoon happy hour. Had one small issue with the room (hot water) but the owner was quick to step up and take care of it with a nice discount. Everyone there went over and above! We highly recommend it.John HartTyler, Texas

Love this charming little hotel, which is really more like a B&B. The staff were all terrific -- friendly, informative and kind. Some of them were there long before the current owners but I know they wouldn't still be around if they weren't the absolute best!Owner Susan is relatively new to the business but she was definitely born to be a hotelier. It's not possible to say enough good things about her so I'll demonstrate.My stay didn't start out well. Though I had read on their website that they don't have an elevator I was under the impression that their buildings were two-stories tall. They are four-stories and I was originally booked on the top floor. I explained that there was no way I could possibly negotiate four flights of stairs because of an acute exacerbation of a back condition and because of really bad knees! The desk clerk was able to move me to the second floor, which was fine. Unfortunately I had an awful first night because of noise from a business in the building immediately adjacent to that room. I called the front desk to ask what was going on. It was about 2am and the woman who answered the phone was as chipper as if it were 10am! The noise abated for awhile but then came back. By that time I really too exhausted to talk so I just waited it out. Normally I would have demanded a refund for the remaining nights of the stay and moved to another place. But before I could do anything, Susan came over to see me the moment I dragged myself to the lobby for coffee. Her apologies were profuse and accompanied by an action plan: she would comp my room and have me moved to a quieter part of the hotel. As much as it pains me that she has had to bear the brunt of the thoughtless landlord and even more thoughtless tenant, both of whom cause her so much grief, I accepted her plan with gratitude.The breakfast was good though I would have liked more options that didn't contain sugar. For example, at the time of my visit they had lots of yogurts but they were all fruit flavored. On the plus side I had forgotten how much I love cottage cheese! In the evenings they offer not just wine but a variety of spirits as well. While I did appreciate the quieter second room, I have to be honest and say that I was a bit stunned to find that it didn't have a chair, while the first room had two. That was remedied when I purloined a side chair from the front house. It wasn't as comfortable as the nice upholstered wing-back but it was fine for my needs.I've stayed all over NYC in all sorts of places but for as long as I am able, this will be my home each time I visit.

From the moment we arrived we felt so welcomed at this great boutique hotel. The morning breakfast and evening happy hour provided a great way to connect with guests from all over the world. The location is so convenient to Times Square, theaters restaurants and the subway. This was my first time staying in this part of the city and I will definitely go back.

This hotel was one of the many highlights on our wonderful first trip to NYC. First the owner, Susan, a native New Yorker, is as warm and genuine a person as you could ever hope to meet. She knows her city so well and is full of tips for things to do and see, can't miss shows, and generally how to function and get around in this massive place. The rest of the hotel staff reflect the warmth and hospitality of its owner. We found all of them to be delightful people who were so interesting to talk to. The location near the theater district and a few blocks from Times Square in midtown was PERFECT. The fact it is just off the beaten path on a quiet neighborhood street makes you feel almost like a local. The common area for breakfast and happy hour was a nice opportunity to meet and chat with other guests, who all seemed like genuine people who know a good value when they see it. We had booked our last 2 nights downtown for a different feel, and while it was a nice spot, we wish we would've stayed at 414 the whole time. We honestly can't say enough about how much we loved our trip and this hotel. We will be back for certain.

The team were all friendly, they seemed to be very willing to help guest with things to do.There were some nice touches e.g. happy hour. Wine and Cheese.The rooms felt a bit tired, clean but dated, the mattress on my bed seemed to slope, ok, but not great.Breakfast is included but is pretty basic.It's small and I like that, welcoming, reasonably priced, but next time I'll probably pay a bit more and go elsewhere.

My husband and I spent thanksgiving in Manhattan and stayed for the first time at 414 hotel. In one word the experience was amazing! This is not your typical hotel, but more like a bed and breakfast where the host really cares about you and wants to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Every single member of the staff does exactly that. This is definitely the place to stay in NYC!

Another charming stay with Susan, Jacqui, Mary, Drew and all the other folks associated with the 414. This time was for 5 nights as part of our annual pre-Thanksgiving visit to NYC, and we had a blast staying here. Everyone is super friendly, our room (406) was very well laid out, the bed was comfy, the water hot and plentiful, breakfast offerings were just right, and the ~5:30 - 7:00 happy hour offered a great chance to meet and greet other guests. They are very knowledgeable about the Big Apple and things to do/places to go and see/restaurants to partake of. If you want to be located close to the Theater District and don't mind walking a bit, the 414 is definitely worth it....try it once and you will return!

I researched tripadvisor before we booked our NY hotel because this was to be our first overnight stay and a special birthday trip. After reading reviews I called the 414 and talked with Susan, the Proprietor who very graciously & patiently answered my questions. We had been looking for a quiet hotel with easy access to restaurants and to all of the sites! Our stay was perfect because of the 414; it is a four-floor walk-up, our room was very clean w/ a super comfortable bed, and it was quiet (our's on the 3rd floor facing the courtyard). This is an old building that has lots of warmth, charm, and style. And the folks that work for her, have the same personality. They really do go out of their way to be helpful and to make sure their guests have the best New York City experience. We walked everywhere, and when we did venture out we took the subway (for the first time I might add). We found New Yorkers everywhere we went, to be very courteous and helpful. We're home now and our trip will always be a very special memory in part to our stay at the 414 and to their wonderful staff. Thanks Susan, Emmy, Drew (sp?), the young lady who helped me fix my earring (she'll know), and all of the 414 family.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. The accommodations were wonderful and the continental breakfasts were great! We liked the Owner and her friendly staff. They were very helpful. The hotel accommodates 22 rooms which we really liked. Excellent location; just a 10 minute walk to Time Square and to many local restaurants, shops, and theaters! Look forward to future stays. Sincerely, Linda Drewitz

We're so impressed by our stay and the staff at the 414. Located in the "Hells Kitchen area with so many food choices and a short walk to Times Square we are already planning our next adventure. We loved the bed and breakfast feel of the hotel and met people from around the world. Thanks Susan

What a find. Its like being in someone's home. We arrived exhausted and hungry to be greeted warmly and at happy hour in the tiny, cosy lobby. This place is located in a lively neighborhood with many restaurants, bustling but still very neighborhoody. The staff were so pleasant. My room, 202, is very nice with a large bathroom and a fabulously comfy bed. There is no elevator so if stairs are a problem, be aware of that. But our suitcases were taken up for us and we were on the second floor, so that was fine. Love this place.

We just returned from spending several days in New York City. Although not the first time to the city, this was our first visit to 414 Hotel and we were not disappointed. The hotel is an absolute oasis in the middle of the city. Although only a few blocks from Times Square, it is quiet, quaint, and well positioned to so many attractions. It's also convenient to the subway and highline. Susan and her staff are accommodating, friendly and go that extra mile to ensure your stay is the best. We now consider 414 Hotel our home when visiting the city.

We stayed at 414 for four nights to celebrate my birthday. This was our first visit to New York. Susan and her staff could not have been more helpful. They all happily gave us directions, suggestions,help, and a wonderful welcome to The Big Apple. The rooms were comfortable. The breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese were wonderful. I just don't think we could have picked a better place to stay. It was close to the subway and great for walking as well. When we return, I am sure we will book a room at 414!

My new husband John and I chose the 414 Hotel after reading all the great reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed!Susan and the team pulled out all the stops to welcome us, including a thoughtfully written congratulations card, bubbles and chocs! The team were so welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable on local activities, breakfasts were yum, happy hour cheese and bevvies a welcome sight after a long days sightseeing! John and I stayed a week and we can honestly say that it was the best hotel of our month long trip to the US, a little piece of good old fashioned hospitality in the big smoke! We are already planning our return trip for our anniversary in 2017!xxNiamh & John

We visited here on a couples anniversary trip last year and I've meaning to leave a review since! Susan and her staff are consummate local experts and fabulous hosts. I cant recommend them highly enough, the back patio is a welcome retreat after travelling the city throughout the day. Perfect location for seeing Chelsea and the Highline.

The most friendly and helpful staff! The hotel is very close to Time Square, Subway station, and almost everything else in mid town.This is our second time in that hotel and we are planning our next visit for next year. We are looking forward to stay at this comfy hotel. Ps, they serve a wonderful continental breakfast and happy hour.

Great location on the end of restaurant row. Theater district, shows, Times Square, subway, great restaurants all within easy walk. Staff was 5 star friendly and helpful. Breakfast and happy hour that was included allowed me to meet the other guests. Many of us were there for the marathon so we had lots to talk about. great fun. Rooms and bathroom were smaller than I'm used to but not a negative. I can't think of any reason I wouldn't stay here every time I'm in NYC. Just about everyone but me were foreign tourist, which made it even more fun. Memorable.

What a find! Excellent location in Midtown Manhattan. Excellent service (over and above anywhere I have been) , friendly, relaxed. Great breakfast (included), Happy hour every day, which was great to relax with other travelers and share our experiences with. Added bonus thisNovember was the New York Marathon and election day. New York is certainly a city that never sleeps! ❤️New York! Love ❤️ 414 Hotel.

My wife and I stayed at 414 Hotel during our recent trip to New York and all we can say is that the hotel was brilliant. Susan and all the staff were beyond friendly and always helpful. The room itself was exactly as expected. Breakfast was simple but delicious and the wine at happy hour was always social and again very enjoyable. Location is also perfect. We honestly cannot say enough good things about 414 Hotel and we will definitely stay here again next time we are in New York

The friendliest and most helpful hotel that I have ever stayed in. Fantastic location. Comfortable beds and quaint building. I can't wait to book my next holiday!! Friendly welcoming staff who suggests places to see, tasty breakfast and wonderful happy hour.

If your primary focus is easy access to the theater district, Times Square, Central Park, and the Upper West side, there is absolutely no better place than the 414 Hotel. I've been traveling to NYC for over 40 years and have stayed in more than a dozen different establishments, and the 414 will be my first choice in all future visits. Great restaurants are nearby and the subway is only a couple of blocks. Susan and the entire staff go out of their way to make sure your visit is special, and the advice they give to first time visitors is excellent.

We stayed here just after we got married. I could not recommend the hotel enough. Such friendly staff and great location. Lovely room with plenty of space and everything we needed on our doorstep. It made a real difference staying somewhere where the staff are so genuinely welcoming and helpful.

Loved this hotel! A nice small hotel, the room was nice. But what really impresses is the ambience there, feels like a bed and breakfast. The staff and owner Sue are sweet and personable. They make you feel at home there. Having breakfast there in the morning was great, and a nice way to start the day. I would love to come back! It's a bit pricy to stay there, but it was really convenient location to a lot of the places that we were going.

I never write reviews. But my fiancé and I enjoyed our stay so much I had to! I love NYC and this is the best place I've ever stayed there. The staff is amazing. They are super friendly, personable, and helpful. They have awesome local insider tips and suggestions. By the end of the first day we felt like family! The rooms are huge for NYC hotels, as are the bathrooms. It's clean, safe, quiet, close to everything. Wonderful happy hour nightly where we met other guests from all over the world. I felt like we lived in NYC for four days, which is how we like to travel. I would stay here again and recommend to all...even locals!!

My husband and I chose this quaint hotel from the reviews on TripAdvisor. I can't say enough good things about it!! We came for our 30th wedding anniversary and upon arrival had champagne and hand written note from Susan. The staff are ALL so very attentive to your needs. We met folks from all over the world who were staying here. I will definitely come back to this home away from home

I stayed at 414 Hotel for 3 days in early October. As others have said, the rooms are nice, and the location very convenient to theaters, restaurants and subways to everywhere in the city. However, having previously stayed in a number of small hotels in Manhattan, the main item that made this place so special for me were the host/owners and staff, and how they treated the guests, and effortlessly connected us all, to the extent we wanted to be connected. From the moment I entered the door, and was greeted by Drew, I felt welcomed. I could sit by myself at a small table for the very nice breakfast, or sit at a long table and interact with some of the other visitors. I ended up having some wonderful discussions with people from all over the world. Perfect for a person like myself, traveling alone....but obviously, based on remarks from my fellow guests, perfect for couples and families. I definitely hope to stay there again on my next visit to NYC.

What a wonderful experience. The hotel (converted brownstones) is modern, funky and homely, the staff are friendly and helpful and the overall location & hospitality is brilliant.My friend and I stayed 3 nights here as a stop-gap between Europe & Mexico and could not have enjoyed our stay more. Great location for food (Restaurant Row) theatre and Times Square all easy walking distance. Convenient to buses and subway also. Every day there was an afternoon mixer in the lobby and guests of all ages and nationalities would share stories of the day - we could stay for 2 minutes or two hours. Would recommend for all ages and travel parties, they even had vegemite for this Aussie! If you are older or don't like stairs request a room out the back or on a lower level as there are no lifts..... Cant wait until my next trip to NYC.

Pleasant and ready staff. Nice place in the heart of Manhattan. Quiet and very clear room. Perfect happy hour every day in the Hotel. Contribution report with good tips for every day. We was in this Hotel for second time.

Stayed at 414 for 12 nights in October while visiting our daughter who lives close by. Beyond the basics - nice, well furnished and very quiet rooms, great breakfast and happy hour, and good WiFi, AC etc. - the key value of this hotel is the unbelievable hospitality and support every single guest gets from Susan and Aviv and their great staff. You really feel like you are staying with friends who go out of their way to allow you to enjoy your stay , have as much privacy and quiet as you require while being there for you for all your needs. There is nothing you can come up with that will not be addressed with patience and generosity and it is very easy to feel at home at 414! We will definitely be back and the only concern we have is that all these, justified, great reviews will make it very difficult to find a room here next time.... Thank you Susan and Aviv!

Stayed at the 414 post cruise, for 4 nights, in mid October 2016, with my wife, as part of our 25th wedding anniversary holiday. Everything about the hotel is perfect. The 414 is a lovely, late Victorian, red brick building, converted from a pair of town houses, incorporating an attractive inner courtyard. The bedrooms/bathrooms are large by New York standards. Breakfast is traditional New York fare (bagels, muffins and the like), and the hotel has a "happy hour" in the late afternoon/early evening with complementary wine & cheese.The hotel is situated on 46th St. just off 9th Avenue, in what was traditionally referred to as the "Hell's Kitchen" area of Manhattan, (but which has more recently been called Clinton). The hotel is thus within easy walking distance of the attractions of Mid-town, such as Times Square, yet because it's in a residential area, it's quiet in the evening. The nearest subway is 5 minutes walk on 44th St.The Manager Susan, and her staff are wonderfully helpful with practical advice on how to get the best out of your time in New York - everything from how to negotiate the subway system, to getting discounts when booking theaters and museums. One very useful feature was a guide to the restaurants near the hotel. Many of these restaurants weren't traditional tourist traps, often being frequented by local New York people. We went in several - the food was always excellent, and prices very competitive.Quite apart from being the perfect base from which to explore the great city of New York, you will not find a hotel more welcoming and helpful than the 414. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anybody visiting the city.

Susan and her team run the "hotel" as their home with great empathy towards all guests.The open approach with genuine smiles show the staff loves what they are doing, meeting people and showing them around in the city. Each morning a newsletter with weather and tips where to go, a delicious breakfast with other guests in or outside. Nice , clean and spacious rooms with a view in a reasonable quiet neighborhood, close to Time Square and several underground stations in walking distance. Also Citibike depots close by (even Susan has some bikes available!)After a long day strolling through the city there is the relax hour with wine and cheese in the common room downstairs. No frills , no plastic it al comes from the heart.Much appreciation the way Susan runs her hotel(s), this is very rare today !Definite worth the 5 stars (with a plus) ! Thanks for our perfect 4 day stay with my daughter.

Stayed here for three nights while visiting NYC. Incredibly friendly and knowledgeable staff. Large, clean, updated room which requires a short walk up a flight of stairs. Sufficient continental breakfast in the morning and a wonderful happy hour in the afternoon. Located a couple blocks from the subway and 1/2 block from restaurant row. Highly, highly recommend this place. We can't wait for our return visit!

Nestled far west of the glitter of Broadway, the 414 is a little slice of European hospitality heaven. Proprietors Susan Yates and her husband welcome guests from near and far abroad into their charming space, a cross between a B&B and small inn. Whether it’s mingling in the lobby over wine and cheese or sipping coffee at breakfast amongst the many accents of that day’s lodgers, the atmosphere encourages friendly conversation, tourist tips, and a unified appreciation for this jewel in the middle of Manhattan. There’s a reason it’s a top spot on Tripadvisor! It’s like being in someone’s home, but with better service, conversation, and social amenities. For a global New York experience, the price can’t be beat, and the owners will be your new best friends.

I stayed at 414 with my two teenage daughters and would definitely stay again! The service here was top notch and Susan & team went out of their way to assist with any information needed. The location can't be beaten a few minutes walk to the bus tour, time square, Broadway and surrounded by top quality restaurants in a very safe part of New York. The laundromat is a few doors down and they wash, dry iron, fold and deliver your clothes for a very minimal price ($10 a big bag) This holiday was a trip of a life time for the girls and I and 414 made it a very memorable experience from the moment we enquires to the day we left. The free breakfast and evening happy hour were extra touches that make this hotel the place to stay when visiting New York.

414 Hotel is one of THE best hotels I've ever had the pleasure of staying. Susan, Jackie, Drew and the rest of the staff are more than hoteliers. They have created a quiet bastion in one of the busiest city in the world, through an informal sense of family, inclusion, they have a genuine interest in your experience. The hotel is perfectly situated for the Broadway experience and Susan knows just about everthing you can know about the theatre scene. I enjoyed our "after show critiques" each morning. All of the staff have great suggestions about things to do, if you are feeling a little overwhelmed about everything there is to do. They share discount coupons and know the ins and outs of finding the least expensive ways of touring the city. I look forward to returning.

We had a great stay at 414 last week. Susan and Jackie and the rest of the staff could not have done more for us. Anything we wanted to know about the best way to get to places and where to buy items were helpfully provided. Tables booked for restaurants etc. They were always there to answer queries at breakfast and again at Happy Hour providing maps and directions etc. These occasions were so friendly with everyone, guests and staff, chatting about things they had done that in the end it seemed like we were staying with friends rather than in a hotel. The location of the hotel is very convenient with lots of restaurants very close.We appreciated having the kitchen available to make cups of tea in the morning and after evening meal and the breakfasts and happy hour cheese and crackers were all very tasty too.If we were coming to New York again we would certainly want to stay at 414 but it does get very booked up so need to book early.Alan and Susan HaxbyYorkshire England

The boutique hotel may not be 5 star in the physical sense, but the location, value and hospitality are unbeatable. It feels like a small European hotel with its small reception area which doubles as the restaurant and meeting place. Susan and staff go out of their way to make everyone feel welcome, not only at the hotel but in New York city. We won't spoil any surprises, but she sure made our visit feel quite special. When we left after our 3 night stay, it felt like we were leaving family.

We stayed at 414 Hotel a week ago and what a great one it was! Excellent location on Manhattan, fantastic service, clean and comfortable rooms. A generous breakfast with lots of choices included. So is happy hour in the afternoon with wine and cheese and coffee and tea throughout the day. Best coffee we had in NY! Do not be mislead by the basic decor in the reception. In most hotels there is a fancy reception area and the rooms are basic - here the opposite applies. Susan and her staff go out of their way to take care of their guests and can assist with advice about what to see, how to get there and arrange tickets. Such a friendly place! We would love to come back!

My wife and I lived in NYC almost 30 years ago and had the opportunity to revisit together in a combined business and personal visit. Having lived in Hells Kitchen back then, I was curious to see how it had changed, so I chose this location for that reason and great reviews on TA. So this hotel is quaint, small, and friendly; a welcome alternative to the chaotic NYC scene. So it was nice to return to this relative island of peace and tranquility every evening. The good things:Very clean and comfortable travelers style hotel, with very friendly helpful staff.Rooms are up at least one flight of stairs, are very comfortable and adequate, quiet and clean.Tiny lobby provides breakfast, complimentary drinks and cheese/cracker apps.You can meet people in this quaint environment from all over the world, as well as local folks who traverse the bridges primarily to atttend the theatre.Walking distance to Theatres and midtown a big plus if this is one of your requirements.The not so good.Hells Kitchen, at least this part well north of the many developments going on around the High Line, remains a rather bleak and dense part of NYC. Streets are still laden with trash (trash bags piled on side streets almost nightly) and proximity to Times Square makes it a rather bleak neighborhood compared to others where density and proclivity of tourism is less. Although some newer and good restaurants are nearby, certainly the restaurant row restaurants cater to those who for the most part, dont know any better or defer to options near shows they are attending. Bottomn lineIf you want to be close to theatre district and like a small scale and friendly place where you can meet others and get help from friendly staff, then by all means check out Hotel 414. However, if you want a place with more amenities, care less about being in this part of Manhattan and getting to know fellow occupants, there are many other options out there that would be better option for the money. It's all about your preference and the kind of experience you are looking for.

This was our 3rd time in NY and by far the best experience thanks to great help from Susan and her team! It really felt like coming home. Great location, great hotel,great room, extremely helpful people, nice breakfast and evening reception, cosy terrace,....We used the bikes and this was a fantastic experience, I would certainly recommend it. Susan helped with tickets for the Broadway show, jazzclub, gospel in Brooklyn,....We enjoyed a real fantastic weekend in NY we will never forget.Hotel 414 is on the top of our favourite places to stay in the world , we promised we certainly will be back! Thanks Susan & team!

I've stayed here twice and will be back in the spring. The personalized service (though "service" seems too cold a word) from Susan, Andrew, and all of the great staff, is like nothing I've ever encountered at a hotel. There's nothing they're not willing to help you with, from nearby (or not) restaurants, to things to do and how to get to them, to introducing folks to an app that works like Uber but whose cars are SUVs large enough for a small crowd. I have a special need regarding linens and they went out of their way to see that it was provided. Susan will spend as much time as necessary to see that you get what you need, from information to to creature comforts. The breakfast choices are wonderful, and there's a happy hour with a great assortment of whiskeys, bourbons, wine and cheeses.
