Quiet rooms, clean bedding, clean bathrooms, breakfast and happy hour in the garden courtyard along with a friendly and helpful staff prompts us to say "WeLoveOurHosts" Susan, Mary, Jackie, Fernando and Emmy!

My husband and I enjoyed a long weekend in late April and really liked the convenience of the 414 Hotel. We are theater buffs so whenever we visit NYC we take in a lot of shows. The location so close to all of the theaters and our favorite restaurant row dining spots couldn't have been better. Still close to the subway for trips to other parts of town, too. The breakfast was always perfectly adequate to start the day; we were never at the hotel during the wine and cheese so can't comment on that spread. I think what I liked most about 414 Hotel is that it has the intimacy of a B&B but the privacy of a hotel. We enjoyed chatting with other guests but never felt like we were rooming in a stranger's house. My only complaint is that our room really needed more surface space/counter space; one expects small rooms in NYC but we needed more places to physically put our stuff. Our bathroom really could have used a shelf of some kind so we could stow our toiletries. Other than that, though, a great stay.

Absolutely gorgeous hotel in the heart of the city. The breakfast and happy hour are a special touch and Susan is the most wonderfull General manager. Absolutely gorgeous hotel in the heart of the city. The breakfast and happy hour are a special touch and Susan is the most wonderful General manager. Would stay again without hesitation

staying at the 414 means to live new york as a real New Yorker .... the atmosphere is very welcoming, you feel among friends and you would never want to leave.everything becomes easier in New York with the help of the owners susan and andrew or jaqui or mary ... their help arrives before it arises the question ...we went for a holiday and we left leaving behind us the friends .... we will return as soon as possible and certainly will be back to 414.needless to say, great rooms the hotel is a tico New York building turn of the century, very well refurbished breakfast is plentiful and first class. afternoon to 414 have the nice custom of offering a drink and conversation.It is the most beautiful place in the world

We have just stayed at this great little hotel and I must say that the staff are without doubt as helpful as I have ever come across. The intimacy of the whole place makes the perfect place to stay. A couple of things are you need to be aware there is no lifts and we found the pressure of the shower poor. However I would not let these minor things stop me recommending this hotel.

My husband and I stayed at 414 Hotel for 2 weeks over April/May and had an EXCELLENT experience there. The front desk team were so friendly, helpful and personal, and a special shout out to my girl Susan who is the most friendly and lovely New Yorker I've ever met. They were always genuinely interested in helping to make our plans the best they could be, to maximise our enjoyment of the city everyday. Breakfast time was always fun to talk about our plans for the day and meet other guests as well. They even went out of their way to pick up our laundry if we were going to come in late that day! The room was a good size, always clean and equipped with everything you need, as was the bathroom. Just what you want to come home to at the end of a long day traipsing around the city. But the best thing (as I've mentioned) was the friendly, personal service, which you just can't get at a big hotel, regardless of the chrome and glass luxury. It really made it feel like you were staying with friends rather than at an impersonal hotel. We would most definitely come again!

This hotel is fantastic. Great location, close to Times Square but far enough away to not be in the middle of Times Square. Staff were friendly, and helpful. Room was quiet and super clean. Breakfast was awesome. Great place. I'm coming back.

Walked to Javitz Center for conference and Times Square for shows; also close to the subway. Location is great on a quiet (for NYC) residential street near restaurant row. Morning breakfast and evening wine and cheese was great. Staff was friendly and attentive. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Daily "newsletter" was a wonderful touch.

The breakfast could be more varied. Beside that, it is a great place to stay in New York. Great welcome, great availability of the staff. We're almost at home with family at the 414 Hotel. The street is quiet while 300ft on the East (the 9th Av) the noise is there.10mn walking to the subway, 10mn walking to Time Square. A neighborhood with many different restaurants. I'm glad to have chosen to stay in this kind of hotel instead of big ones like AKA, Novotel, ... which might sometimes be at the same price, but in really noisy streets. When you pass the 414 Hotel door, you're reached the calm.Thanks to all the staff: Suzan, Jacqui, Mary, Emmy and the others. I recommend.

A fantastic location with easy access to most/all of the N.Y. visitor 'hot spots'.Rooms are spacious, well maintained, and comfortable. If there is any street noise, it's generally a friendly reminder that you're in the heart of a major city!The ladies in the hotel lobby are GREAT! Need a good restaurant (Becco), boarding passes, cabs, or light touring conversation, they are there for you! Breakfast or a loooong 'happy hour' are a great way to meet others from around the world and to share your N.Y. experiences. 24-hour specialty coffee machine was appreciated! We loved our four nights there at the end of April , and hope to return in the near future!

What a great hotel this is. If location is everything then this hotel has it all. On W 46th between 9th and 10th, its only a short walk from the restaurants of Hell's Kitchen - Restaurant Row and Theatre land and Times Square.It's location is not its USP. That comes from the amazing staff Susan who owns it with her husband, Emmy Jackie and Mary who simply cannot do enough to help.A complimentary continental breakfast is served in the lobby from 7am. Not only do you get to meet other guests but if you need any tips travel, shows, attractions restaurants or anything else they are only too willing to help. You may find they have access to good discounts at various places too. We love our guests is their motto......and how!There is a complimentary happy hour with wine and some spirits served with cheese and nibbles. A small touch but a special one. If you are travelling alone or with a friend or partner this is another great way to meet your fellow guests and pick up tips fromRooms are clean and comfortable.This hotel isn't highly rated by so many reviewers by accident. It's wonderfulEnjoy your stay

This is a small style hotel. I got a great deal and the stay was very nice. I can't say if I paid full price I would have been so pleased with my stay. The quality was very nice. Good location. I would recommend it.

I am so thankful to have found this boutique hotel on Trip Advisor. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. But what was so amazing was the staff. They were so nice and helpful. Their warmth and hospitality was comforting. The breakfast was great and we loved the happy hour of wine and cheese in the evenings. Our room was facing the street but still was able to sleep fine. I figure I would just roll with the noise outside. It must be what New Yorkers deal with on a daily basis and so I didn't let it bother me. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

I felt welcomed and taken care of the second I walked in the door. Coming off of a bi-coastal flight, I appreciated how quickly they checked me in and invited me to join the early evening wine and cheese happy hour. The hotel host also recommended the perfect place to get some yummy NY pizza, and gave me perfect directions to the restaurant, Two Boots Hell's Kitchen, and also my after dinner coffee at Starbucks. They were also incredibly accommodating about storing the luggage for me and my friend that came in the next day before we could get into the other place we stayed in the city. My only suggestion is that if you don't work out several times a week like I do, definitely ask for a second floor room. The stairs to the rooms are steep and narrow, and there is no elevators in these beautiful older buildings. Not a huge deal, but it was work carrying my bag up and down to my 4th floor room.

Our room was small but your in New York... However what was lacking in our room was made up for by the staff. Our first morning... we saw a couple hugging the staff and saying goodbyes as if they were family. At first I thought it was a little odd but as we finished out our stay that encounter I witnessed on our first day explained everything.  Each morning we were greeted by name with coffee and a lovely breakfast spread. Each evening we would come back to the hotel to wine and cheese happy hour!!!! The only down fall to this was the weather that we could not really enjoy the courtyard. We did brave the cold and rain one evening and people watched from the front stoop. The GM Susan was giving me advice via TEXT while we were out sightseeing - tell me if you would get one on one service like that from the big chains? On our last day it was raining but we were on a mission to find one last item for a family member... Susan called a local store to make sure they had it so we didn't have to walk down there in the rain with no luck. She even stood in the rain to hail us a cab. Hands down AMAZING Hospitality - such a caring staff! I kind of miss them already!

The warm, pleasant and welcoming atmosphere of ALL the staff exceptional.Every one is very attentive and willing to helpHappy hour is great.A unique, highly recommended island in the heart of the city.

I havent even stayed here yet, but I think it is extremely important to point out the wonderful customer service offered by this hotel. Fernando and Susan were extremely prompt in their replies to all of my emails. They have shown professionalism, compassion and top of the range customer service. They have made the whole experience seamless and even gone as far to offer assistance in booking of tours. I can see already why they are rated so highly on here and am very much looking forward to our stay. See you soon Susan & Fernando and thank you so much for all of your help in making our trip of a lifetime affordable and memorable.

My wife and I just celebrated our wedding anniversary in New York and stayed (again) at the 414 Hotel. What a gem! The 414 continues to amaze me as a comfortable and convenient oasis in the heart of New York City. Susan and the staff at the 414 are attentive to every detail and the warm welcome we received was over the top!

we really enjoy our Holiday in this hotel , we have a warm welcome from the staff and Susan, who provide us a lot of valuable informations for our first trip in new York .We have a quiet and nice bedroom ( queen size ) , best place next to Time Square.I highly recommend this Hotel.

Location of the hotel is excellent, staff is very friendly and gives good help in finding the hotspots of NY. Close to subway, Times Square, and many restaurants in this neighborhood. Rooms are good and breakfast is cosy and efficient.

Located near Times Square, this hotel has a really kind manager (Susan) and a lot of other helpfull and friendly co-workers. As mentionned in some reviews it is true that the rooms are not the newest, but the rest makes up for it. Overall everything is clean, the staff is super-friendly, the breakfast is good, wifi is excellent and there's not a lot of noise even if you're in the middle of the city...as a bonus you have a nice concept with their happy hour between 5:30 and 07 pm, with drinks and cheese with bread offered. A real nice touch also are their two bikes we could use with a helmet and a lock included. You have to try Manhattan by bike, especially along the Hudson river wich is down the street of the hotel (and of course take a ride to Central Park!)I would go back without a doubt if i'm in NYC again...

We stayed at 414 Hotel two years ago and found it to be the perfect locale for us. We were able to walk to all the plays and restaurants we had on our bucket list, as well as Times Square, the High Line, and Central Park. The metro connects you to everything, but it's nice being in a central location to avoid long rides and transfers. Susan is the perfect hostess. Very helpful, very engaging and generous. We asked for a wine opener and were told "help yourself to anything you need in the kitchen!" The expresso machine is nice so you can make yourself a coffee at any time. Our room was comfortable and cool and quiet. No lift, but Susan helped us with our bags herself, and there's always someone to lug them up the stairs for us. Being able to walk to things is important in New York, as if you find yourself in an Uber or taxi, you can end up in a big traffic logjam. We hopped out several blocks from our destination on several occasions because nothing was moving! Susan also turned us on to Via, which is like Uber, only cheaper! The lobby/breakfast room is a gathering place where we have met wonderful people from all over the world. Nice to share experiences and travel stories after a long day over a glass of wine at the complimentary happy hour! This is a very friendly place!

My husband and I and another couple stayed at 414 Hotel recently and had a fabulous time. It really is much more than a hotel - from the wonderful staff who make sure you are comfortable and well taken care of to the terrific breakfast and happy hour snacks and wine - and the lovely room and extremely comfortable bed we slept in.414 Hotel is a special hotel where you meet people from all over the world. After a busy day touring NYC (much of which was recommended by the staff) it was lovely to come back "home" to be welcomed by the staff and introduced to other guests we could chat with and share what a fabulous city NY is. And you cannot beat the location - it is perfect!Many thanks to the owners and staff of 414 Hotel!

The hotel is very conveniently located only 5-10 min walk from Times Square. Also there are several restaurants to chose from right by the hotel. The hotel has, as I understood, only 22 rooms.Check in late on a Saturday night was friendly, and the guy who assisted us gave us a lot of useful information.We had a room towards the courtyard which resulted in us having the curtains closed at all time for privacy. The room had a musty smell that we noticed immediately every time we entered the room (but sort of disappeared when we had been in the room for a while, I assume we got used to it...). The room had good size, and was of OK standard. The bathroom had no heating, and it was very cold to step in the shower in the morning. It was very quiet, we experienced no traffic noise except the occasional sirenes from emergency vehicles.The TV could need some tuning, we ended up not watching it as it was really hopeless to use. The room had a safe of good size, and also a mini fridge with some drinks and snacks ( each item from were only USD 1, great!!!).Breakfast was included and served in the lobby. It was simple, but quit adequate; bagels, oatmeal, fruit, pastry, juice, egg etc. In the afternoon they had a complimentary wine and cheese serving, we did unfortunately not have the chance to try this.One day they did not finish the room until after 4 pm which was kind of a drag as we had been out walking for 7-8 hours and wanted to take a nap before going out to dinner, so coming back to an unmade room was a disappointment.The staff was very friendly and nice, except from one woman who never said hi, she just gave us a hostile look every time we tried to greet her, she was the direct opposite of the two lovely ladies who we met during breakfast. All in all, the hotel offered a lot, but I found it very expensive, we paid over USD 300 per night, and the hotel was of a midrange standard. But hotels in NYC are in general very expensive, so maybe this is what it costs...

Our third time here and it really is home away from home. This small boutique hotel offers big service for all the guests. Susan Yates greets us each morning, inquiring about our day, our plans, and able to assist with even the smallest detail. We've always enjoyed the chance to meet other guests, share stories, tips and ideas to make our stays terrific. With 24 hour staff, we feel safe and free to come and go.

A "5-C" Boutique Hotel: Classy, Comfortable, Convenient (Broadway/Times Square/Restaurants), Caring [Susan/Andrew (when he's not visiting the grandson /staff)], & Chic. They've added a morning "news sheet" with weather, tours & trip zips, hotel services. Entire staff is very knowledgeable about NYC that makes navigation around the city a "breeze" (well, you're in NYC, a relative "breeze.") Also, they provide umbrellas, if needed, so no need to pack one.

My first visit to NYC was great! One of the highlights was the 414 Hotel. A very comfortable boutique hotel, 414 Hotel was located within walking distance to many of the tourist attractions and very close to the subway.But the best part of the hotel was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Each morning before I was off to explore they were there to help with advice on what to do and how to get around. Overall is was a great hotel that helped add to a great trip.

414 Hotel is located in Hells Kitchen which is in Midtown and therefore an ideal location to explore the whole city. It's just a 5 to 10 Minute walk to Times Square but not in the middle of the hustle and bustle which is very nice. Also, you'll find some nice and individual shops and restaurants around. The double room has been spacious and freshly renovated. The bed was very good and there are plenty of possibilities to plug in your devices via USB and charge them so that you don't even need a converter which is really handy. Breakfast is included and consits of bagels, cereals, bread, cream cheese, sweet spreads, fresh fruit and really, really good coffee. They have this Jura coffee machine where you can take a cup whenever you need some extra energy for exploring the city. If the weather is nice you can even have your cup in the courtyard, looking at the Brownstones and fireladders which are so typical for the city. Every day at 5pm theres a get together with free wine and cheese where you can have a chat with the other guests. The whole atmosphere is just really welcoming and warm. Everybody we met has been very kind and helpful. 414 Hotel is rated one of the top ten Hotels in New York on Tripadvisor and I can really see why. The value for money is excellent and the location a dream if you want to explore this beautiful city. Rooms start at around 230€ at Booking.com.

From the moment you walk in, the welcoming to 414 makes you fell like you are visiting friends you have known a long time. Susan and staff are incredibly friendly and helpful with everything from finding rides in the city, sights to see and the best way to get there. Help with Broadway tickets , places to eat and a Memorable tour of Central Park.Happy hour is amazing, something rarely seen in hotels. Continental breakfast and all day coffee and tea were just above and beyond anything I have ever seen and the $1.00 water and snacks, might be the best deal in the city. Highly recommend and will definitely stay there on my next trip to NYC.

I loved this hotel! There is not one negative thing I could say about it! The 414 was recommended by a friend of my aunt's who had stayed there in the past and I am so glad we took his advice! It felt like home! Susan and her staff were beyond amazing! The location is incredible! The other guests were wonderful as well. I will never stay anywhere else when traveling to New York. I think I'll start by booking my room to make sure I can get in and then arrange everything else around being able to stay here! Thank you Susan and staff for everything you did to make our stay so wonderful!!!!

One of the reasons we liked 414 Hotel so much is down to Susan and her excellent team. It's clear from the moment you arrive, to literally the second you leave, that their goal is to make YOUR stay as memorable as it can be. They are flexible, relaxed and always on-hand to offer honest insight on where to go and the best way to do NYC. Complimentary continental style breakfast was served up each morning along with smiles and a happy good morning. Tea, coffee and cakes were available all day - so perfect pick me up after a busy day in the hustle and bustle. Happy Hour from 5.30-7pm included red and white wine along with harder stuff! If you want home from home and the opposite of corporate, give 414 a go - AMAZEBALLS. The Waddington Family from UK.

I cannot say enough nice things about this small hotel. Nothing disappointed and the very best features were: its location (just a few blocks from most theaters); its kind and helpful staff; the small kitchen that was open for a prefect small breakfast and; its a wine-and-cheese Happy Hour. If you can manage climbing a few flights of stairs, this is a great alternative to the big chain hotels.

We stayed a week and were extremely pleased with the location, so close to theaters, subway and bus stations. We greatly appreciated the great variety of restaurants which can be reached within five minute walks. What really made the difference is the staff, so friendly, constantly caring for the guests, helping with theater reservations, providing great advices. We never met someone like Susan before. She strives to make you feel part of the big 414 family. Awesome experience, well beyond our expectation, we will come back!

I have been staying at 414 Hotel when I come to NYC for almost 5 years. I tried other hotels and when I after finding 414 Hotel, I couldn't imaging staying anywhere else. The owners and staff are like family. The service is spectacular, the rooms very comfortable and in the summer, the court yard is such a lovely relaxed place for breakfast, a glass of wine after a busy day in a busy city or some place quiet to eat take out from the Shake Shack close by. An added benefit to 414Hotel is the interesting and nice patrons the hotel attracts.

we recently spent three nights at the 414 hotel in midtown Manhattan. it was a delightful experience. The staff went out of their way to welcome us and get to know us personally. Anything we could have possibly wanted was supplied - car services, information, great places to eat, etc. The room was large, very clean, and comfortable. It is located on 46th st, between 9th and 10th ave, so it is in a good location, yet it is a quiet street - no blaring car horns or ambulances to disturb our sleep. Breakfast each morning is a delight - lots of good foods and a common table to eat with other guests, who were all friendly. there were many international guests, perhaps this felt more like a European hotel than an American one. in the evening, they have a wine and cheese happy hour - again, good wines and wonderful cheeses and a chance to mingle with other guests. There is no elevator, which we knew, but it did not present a problem for us. In fact, I liked having to walk up 3 flights to our room - my Fitbit recorded each flight of stairs ! Thank you Susan, Emma and the rest of the wonderful staff for a lovely stay in NYC.

414 was a great place to stay in our first visit to NYC. The location is perfect for exploring midtown and the the theatre district and a quick subway ride to downtown. Susan and her staff are so accommodating and helpful . That made you feel like one of the family. The hotel is very comfortable and is a bargain price wise when compare to others in the area. We will be back!

Hotel is beyond welcoming with the amazing hospitality of the staff. The head of staff Susan went out of her way to help us with whatever we wanted and so did the rest of the staff. Everywhere is clean, rooms are very welcoming and comfortable! This hotel is a jem in the heart of NYC. The hotel definitely made our one year wedding anniversary trip to NYC a wonderful experience! :) We will definitely visit again if we go back to the states. Thank you all for everything!

414Hotel gave us very good home base for a full week in the city, location is perfect but above all is the service and concern of all the staff… they are all very well leaded by management to be with very high service oriented attitude… the after noon happy hour is very generous. the room was comfortable and clean... few improvements were reported to the hotel team and they promised to take care.

My daughter and I stayed at 414 for a week in March. Susan, Emmy, Jaqui and the entir staff was wonderful. The happy hour hosted nightly was an amazing opportunity to get to know people from around the world.

What a lovely, friendly hotel. Nothing is too much for any member of staff, who are always happy to help, advise or even just chat (great recommended hat shop, Ike). Nice, clean rooms and a lovely touch of wine, cheese and spirits. Great location also.

We recently spent four nights at 414 Hotel. It's a charming place in a fantastic location. We loved the daily breakfast and happy hour...delightful perk! The very best part of this hotel is its staff...amazingly friendly and helpful. We hugged when we said goodbye! I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Truly enhanced our trip to New York City.

Amazing time in New York especially going back to stay at the 414, our go to hotel. Susan and Andrew are the best and it feels like going home. Thank you 414 for another great stay. Michele and Madison

Stayed at the Hotel 414 for spring break. Excellent choice all around. Close to broadway shows. Great places to eat. Nice residential street, homey atmosphere. Staff is over the top helpful and friendly. Rooms with comfortable beds. We had room that faced street, very quiet. Breakfast and evening reception were wonderful! We could have not picked a better hotel!!

All the reviews say everything I wanted to. This is not a 'chain' hotel, it is a guest house or B&B style place, with its own quirks and great staff. The facilities are good, decent sized rooms, I thought large in my opinion. $1 for anything from the mini-bar, which is unbelievable. But more than anything the staff will literally do anything for you. From having marmite for us Brits, to vegemite for the Aussies, you can tell it's all about the detail. When we arrived without my daughters case, a toothbrush was given to her straight away. When a button came loose on a coat, a sewing kit with a kind little note was on our doorstep. We were celebrating loads of family birthdays/wedding anniversary and this was a holiday of a lifetime for us and a bottle of prosecco was in our fridge on arrival. In the end we shared this one evening at the wine and cheese hour, as it was the day the hotel got to #1 here on trip advisor and instead of just wine, bubbles were provided in celebration. Just a note re noise, we were in the front building on the first floor and kept our window open, yes the bin men woke us up, but what do you expect in a city? The air con units were a tad noisy, but this is an old building and it's not easy to retrofit the most modern systems. Susan and her team were amazing and we are sad to be back home. Can't wait to go back.

There are not enough superlatives to attach to this hotel, however as a start, outstanding location, perfect ambiance and exceptional service are but a few.The hotel is independent and overseen by Susan who has forged a family atmosphere between staff and guests. Breakfast is communal and a time to share plans, learn from other guests and add additional locally recommend items to the itinerary. The breakfast selection is good, the coffee outstanding.Location is perfect, two blocks from Time Square (over rated and full of fast food joints), one block from the subway and close to all theatres.Rooms are comfortable, well furnished and have additional, thoughtful touches including USB ports to charge phones and tablets.Having gushed about everything so far, my personal favourite is happy hour where the hotel offer cheese, biscuits and wine each evening free of charge.Do not be tempted to book into one of the many New York soulless, corporate monstrosities, plump instead for an oasis of tranquility amongst the hustle and bustle of a city that never sleeps.I look forward to returning again soon

Very nice small hotel. The staff were fantastic and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. Pros - wifi was very handyThey supplied bikes for ridingStaff were outstandingBreakfast was simple but delicious. Close to times square Afternoon happy hour was a great time to get some drinks and meet people.Room was clean and from what ive heard a very reasonable size for ny.Cons - no lift but that is clear when booking.Sometimes the street noise was a little loud but expected for the room we got and being new york

We recently spent -4- nights at the 414 Hotel and were extremely pleased. The hospitality (this is New York City?) far exceeded our expectations. The room, while certainly not large, was exceptionally clean and met our needs. The hotel does not have an elevator so be prepared to climb a few stairs with your luggage - staff is readily available to lend a helping hand. The lack of an elevator was not a problem. Susan and her exceptional staff will do EVERYTHING to accommodate your individual needs. As many others have correctly pointed out, the 'crown jewel' of the hotel is the outstanding service provided by the staff. They are to a person excellent in every way! Kudos all around for providing such a welcoming, comforting environment.The hotel provides a free continental breakfast each morning - the coffee is exceptional! They also provide an early evening 'happy hour' with wine & cheese and other spirits if the mood strikes. The hotel is located in the Hell's Kitchen area of NYC and is in easy walking distance to Times Square (but far enough away not to be bothered by the crowds!), the theatre district, and several excellent restaurants. I suggest you try Amy's Bakery on 9th Avenue...In conclusion, we now consider the 414 Hotel a 'home away from home' and will certainly book the next time we are in the city. Do yourself a favor, give this hotel a try - you won't be sorry!

The folks at 414 were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is provided and they have a happy hour, much like at a B&B. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and have all the amenities I would expect from a much more expensive hotel. Not a flashy or trendy spot, but it's hard to beat great service, comfort, cleanliness, and value in Manhattan.

We had a great week visiting New York, and 414 hotel certainly contributed to it. Good location, tranquile but close to everything.A nice, clean, comfortable and reasonably sized room and most importantly, a great atmosphere in the hotel. Staff is fantastic, friendly and helpful. They made us feel as friends, rather than customers.The wine and cheese happy hour, simply great to relax and chat after a hard tourist day, before going out again at night.

My company normally books me into the large hotel chains, but they were all booked during a recent trip to NYC. I found the 414 online and gave it a try. I was warmly welcomed and had a very comfortable room. The happy hour was a nice touch, and the breakfast the next day was a welcome treat. On top of that, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The only downside was that I was on the 4th floor of a 4-floor walk-up. There is no elevator, so I got my exercise.

My stay at 414 was memorable and a great one. Thank you to all the staff at 414! I was a solo traveller and was celebrating my 30th Birthday whilst in New York. The staff at 414 had a little gift ready for me on the morning of my Birthday which really made me feel at home! I absolutely loved the wine and cheese every afternoon which gave me the opportunity to meet other guests and feel social. The breakfast in the morning was also great, got my bagel fix, they even had vegemite for the Aussie Traveller! The hotel is close to Times Square and the Subway, located in Hells Kitchen so great restaurants and atmosphere. The staff are there for any questions or local tips! I would just note it is 4 flights up to the top floor no lift/elevator so if that is a problem I would suggest staying on the lower floors, otherwise it is no problem, good for the health! Thank you to all the staff at 414 for making my stay a great one! If I ever find myself in NYC you can be sure you will see my face again!

We had a wonderful stay at the 414 Hotel. The location is excellent, only a few minutes from Times Square but when you turn around the corner of the street it seems so peaceful and quiet. Susan and her staff made us feel at home from the moment we walked in. The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable, good use of space, very comfy beds and free wifi everywhere. What really makes the 414 stand out is the family feel, the breakfast and happy hour where all the guests meet up and exchange experiences and not to mention the great advice from the staff. We were looking forward every morning to the daily newsletter with tips and info, and recommendations from the staff. It really was home away from home, we can't wait to go back!

Our stay at the 414 Hotel was wonderful as always. The staff are always so great and helpful with whatever you need and, being there for years, know you when you come back. The breakfast is great (especially with the addition of the fancy coffee machine making espresso, cappuccino, macchiato, etc. at the push of a button), bagels, muffins, toast, juice, hard-boiled eggs - who could want anything more included in the price of a room? Also between 5:30 and 7:00 p.m. there is a happy hour with drinks, wine, lots of different cheeses, crackers, etc. This is our place to stay when in New York.

This is a great affordable and unique option for New York City! My family stayed for a fun getaway and wanted to be near Time Square. This hotel is just a 10 minute walk and is in a nice, quiet and safe neighborhood. The vibe is great - more like a bed and breakfast. We took advantage of a nice (and free!) happy hour social in the evening where we got to meet and share a drink with travelers from all over the world. Breakfast was also included and really great. The rooms are not huge but ours was super clean and perfect for the three of us. Parking a little challenging but a pretty cheap (by NYC standards) lot just around the corner. The staff very friendly and accommodating, recommending great options for eats in the neighborhood and offering to make reservations. We will definitely be back to the 414 on our next visit, which I hope is soon.

My daughter and I spent a week at the 414 for spring break. The location is fantastic. A couple of blocks from Times Square, many theaters (Hamilton is right down the street!), and several subway stations. It's very easy to get anywhere you need. There are tons of restaurants on every surrounding street and the staff has a sheet of recommendations too.We had a room at the front and I did hear street noise on occasion but it wasn't a problem. Room was pleasantly sized and the bathroom was very large. Both were spotless. There was a selection of snacks and drinks in the room and unbelievably, everything is only $1. I can't even get large bottles of water at home for that price. Free wifi worked great.Susan and her staff are what make this place special. Every day, leaving and returning, we were greeted by name and asked about our plans and whether we needed anything. It really was a home away from home for us. They offer a continental breakfast in the morning as well as wine and cheese each evening. In addition, coffee and tea are available all day, which proved to be a welcome relief when I fell ill with the flu. We will absolutely stay here again.

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were made to feel very welcome in this boutique hotel. The room was a good size and very clean with a large comfortable bed, couldn't ask for more.Happy Hour is great, not just because of the free drink and snacks but it's a great way to meet the other guests and chat to the staff who are always happy to suggest tips for things to do and how to get there.Breakfast is simple but convenient and sociable, there's enough choice to fill you up and set you on your way.The location is ideal not being too far from Times Square or some great "off the beaten track" places to go.What really makes this hotel is the friendly helpful staff.Would definitely stay again.

I had walked past 414 Hotel several months ago while walking the City near my daughter's apartment. I stowed away the address to research for my next visit. In making the reservation the staff was enormously helpful, but the real pleasure was when my friend and I arrived and stayed for the next several days. Susan and her staff were helpful beyond words in seeing not only to our needs within the walls of her building, but helping with transportation, directions and ideas for cultural events. I have found my home away from home for every future trip to see my "millennial" daughter chasing her dreams in NYC until they bring her back to Georgia...and even after. Thanks 414!

Friendly friendly helpful staff, nice sized rooms and organized clean bathroom. Breakfast awesome! It truly is an oasis in the midst of busy NYC. The hotel is perfectly situated in the theater district area and adjacent to many great restaurants.

My daughter and I just returned from a week long stay in NYC at the charming 414 Hotel. We could not have been more pleased with this lovely and welcoming boutique hotel. My daughter is a budding performer so our trip was planned around some college prep activities we had lined up and lots of theatre. The hotel is perfectly situated in the theatre district area and adjacent to many great restaurants. Our room was clean and bright with plenty of space and a refrigerator and basket always stocked with drinks and snacks. The staff was friendly, helpful and always attentive and interested in finding ways to make our stay enjoyable. We had planned a very busy itinerary and were on the go much of the time, but it was always so wonderful to return to the welcome and warmth of our hotel. It truly is an oasis in the midst of busy NYC and as we will likely be returning regularly in the coming years I am very happy to know we now have a home away from home at the 414 Hotel. We can't wait for our next visit!

Friendly friendly helpful staff, nice sized rooms (for NYC). Right in the middle of all the action, restaurants and theater district. Would definitely return. Our room on the fourth floor, no elevator but the staff helped carry our bags. Breakfast awesome.

On a family vacation for a few days, we arrived at midnight to find a warm welcome and efficient check in process. Our two rooms were in the rear building, so very quiet. The rooms are a good size, spotlessly clean, with large flat screen TVs, safety deposit box and the most comfortable beds and pillows. Free and good wifi. Bathrooms are surprisingly roomy. The first morning, we were happy to find the breakfast room buzzing with people from all over the world. The breakfast is included and offers pastries, bagels, cereals, boiled eggs, toast, juice, coffee, etc - all you need to fuel up for a day in New York. From 5.30-7.00pm there's then "happy hour" with free drinks and cheeses and another opportunity to meet up with fellow guests, who were always interesting to talk with.The location is great - ten minutes from Times Square and right in the theatre district. Five minutes walk from the downtown/uptown subway. Restaurants everywhere of every type and budget. The block isn't too noisy either.The real gem here is the people. The owner, who is fantastic, has clearly chosen staff who are professional, friendly, customer-oriented and interested in people and who bend over backwards to help make your stay pleasurable. They really make you feel welcome and at home. If you're looking for a generic chain hotel, or need an elevator, this isn't for you. But if you're looking for a real boutique hotel, in a great, safe location where you feel like the hosts treat you like a real guest, you'll love it. Wouldn't hesitate to go back....and I'm fussy!

Room was nice size ... clean and with comfortable bed. Staff are welcoming and really cared that we enjoy our visit. The 414 is within easy walking distance of the theatre district. Highly recommend if you want a quality visit to midtown New York.

We had a great time in NYC and actually a big part of that was this very enjoyable hotel. A great location and this place has a “homey” atmosphere that is quite rare in NYC, a gem! Esp. the small scale operation, the breakfast, happy hour and living room atmosphere where people can meet is great. So a great time in NYC. They made us feel very welcome. We will be back!

414 Hotel is a small hotel in a (relatively) quiet area of mid-town Manhattan. The location is close to theaters and restaurants. Hotel staff members are outstanding and made us feel welcome from the minute we walked in. Our room was simple and comfortable. We loved the breakfast and the evening wine and cheese. The only possible downside is the lack of an elevator - but the hotel makes this clear in its information when booking. We would definitely stay here for future visits to NYC.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at 414 Hotel. The location is excellent with Broadway, Hell's Kitchen, Subway stops, etc. in close proximity to the hotel. The staff honestly could not be more welcoming and helpful. My wife and I would highly recommend this to anyone look to visit NYC.

My whole family and I stayed here for 5 nights in March 2016. For my husband and I this was the third time we were in NewYork and the third time we stayed at cute 414 hotel. The hotel staff is so loving, they are now to be considered as our family members :-)Nice rooms. We have now stayed in three different rooms, two facing the courtyard, and one facing the street. We slept well in all three.Hotel 414 has an excellent location, very close to the restaurants, to highlane park, and to Times square.Complimentary breakfast is good, and the new coffee machine makes very good cappuccino. We also enjoyed free wine and cheese in the afternoons.Every morning we received the hotel newsletter outside our hotel room with today's weather forecast, tips on what to do today, and a summary of the guests nationalities. We loved it!Hotel 414 is a cute little hotel with 22 rooms in a typical newYork building. It has some steep stairs and no elevator, but it is so worth it!

Stay at the 414 hotel was excellent from start to finish. The hotel is in a quiet area within walking distance to time square. Complimentary breakfast to start the day and happy hour with cheese and wine to relax before going out for the eve. Extremely helpful staff who are always available for any queries. There is free fast wifi which is always a plus. Keep up the great work! from Paul and Analise in Malta

This hotel is amazing! From the welcome where we were welcome like family, through the free wine and cheese every evening between 5-7pm, all the way to how the team at the hotel is looking for every way to help you.Everything at the hotel was perfect:1) Warm, welcoming hotel team2) Large, Quiet Hotel Room3) Good free wi-fi4) Complimentary Breakfast5) Free wine and cheeses every evening between 5-7pm6) Excellent location close to Times Square7) Every day the hotel puts out a bulletin with useful information with what to see and doLoved the team and the hotel itself!

Room was spacious. Immaculately clean. All staff amazing helpful and friendly. This hotel made our holiday. Enjoyed the breakfasts and cheese and wine happy hour. Both complimentary . Loved it . All staff went the extra mile to ensure you got the best out of your stay.we arrived late no problem. Helped with return transfer to the airport. We met other guests and it was nice to chat at breakfast or the happy hour about all our experiences. We noticed repeat guests from all over the world. This has to be a good sign. Definately prefer this experience to the faceless big hotels that are on offer.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights last week for a spring city break. In a word, it was wonderful, again. See my posts in April and September 2014. The locale is great, just three blocks from Times Square and one block from Restaurant row, but on a quiet residential street. But what makes this place special is the treatment you receive from the owner and the staff. Susan, Mary, Jackie and Emmy treat you like long-lost relatives, and provide you with many helpful tips to make your stay more enjoyable. I would recommend the 414 to anyone who has business or vacation and wants to stay in Mid-town/Hell's Kitchen. Try the continental breakfast and do not miss the happy hour. Hope to be back soon. Cheers.

Mary was a sweetheart and the place is clean, good price, and great location. Full bathroom with bath tub. Walking distance to time square. The picture was after I messed up the bed. Nice complimentary happy hour and breakfast. Thank you!! I enjoyed my stay and felt very safe. Thanks Mary!!

We just concluded a wonderful stay at this very special place. It was not surprising that many of the folks we met during our visit were return guests. When we arrived, Drew greeted us with open arms and immediately made us feel at home. When we departed this morning, Susan (the owner/manager) made certain that all of our needs had been met during our time there. Honestly, I do not have enough superlatives to express how much we enjoyed ourselves and appreciated the hospitality of the 414 Hotel. It is important to recognize this is a boutique hotel experience, not high luxury (or high expense) accommodations. However, having previously stayed at many NYC luxury properties, I will always now prefer to stay at the 414 Hotel. From the continental breakfast to start the day, to the lovely complimentary drinks in the evenings, to the convenient location and discounted parking for guests, it is an amazing value. If you want the quintessential NYC experience, the 414 Hotel is the perfect place to stay.

I enjoyed ever single aspect of my two night stay with the 414 Hotel team. I travel often and usually use airbnb or enjoy upscale B&Bs. 414 Hotel has the charm of a B&B with the privacy of a hotel. The staff from morning to night was gracious and thoughtful. Breakfast was filling and not your normal "continental breakfast" with gourmet espresso. Evening cocktail hour had special cheeses and wine, divine.I felt comfortable working on my laptop from the lobby. There were guest from all over the world coming in and out; each was more pleasant than the last. The room was spacious, clean and comfy. They offer a mini fridge with reasonable priced items, bonus! I will never stay anywhere else when I visit NYC. Thank you 414 Hotel team for offering me a safe, comfy place to work and rejuvenate.

Just back from a weekend stay at the 414 Hotel and it's a challenge to say anything different from the many excellent reviews.Susan and her staff make you feel like old friends. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and comfortable. They provide great tips on area restaurants and activities. The hotel is located on a quiet, residential section of 46th Street yet is only a couple of blocks from the Times Square area.Every morning you partake of a free continental breakfast and every afternoon a free cocktail reception. Not sure if the words "free" and "NYC" have ever been used in the same sentence but they have now!Our bottom line: It was great and we will never stay anywhere else in Manhattan.

My sister & I stayed here whilst on a four night visit to New York. We took the NYC Airporter from JFK airport to the Port Authority Bus Terminal and the hotel is a short 10 min walk north. The hotel is in a perfect location to tour all the sights either on foot or by subway. It is a short walk from restaurant row, where you can get pretty much any type of food. The hotel itself is very comfortable. The breakfast & evening cheese & wine is a great excuse to sit & chat with fellow travellers and the staff. The best quality of the hotel however is the staff. They are all engaging, helpful and welcoming. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a perfect home from home location to visit this amazing city.

The staff amazing and friendly. The location perfect! We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the 414. Whether you're a family, friends, partners this is a place to stay. If you need help on where to go or acquiring tickets to a show, it's a one stop shop.

This is our second stay at Hotel 414. We arrived a little before the actual check-in time, but our room was all ready for us. We were warmly greeted by Hotel 414 staff. They even remembered that we had a daughter who lived in New Jersey! Room was very comfortable, well stocked and quiet. Breakfast the next morning was great--they now have an expresso machine. We were only there for one night. We definitely be back doon.

This hotel is excellent ! Not your run of the mill chain hotel .... It's on a typical New York street in a brilliant midtown location. The staff are brilliant , very friendly and helpful. They made our stay so memorable. Breakfast was simple but very well done ! " Happy Hour " was again simple but so good ( especially the complimentary Bourbon !! ) Our room was a good size with a huge very comfortable bed !!! We stayed the weekend of the January snow storm which again made the break so memorable. We can't wait to return. Thank you so much for your hospitality!!

The staff was outstanding. Our room was comfortable, well appointed and quiet. This is not some faceless chain. Instead, a welcoming home away from home- great attention to details in personal customer service and a sense of place. The perfect time away for us is when you leave planning your return.

We enjoyed everything about our stay at the 414. Susan and her staff were so helpful and informative about the area and the city. Could not ask for a better experience, We are looking forward to going back.

This hotel did not disappoint following the reviews on here. If you are looking for a corporate chain hotel this is not for you!The unique selling point for this hotel is the staff and how they manage to very cleverly get all the guests chatting about their experiences. I suppose if I read this, I might think.......well I like to have a private time but you do and just get a few other peoples great ideas on where to eat and where to visit.I can not recommend highly enough. The breakie is great start to your day and the wine and cheese during rush hour is such a nice touch to keep you out the hustle bustle.The room is a good size for New York and the location is fab, everywhere is walking distance. Goes without saying clean and good amenities. Oh and I must mention the beds are very comfortable.Great value, great hotel, great people!Thank you

My husband and I recently spent 3 nights (Feb 8-10) at the 414 Hotel. We had read amazing reviews of this hotel in TripAdvisor so we were both excited about our stay and cautious too, wondering if all the good things written about the 414 Hotel could possibly be true. First, let’s get by the basics – (1) Cleanliness: The 414 Hotel is very clean--both the guestroom itself and the common areas where guests meet for breakfast or the wine and cheese get-together in the early evening (2) Comfortability: Our room at the 414 Hotel was a comfortable size. We slept well in the queen size bed and were very pleased with the large bathroom. Also, there were lots of drawer space in our room which is something we don’t usually find when we stay at hotels. (3) Security: As noted, this is a small boutique hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The entrance to the hotel is locked at all times. You can only get in when a hotel employee buzzes you in. Now for the fun part. The most distinguishing factor about the 414 Hotel is the friendliness, courtesy and kindness of the hotel staff and owner. They all go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. I told my husband a number of times during our stay that I felt as if were staying at a friend’s home which was a compliment about how very relaxed and welcomed we felt at the 414 Hotel. We would definitely stay again and have already told friends about it.

I staid at 414 hotel end of January and enjoyed the stay very much. 414 is a lovely boutique hotel near Broadway and Times Square, yet in a very quiet road. The staff is wonderful and is always ready to help and give advise. Breakfast time and cheese and wine taking place every evening are great.I would strongly recommend a stay anytime. ML

We had a wonderful stay at the 414 Hotel ! Located in Hell's Kitchen, 2 blocks from Time Square but in a quiet street. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Clean room with enough space. Nice happy hour. Excellent if you are looking for a small, friendly hotel. Not if you're searching for luxury .

This is the best hotel in NY if you don't like the corporate chain hotels.It's a cozy 4 story hotel in the middle of a narrow(not a lot of big trucks go by), tree lined street, facing a church with stain glass windows.Cleaners and Laundry are a few steps down the street. Walk to Restaurants and bars within 4 minutes in either direction.A 10 minute or less walk to Times Square and Theater District.Free wine and cheese at the end of the afternoon, coffee, espresso,tea in the lobby all day. Susan, the owner, is usually there every day.She is charming and full of good advice about things to do and places to go.

This little hotel is so budget friendly and in such a great spot. It is clean and homey. But the best part of it is the wonderful staff who are so knowledgeable about New York and what to do and the best way to do it. The afternoon 'happy hour' is a great treat to get to know the other travelers and check in with everyone. Our room was in the rear building across the courtyard. We slept soundly in a comfy king bed, probably because we spent so much of the day wandering around. We needed very little transportation as there is so much in the immediate area to enjoy, but it was easy to get an Uber whenever we wanted to venture further. We would definitely stay there again. I would say the people who run 414 go the extra mile and obviously enjoy their workplace!

Arrived for a week in NY and stayed in the 414 hotel, was wonderful! The staff, the service, atmosphere and the room. Breakfast in the hotel is very nice and full of excellent food, very esthetic. The staff in the hotel is helpful and recommends places to visit and where to go. Rooms are very nice and clean, Restrooms are perfect and roomy. And lastly, location location location

Me and my wife stayed there for 5 nights on the 2nd week in January. From the correspondence before we arrived till the cuddles when we left I have nothing but plaudits for the way this hotel do there business.The room we had had was clean spacious and a super comfortable super king size bed. In hindsight I think you need this bit of luxury to retreat to after long days of walking and sightseeing.Location is brilliant, quiet and only a short distance from bars, restaurants and shops. Times Square is a 3 minute walk and also port authority bus station is within 5 minutes away if you fancy a trip to jersey gardens outlet mall which I would highly recommend for great shopping.The staff are the best part of this hotel, for there knowledge of New York from shopping, tourist attractions, travel advice and tours. The hotel managed to get us ice hockey tickets last minute for 9 dollars each and what a night it was.New York is a magical city and this small hotel is just as magical, stay here and make your fairytale holiday complete.

We stayed at this hotel for one night early Feb 2016, and chose it for the favourable reviews, and reasonable price, with breakfast included. It is exactly as described by the management. The staff were friendly, pleasant, and helpful. I would not hesitate recommending, and would definitely stay at the 414 again.

So difficult to find a good, budget hotel in NY. This hotel offers great value for money. Old but clean and great service. 700 meters to Times square, in the Middle of resturant street in Hells kitchen. Sheets and towels 5 star. Basic breakfast but nice afternoon wein and cheese served. Staff friendly and helpful. Very pleased with our stay for 4 nights.

We spent 4 nights at the 414 hotel. It has always been a struggle to find a good hotel in New York, now we have a place we really want to go back to. All the rooms, the food the location, is really good, but what makes this hotel to stand out from all the others is Susan and the staff, you could not ask for more. All the suggestions what to do and where to go.

I've been many times in NYC but this was by far best experience ever.This warm family hotel has the best hosts I've ever met.They take care of every single detail and help you with anything you will need, tickets, information. They have discounts for almost everything and made our stay unforgettable.The staff is willing to help you.We will repeat for sure!Susan the owner took us for a walk to Central Park and it was a great experience that we will Not forget.You are wellcome to the daily happy hour with wines and cheeses arround the fireplace in the cosy lobby.I want to come back again!

This was our first trip to New York and Susan spent so much time with us to make we knew how to get around in the city. We felt like we were her only guests. The most amazing part was the entire staff was gone while we were there. Susan husband took the whole staff on a cruise. I initially thought this was going to suck because the regular staff was gone, but honestly had Susan not told us we have never known. We will definitely be returning for another stay.

Just stayed at 414 hotel for five nights. the quality of the rooms, décor, breakfast, communal area, etc are excellent but what makes this hotel stand out is the personal touch throughout. some examples:1) providing discounted bus tour tickets2) going out of the way to make a birthday special3) happy hour snacks and chatetc etcThe staff are really friendly, approachable and open and see you more than just a customer. The staff clearly enjoy working at the place.Couldn't recommend this hotel more. Its got character, style and a personality!

We're return guests and just love being here. Staff are warm and friendly and call you by name. There's a nice breakfast and wine/cheese in the evening. Great location...walking distance to Times Square and the theatre district, as well as Hudson River. Nothing fancy, but so sweet and quaint.

I cannot recommend the 414 Hotel enough! I've been to NYC many times, and this is absolutely the best hotel I've stayed at in the city. What makes the 414 Hotel so incredible is the people. We felt so welcomed by Drew at the front desk our first night, and then each day as we returned to the hotel. Susan, the owner, was so nice to talk to and also incredibly friendly. Chatting with other guests from around the world during breakfast and happy hour (HAPPY HOUR!) was so nice. The happy hour was such a cost-saving element for us because we had a glass of wine at the hotel, and didn't need to spend a fortune out on the town. My boyfriend and I are both in our late 20s, and fit right in with the mix of people of all ages from around the globe. The newsletter of events happening in the city each morning was so nice, as well as the list of neighborhood restaurants and recommendations from staff. The hotel staff helped to arrange a shuttle back the airport for us, and when I was feeling ill one morning they kindly offered to get anything I needed to help me feel better. Just like staying in the home of a friend. Seriously, just book this hotel. I won't stay anywhere else now!

My husband and I stay in no other hotel in NY than the 414. We come, on an average, of once a year and always look forward to a clean and comfortable room, quiet, and most wonderful and interesting guests and staff. The staff, from Susan (the owner, who comes almost every morning to spend the morning with her guests) to the desk staff to the cleaning staff are all a pleasure and want to please you as if you are guests in their own homes.

My favorite place to stay in NYC; caring, attentive staff who know how to make thr stay special; more like a warm family atmosphere. Daily complimentary happy hour and breakfast are a treat! Great rooms.

Second visit to this hotel, it sure beats the big hotels in the city. Great location, really shows what hospitality is all about. Nothing is too much trouble for the management, this is definitely the place to stay if you want to feel like you are someone special. Thanks to the team at 414. I'll be back!

We always do a lot of research before we go anywhere, and this hotel was in the top 10 hotels in New York! Can any small family run hotel be this good......well yes it can! There are always some things I look for, cleanliness....this hotel was spotless. Location.....2 minutes walk from Times Square. Value....again great value for New York. Room size....we didn't want a corporate box room, and we didn't get one, the from was huge with plenty of room. And finally it's how the place makes you feel.......with free happy hours, guests chatting at breakfast, free umbrella when it rains....or Daily weather and info sheets, the home made breads and pastries at breakfast, we couldn't have chosen better, and would recommend this wonderful little hotel to anyone. Thanks to all the staff especially Susan the owner, whose friendly face wished us a nice day everyday!

This City is Amazing !!! Even more so when you stay in fantastic hotel like 414 !!!! The location is central and allows easy travel anywhere in Manhattan....... even with 2 ft of snow !!!! There are really good and varied restaurants and bars within a 5 minute walk ( Pony Bar on 10th for amazing Craft Beer). The staff at 414 are absolutely wonderful and epitomise the friendliness of New York !! Nothing is too much trouble. The room in the rear building of the hotel was lovely with a really comfortable kingsize bed. We'll be returning here as soon as possible. Hopefully not when the snow is this deep !!! To everyone at 414 .. Thank you so much !

What a wonderful place to stay, I highly recommend this lovely friendly hotel with the personal touch. The owner Susan is very visible and a wealth of information on things to do in the city. She and her staff are charming, friendly and helpful. The included breakfast really sets you up for a busy day of activity and there is always tea and coffee available. It was my birthday during our stay and I was treated to a gift and bottle of bubbles with a hand written card, very generous and thoughtful! Our room overlooking the street was not as noisy as I was expecting thanks to the noise reduction glass and we slept very well in a comfortable bed. The Hell's Kitchen area is fun with lots of lovely places to eat and a short walk to the subway. I wasn't very well during our stay and Susan kindly extended our checkout on our last day. Nothing was too much trouble and we very much hope to return one day.

We loved it. Susan (the owner) and indeed all the staff go out of their way to make each guest feel like a family member. The décor is simple but very clean. The rooms and comfortable and spacious with everything you need on hand. The staff recommend restaurants and activities face to face and via a handy daily newsletter posted to your door. The breakfast is plentiful and relaxed. The "happy hour" of free whiskey, wines and cheeses in the evening is a lovely way to unwind and chat to guests and staff or just read the paper. We have stayed in other places in New York but would now only ever stay here. Its a real gem.

I have travelled all over the world and I can honestly say that hotel 414 was one of the best places I've stayed. Susan is incredible in what she offers - a stunning hotel, home comforts, great staff and all the extras of a great breakfast and evening drinks. She went out of her way to make my stay amazing and I am extremely thankful. All the staff I met were brilliant and like the multicultural mix of guests her staff is an eclectic mix of people who each offer their own personality and experiences. Towards the end of my stay the core members of the staff had been treated to a mini cruise as a thank you from Susan, which sums up how she values her staff and how they love their job. Combined with great location, lots of recommendations and endless help to make your stay the best it can be - I look forward to returning; hopefully in summer when it's not -7c!

I don't think we've ever stayed in the same hotel in NYC three times...until the 414! We returned last week from a 6-night stay, this time celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. When we arrived there was a bottle of Prosecco in our room's fridge, along with two champagne glasses and chocolates. What a way to start our visit! We were delighted to see staff members Jacquie, Drew, and Mary, whom we remembered from last year. It says a lot about owner/managers Susan and Andrew that they are able to retain excellent staff from year to year. New amenities this year included redecorated rooms (some bright, cheery colors), a comfy chair in the room, good for quiet time/reading (I believe the addition of the chair came about after my suggestion for such to Susan--how's that for responsive management!), and a fancy coffee machine (which makes excellent coffee, espresso, latte, cappuccino, etc.) available to guests at all times, not just at breakfast. One of this year's treats was that Susan is offering occasional walking tours (free to her guests) of Central Park. Susan is a native New Yorker and grew up with Central Park as her back yard. As many times as my husband and I have walked through Central Park, we got so many new insights and discoveries on Susan's tour. Thank you, Susan! On one chilly morning, we returned to the 414 after a walk, and I asked Jacquie whether they had hot chocolate. No problem she said...and proceeded to make us cups of steamy, foamy hot chocolate using the coffee machine milk steamer. Yum! (A couple days later, when we came back after a show, Jacquie asked if we'd like a hot chocolate. Good memory! Good service!). Oh, and then there's happy hour--wines, whiskeys, and snacks each evening, a great time to chat with other guests (on this visit, we met people from Australia, Viet Nam, Canada, as well as the US). The Hotel 414 is in a perfect location for anyone planning to see Broadway shows; it's just 3 blocks from the TKTS booth and nearby to all the midtown theaters. It's also less than a 30-minute walk to Lincoln Center, Central Park, Columbus Circle, etc. Of course, it's close to subway and bus lines that will take you anywhere in Manhattan. We are so happy to have found this wonderful hotel and its wonderful owners and staff. We're already planning our 4th visit!

We loved everything about the 414 Hotel; its staff, homey atmosphere and close proximity to Time Square made it a great place to stay. Everyone including the other guests were so nice. We loved the quaint atmosphere of the lobby and how breakfast and the happy hour brought people together to enjoy conversations about one another's adventures in NYC. Our room was clean,spacious and surprisingly quiet. The hotel is in a neighborhood with many excellent and varied restaurant choices which the staff can help with. The 414 Hotel will surely be on our list of places to stay when we return to the city. We thank Susan the manager for making our stay so comfortable.

I've visited New York many times in different districts, in large and smaller hotels so feel I can give a fair review.It's a lovely small hotel, in two Brownstone buildings connected by a courtyard garden which I imagine must be great in summer. There is no lift, true but the staff are more than willing to take bags up etc. I guess though if you have mobility problems, it may not be the place for you. Rooms are spotlessly clean and large for New York - we were in a superior room. Remember most New York rooms are on the small side though. Mini Bar with really cheap items is in the room and there is also a fridge plus a safe. Hairdryer is also provided and it's a good one ladies so no need to pack one.Downstairs near their front desk is where breakfast is served in the mornings. I didn't have any but it looked fine. It's continental in style so expect pastries etc. You can do toast and take your coffee out as well. My mum and sister had the breakfast and said it was all good. Has a lovely fire roaring away too and from 5:30pm ish, they do a great happy hour of wine, spirits, cheese and crackers. It's a lovely touch when you get back from a long day of pounding New Yorks streets. Well located a few Blocks from Times Square and there are restaurants and bars right on your doorstep if you don't want to venture too far. It's near Subways too but everything is so walkable. Lastly, Susan and her team at the hotel are really what make the difference between this and other hotels. They've thought of everything, make you feel like it's your place without being too intrusive and really couldn't be more helpful. They are faces in what can be quite a faceless city. Book here, you won't regret it. It's great value for everything you get.

This is my second stay and it was better than the last time which was also excellent. I would not consider staying anywhere else. Convenient home base for NYC exploration close to many subway lines and steps away from Time Square. Staff is extremely helpful. I will be back soon!

This hotel deserves these great reviews. The staff (Susan, Jackie and Drew and everyone else) are so attentive, friendly and helpful from the minute you enter the lobby and that lasts the whole time you are there. The location is excellent. You are close to times square, the theater district and many restaurants but it is away from the noise and the crowds. The price is also very good. We will recommend this hotel to all of our friends and definitely come back here when we return to New York.

The 414 definitely met our expectations! Exceptional staff, excellent location, and tasteful decor. We had a wonderful time at this boutique hotel just steps from the bustling city center. Our trip was centered around celebrating my husband's 40th birthday and the hotel staff was kind enough to surprise us with a bottle of champagne and a small gift left in the room for him. Such a lovely gesture. We typically only stay in smaller more personal hotels and this one will definitely be a repeat on our future travels to the city. There is a definite reason they are in the top ten on trip advisor! Don't miss out on the 414 experience!

414 is more than just a hotel! It's a place where you feel like you have just come home. The staff are like brothers & sisters & the hotel room like like your bedroom. It is so safe & warm! The rooms are quite homely and having a tv mounted on the wall is nice to be able to connect with the outside world, and the channel guide helps to navigate the tv when you're in a foreign country!

I visit New York 3 to 4 times a year. My son lives in Hell's Kitchen. My trips are fun trips-plays, shopping, fine cuiseine, current events sight seeing, new hair cuts and of course visiting my son who knows the city. I have stayed in approximately 50 hotels over the years...B &Bs and other accomodations including the more well known-Waldorf Astoria, Roosevelt, Hampton House, Marriott and other unique ones like the Leo House. This Christmas was my first stay at 414. My son's business,"Mud, Sweat and Tears" a pottery shop is a block from the hotel. He saw the sign, read a review and suggested I try it. I loved it. The staff was wonderful, accommodating, knowledgeable, and delightful. The other guests, some of whom I met at coffee in the morning and Happy Hour in the evening were interesting and pleasant. A number of them were from Europe, and one family was from Australia. The accomodations were comfortable, clean, and tastefully appointed. The location was ideal for the theatre, restaurants and Central Park. It was quiet at night The price point was great. Will definitely return. P.S. The morning news memo is good ifo., noting current events ...to see and do.

Susan, Drew and the gang made our stay in NYC fantastic!!! From the moment we arrived we felt like we were at home. They gave us restaurant recommendations, subway maps, and other info. The happy hours were great as well! We will definately be back.

If you want to be nearby the Theater District, Restaurant Row, subway, and the like - the 414 Hotel should be on your list of potential places to stay. But it's location is just part of why this is a terrific hotel. Rooms are a nice size, free wi-fi is provided, a light breakfast with a wide variety of choices is available....and the great service provided by the 414 team (day and night)There is no elevator, but staff assist with your luggage if needed. Just a few flights of stairs if you are on the the highest levelWe have visited NYC several times the past decade - the 414 is where we plan to stay for future visits.

This is my home away from home when I am in NY. It is pleasant, near everything, warm and I feel good being their. The continental breakfast is great and in the evenings they put out a wine & cheese platter.

My wife and I enjoyed a four night stay at 414 Hotel whilst on our honeymoon in November 2015. We had chosen to stay there partly because of its central location, and partly because of the many top reviews on Trip Advisor, and it proved to be an excellent choice.As many other reviews have already said, Susan, Andrew and the team are exceptionally hospitable, friendly and helpful hosts, and the welcome we received was second to none. Whilst 414 Hotel may not be the ideal choice for those seeking modern, five star facilities, for guests who value the personal touch in a small, traditional hotel, it is a great choice. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean and the breakfast choice was varied and perfect for our needs. Other touches, such as the evening ‘happy hour’ of complimentary cheese, wine and spirits, and the daily newsletters with tips for guests, were very welcome. When we were there, I also mentioned that it had been my wife’s birthday a few days before we arrived, and Susan very kindly presented her with a surprise birthday gift before we left – a lovely touch.There are plenty of restaurants and bars within a five minute stroll of the hotel, and Times Square is also little more than five minutes away. We walked to the southern end of Central Park in about twenty minutes from the hotel. We flew into Newark Airport and found the transfer into NYC by train fairly straightforward. It then took us about 25 minutes to walk to the hotel from Penn Station. However, for the return journey, we decided to book a car via the hotel reception to take us directly to the airport – the service was punctual and the driver polite.We wouldn’t hesitate to recommend 414 Hotel to others, and we hope to be able to return in the not too distant future. We had an excellent stay there.Steve

I cannot say enough good things about our experience at the 414 Hotel!If you're looking for the perfect New York-esque experience with a very personal touch, your search is over.Planning a trip to NYC for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, we began our search for a hotel in late spring 2015. After pouring over hundreds of property listings, we kept coming back to the 414 Hotel. From the moment we contacted the hotel to get additional details, we were treated as long-lost friends. Manager Susan Yates, and her delightful son Zach, answered every question we had and even some that we didn't know enough to ask! Impressed with the personal touch, we immediately made our reservation.We fell in love with the hotel as soon as we arrived. It was just as we'd imagined, but even better. Located just a couple of blocks from Times Square, restaurants, theaters, bars and shops were just steps away. We were close to the action, yet situated in a neighborhood-like setting. Our room was in the lower part of the courtyard area and was BIG and very, very quiet. We didn't hear a sound or any street noise whatsoever.Susan and her staff, especially Jackie and Drew, couldn't have been more attentive. They were available to provide directions, tour suggestions, show information and great conversation. No request was too much trouble.From the ample continental breakfast, including a nice spread and an espresso/cappuccino machine, to the warm and inviting Happy Hour reception with guests from around the world, everything was welcoming and relaxing.Simply put, I cannot recommend the 414 Hotel highly enough.

It’s very impressive how this nice small operation really gets the job done in a great way. Our room was spacious and very well maintained. There is no elevator, but the staff will gladly take your bags up and down if you want them to. Our room was on the top/4th floor, but we only had small bags to carry. The bed and pillows are very comfortable. All the people working there are very friendly, pleasant and helpful. Nice continental breakfast; and very nice to offer the wine and cheese happy hour. The location is tremendous; nice quiet spot, but very close to lots of action. There are tons of restaurants, bars and shops nearby. The subway is not too far away, Time Square is only two avenues across walk away. We took a quick subway ride to the lower Manhattan, East Village area. It’s a short walk to the Central Park, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center area. We also walked over to 5th Ave., Rockefeller Center and a lot more. To avoid the hassle of driving and traffic in Manhattan, we drove down the west side (Henry Hudson Pkwy, I believe). It was easy to get to the hotel, but it was clear that going any deeper into the city the traffic was heating up. We parked in the garage close by that was listed in the information we receive with our hotel confirmation. First they said the garage was full, but when I said we were staying at the 414, they were happy to park our car in the garage! The hotel stamped our parking slip so we got a discount on the parking cost. It was easy leaving the city by the west side, as well. Very impressive focus on customer satisfaction. Thank you 414 staff!

We were in town for a meeting and had to stay in the neighborhood as it was close to the meet venue. We found this gem on Trip Advisor and cannot say enough nice. If you like the Theatre District, this is great. Very intimate, friendly, clean..... sort of like family. If you need fancy upscale amenities such as bathrobes, room service, gift shop, this is not the place for you. There is a definite European feel and in fact half of their guests are travelers from outside the US. Susan (the proprietress) is a native and can guide and direct and does so graciously. Conveniently located a couple doors down is a laundry where we took our stuff and went home with clean clothes! We will return to this hotel, hopefully soon!!!
