First time in Americas and therefore New York. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay encapsulated by a fantastic hotel. The welcoming to the departure from 414 made you feel at home. Wow to go back to such a friendly family atmosphere who wanted to know all our adventures.

Thank you 414 Hotel for being the best part of our amazing trip to New York! My sister and I spent my 4 days at the 414 Hotel to celebrate my 40th birthday and I could not have been more impressed. The hotel was immaculate; the breakfast and happy hour were superb; and the staff exceptional. I cannot wait for my next trip! A special thank you to Susan and Drew who went over and above. We enjoyed every minute of our stay!

My sister and I stayed at the 414 Hotel for 10 days and think we probably chose the best small hotel in New York. The room was very comfortable and clean and quiet altho, being a light sleeper I used ear plugs , the location was central, close to many restaurants and very handy for walking back after a Broadway show. Susan and her colleagues couldn't have been more welcoming, friendly and helpful and encouraged all the guests to make themselves at home (tea and good coffee are available all day and also any muffins and croissants left from breakfast!). Any request was immediately attended to and every morning there was a concise Newsletter under the door with weather details and suggested activities for the day. Drinks and nibbles every evening in the lounge area were a wonderful way to relax and meet other guests for a chat and exchange of experiences. We would definitely stay there again if we're lucky enough to return to New York.Rose and Sue, Australia

My parents arrived on September 2015 to 414 Hotel.Our room was ready and the staff were happy to see us and helped us with the luggage. The room was clean, very big and comfortable on the first floor. Included a big TV screen, great bath and a comfortable bed.The location of the hotel is perfect, very close to the Time's square.The staff gave a daily information page with forecast and daily activities around the hotel.We really enjoyed staying in 414 hotel and we look forward to stay there again! Really recommended.

Great hotel and very friendly staff. Complimentary cheese, wine, whiskey in the evening - what more can you ask for? We had a great time and would stay again anytime at 414 Hotel! Susan and her team turned our trip into something special as they know the best places to go and the friendly atmosphere is special in a huge place like NYC!

I celebrated my 50th Birthday and decided to take my first trip to New York City and see the Christmas lights of the Big City. My adventure started with my friend finding the 414 Hotel by accident and it was the best accident I ever had, from the moment we arrived they could not do enough for us. We arrived at 10:40AM on a Thurs and couldn't check in but they were happy to hold our bags as we were asking about where to park (yes we drove into the city) Andrew explained that on Thursday that it is street cleaning day and everyone on the street must move there car so we may be able to get a spot on the street. Andrew offered to walk down to where we had doubled park down the street, so he walked down with my friend Jen while I waited at the hotel as I was waiting someone right in front of the hotel pulled out of there spot so Pop (hotel employee) went out with me to hold the spot while my friend moved the car into the spot, so here we are parked in front of the hotel waiting for the street cleaner to come down, Andrew also told us that we would need to stay in the car until 12:30pm or the police would have you towed, Andrew kept coming out to the car and checking on us if we wanted coffee or a snack and when the street cleaner came down the street Andrew came out and showed us what to do and how to move out into the street and back into our parking space, lets just say we experience the New York driving experience first hand but in the end we had a spot right in front of the hotel and Andrew saved us about $100.00 in parking fees so we could stay there until we checked out on Sunday. When we were able to get out of the car we went into the hotel and they had fire in the fireplace going and left over bagels from breakfast and offered us something to drink and snacks while they explained how things work in the city. Jackie who was at the front desk use to be a personnel shopper and she is a wealth for information about shopping and getting around the city, she had explained about the Big Bus (tour bus that takes you around) that was the best advised because we learned many things about the city that were would not have know walking around. If you do the Big Bus tour we did the 2 day tour and got a 3rd day free, it takes you on the downtown loop, uptown loop, night tour, boat tour all while you can get on and off at different stops (except the night tour they don't let you off because of the traffic). Jackie gave us a voucher for the Big Bus that saved us $20.00 on the tickets, she also gave us a gift card to Century City 21 (excellent shopping mall in financial district) every gift card has an amount but you don't know until you use it at the mall my was $5.00 but it could be up to $500.00. Andrew and Jackie told us about the restaurants near by as we were in Hells kitchen. We then decided to walk down to Time Square and get our feet wet with the City, when we got back they were having the wine, cheese, and bourdon something they do every night. We loved this about the hotel you sit around and share stories of your day get tips from other guests and meet a lot of great people, we meet people from Israel, California, North Carolina, West Virginia, Canada, Scotland, London and everyone was so friendly that you feel like you are at someones house party not the hotel lobby. Drew was another employee who works the night shift and he was so much fun to get to know and loves to meet new people and get there life story. We stayed for 3 days and had a great time, the next morning we meet Susan who I had heard was the owner of the hotel she was also great and I had to tell her how we had only been there one day and already felt at home, Susan told us she was giving a free walking tour of Central Park and we were welcome to join her and other hotel guests but we had other plans. Everyday at the hotel they would put on your door a newsletter about things happening in the city that day, what the temp. was and other fun facts from this newsletter we found out that on Fridays at the Museum Modern Art has free Fridays at 4pm to 8pm so again they saved us more money so in all they saved us about $150.00 in our different activities. You may notice on the hotel website that they don't have elevators in the hotel but don't let that keep you from this gem of a hotel because they have some rooms that only have a few small steps to go down and they helped us with bring our luggage upstairs. We never met the housekeepers so I am sorry to say I don't know there names but they were great and our rooms was always so clean and fresh. The hotel is immaculate and they have coffee, tea or hot coco all the time. There was a great coffee machine in the kitchen that makes Cappuccino, latte macchiato, or Espresso which was just what we needed when we got back in the afternoons. We ate at the Galaxy Dinner and the Bare Burger both about 1 to 2 blocks from the hotel every good meals, we ate at the Bare Burger twice because we liked it so much. Pros Everything Cons None in my experience. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, one more thing that I liked was that this hotel is close to everything but far enough away from the chaos of Time Square.

The location is ideal being walking distance to Javits Center, and just blocks away from the heart of Broadway and the Midtown shopping and restaurants. The friendliest owners and staff there to greet you whatever time of day. Easy in/out and very comfortable, quiet rooms, and while centered close to all the action, the quiet street is a nice respite. Meeting other guests at breakfast or over a glass of wine at the end of the day is as nice as it gets. I've stayed in many of the "fine" hotels in the city but 414 Hotel is my first choice. Been there more than once and will return!

If you are a bit tired of the chain hotel and want a friendly place to stay, then this is your hotel. We were there for 5 nights and will always return if and when we get back to NYC. In the heart of the theatre district, this hotel is within walking distance of much of central Manhattan yet totally quiet for a great night of sleep. In addition you are treated to happy hour every evening and a great breakfast in the morning. The intimate dining room is a nice advantage as it allows guests to gather and share stories and in the process make friends. The hotel staff is super friendly and helpful and they go out of their way to answer questions (such as how do I get to...) Their attitude expressed several times was to make yourself at home and they mean it. Everyone is familiar with the occasional grumpy desk clerk or other employee at a big hotel, but at 414 Hotel everyone who works there is smiling and happy to help in any way. The result is that they have created a family among themselves and they invite all guests to enter and be part of that family atmosphere for the duration of their stay. We have found our new home away from home when in New York.

It was amazing to be there for a week!We enjoyed a lot with their friendly way to deal with their guests. The managercof the hotel helped us a lot with all reservation in restaurants and all hints about the City and places to be visited! It was fantastic each detail added by her.I really hope to be there again.Congratulation for this amazing hotel and wonderful team that recepted us very well and friendly!

Staff is super friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Stairs can be a challenge but staff carried luggage making that part very easy. Other guests very nice also sharing breakfast in the morning was a treat!!! Close to restaurants, theater, shopping and Susan is great at offering suggested sights and travel routes.

This was honestly one of the greatest hotels I have ever stayed in. In summary:-rooms are large, clean, and comfortable bed. Not luxurious or fancy but I had no complaints-location was a massive bonus - 2.5 blocks from times square, 1.5 blocks from ACE subway, but also on a quiet and safe street. Some great restaurants on that street (Becco's...)-at breakfast, the staff came round and helped us plan our days to get so much more out of the trip-the late afternon/ evening happy hour (free wine, whisky, cheese) was not only amazing value, but gave the chance to chat with other guests and the staff - which was great for swapping ideas/ experiences as well-I genuinely felt everyone who worked there could not have been more lovely, helpful and just made us feel really welcome and valued-Susan gave us a really special experience when she took us around central park, it was a real treat and I feel so lucky!Yeah. Can't think of anything bad to say.

I must agree with all the wonderful reviews, this charming place is a gem! This was my husband's first trip to NYC and I so wanted him to have a wonderful time. As you know, traveling here for the first time can be a bit daunting. I needn't have worried a bit. Because of the caring staff at 414 Hotel, we both had a marvelous time. Susan's suggestions are always geared to the individual guests needs and interests. Drew, one of the night managers was so wonderful to us, he bent over backward to make sure we had everything we needed (wanted). I felt we came as strangers but left having made many new friends from all over the world. This is the only place I will ever stay in NYC!

Have just had four nights at 414 hotel and had a wonderful time there. Susan the owner and staff were amazing, so helpful and informative of the city. Any questions we had they were able to answer as it was our first time in New York. The room we stayed in was perfect and had everything we needed for a comfortable stay.The breakfasts were great and enjoying a glass of wine and cheese in the evening meeting up with other guests was an extra special touch.Thank you Susan and staff at 414 for a wonderful stay.
Location - 5 Quaint street but 5 min walk to the heart of the cityStaff - 5 Most friendliest and helpful staff I've experiencedComfort - 5 Felt like I was in someone's home w/breakfast & happy hour!

This small (22 rooms), boutique hotel is a true gem among the behemoth hotels around Times Square. I will say right off the bat, that I much prefer small hotels. Why? Because service is almost always far better. But most importantly, you meet people, you have conversations, and usually make new friends. The 414 is not the place for you if you prefer to remain anonymous, and only deal with the front desk. However, if you enjoy a great (and included) breakfast while conversing with travelers from England, France, Germany, or Australia, maybe this is your place. And if you enjoy a happy hour discussing the day's events with your new friends, then you'll love it. By the way, the happy hour is more than an hour, includes Bourbon, Irish Whiskey, wine and cheese. The owners, Susan and Andrew, will be your new friends. They could not be more accommodating. And the staff; wow! Every one of them - Mary, Will, Drew, Jacqui, are beyond accommodating. The entire staff really desire that you have a wonderful time while you are in New York. As if this isn't enough, they are located just a block down from "restaurant row" and only a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway theaters, and the Subway. Nevertheless, the block on which the hotel is located is quiet, almost residential in its feel. The rooms are simple, but more than adequate and large enough to move about. Unless Yoko invites us to stay with her at the Dakota, we won't stay anywhere else.

From the moment we set foot inside 414 hotel, nothing was too much trouble. Susan, Mary and the team were wonderful hosts and could not do enough to ensure that our stay here was anything but perfect. We used this as a base to explore the city and the location of this cosy hotel was perfect. The rooms are functional, comfortable and spacious enough to act as a lovely place to rest before using its great location to see most of Manhattan on foot. The breakfasts are simple and delicious, and act as a great way to get more local tips from the wonderful staff. The atmosphere from the guests and staff was simply superb and it was the way the staff treated us which made this hotel one i will certainly use again when next in NYC. Thank you for a lovely stay..

Excellent base for a trip To New York. Felt like staying in a home rather than a hotel such was the relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. Great early evening free wine,cheese and whisky happy hour gave us chance to mix with other guests and share our experiences of New York. Rooms were of a good size with great comfy beds and we could open the windows and still not get disturbed by noise. 414 Hotel is a great place to stay.

Susan and her team do a really great job of making you feel welcome. It feels like a country hotel but in the middle of the city. Really great location, just a short stroll from Times Square. Would likely be one of the best hotels we have stayed at. Great Breakfast and a happy hour in evening to mingle with the other guests. First time for us in New York but will be back and will definitely stay at this hotel again

We recently stayed twice at 414 Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the experience both times. Location is great , rooms are spotless and very comfortable. The breakfast area is very busy most mornings but this fits with the generally fast pace of New York!The best aspect of our stay was the outstanding friendliness of all the staff and their genuine efforts to help with any queries or suggestions for exploring New York. Every morning each room received an information sheet for the day and then over breakfast staff made time to individually check if any guest needed advice. Thankyou to Susan and her staff for a truly excellent experience!

My wife and I have stayed at the 414 for several extended vacations in the Big Apple, and each time we have been extremely satisfied with our experience here. Susan, along with Jacqui and the rest of her amazing staff, do an excellent job in making you feel at home as if you were staying with family and friends. The location makes it easy to walk anywhere in mid-town Manhattan and partake of the many theaters and restaurants in the area. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the water is hot, and the noise level is subdued, especially if you get a room in the back building totally off the street. They offer a range of breakfast goods starting around 7am and also a happy hour with wine and spirits around 5pm. Susan and her staff know the ins and outs of what's happening each day in NYC and are full of great suggestions and helpful hints on how to maximize your stay....there's even a daily one-sheet newsletter with that day's weather and events placed on your door each morning. If you are looking for a good mid-town place and haven't tried the 414 yet, you may want to re-consider your next booking and give this one a try.

We were charmed by the friendly atmosphere at 414. No luxury, except for the fantastic bed, but everything neat and tidy. The real treat is the gathering of guests and staff in the reception area, for breakfast, happy hour and generally at any time of the day. the staff members were without exception intelligent, helpful and friendly, and the guests fell into line with the friendly atmosphere. We will definitely stay there whenever we are in Manhattan.

If you want a large state of the art hotel with a spa, gym and rooftop bar - this is not the place for you! If you want a small (20 room) place with really helpful staff who will make the effort to get to know you personally, and which is set up to let you meet your fellow guests, then read on...This Hotel is right in the heart of mid town Manhattan, walking distance to Times Sq, Central Park, and lots of bars, restaurants, subway stops. We paid £2,000 for a 10 night stay. Our room had wifi, ironing board, safe, fridge, TV, lots of clothes storage space - also multiple USB chargers which were in constant use for phones, iPads etc. The cost included breakfast (tea, coffee, juice, cereal, fruit, croissants, bagels), hot drinks (tea and coffee available all day), and alcoholic drinks (there was a happy hour each evening with wines, spirits, cheese, biscuits - to encourage guests to socialise in the public area near reception before heading out for a meal) The team couldn't do enough to help the guests out. Normally one of the owners, Susan and Drew, were around each breakfast time and during the day to see what people were planning and to offer suggestions. They and the rest of the staff were always happy to book cars, reserve restaurant tables, provide directions etc We normally find we keep to ourselves a little on holidays, but on this trip we get to know several other guests with whom we shared tips on what we had done or planned to do, this made our stay feel like we were part of a community.A couple of things to watch out for. (1) no lifts in the hotel so if you have heavy bags they will have to go up and down stairs (2) I thought the bathroom needed a freshen up - including a more powerful shower. We certainly wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to friends, or to go back there ourselves if we return to NY for a holiday

414 is a great little hotel with a B&B feeling in a really great location in Manhattan. The owner is very nice and helpful. She went above and beyond to accommodate an early check-in. The room was very comfortable. The stairs are a bit tough if you have a lot of luggage but it's manageable. Overall a great night at 414.

414 Hotel is beyond outstanding. The location is great no matter where you want to go in NYC (walking distance to Times Square, steps away from the bus line, a few more steps from the subway). The staff were awesome and made the trip to NYC even better than expected. The staff always had great suggestions of where to eat and what to do. The rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was above what I expected and the happy hour in the evening was perfect for a rest between day activities and nightlife. The hotel provides a lovely space to meet others staying at the hotel which provides a great international experience (again not expected when I booked the room). The hotel stay was one of the highlights of my trip. 414 Hotel will always be my preference when staying in NYC...absolutely loved it!!!

The staff are knowledgeable and welcoming. The place gets all the important details right; including a daily newsletter that tells you which museums are open and closed and gives you the hourly weather. There's also a list of favourite restaurants with an explanation of what they like about them, a bucket full of umbrellas for a rainy day instead of one or two and a happy hour that is genuinely convivial. The location is terrific, the rooms and bathroom are big by New York standards.

414 Hotel is a small, bit worn, but very nice and quiet hotel with the most perfect location. If you would like to meet nice people to share you experiences with and very good service from the most competent staff, this is the place to stay! My daughter and I were here for six days, and Susan and the rest of the staff gave us the best advises what to see in the big city.

We stayed there the first week of november, and we had a lovely time. The owner, Susan helps you around and gives you tips. Also the breakfast was nice. Further I had a problem with my Samsonite and Susan really helped me out and took care of it so I didn't had to loose time. I really would come back to this hotel. Susan puts her hart and soul in her hotel and that's what makes the difference.

414 Hotel is amazing! The owner greets guests and is awesome: the staff is friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean and good size. It's only a few blocks from Times Square. A wonderful, magical place. It's the only place we stay when visiting the city.

This hotel is in a great location, near to theatre district but removed enough from the madness of Times Square, though only a 5 minute walk away. Room size is generous for New York. There is also a fridge in the room, which is useful. The real strength of this hotel though, is in it's people. From before we arrived we had great service, and we had a lovely welcome during happy hour. Happy hour is a great initiative, as it encourages you to chill out for an hour in this busy city, before heading out again after a busy day. Breakfast is nice, with enough choice. The staff are very welcoming and happy to answer any questions about getting the most out of the city. The daily newsletter is a nice touch too. I'd definitely recommend a stay at the 414.

We just got back from an awesome long weekend in NYC. The 414 Hotel made our stay so enjoyable and fun. We initially chose the 414 because it was close to our friends' apartment, but realized immediately that we had landed somewhere special. All the staff members are so friendly and welcoming, the rooms are spacious considering NYC norm, beds are comfy, happy hour and breakfast were perfect, the espresso machine was to die for, great location, and the hotel staff's attention to detail is superb. Don't miss out on this gem-- Highly recommend!

This hotel is a bit of a gem. Situated two blocks from Times Square and all the hustle and bustle that goes with it but the hotel is a haven of peace and quiet. It does not have some things like an elevator or a restaurant or a man outside with a uniform on but what it does have is a staff so friendly and helpful you will feel right at home. They are so knowledgeable about the area and they will tell you how to get about, events on in the city and restaurants to dine in. There is a complimentary continental breakfast in the mornings and a happy hour which can go on for up to two hours depending how you are getting on with your fellow guests. (The drinks are also complimentary) It is a more intimate hotel, more like a large family atmosphere but none the worse for that. The hotel has two parts, a front part and a rear part, my room was in the rear part and although it does not have a view as such it is so quiet you would not think you were in Midtown New York. A nice touch was the barrel of umbrellas by the front door to use if it rained. I picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and I was not disappointed. Try it!

We spent 3 nights at the 414 Hotel. Great location and friendly, informative and very helpful staff. Especially enjoyed meeting the other guests at breakfast and Happy Hour. Would definitely stay their again and recommend it to others.

The customer service was exceptional. Everyone was so helpful and provided lots of help and advice to help us make the most of our trip. The breakfast each morning was lovely with plenty of variety. After a day of sightseeing it was nice to be able to sit down and relax with a glass of wine, cheese and biscuits, courtesy of the hotel. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we had such an amazing time and it wouldn't have been the same staying anywhere else. We can't wait to come back!

I really enjoyed my stay at the 414, such a lovely friendly place. Like a home from home. The location is perfect a short walk from Times Square in Hells Kitchen. Right near all the Broadway theatres and so many restaurants of different types and prices. The hotel has coffee and teas on tap all the time  Breakfast is lovely continental with lots of choices. There is a cheese and drinks Happy Hour every day, very friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Susan , the manager, is a great host and went out of her way to show us round with a lovely tour of Central Park. She also gave us an insight into New York life.When I go back to New York I would not even think of going any where else. 414 every time!

The location is great for young energetic theatre goers and those who can abide the ridiculously steep and narrow stairs. Don't expect any assistance with luggage up and down them. A front facing room will, rather than offering "quaint, tree-lined views" as mentioned on the website, instead offer box seats to the loud and weed-smelling turkish bar next door as well as the church directly across the street, where sadly but noisily a long line of homeless will appear regularly seeking a meal. The street is their living room and their loud conversations are regularly present at all hours of the day and night, non-stop on weekends.. The street the hotel is on is raucous and tumultuous day and night, so insist on a courtyard room or bring earplugs. I never saw anyone to mention this to other than housekeeping until the morning of our third day at the property; when i did speak to the manager she was condescending and sent me a letter suggesting it was my error in not booking a quieter room and holding her responsible for "regular street noise". I guess she didn't realize i was born and raised here,return often and have stayed in numerous hotels throughout the city and locally, know when i'm being shined on, and found her arguments ridiculous. Anyone spending a single day here would be well aware of a noise level way beyond "regular", and the website suggestion of a calming, refined location is misleading at best. My firm and resolute insistence that I be given an adjustment on my bill was granted, but not without the manager leaving me a sharp note stating that I was "crass" in requesting same.There are numerous small boutique hotels nearby that are what they say they are and are better.

A small hotel that excellent managed with a very friendly staff. If you have the chance please take a room in the rear building - a unbelievable quit place for NYC. The happy hour is a good chance for a get to gather with other guests.

This little hotel is a delight to come home to after a day of tramping the exciting streets of Manhattan, doing the galleries, shopping in Fifth Avenue or enjoying the fresh air in Central Park. It's also perfect for setting out for the evening's entertainment, just a few blocks from Broadway and Times Square. The best part about the Hotel is the warmth and kindness as the staff mingle with the guests at breakfast time, find out the plans for the day and offer suggestions about transport, things to do and the easiest way to get around. This was invaluable to me on my first trip to NYC, in which I even found some of the procedures and routines quite different to the way things are done in Australia. The other lovely thing was Happy Hour at night, when Susie and her team got our a range of spirits and wines, along with high quality cheeses, fruits and crackers, and welcomed the guests home from their busy days on the town with welcome drinks and an ear for the stories of the day. Fantastic and something I have not encountered before. It also encouraged the guests to mingle and I found I had made some nice friends, even after a day or two. The hotel is clean, the beds are comfy and spotless and with my view over a little metal balcony and leafy trees in a quiet street, I could have been in an expensive area of Paris, not a few hundred metres from the razamataz of Times Sqaure. Thank you to Susie and her wonderful team and to my family, who treated me to this little Shangrila in the heart of NYC. I would always come back here and recommend it to anyone who would like a homely atmosphere and a clean and comfortable bed and bathroom but still be in the midst of all the excitement that NYC offers.

They knew us by our first names and made us feel so welcome throughout our stay. The breakfast and happy hours we're very enjoyable mingling with guests and the patrons of the hotel. They were very helpful and kind throughout. The location is second to none. Very convenient for us going to the theater. A lot of good restaurants close by. Yes it is older and small and no elevator but the kindness that they bestowed upon us made up for any shortcomings.

Susan, Andrew and their staff make you feel welcome, comfortable and cared for from the moment you arrive. The rooms are spacious for Manhattan and well equipped (just the carpet could do with a little refurbish). I especially enjoyed the complimentary cappuccino as well as the wine and cheese in the afternoon when I could relax and meet other guests. I will definitely return to 414.

very close to the theater district, yet, away from the noise of union square. very clean, great coffee and great tourist advise. Visitors from all over the world are staying there. there is a darling sitting room when one can chat with the other guests.

A charming small Hotel, a nice team managed by a superwoman: thoughtful, organized, devoted and worried in the well-being of her customers.A very good location in the center of NY.An excellent breakfast.Great experience. We'll certainly go back to NY and at the 414!

What a wonderful, friendly hotel in a great location. All the staff were so helpful without exception especially Mary, Drew and of course Susan. Lovely room with a comfortable bed. Would definitely stay here again.

This lovely little hotel in the heart of New York City has it all. The rooms are spacious, the breakfast is good, the free happy hour is very generous but above all the staff are friendly and reliable. Thank you Susan for your wonderful hospitality.

Hotel 414 was even better than I expected! The staff was overly friendly, breakfast was delicious and my room, which was situated just outside the inviting courtyard was spacious, comfortable and clean. I'll be staying here again!

An oasis in New York. The service is personal & helpful with unique ideas. Great location in a quiet neighborhood. Nice breakfast and refreshment. An excellent base for a visit to New York. Definitely a place to return to again. THANKS

Great stay, staff is incredible, they made our 30th wedding anniversary a wonderful experience. This was our 4th stay at 414 and each time it gets better. Great location where you meet new friends from around the world.Thank you Susan and Andrew

414 is probably the one hotel where you'll feel right at home from the moment u check in. The staff are wonderful, friendly and helpful. Spot on location, free wifi , breakfast and complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings.Susan is hands on and has a very dedicated team to see that all the guests are taken care well. Prior to arrival , we had concerns about noise from the adjoining street. However, this was unfounded as the management had double glazed the windows and the rooms were spacious, comfortable and quiet.Will highly recommend to first time New Yorkers and definetly stay again.

Fabulous location. Spoiled for choice of excellent restaurants within walking distance of hotel. Susan and staff very welcoming and warming. Nothing too much trouble. Good breakfast choice and very nice touch having cheese and wine each night. Would definitely recommend and hope to return at sometime in the future.

Great location, lots of restaurants nearby and only a few minutes walk to Times Square. Staff were friendly and very helpful and it's obviously very important to them and the owner Susan that you have a fantastic stay. Would definitely recommend!

From the moment we checked in we were made to feel welcome and the tempo never waned. Susan is so warm and helpful and leads her staff brilliantly along the same path. Her desire to make the 414 a home away from home permeates the whole place. We loved it and will certainly stay again..

The 414 Hotel is a gem. Do not go if you like big glitzy impersonal 5* hotels. Do go if you like friendly caring people. Rooms are perfect and the little building with its little street terrace and courtyard is wonderfully New York.

What an amazing experience being at 414 Hotel. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Susan and Aviv Bernstein were welcoming and helpful with places to visit, shows to see with coupons. Wonderful breakfast and terrific happy hour. We will be back for sure.

My wife and I stayed here to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. All the reviews about Susan and her great staff are true. Also the happy hour provides an easy, fun way to mix with other guests in a convivial atmosphere. We shared experiences from our day in the big city and got ideas for the future. 414 provides 5 star welcome and help in a small 3 star hotel with a homely bed and breakfast style. We loved it.

This was our first time staying at the 414 Hotel, but it will definitely not be our last. Susan and staff went above and beyond to make sure everyone felt like they were at home. The breakfast and evening happy hour were quite nice and the room was of good size for NYC standards. Can't say enough good things about this property and we are definitely looking forward to a return trip to the 414 Hotel.

The 414 is located just a few short blocks from Times Square. The hotel personnel are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The included continental breakfast is adequate and the wine and cheese in the afternoon is a nice touch. The only negative is no elevator. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Great experience in a really great location with friendly staff and warm reception in an unbeatable clean atmosphere I would highly recommend this facility for vacation or business the staff are great

This unique hotel offers a gorgeous, quaint setting in an excellent location in New York. The rooms are spotless, the beds extremely comfortable and lobby area very inviting. The staff are there 24 hours and are exceptionally helpful and friendly. To complete the experience is the continental breakfast in the lobby with excellent coffee to start the day. This is my new hotel of choice in NewYork City

This is a small hotel in an older building with modest rooms and a diminutive lobby but the experience of staying here was everything we'd hoped for. The staff are joyful and accommodating. Their friendly care combined with the spirit of quiet camaraderie with other guests and the neighborly local environment we felt a real sense of belonging during our visit. The mid town Manhattan location near the theater district is fantastic. Excellent value in an expensive area.

The hotel is easy to find and has the warmest, sincerest welcome of any hotel I've ever stayed in.It maybe needs a little upgrade, but nothing is dirty and nothing is broken. They work as a team and make you feel like family- nothing, and I mean, nothing, is too much trouble. The staff are by far the hotels very best assets, I cannot recommend this place enough.It's a short walk to subways but when you're in New York, you'll want to see New York! Walk-forget the subway.Lots to see and do, and staff will help you with maps and guides and tips for travellers. Also, another nice touch - they provide every guest with a daily news sheet, letting you know the temperature for the day and if there are any special events or cheap museum rates available- really helpful

We chose this hotel after reading many of the reviews. If you are a "Four Seasons" fan that enjoys all of the amenities they offer, then this is not the property for you. If you want to experience the warmest, most helpful staff you have ever experienced then go for it. Susan the owner and manager has hired exceptional staff that follow her lead for welcoming each and every guest to the hotel. All of the staff are great but special mention must go to Jacqui and Drew who are absolute stars. The accommodation is not deluxe, but perfectly comfortable and very clean. The location is excellent within walking distance of so many highlights. The continental breakfast and the hosted happy hour are very welcome bonuses. Should our travels take us back to New York, we would not consider staying anywhere else.

My 10 year old daughter and I stayed at the 414 Hotel recently for four nights as part of a celebration trip to New York City. The location is fantastic and though the 414 Hotel does not have room service or restaurant facilities, they are not required as there are so many wonderful choices within easy walking distance as 46th St seems to be the main restaurant area for midtown.The breakfast included each morning, was cosy and lovely, and a great way to chat to other travellers and share ideas about what to do next and the happy hour provided each day after a long day exploring New York was the icing on the cake.The staff at 414 were incredibly helpful and friendly and always offered a smile and plenty of helpful advice, this was important for us as travelling with a 10 year old to such a large metropolis, it was nice to know that our hotel was a sanctuary to return to after the busy days and nights spent exploring all that Manhattan, New York had to offer.Times Square is an easy 2 block walk away and this is the hub to exploring all other parts of New York. The main Broadway Theatres are also within easy walking distance and we thoroughly enjoyed our night out at the Lion King during our stay.We would highly recommend staying at this Hotel if you want a cosy, friendly, unique New York experience.

There are no words to describe the AMAZING experience my friend and I had in NYC-- all thanks to the 414 Hotel. It started when I looked on Trip Advisor for a hotel that had great reviews. Came across this one. It was still 4 months out from my trip, so I thought I'd wait a week to book. Long story short, it filled up quickly (I now know why!) and I was so bummed. Contacted Susan in the middle of the night via email and immediately received a response. She went out of her way to accommodate me in the event of a cancellation. Woohoo! I had a room!When we arrived, Drew was most kind and helpful! Very pleasant. We felt at home right away. My friend (who won't mind me saying she is very hard to please) could not stop talking about how great everyone was and the room was perfect! We had just experienced a not-so-good taxi ride from the airport, but the hotel staff was able to make us feel better instantly.There's so much I could say, but I will run out of space, so all I can do is just hope you consider them for your stay. I am a firm believer in rewarding hard work and that tips should not be mandatory but should reward exceptional service. I could never repay them, so this is my version of a tip... and if you've stayed here and enjoyed your stay, please consider doing the same! The staff went above and beyond and they deserve all of the recognition they can get! Loved the happy hour every night (wine, cheese, etc.), loved that they include breakfast, loved that they had a private patio, GREAT location to everything, very nice-sized room and most of all, great employees. Loved getting to know Mary & Drew and appreciated so much the food recommendations and super easy directions to take the subway. Without them I would have been lost. There's not a bad thing about this place! 5 stars and more if I could! - Brittany S.

A Super nice hotel1. Great location  - Just 2 blocks from time square - Located in Hell's kitchen, a lot of variable restaurants and pubs2. Very very kind and nice people including hostess3. Spacious room, Big bathroom(I bet the bathroom is one of the biggest among hotels in new york) 4. Quiet atmosphere. No car klaxon sound in late night.You must reserve as early as possible :) (22 bed rooms)(I heard from the hostess that we are the first korean staying 414 hotel. It's a great honor.)

I recently completed my second stay at this gem of a hotel and, as before, was delighted. Susan, the proprietor, and her terrific staff anticipate guests' needs, go the extra mile and are very knowledgeable about city attractions, transportation, etc. There is a very nice complimentary continental breakfast, as well as a daily wine and cheese hour, and one always meets interesting people. Theaters and numerous good restaurants are close by.. Kudos to the 414.

What caught my eye while searching for a hotel, was the pictures of this lovely & unassuming hotel. The street shots reminded me what I imagined a NYC neighborhood street to look like…just like I've seen in the movies. I opted for the airport pick-up service & that was wonderful…timely & a nice nighttime ride through snow covered streets. I was meeting up with a friend & it was a wonderful place for a first time visit to the city. All of the staff were friendly & helpful & always ready with directions or suggestions. Susan, the owner, was so personable & welcoming, which just added to the warmth of the place. My stay overlapped with winter storm juno & although there weren't any problems, the hotel had left instructions in case of any storm shenanigans. I wanted a room overlooking the street & the neighborhood view was perfect. The building itself is a beautiful red brick. The room was clean & tasteful. I loved the windows…they were the old-style paned push-up type, so they opened to get a bit of fresh air…plus a fire escape (!) which, for me, added to the ambience. (I would love to know the history of the building :) The location seemed to be pretty ideal. It was easy walking to restaurants & the subway. I love feeling like I'm in the midst of the place I'm visiting & it truly felt like I was in New York City. I would definitely stay here again. I already have, & will continue to, rave about this hotel.

We haven't found,in our worldwide travels, such a warmth and welcoming experience as this small boutique hotel exudes. The owners and staff greeted us like long lost friends; we even got to know fellow travelers as we sat around the breakfast table (provided, but make your own) or gathered for a glass of wine (provided) before leaving for the theater. And if theater-going is a mission of your trip, this is ideal--we walked back and forth to every Broadway show we attended. Another plus--knowledgeable staff abut what transportation--what bus to get you where.

What can I say? From my very first email to Susan, to the end of our wonderful stay, the service was first class. The hotel is located in a quiet area and well within walking distance to all major attractions. We stayed for 6 nights, and during that time we walked everywhere, and only used the subway twice (which is close by anyway). Our room was very clean and quiet. The included breakfast was plentiful with cereal, fruit, muffins, bagels, croissants, toast, boiled eggs, fruit juice, etc. (they even had Vegemite for us Aussies!). The staff were the some of the best I have ever encountered, and of course, that starts with Susan. She would greet us every morning with a smile, helping us to plan our day, and made some great suggestions. We have made a new friend in Susan, she truly is special. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone with no hesitation.

We stayed here 4 nights it was amazing. The staff have to be the friendliest in NY. Breakfast is simple but good and the information gained from staff at this time is really helpful. The room was comfortable and luckily on the ground flor as there are no lifts. If we come back this is where we will stay.

The service provided by Susan and all the staff at 414 Hotel was beyond amazing. We were made to feel like family from the moment we arrived. We were always greeted with friendly smiling faces asking how our day/night was and if we needed any help figuring out what to do or to see and how to get there. They were full of great ideas that made our trip even better.The room was small but comfortable for 2 women that brought too many clothes! It was nice and quiet as well being walking distance to Time Square. Within the first hour we had mounted police officers and their steeds walk past while drinking our welcome wine in the quaint, energy filled lobby with people from all walks of life. The food and daily wine and cheese happy hour was a treat!The only negative to the whole trip was having to get my overstuffed luggage (my own fault) up those stairs! In no way a poor reflection of 414 Hotel - they just smiled and helped us both up.

We traveled to the city to enjoy an early 50th birthday celebration for my husband. Mind you, I booked our room months in advance. Well, when we got to our room my husband was greeted with a handwritten card saying that the staff "would like to start with some bubbly and some sweets!" On the tray with the card were some Lindt chocolates, two champagne flutes with birthday napkins in them and we found the complimentary bottle of champagne in the little fridge in the room! Talk about personal customer service! I was blown away by this very thoughtful gesture as it had been some time since I mentioned in passing the trip's reason while booking over the phone! The room we stayed in was just off the courtyard between the two buildings that make up the hotel property and was just terrific! Plenty of room, nicely laid out, and the bed was quite comfortable. 414 Hotel serves a lovely breakfast with croissants, bagels, scones, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea and I am sure there's more I have forgotten to think of. There is also wine with cheese and crackers in the evening! This hotel was also the perfect location for us as it is within walking distance to Times Square and everything we were interested in. And of course, there are tons of restaurants to choose from. My husband and I could not find a single thing about 414 Hotel that we did not like! This little gem in the heart of Hell's Kitchen is an absolutely wonderful hotel! Every single person who works there is warm, welcoming, and personable. Thank you to all the staff, especially Jacqui and Mary at 414 Hotel for making our stay so enjoyable and memorable! We hope to see you again!

We ended our stay after 3 weeks travelling USA in the 414 hotel in New York.When we arrived it was early evening and happy hour was on! Every evening between 5.30-7pm ish happy hour where wine and spirits with cheese and crackers was complimentary to guests! Staff very helpful giving advice on where to eat etc! Hotel quirky and had a relaxed and family attitude to their guests. Room was cosy and very comfortable. A complimentary bottle of fizz with lovely card was left for us from hotel.The small kitchen was open and tea/coffee available when u want. Breakfast continental and again help yourself one.Location between 9th and 10th avenue. Great location walking distance to restaurants and Times Square and all theatre areas.My only thing is there is no lift we were on 4th floor and carting luggage up was tough. Staff did offer but if u have mobility problems ask for room on 1st or 2nd floor.Staff we met was Mary, drew, and strawberry! Thank you all for a memorable end to our road trip!! This hotel really worth trying out!

Stayed 3 nights at this hotel and had a wonderful experience. Rooms are lovely; wine and cheese in early evening; wonderful locations; and very engaging and helpful staff. You can walk to the theaters, lots of restaurants, shopping and easy access to public transportation.

Myself and my new Husband stayed here for five days to start our honeymoon on 26th August 2015.This was our first time in America. As soon as we arrived at Hotel 414 Susan and Strawberry greeted with such big smiles We arrived early but within no tike we got into our room.Hotel 414 is such a lovely place to stay, the hotel reminded me of a hidden gem.Susan and the rest of the staff are amazing, such kind hearted people who are willing to help you out in anyway. Our room was brilliant, clean and plently of space with a nice bathroom. A bottle of bubbly was waiting for us in our fridge and a gift was left in our room when we arrived which was so kind and thoughtful.We had breakfast every morning at the hotel which was great and we got to mingle with the other guests, also happy hour in the evening with the wine and cheese was fab. I have to say overall we had an excellent stay and we will be back to New York to stay in Hotel 414 hopefully next year.Thanks very much Susan and your staff for an amazing start to our honeymoon, we will never forget it.Roisin & Gavin Hart x

We stayed 4 nights and will definitely do so again. Superb location with a clean and comfortable room. Susan and her staff are genuinely friendly and knowledgable not to mention helpful and polite. They take the time to get to know their guests enough to make meaningful suggestions on where to go and what to do. Superior service at very reasonable rates! 本当にオススメですよ！

This is a very belated review of a wonderful hotel in New York City. We had tickets for a show one Saturday night in June and needed a place that was convenient to the theatre as we were running in from an event in Westchester and had to leave early the next morning. I found the 414 Hotel and we made a reservation. When I made the reservation, I also asked if they could recommend a restaurant near the theater, as it was Saturday night. Mary who took the reservation, sent us a list of nearby restaurants. One day later, Susan, the General Manager, contacted us noting that the play we were seeing was a little further away and asked what sort of cuisine we liked. She found us a lovely French restaurant, made the reservation, and confirmed it. It made our very short trip into NYC quite a treat. As others have noted, the hotel is in a great location especially if you have theatre tickets. We had a room off the patio which was slightly below grade, so quiet, and cool. The bed was very comfortable, and the breakfast was great. But truly what made this a very special hotel was the amazing personal service.

Just returned from 4 nights at this lovely boutique hotel. Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful every step of the way. We went for our 10th anniversary and they were kind enough to have a lovely bottle of sparkling in the fridge for us. Lots of opportunity to talk to other guests at breakfast and cocktail time late afternoon - added bonus.

My husband and I stayed at the 414 Hotel from Aug 20th-29th, 2015. From the start (when I was greeted by Drew with a hug and glass of wine) we were made to feel at home. Breakfast was very good, enough to fuel us for busy mornings on our feet in New York. The staff were all very friendly and eager to help us with any of our questions about the city, whether it be attractions, Subway directions, or restaurant or play recommendations. The hotel was extremely clean, and well situated, only a block away from Restaurant Row, where you can find food of any type you could imagine! Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the courtyard, it was very quiet, with good amenities and very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York, I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else!

Just spent 2 nights here. Room very nice, location very good. Owner and staff are very helpful and made stay very nice. Breakfast served, Wine and cheese in evening.We plan to stay longer on our next trip to NYC.

We loved 414 Hotel! It is perfectly situated a few blocks from the madness of Times Square and is not far from Metro stops and it's very walkable to Central Park, The Rockefella, Intrepid and many other major attractions. Despite being so close to the action, 414 is on a quiet street.We stayed in the building behind the reception, across from the lovely courtyard. It was a great, comfortable and clean room with large bathroom and was so quiet, you wouldn't know you were in the centre of NYC. The much needed A/C was a godsend during the hot summer.The staff are all amazingly helpful and can't do enough for you, from providing restaurant recommendations or suggestions of places to vist. Plus, If you need theatre tickets, have a chat with Susan and she'll help you out! There's actually a theatre directy opposite the hotel where we saw a great off-broadway show for a fraction of the price (thanks Susan!!). The (free!) breakfasts are a simple affair of tea/coffee/juice cereals, fresh muffins/bagels and pastries and the nightly wine/cheese hour (or 2!) is a delight and so generous!! I should've found out what kind of crackers they had, they were delicious...All in all a perfect stay and we wouldn't hesitiate to stay there again should we return to NYC.Thanks 414!!

very good situated, friendly, clean, good furnished. I would recommend this hotel for your stay in New York! The hotel team is very helpful and will give you interesting information and ideas for your visits.

Susan Yates, Jacquie, and Drew were the icing on the cake at this gem of a hotel. Centrally located with a continental feel. We were the only Americans staying there at the time and we enjoyed hearing of the adventures of our fellow out-of-town guests. Breakfast was yummy and substantial. Happy hour was a bonus and counted as dinner for us one night. Wanted to keep this as our little secret but couldn't be that selfish. I want them to be around for a long time.

The 414 Hotel ist perfectly located in Manhattan, quite (for NYC) and just 5 Walk from the Time Square. Basically you can reach everything which is in upper Manhattan by Walking (Time Square, Pier 79 for the Water Taxi, Central Park (15min), Rockefeller Center and Empire State (25min)) ... it's also possible to walk down the Broadway down to Downtown, takes a while but nice. The next Underground is located just 2 Blocks east and one block south of the hotel (so 6 - 8 min easy walk, also with luggage). The Hotel itself is excellent, small (in terms of # of guest, family feeling, pretty large rooms (for Manhattan). Breakfast is small but ok (cornflakes, bagels, cream cheese, sweet toppings etc... I guess it's the american way of breakfast ...) The staff is absolutely willing to help you with whatever request you have and supporting you wherever they can. Fazit: Absolut enjoyable and perfectly located.PS: be aware that there is no elevator to reach the "upper" (max 3.) floors

We stayed in the 414 Hotel from 2nd to the 8th August 2015 and our stay could not have been better. We were in New York for the first part of our honeymoon and upon arrival (feeling slightly worn out from a long journey) we were greeted with not only a lovely room on the top floor, but a bottle of sparkly, chocolates and a personal card congratulating us on our wedding. The whole theme of the hotel is personal. The staff are super friendly and keen to help you have the best time in New York. They offered recommendations for experiences and bars and restaurants all of which were fantastic, especially the roof top bar they advised us to visit with a view of the empire state. Susan (the manager) was fantastic and really made us feel at home. She also helped us with booking a restaurant and has even emailed us since our stay thanking us for our visit. Our room was spacious, with modern décor, a great sized bathroom and excellent air con. The room was serviced whenever we wanted it. Another bonus of this hotel was that a great brekkie was included. Coffee, tea, juices, water, bagels, bread, cakes, croissant, eggs etc. which was a tasty way to save money in the pricey city. Also the free cheese and drinks around 5pm was a brilliant thing to offer and gave us chance to mingle with staff and other guests. If you want your stay in New York to have a good location and a very personal feel then we would 100% recommend this hotel. Thank you to Susan and all the staff for making our honeymoon so special. Very best wishes Louisa and Marc Spreadbury

We stayed at the 414 hotel for 5 days in August for our honeymoon.The hotel was great, particularly Susan straight from booking. She emailed me promptly, communicated well and made us excited for our visit by telling us she couldn't wait to meet us. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is within walking distance to subway stations and tourist attractions such as Times Square and Top of the Rock. It is also close to a wide range of places to eat and shops. However the hotel is far enough away to feel like you can relax from the craziness of New York. The hotel is quiet and once inside the pretty garden feels like you aren’t in New York at all!The room was clean and simply decorated. It had everything you need. Very good air conditioning, a comfortable bed, toiletries. We also appreciated the New York guides left for guests. The room also had a mini fridge which contained cans of pop and water which could be used then added to the room bill at a reasonable price, not your usual mini bar. Our room was on the bottom floor and although we did hear people walking in the room above it wasn’t loud enough to stop us sleeping and you couldn’t hear any other noise. Facilities such as free Wi-Fi are also available. The thing that really sets this hotel apart from others is the staff. They are kind, helpful and would do anything for their guests. They take the time to get to know you and make you feel comfortable. A couple of examples are that Susan had left us a very lovely message in a card with a bottle of sparkling wine telling us to enjoy our honeymoon. On our first day in New York there was a lot of rain firstly we appreciated the hotel provided umbrellas and secondly the staff at the hotel were keen to help with organising sightseeing that could be done in the rain, they are very knowledgeable on the local area. Another member of staff who made us feel very welcome was Drew. He told us that the 414 hotel was ‘home’ and he really made us feel like it was. A nice surprise for us was the free breakfast, we didn’t realise this was available. The breakfast included teas, coffee and juices, pastries and breads, yogurt and cereal. All of a high quality. Although it didn’t affect us another guest asked for Gluten Free items for breakfast and this was provided. Between 5:30 and 7 wines, spirits and cheese are laid out for guests to enjoy. Most evenings we missed, or would have missed this as we were still out but Drew on a few evenings was kind enough to keep them out as he knew not all the guests had returned yet. I would highly recommend that anyone stay here. It was an amazing find and if we ever return to New York it will be our definite choice for a welcoming, friendly and high quality hotel.

We absolutely loved our stay at 414. Great room, great price amd wonderful amenities. There's a wine and cheese hour every evening and a really good breakfast every morning. The staff was one of the best parts. Susan and her crew are so kind and personable, greeting us, sharing tips and really connecting with us on a personal level. Clearly the owner strives to make this a very very pleasant place to stay. Will definitely be back here.

We have never put a review on trip advisor, good or bad. We have been intending to do so since our lovely experience staying at 414 in November 2014.It is particularly bad of us not to have done so earlier as it was through trip advisor and the comments regarding it that led us to 414 for our stay in New York. We stayed for a total of 12 days connected to the New York MarathonIt was the nicest part of our 5 week stay in America. As lovers of New York who had not been there for 14 years, we had many disappointments regarding the loss of individuality and the franchising of NY, but the warmth and generosity of Susan and her lovely staff compensated immensely. Linda and Vincent Beagley

Thus is my fourth stay at 414 Hotel. I am glad I found this gem. The staff is friendly. The happy hour wine and cheese is a great way to meet guests from all over the world, and compare notes on what to do in the city. The rooms have recently been refreshed, always clean and comfy. For a special treat ask if the courtyard suites are available. Today on checking in, there were flowers and a note from the owner.

This was an ideal location for our night in NYC. It was a spacious room in a big city walking distance of Times Square, Grand Central Station etc. The room was a decent size and the bed was super comfy. The only downside was that we were on the fourth floor and there was not a lift! Not ideal after a long flight and a very early start.We left before the main breakfast started but the hotel did put out some coffee and muffins for us which was a lovely touch. Overall a good location and a pleasant hotel.

As most of the reviews say, this is a very well-run small hotel. The staff quickly knows every visitor and will give you as much help as you want. Most of the guests this weekend seemed to be International travelers. The rooms are not glamorous, but they are larger than average (for NYC), clean, quiet and everything works. Breakfast, WiFI and cocktails in the evening are included, which is a big plus for me. If you get a room in the back, you can't hear a thing. It can be hard to get a reservation, due to excellent reviews and repeat customers, but it is worth it. We will be back.

Our stay was great. The hotel has an Excellent location and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We have stayed at the 414 twice now and rooms have always been clean and nicely decorated. the beds are very comfortable.

This hotel was recommended to us and we are thrilled with it. Although it may not be a new building it makes up for it with charm and the friendliness of all their staff. Located very centrally on W 46th St, it is close to the theatre district, Central Park, Times Square and some absolutely fabulous restaurants. Breakfast is provided and they have a happy hour from 5.30 to 7pm every night where you can help yourself to wine or spirits and crackers and cheese. The rooms are well appointed with a super comfortable bed. I would highly recommend this hotel to all.

We LOVE this hotel and the lovely people who run it! It feels more like a European B&B than a hotel in the theatre district of NYC. In the morning there are breakfast options and the evening there is a selection of wine and cheese. Lovely.

Thank you to the 414 Hotel staff for making us feel very welcome during our visit in NYC. We so appreciated your advice and tips each morning on how to make our visit more enjoyable as we explored the city. Looking forward to our next visit!

We loved staying in this little boutique hotel. The owners were extremely hospitable and helpful, rooms were clean, quiet, and well equipped. Location is superb- you are close to everything. Happy hour every day with wine and cheese and very nice breakfast. Hotel staff very helpful. Definitely will stay here again. Felt like home away from home.

Great location, comfy clean room, fabulous hosts! Breakfast was included and each evening they had a nice little wine and cheese which was a neat opportunity to meet other guests. Should mention that all Broadway shows were very close, about a 5 minute walk way.

What a wonderful hotel. So close to everything. Great neighbourhood, and you can park right on the street. Makes you feel like a NYC resident rather than a visitor/tourist. The staff is extremely friendly and all accommodating. Very comfortable rooms. Loved our stay here.

Have to recommend 414 hotel to everybody. Location is awesome, very close to time square yet a tree lined part of west 46th street. Sit out the front with a coffee and watch the world go by. Great quiet rooms, staff could be the best in the world. Breakfast and happy hour a great time to meet people from all over the world. Not often do you have a tear when you leave. Geoff & Sue

We stayed here while attending a show at the Javitts Center and spending a leisurely weekend in NYC. It was great for both. Close enough to walk to Javitts. Definitely one of the most reasonable options close by. Only a few blocks from the Theatre District and Times Square. Walked up to Central Park and even to Empire State Building. Subway stations are about three blocks away. The hotel itself is small. Service was very friendly and helpful. Each afternoon they feature a great happy hour with wine, cheese and snacks. There is not a lot of space for guests so we found ourselves back in our room as only place to sit. The hotel is spread between two buildings with a patio in between. Our room was in the front building by the kitchen and facing the patio. It makes for a fishbowl experience. Most guests don't know it is a room so they are loud as well. The room was small but bathroom had a good amount of space. It was not a problem and the rate was good. If you prefer more anonymity in a hotel, space and quiet then this is probably not a fit for you. If you want to meet the other people staying at the hotel and spend time lounging then this would be a great fit. I would definitely recommend asking for a room in the back building.

This hotel is quaint and right in the middle of everything. The happy hour involved several great cheeses and two different types of crackers, including one that was gluten free. Also had several different types of alcohol. The best part are the two benches in the front on the sidewalk which had some fantastic people watching. They have an average continental breakfast which you could enjoy in the cute courtyard. We had a room facing the front of the hotel and it did get a little noisy at times. The rooms are bare bones, but comfortable and clean. The front desk people were all very nice and helpful. It was a great place to stay for the price.

My daughter and I just returned from a 3 night stay in NYC. I spent hours looking online for a quiet hotel near Times Square and I found it. Everything about the 414 Hotel was wonderful. The staff are all extremely helpful and always cheerful, the location is ideal and the rooms/public areas comfortable. I am a very light sleeper and struggle to sleep at hotels because of noise. I communicated with Susan via email before our stay and let her know about my difficulties. Our room faced the courtyard and it was quieter than home! There is no elevator in the building, but staff helped with bags and I will gladly climb a few stairs for the warmth of the 414.

Fantastic hotel, a bit like a bed and breakfast, as this is a boutique hotel.Susan and her team knew our names and we received a fantastic welcome.Staff had relevant good information about the area and was very helpful.Did I mention friendly...The rooms were clean and comfortable.The breakfast was a great continental breakfast... even had Vegemite for the kiwis.Every day there is a happy hour or 2 with wine and cheese and crackers, a chance to catch up with others if you wanted to, or just have a quiet drink.There is a private courtyard or a front seating area if you want to people watch.Our room at the top of the stairs (301) was very quiet. We found the location to be ideal - close to a huge selection of restaurants and a five minute stroll to Times Square and the subway. Recommend getting a metro card if you are there for a week (you can use this on all the buses and subways) You get the metro card from the subway and can pay with visa - you do not need to put in your postcode when they ask it will still go through.Movit is a great app for finding the buses and subways to places you want to go.If you're looking for a quaint, quiet, restful boutique stay in NYC, this should be your first choice!

My daughter took me to NYC for my birthday. She could not have picked a better hotel. The staff was very helpful. Rooms were very clean. Close to food, transportation, and Broadway. A light breakfast and happy hour in the evening was a real perk. Couldn't have asked for more!

414 was the ideal boutique hotel for our short stay in New York. We were greeted with such warmth when we arrived and this friendliness from the staff remained consistent throughout our time there. The room was small but comfortable, overlooking a lush courtyard terrace area. Most importantly, our room was incredibly quiet.We found the location to be ideal - just around the corner from a huge selection of restaurants and a five minute stroll to Times Square and the subway.If you're looking for a quaint, quiet, restful boutique stay in NYC, this should be your first choice!

First trip to NYC and we wanted central location with plenty to see and do around it, we found it at the 414. We spent 6 days going to all the tourist locations, the hotel staff could not have done more for us, giving us plenty of helpful advise and directions. Happy hour was just what was needed at the end of the day. Breakfast was all we needed to start the day. Our room was clean and as we were lucky to get a room at the back we had no noise. Staff helped us carry our bags up as there was no lift.

We couldn't have chosen a better hotel for a first-time visit to NYC with a 16-year old. Within minutes after checking in we referred to it as "home" and it was such a delight to return to such a quiet and charming place after a long day of sightseeing. Ideally located close to Times Square and subway but a quiet, tree-lined street and local neighborhood feel. Lovely place, thoughtful and helpful staff and genuinely caring owner!

Staff were great they pre-empted all our questions and were very proactive regarding all our needs. Complementary happy hour worked well with all travellers sharing their daily experiences.Only small downfall is that bedrooms overlooking the street can be noisy.

If you want a real home away from home, you need to book here..! The rooms are equipped with all the necessities a person is in need of, and of course a good and comfortable bed. The hotel has a friendly staff, in which they can give you tips for nice hang-outs, show,s and/or good restaurants. No question is too much asked for them. The hotel is located in Hell,s kitchen, and it is nearby all the hotsppots. Broadway is a 10 min. walk, 5th avenue and Central park like max. 30 minutes.As a bonus they even supply a sort of "happy hour" between 17:00 and 19:30 you can take some drinks at the bar downstairs with a little bite. All in all i can say, that if we visit NY again, we will definitly book here again..!

We booked the 414 hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. From the first moment we entered the hotel the staff was wonderfully attentive and pleasant. We would like to thank Susan and her staff for their thoughtfulness and travel tips that helped make our anniversary trip a success!

Very comfortable small hotel (22 rooms) in excellent location on 46th between 8th and 9th. What makes it 5 star for me is the exceptional service. The owner, Susan, knows every guest by name. Drew and Jacky make sure each guest is completely comfortable. A lovely breakfast and an early evening happy hour with wine, brandy and cheeses. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC. Many are return guests

Loved the location, boutique atmosphere, staff, breakfast and wine & cheese hour. I was only in NY for 24 hours and this hotel was perfectly located to walk to Time Square, restaurants and many other attractions! Love, love, love

My daughter and I had a wonderful vacation in NYC. She attended fashion camp, and I had the week to relax and enjoy the city. Thanks to Strawberry, Susan and the entire staff of Hotel 414 for making our trip so enjoyable. I will miss the daily breakfast, walks to nearby sights and especially the afternoon glass of wine. This hotel is a great find and we're looking forward to staying at 414 again soon!

We chose the 414 based on its Tripadvisor reviews. It sounded like our sort of hotel - small and friendly and the location looked perfect. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. From the moment we got there (late on a Sunday night) we were made to feel most welcome. We stayed with our 2 (adult) children. Both rooms were a reasonable size, nicely decorated with very comfortable beds and all the amenities that we wanted. We had one courtyard facing room and one street facing (there were no noise issues at all with the street facing room). The breakfast provided a good start to the day and we enjoyed having it in the courtyard garden. We also enjoyed a glass of wine some evenings at the hotel's Happy Hour before heading out. And the setting was ideal - a short walk to Times Square but in a quiet street and lots of restaurants and bars within a few minutes walk (the hotel's list of good local restaurants and bars was invaluable).The best thing of all was Susan and the staff - they could not have been more welcoming and friendly, always ready to help and advise on any queries we had and print out information about places we wanted to go. In particular when our return travel home was disrupted they went out of their way to help book a return flight for me and to make sure the rest of the family still had a bed for another night! We wouldn't stay anywhere else in New York!

We stayed at 414 for two nights. The room was small, as expected for such a great location, but packed with more amenities than other chain places. I found the room to be clean and comfortable. The hosts were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was satisfactory. The hotel is walking distance to subways, Time Square, shows, Central Park, and many, many, many good restaurants. The best part is that it is about a quarter block off the main streets and so was had a nice, quiet neighborhood feel to its surroundings.I'd definitely stay here again - not just for the location, but also for the small, personable feel of the hotel.

I don't quite know how to describe our stay at 414 Hotel other than by using the title of this review. From the impeccable standard of the spotless room (which was much larger then we expected from the classic walk up building) to the delicious breakfast, we could not fathom a single fault with this hotel! The location is excellent (just a 5minute walk from Times Square) but there was very little noise from the street. The service and staff were the friendliest that we have met and they had a fantastic way of making you feel like you were at home! We even received an email thanking us for our stay personally after we left! If we ever get to return to New York, I would not consider staying anywhere else and will strongly encourage our friends and family to join you if they visit NYC. Thank you for a wonderful time!

We would be happy to return when next in NY - the local knowledge for people like us who use public transport was invaluable, advising the best way to the entrance for the downtown subway for example and the bus to take down to the WTC memorial.Numerous theatres are on the doorstep, easy walking for Times Square, Central Park is a bit further but still doable, and Port Authority is walkable for the shuttle bus back to the airport.Breakfast choice was a great start to the day, and although there's no tea making facilities in the room the kitchen was always open to make a hot drink when you got back from a day out.Our trip coincided with our Silver Wedding and we took away some special memories - thank you.

Our daughter moved into a studio apartment in the Hells Kitchen neighborhood recently, so her Mom and I were looking for a good place to stay when we come down to visit. We found it at the 414 Hotel.We were a little early and expected we'd need to drop off bags and come back later. To our surprise, Strawberry at the desk said they had a room ready and took us up to it. I never did ask whether her parents were Mets fans. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. There were plenty of outlets for chargers and such, something I like to see.When we had coffee in the morning (breakfast was included, but we were going to brunch with our daughter), we met the owners, Susan and Andrew. They were a joy, and we must have chatted for 45 minutes. It felt like staying with old friends. After returning from our one-night stay, Susan sent us an email thanking us for our stay. You could tell it wasn't one of those robo-generated emails, and it was a nice touch.So, if you'd like a nice place to stay near Times Square and Hells Kitchen, try the 414. You won't be disappointed.

The 414 Hotel exceeded our expectations from the friendly staff, breakfast spread, clean and comfortable rooms to the afternoon happy hour and ideal location of the hotel. Our rooms in the back building were very quiet. Though the place is not fancy and lacks an elevator, it provides first class hospitality.

My wife and I have just returned from our stay at the 414 in New York. We absolutely loved it. The hotel has got a really homely feel to it. As soon as we stepped into the hotel we were given a very warm welcome by Drew .. great guy. The following day we met Strawberry (yes that's her real name) and she was just as nice. It turns out all of the staff and the owners are genuinely nice people who care about your stay. Location-wise it's just right ... near enough to the action (e.g. Times Square) to walk there, but far enough away to make it quiet at night. And being mid-town Manhattan, you're central for travelling to all of the New York boroughs. We stayed in a room in the separate building behind the main building ... very quiet at night! It seems that the 414 also has a bit of a rare jewel for New York ... a quiet courtyard at the back of the main building .. lovely to sit and have breakfast there. Whilst we were there, NY experienced a bit of a heatwave, but the air conditioning worked fine. We're new to NY so we had a lot of questions and the staff were always glad to help and were a wealth of knowledge. If and when we go back to NY, we'll be heading to the 414 again.
