The best place in NYC. The only place Im gonna stay when Im in the Big Apple.The breakfast is good and the social-happy-hour is an example of the small things they do but in the end makes an enormous difference from other hotels.Great people in a lovely atmospheric hotel close too Broadway and Times Square.

Mom and I arrived at the 414 Hotel on July 3 rd for our annual 10 night Holiday in Manhattan. My friend Cyrena suggested the 414, as she walks by daily and admires the Charm it projects. We had a first floor room with windows on the private and intimate garden courtyard, where we enjoyed our daily European influenced breakfast. The daily wine, bourbon & imported cheese Happy Hour is a great way to mingle with guests and hosting staff. Edythe (mom) is a young, handicapped 83 year old whom the staff called "mom" as they pampered and catered to her. The owners, Susan and Andrew are present on a daily basis to assist with reservations, transportation and interesting conversations. We enjoyed the communal front porch and garden courtyard settings which are not available in larger corporate properties. Upon saying Farewell to Susan, Andrew and the staff, we booked our annual 10 night Holiday for next July. It just seemed natural to have a Reunion with our 414 Family in 2016!

Loved this hotel, it doesn't have glitz and marbel floors but it has character and history. The owners and their staff are just so lovely and can't do enough to help you with local knowledge and make you feel very welcome. Loved the location close enough but far enough away from the hussle and bussle!Rooms very comfortable. Breakfast and happy hour was great! Definitely recommend to stay there.

We spent two nights at 414 and were blown away with how great everything was. The location is great for walking around the city and not loud or scary at night. Susan, Drew, and the staff went above and beyond for us! It was our family's first time in the city and they helped with recommendations, travel tips, food accommodations, and even made efforts to connect and befriend our young children. EVERYTHING about our stay at 414 was delightful. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The courtyard is darling and the wine/cheese hour is a treat. Breakfast was delicious every morning. The other guests were even friendly and gave us unused metro passes. If we make it back to the city - with or without children - we will stay here EVERY time!

I booked our stay at 414 because of the Trip Advisor ratings and I am so glad that I did. Susan and her staff are wonderfully warm and welcoming, giving this boutique hotel an air of immediate familiarity. It is a place you will want to return. I know we do.

I don't know how you could do any better for the price in NYC than Hotel 414. With a great midtown location (46th st between 9th & 10th), Susan and Will run an exceptional outfit - super friendly & helpful staff; clean, comfortable, well appointed and amazingly quiet rooms.It's the attention to detail that makes the difference - on arrival you're provided with a comprehensive local food guide, and there's an evening happy hour with wine, cheese and spirits laid on - not to mention a generous breakfast of cereals, pastries, fruit, bagels & toast. There's even a jar of Vegemite lurking in the cupboard for us stray Aussies and other adventurous types! There's also a charming courtyard just perfect for enjoying breakfast, and hearing birds chirp, despite the midtown location.There's a truly personal service that you just don't get in chain hotels - Susan and her staff at 414 genuinely want to make your stay a terrific one, and go out of their way to make you feel cared for and at home. They take real delight in getting to know their guests. We stayed 5 five nights in this Manhattan oasis and loved every minute.Handily located in proximity to the restaurant & theatre district, 415 is about 5 minutes walk to either the 42nd St (Port Authority) or 50th St subway. My tip - head to 50th to avoid the circus!If 5-star luxury is what you're after, then perhaps look elsewhere. But if good old-fashioned value, warmth and hospitality is your thing, then git yourself pronto to Hotel 414. Absolutely recommended 200%.

This was our first time to NYC and the staff at 414 Hotel was exceedingly helpful. We would contact them with questions about the area, what to do, what to expect, etc and they answered every question in detail, even before we booked with them. This friendly and thorough service did not stop face to face. Every morning Susan and staff would ask us what our plans were for the day and they had many interesting suggestions to make the most of our time. The location was perfect. It's close enough to the excitement, but resides on a somewhat quiet street. The hotel offers breakfast every morning, microwave in the room and access to a kitchenette; which not only helped economically, but also was a time saver. The afternoon cheese and cocktail hour is a nice touch that we wish we could have utilized more often. The rooms were clean and we loved the artwork of pics of old NYC. We usually book with airbnb or a cheap hotel, but wanted something a bit more special for our honeymoon. We found it in 414 Hotel. So much so, that we've reconsidered our "usual" for future vacations. The little money we would have saved was made up for in abundance.

We stayed 4 nights and this little hotel offered us a quiet retreat after each day touring around the city. Location is great and surprisingly quiet. Rooms were very comfortable with nice appointments and the quietest air conditioner!Staff was really friendly, helpful and had excellent recommendations. Loved the continental breakfast and happy hour on the patio.

Lovely ,excellent position, very comfortable and the staff are amazing. If i stay in new york this is where I would stay. Within easy access to broadway, restrants etc. the happy hour was a godsend after a long day sightseeing.

We spent 6 nights in this charming hotel.The location is great, in a "village" in the City near Times Square.It is just like home! Everything is done to feel good.Congratulations to Susan and her team!I hope to come back soom to the 414!

Very pleased with my stay -comfortable room, friendly staff, and breakfast items available each morning. Located less than a block from bike shop offering hybrid/road bike rentals (Danny's). From hotel it is only 3 blocks to waterfront bike path offering miles of biking and routes to Brooklyn Bridge and Central Park.

What a wonderful little gem this smaller boutique hotel is! So close to Times Square, but so relaxing, quiet and in a quaint neighbourhood. It was so nice walking back to the prettiness of this lovely street! We absolutely soaked up the hospitality and the helpfulness of the front desk. They had suggestions for everything and printed out maps and reviews with asking for them. The breakfasts were substantial and healthy, and the Happy Hour perfect with delicious cheeses/crackers and a great selection of wine and spirits. They also had flavoured waters, coffee, and a wide selection of teas. Perfect for relaxing after a hectic day of sightseeing. The small courtyard in the centre of the hotel made us feel like we were in Paris. There was a wide range of tourists staying there from all over the world. This stay definitely made celebrating my daughter's 20th Birthday special. We will definitely stay there next time we visit the Big Apple. We loved staying in Hell's Kitchen with all the restaurants and wonderful food in the area! A big Thank you to Hotel 414:)

414 hotel is very well located. The rooms are nice and clean. And above all it is a very warm, friendly and welcoming hotel. Thank you Susan for helping us and giving very good suggestions for our stay. The staff is also very helpful and friendly. Enjoyed our stay very much:)

My granddaughter and I recently spent 5 nights at 414 Hotel. How happy I am that we found this amazing place! The location is perfect for going to the theatres in the evenings, and is close to many good restaurants, as well as being within easy walking distance to Times Square and other attractions. Susan and her staff are very friendly, attentive, and helpful, always going the extra mile to make their guests feel at home. Our room was lovely, clean, quiet, and well-equipped, and the beds extremely comfortable, making for a great sleep. We loved the included breakfast, which was a really good start to the day, and the happy hour late in the afternoon, where one could sit and relax a little before going out to dinner or the theatre. This hotel is truly a gem, and made our visit to New York City all the more wonderful. When we left, we felt like we were leaving friends.

When ever I stay in the city, it's at the 414 Hotel. The friendliest and welcoming Hotel in New York. The staff is exceptional especially Susan the manager. You feel like you're staying with family and friends. Love it!

414 is an amazing place, an oasis in the jungle. Just a few steps away is the busy centre of NYC, with Times Square, Broadway etc, but this small hotel succeeds in being warm and cosy, every day it felt like coming home. The owners and staff are truly kind, not "fake kind" like in some hotels. This is really the place to be. If NYC, we'll never go anywhere else again.

We were celebrating our 32nd wedding anniversary with a play in NYC and decided last minute to stay the night- as it was July 2 and last minute we figured we'd have trouble finding a place- saw an ad for this boutique hotel, with such a pretty awning and after checking out reviews we decided to try it--it was a lovely tree lined block, it offered a "happy hour with cheese/crackers/wine", continental breakfast was also included. The best part was the courtyard between the front and back building which was a little oasis-our room was quiet, very comfy bed and plenty of room. We awoke early and had breakfast downstairs and then took our coffee out to the courtyard in the sweetest mug which I purchased to bring home! The staff was friendly, and we felt like we were visiting a relative not staying at a hotel at all- it was also fairly priced, will be back again soon, it was really lovely!

I came to NY with my daughter and wanted a safe and nice place to stay that was close to everything and that is what we got at 414. I could not believe how nice the staff was - the best customer service I have experienced in quite a while and their restaurant recommendations were wonderful. I will always stay here - it was a wonderful trip

All the staff was super nice and helpfull, especially Drew, who was the person with whom we had the opportunity to talk a little bit more. The breakfast was fine and we enjoy a lot the wines and cheeses happy hour - it was great for a break before dinner and nightlife.We consider the Hotel 414 is an excellent boutique hotel, which despite not having elevator, gym, pool, sauna and so on, has a very own charm and provides a magnificent experience to all its guests.

So much better than a chain! The location is central to "everything" in NYC - food, subways, shopping, sightseeing, Broadway, Times Square, etc., etc. Room was nicely appointed and had everything we needed for our 4 night stay. Breakfast and a very nice happy hour was even included. Price was very reasonable and Susan was a wonderful hostess (the staff was so friendly and accommodating). When we go back east again (and we will go back), we will surely look to the 414 Hotel before any others.

There is truly no better perch for NYC theater going than the clean, comfortable, friendly 414 Hotel. The 414 is perfectly situated on W. 46th Street between 9th and 10th Avenues in the historic Hell's Kitchen neighborhood, a quick well-lit walk from any Broadway theater. Busy bright Times Square is close but can be ignored or enjoyed depending on preference. The quiet 414 is just a five minute walk from the 42nd Street subway station, where all the city's subway lines converge. This makes 414 the perfect launch point for any New York adventure. Staff is genuinely warm and helpful and kind in every regard. The free continental breakfast is generous and available for hours, and the free wine/beer/scotch cocktail hour offers an opportunity to relax and regroup before theater or dinner plans. I've stayed at 414 half a dozen times now, and notice constant updates to decor and furnishings that keep the hotel fresh. I now consider the 414 Hotel a welcome given on my New York trips, and never even look at other listings!

Such a great hotel! The staff are so kind and helpful. Our room was a good size, clean, quiet with a comfortable bed. The included breakfast had many options, we were always very full. The location is close to restaurants, theatre, subway stations, but on a quiet street. Happy hour is great, with a very cute courtyard to enjoy your drink.The staff made us feel very special about the occasion we were celebrating. All in all a great Hotel.Thanks for contributing to our great trip. Susan, Drew and Mary!!!

This is the only hotel I use in NYC - and I go there a couple times a year. The owner/manager is a lovely woman and the entire staff takes on that vibe. The location is perfect, esp if you are there for the theatre or restaurant row. Easy, fast and cheap cab from PENN - so if you take the airtrain from JFK, you can get to the hotel for about $25 total. The hotel price is very very reasonable given how crazy expensive NYC hotel rooms are - and the rooms themselves are huge in comparison. The courtyard in the center is a great place to retreat, as is the "breakfast" area in the lobby. I can't say enough about this hotel. It's a gem.

We were lucky enough to snag a 1-night stay here on short notice recently. What a terrific find. Our room had everything we needed for a comfortable stay; the location is super convenient to Hell's Kitchen and the Theater district; the courtyard is a little oasis in the middle of the urban jungle; the happy hour and breakfast spreads were completely satisfying; and best of all, the owner and staff were absolutely delightful and engaging.

A wonderful little quiet gem in the middle of a busy city. Lovely people that make you feel very welcome. NY hotels are expensive, but this one is worth the money. I will certainly stay here again in the future.

Great place in am awesome location with the most friendly staff. If you find the cost of hotels in NYC over priced then this is the place for you. Hotel is situated on restaurant road and a 10 minute walk to Times Square. A+

A lovely hotel with possibly the nicest staff we've ever encountered in NYC. The location is superb. The breakfast just what you need to start your day and the "Happy Hour" is a pleasant respite after a day of sightseeing. Highly recommend and will definitely go back. Many thanks to Susan and her gracious employees!

We were fortunate enough to book the last available room after a last minute cancelation by the renter of our AirBnb host. The location could not have been better for exploring the city. The hotel is close to Times Square, but far enough away from the crowds. The owner and staff are obviously concerned about guest comfort. Would return without hesitation!

This is a seriously late review and I apologise as this hotel deserved one the minute we landed back in the UK!! We travelled for our anniversary break with our daughter who was 2 and I was 6 months pregnant at the time. From the minute we landed to the minute we left, the hospitality we received was outstanding and I can't recommend this hotel enough. I usually only stay in 5 star hotels but Xmas in NYC means prices go ridiculous and I was slightly worried about the amount we paid to stay here considering it was a 3 star ..(expect all of NYC to be sky high with prices in December!!).... But the decision. To stay here was the best!!!Clean.. Fab location .. And outstanding service.. There is nothing I could fault... Thanks again and look forward to visiting again!!

Location is great, Everything to do in NYC within walking distance. Timesquare is 10 minutes walk. Central park 20 minutes. I would go back there. Our room was great, simple, but great with what you need. And the best, it was so quiet that it was possible to sleep the window open... A real luxury, especially in Central New York!!!. The team is great (I don't remember all the names, sorry!), really welcoming, helpful and engaging. It was great for us to exchange with the team, on New-york, travel. Good tips also for nice restaurants in the surrounding. Breakfast : Simple and good. What you need before going into New-York. Wine and Cheese happy hours : Great time to discuss with other guest from the hotel. Wine is good and Cheese was as well. Room was comfortable, clear, on the fourth floor. Quiet and not giving on the main street. No noise from other rooms (except if they slam their doors...).Would go back and after a 23 days trip in the US, this accommodation is in our top 5 and the best I went when travelling to NYC.

Many thanks to Susan and her team for their hospitality and nothing was to much for them. They have created a wonderful retreat from the frenetic pace of New York. Creating a space where travellers would mingle and get to know each other over either breakfast or their Happy Hour

Best Service, best location, best advisor to "what to do in the city" with the best discounts on everything!!------------------------------------------------------------------------ Certenly to repeat

Stayed at this really cute hotel just a few days ago. The staff was very kind, attentive, and always had great recommendations for places in the area. The place is very clean and well kept. Susan and the other girls were just great! They're very personable and accommodating. The breakfast was great and they provide their guests with snacks later in the day as well. Had a really nice time here, would definitely recommend this hotel.

My husband and I loved our stay at the 414 hotel. We were taking a break in the middle of planning a wedding in February (why it has taken so long to write this!) and decided to head up to New York to see a show. We found this hotel and weren't sure what to expect. I will never stay at a big hotel in New York again!In fact, I seek out boutique experiences and this experience rivaled some of my stays at other boutique hotels in the city. The experience can be as intimate or anonymous as you would like. The amenities are amazing. At the Marriott you can barely get a coffee. At hotel 414 there is a fully stocked breakfast (bagels, hard boiled eggs, cream cheese fruit etc...) and snacks throughout the day, including an amazing wine and cheese hour...whiskey if you are feeling it. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and meeting different groups at the table for the breakfast and wine hours. We became fast friends with other travelers staying at the hotel. We even got great tips from a fascinating and inspiring couple on the speakeasies and advice for a late year trip to Austria. It was fun to share stories before going separate ways for the night and then to see the same smiling faces at breakfast. The room was a very good size for the city...we were lucky enough to get upgraded to a room off the patio.The owner was a pleasure to talk to as well. The proximity to times square is perfect. In a few blocks you are right in the mix and in a few blocks your are back to your cozy respite in the city. We loved the experience!!! Thank you Hotel 414. We'll be back for sure.

Stayed at the 414 Hotel for 6 nights with my mum and loved it. Location is great, lots of good restaurants around, perfect to explore (all parts of) Manhattan. Staff was very friendly, helpful and attentive. Loved the Happy Hour, even though we only made use of it twice, but it's a nice little touch; relaxing with a glass of wine and some cheese in the lovely backyard after having roamed the city all day. Breakfast is simple but sufficient. My mum even got a little birthday gift which was very sweet. As other reviewers said, it feels like home. Would definitely go back and highly recommend it to future travelers.

Everything about this hotel was so wonderful. The location was awesome, the room was surprisingly spacious, the price was definitely reasonable, but above all, the customer service was incredible! My husband and I visited while celebrating our 1st year anniversary and the staff made us feel so special. We mainly interacted with Mary and Susan, but everyone we talked with was wonderful! Mary gave us some wonderful restaurant suggestions - when we checked in she actually gave us a list of restaurants in the area and she went through the list with us highlighting some of her favorite ones. Susan is probably one of the sweetest ladies we have ever met. She made such a special effort to make us feel welcome and to see if there was anything she could do to make our visit even better. She was actually able to get us really great discounted tickets for 39 Steps (which is such a fun, high-energy play if you happen to be looking to see a show in the city for a non-outrageous price).We loved our stay at the 414 hotel and we would recommend it to anyone who is visiting in the city!

My husband and I stayed at the 414 hotel last week to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary and we're already raving about our experience to our friends and family back home. From the moment we booked the hotel, we were graced with incredible customer service. I'd actually received an email shortly after booking thanking me for booking and inquiring if we had any special requests. I had mentioned in the comments that we were celebrating our 1st year anniversary and that, while we booked a queen bedroom, we would love to stay in a king bedroom if one became available. I received a response shortly after stating that they would definitely try to do what they could to try to move us to a king bedroom, but that at that time they didn't have a king bed for our entire stay so the worst case would be that we would have to move rooms for our last night. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were excited to hear that they were able to upgrade us to the king bedroom! When we opened the door to our room (which was surprisingly large for New York), we found a bottle of champagne, chocolates and a hand written note from the 414 staff. The champagne and chocolates were very generous, but honestly it was the note that really impressed us. The fact that they took the time to wish us a pleasant stay and a happy 1st anniversary just meant so much to us. I just can't say enough kind words about the staff at the 414 hotel. We mainly interacted with Mary and Susan, but everyone that we interacted with was so kind and helpful. Mary helped us to get checked in and she was so patient with us in giving us suggestions on her favorite places to eat within the area. We were really hungry the night we checked in and it was fairly late so she recommended that we try Five Napkin Burgers because she said that it was close, tasty and quick. She was absolutely right! If you are looking for a fun place to grab tasty food, I would totally recommend that you check it out! Susan is probably one of the sweetest people you will ever meet. She was so fun to chat with and she takes such good care of the guests that visit 414. At breakfast, she was always asking us about what our plans were for the day and she would offer suggestions on how to get discounts or the quickest way to get places. My husband and I were considering seeing 39 Steps and when we mentioned this to her, she was able to help us get super cheap tickets for the show! The 414 was the best decision we made in NY!

When we booked this hotel, I'd expected that it'd be cramped or noisy given how central it is, but luckily I was quite wrong! The street it's on is quiet and tidy despite being 5 minutes walk from the bustle of Time Square etc. The room was very clean and well presented and had all the amenities you'd expect.The reception staff were wonderfully helpful and the service was really good in general. They also serve free wine and spirits with cheese and crackers in the afternoon! A lovely little extra!All-in-all, I'd definitely recommend it and would stay again

I went to New York by myself and could not have had a warmer welcome had I stayed with family.All the staff are so interested in what their guests do and go out of their way to help. It is in no way a glossy hotel but has everything one needs - a few minutes from the theatre district; breakfast included where you meet all your fellow guests; and a happy hour in the early evening where we all discuss what our individual plans are for that night. A very pretty courtyard at the back too. I felt very safe and simply very happy there.

This hotel was a real find ,in an excellent location ,two minutes from the bustle of 9th avenue ,yet in a leafy street full of Brownstones .it has a lovely garden to sit and eat breakfast in .The Room was really nice and we were grateful for the efficient air conditioning!The main thing that makes this place so special is the attention to detail and personal service of the staff,particularly Susan the general manager .She remembers everyone's names and what their plans are for the day ,all the staff are so helpful with advice on anything you might need.The happy hour with cheese and wine and complimentary drinks was most welcome .414 hotel is an alternative to the anonymous mass hotels ,if you like to feel cherished this is the pace for you .

Quiet and cosy hotel, located only 5min walk from Times Square.Very friendly atmosphere.Rooms are specious and cleanSome might need a bit of refurbishing - which I understand is currently happening.Aircondition is rather noisy, though

The friendliest hotel in the most convenient location. The room was great with no street noise to disturb our sleep (we had a back room) Susan and Mary were so welcoming it was like visiting family. We know we will be staying at the 414 next time we visit New York.

My stay here was exellent and I have no qualms recommending it. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and went out of their way to give you the best stay and time in NY as possible. They really offered a level of service and friendliness you'd be lucky to get at 5* hotels On my last day they looked after my baggage as I had a night flight (not unusual I know)but then were happy to let me sit in the recepton, browse the internet and have a free coffee and cake when I came back at 5pm before heading off to the airport, all exceptionally welcome after a long hot day in the city.Included in the room charge you receive a generous breakfast. Coffee and a wide assortment of teas are available all day and night and at 6pm they have a happy hour with wine and cheese, a welcome extra. It's well located, you can walk to the park in 10 mins and there's a huge choice of restaurants (catering to all pockets) within seconds of the hotel. My room was on the 4th floor over-looking the road but I slept well. I think if you're a light sleeper you should probably ask for one of he upper floors (4th is top), or they have rooms at the back which don't overlook the road. I couldn't hear anything from the road, or nothing intrusive at least, but as it was very hot when I was there I had air-con on and that cancelled anything else out anyway, you just had the white noise of the aircon. The room was much larger than any other I've ever had in NYC and it was nice not to feel hemmed in. There was a desk and other seating and the bathroom was big too, with a long counter for your belongings. I'll definitely check out this hotel next time I'm headed NYC.

I had recently been to Hotel 414 to meet a friend and have some photos taken.They were great and we got the room for only a few hours, the entire place was spotless!I was very surprised, coming off the NYC streets to some smallish hotel, but its a bargain!Some may gaff at a stairs only building but I made it to the 4th floor no complaints.

We stayed here in late April / early May and what a find! I feel like I read every review of every hotel in NYC before booking here and I'm so glad we did.The location is great, close to subway, taxis and a few blocks from Times Square (but far enough away). It's a pretty quiet location on a lovely street that is very 'New Yorky' for us out of towners :) We booked a king room off the courtyard which was a very good size for NYC and had everything we needed. The continental breakfasts are great. It's simple food but to us that was a great bonus not to have massive cooked breakfast as on holidays you eat out at every meal anyway. There was cereal, bread (bagels, bread, croissants, pastrys), plus other things. Even Vegemite for us Aussies! Thanks!The staff are fabulous, super friendly and very helpful. It was really nice to have a chat over breakfast - or at any time! They really added to our experience at 414 Hotel. Would definitely recommend and would stay again. Thanks Susan and the team :)

I have enjoyed my stay at the 414 Hotel in N.Y city. I find that this hotel is perfect for me and for all I need in N.Y: it provides great friendly atmosphere, its location is superb, its rooms are very nice, clean and most comfortable. Undoubtedly, the 414 Hotel is my first choice from now on in N.Y. and I will also recommend all my friends to choose the same

414 Hotel is a gem if you are in New York for holidays and you need a place to settle down in the evenings. Make sure you get home before 6pm, as there is a Happy Hour every night with free-flow of wine, whisky and other drinks, matched with cheese and crackers! Where else?The location is great for theatre hopping, and there are restaurants galore (the next stretch of 46th street is called restaurant street!)Rooms are fine, amenities OK. No tea-making facilities in the room, but 24-hour supply of tea and coffee in the lobby.Breakfast is unlimited coffee, tea and juice; muffins, bagel and croissants, yoghurt and fruit, boiled eggs. But I guess you could other things if you ask, as Andrew, Susan and Strawberry do not know the word "no". Everything is possible, and always with a smile. Strawberry is fabulous, and the other staff are very nice as well.The only drawback? I was in New York for business, and a desk would have been useful. However, the large table in the lobby/dining room was a good alternative, and there is free WiFi throughout the hotel.

Stayed five nights, over a weekend, at this delightful, small, quite, perfectly located, hotel. Our good sized room was on the third floor and amazingly quite for the location - just a few blocks from Time Square. A very nice breakfast each morning was included in the price. I have stayed at half a dozen different Manhattan hotels and like the 414 the best, partly down to location and the room, but also because of the super friendly and accommodating owner and staff - who really make the place perfect.

This was my 6th visit to Hotel 414 and it seems to improve each time! Last year they added wine and cheese (and liqueurs!) to enjoy before dinner, and their breakfast buffet is always delicious. Susan and Andrew both go above and beyond to make their guests feel welcome and at home, and will dispense advice on restaurants, plays, etc. Their location just west of Restaurant Row couldn't be better to get to the theater district and especially the back brownstone is very quiet. I am happy they have banned smoking in the charming inner courtyard between the 2 buildings.

This hotel is the perfect find! It is a quiet but so close to the midtown action. Staff so friendly who made us feel very welcome. Rooms very clean and comfortable with plenty of space. My daughter and I had a great stay and will definitely stay at 414 again when I go back to NYC!

This is the second time staying at 414 Hotel but the first under the newer management. It is a warm, friendly, quaint boutique hotel in a perfect location. Walking distance to Times Square, tons of restaurants, The Intrepid and so much more. Lovely continental breakfast, delicious coffee. Most importantly, amazingly friendly and helpful staff. Also have a late afternoon social time with complimentary wine and cheeses. A wonderful and affordable NYC lodging choice.

This hotel is amazing. It is made up of 2 back-to-back townhouses with a small, quaint courtyard separating them. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The rooms were simply decorated and very clean. Our room overlooked the courtyard and was quiet from any outside noise. In the evening they offered a wine/spirits/cheese bar that was an unexpected surprise. We sat in the courtyard and enjoyed our food and drinks. A continental breakfast is also included. I highly recommend this hotel and will definately stay here again whenever we travel to the city.

The most helpful and friendliest staff you'll ever meet in New York; their wonderful team consists of Andrew, Susan, Mary, Jacquie, Fernando, Strawberry and the very special Drew! The Rooms and amenities are kept spotless, the indoor AND outdoor courtyard breakfast nooks are quaint and the great service always makes your stay a pleasure. Go 414 Team!

I love staying at 414! The rooms are clean and comfortable. The owner and staff are friendly and beyond helpful. The courtyard in the middle is a lovely retreat from the business of the city. The location is convenient. I've stayed in other hotels and now that I've discovered 414, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

My mother and I just came back from a fantastic trip to NYC, which was made all the better by our stay at 414 Hotel! Absolutely every staff member was extremely kind, pleasant and helpful. The proprietor, Andrew (sadly Susan was convalescing with a broken knee, but we Facetimed with her on our last day!), greeted us every morning, always remembering our names, asked us how our day was--also remembering what we did the day before. Andrew, Jacquie, Mary, Strawberry, and Drew (my Mom wanted to adopt him!) were so helpful, funny, kind, and also offered us suggestions as to what to do in that busy and amazing city. The 414 Hotel is a small hotel with a big heart--we felt so at home there. Our room was clean and much bigger than we expected. We also loved the delicious breakfast bar, and especially loved the happy hour at 5:30pm--what a great way to start our evenings, sitting with the other guests, chatting and laughing and sharing stories. If I ever get back to NYC, I am definitely staying at the 414 Hotel, my new home away from home!

First and foremost, LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!! This is the very best location and the price is beyond reasonable. While it's a block away from Restaurant Row and maybe four blocks from Times Square, it is an incredibly quiet area considering it's so close to so many things. We were able to walk to most of the places we wanted to go, but if we needed a cab, we just had to walk about two blocks and we could catch one within a minute to get us to where we wanted to go. Loved everything about this hotel! The hospitality was amazing, the room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast bar was just perfect, and the location was incredible!! We were able to walk to and from the Broadway shows every night. The neighborhood was safe and so quiet and we cannot wait to stay here again and again!

Stayed here for our honeymoon in March 2015 and had the best stay to end our perfect wedding. The service was second to none, room spacious and cleaned regularly and the happy hour cheese and wine was a great added extra.Susan and the team were an absolute pleasure - friendly, polite and always happy to help and give us information.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and won't hesitate to return. Recommended.

We stayed @ the 414 in NYC this past April and had a most wonderful stay. The 414 could teach the big hotel hospitality. Close and walkable to times square, broadway and great restaurants. A.M. breakfast and P.M. happy hour is frosting on the cake. Would go back for sure. Charlie (Minneapolis)

I got to 414 Hotel by chance and enjoyed every minute of it. The Hotel has beautiful and spacey rooms and a warm and welcoming staff. It really felt like a country-like hospitality in the middle of New-York. I highly recommend this place and plan to come back during my next visit to NYC.  הגעתי למלון 414 במקרה ונהניתי מכל רגע. למלון יש חדרים יפים ומרווחים וצוות חם ומסביר פנים. התחושה היתה של אירוח כפרי בלב ניו-יורק. אני ממליץ על המקום בחום ומתכנן לחזור אליו בשהותי הבאה בניו-יורק.

At first I was hesitant to write this review...only because if I share this gem I may not be able to get a reservation on my next visit! Cozy, clean, quiet, friendly, funny, helpful, informative...running out of adjectives to describe the hotel and the staff. From the moment we arrived and Andrew (owner) carried our bags upstairs and poured us a glass of wine (so appreciated after a long travel day), we knew we had selected a gem. The staff is amazing...especially Strawberry! Excellent value since a decent continental breakfast is included (carb up before heading out to explore), as well as wine and cheese social in the evenings. Nice way to meet other guests...our own little United Nations (other guests from UK, France, New Zealand, Japan). Located on the west end of 46th Street which was tree lined and felt more "neighborly". You can't walk 5 feet and not trip over a bar or restaurant. We will definitely return again...and again...and again.

We've been using 414 as our hotel of choice in NYC for over 8 years. It's the perfect location as a base for exploring the city...close to subway stations and bus routes and within easy walking distance to the Theater District, Central Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. We take the Amtrak from Annapolis, MD and, weather permitting, walk up 9th Avenue to 414. The new owners, Andrew and Susan, are affable and very accommodating. Longtime employees Mary and Jackie, as well as Drew and Strawberry provide excellent service and are very knowledgeable of the city's goings-on. This place is a gem! We especially love the courtyard between the two buildings. Tip on dining: an excellent and inexpensive meal can be had at the Amish Market on 9th Ave between 49th and 50th.

The hotel was ultra clean, comfortable, all white on the bed, and the proprietors were very sincerely friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend it and will stay there again. The location for theatre can't be beat. A nice little breakfast is included, and they offer tea, coffee, wine in the afternoon. They even offered my friend who came to pick us up some food. It is a real find.

Just stayed here at the 414 Hotel. It is a gem in the best location of NYC. I arrived before my companion and was allowed to go to the room even though the reservation was in their name. The room was very spacious for a NYC hotel room. They have continental breakfast which was nice. At night there is wine,cheese and assorted whiskeys complimentary.The location is perfect to midtown and Times Square. I strolled all around midtown and when I returned to the hotel in the mid afternoon I sat in the lobby reading. Andrew, the owner offered me a glass of wine and some lovely conversation.I want to give a shout out to Andrew, Jackie,Strawberry and Marie. They all made my stay fantastic.The only cons I had was the water pressure in the shower was very weak and the A/C was noisy. Next time I would ask for a room in the back building.I would not hesitate to come back here and stay again and I highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is very well situated on West 46th street.It is close to the theatre district and very walkable to theatre which I did.I had a meeting on Monday on upper west side and older gentleman (assume proprietor) was very helpful. It was pouring rain and windy and taxis not to be found. I was given clear info on how to get nearby bus which worked beautifully and saved me money. Also was kindly lent an umbrella.Breakfasts are quite convenient and ample.My room was on the first floor near reception. Not a good location for quiet. Tried to arrange for quieter room but nothing available. I ran air conditioner and use ear plugs and slept fine. Rooms across the courtyard from street are clearly superior location.The prices are very reasonable for NYC. Room was clean and bathroom roomy and clean.

We so enjoyed our stay at the Hotel 414. We could walk to Times Square, yet we could come back to listen to the birds in the trees inside the court yard patio area! The staff were so welcoming and warm! Our room was clean and restful to come back to after walking through New York City each day! Breakfast was always available and evening wine and cheese was available! It is a place we will truly come back to!

The 414 Hotel is a gem in a convenient location in Manhattan that I discovered several years ago. Every year I so look forward to returning to the 414 because it offers everything in a hotel that I would rate as very important to myself, family and friends. Location, cleanliness, atmosphere and friendly and helpful staff is what brings me back every year. This is a small hotel that really caters to personal service for their guests and is able to maintain an attention to details where large hotel chains always fall short . The owner/manager sets the bar so high that it appears easy for them to be noticeably better than any of their competition. As soon as I checked out 10 days ago I found myself thinking of my schedule and how I could put the 414 on my calendar for a future stay. The 414 Hotel is not just a good hotel . . . in is an awesome hotel!

I lived in NYC for 10 years and was looking for a place to stay for about 4 days in April. I found this hotel and since the reviews and price were good, I thought I'd give it a try.Positive feedback: I landed in Newark and 5am and let the hotel know that I was coming in very early. Although they recommended that I reserve a room for the night before, they also had an available room ready for me when I checked in at 7am. Also the wifi is pretty good and overall the service was good. My safe was broken and they replaced it for me quickly. Other feedback: It seems that they were renovating two rooms just below my room and they started work at around 10am - 6pm most days. So, the first morning I wanted to sleep for a while but was awakened by heavy hammering. The other days I got up and out of the room. :-)There was a bit of a chemically smell in my room (206), but I survived.All in all, a good place to stay and nice people work there.

My husband & I had a quick trip to NY the week of Good Friday, Passover & Easter Sunday. I check out hotel accomendations & everything was really expensive. I found the 414 hotel in Tripadvisor & it sounded perfect for our needs at a reasonable rate. It's located mid-town near the theatre district. The rooms are fresh & clean. The staff was friendly, offering advice on where to eat & places to visit. The hotel serves a ample breakfast & offers wine & cheese later in the day. They have a fireplace in the lobby, lit all through the day. We really enjoyed our time there.

My partner and I stayed here for 8 nights and loved it. Perfect location, close walking distance to Times Square and 42nd street subway station but far enough away for noise concerns. All the staff were so lovely and willing to help with anything we needed, very helpful for our first time in New York. Breakfast every morning was nice and simple. They even had a jar of Vegemite stashed away for us Aussie travelers. Complimentary wine and cheese every night too! Rooms are decent size and the bed is extremely comfortable.

My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights and loved every minute of it. This is more than a hotel but rather like a home away from home. Susan and her team welcome you like long lost family members and are always on hand for ideas of where to eat and sights to see that aren't always in the tourist book. The rooms are spacious, clean and for New York; quiet!! Breakfast is included and coffee is always avaliable. The wine and cheese offered at the end of the day is a fabulous touch and it gave us a chance to chat with the other guests, which we both really enjoyed. This hotel really added to our overall holiday experience and we are already looking forward to staying again. If you are looking for somewhere that is relaxed, comfortable, clean, quiet and friendly; then this is the place, I couldn't recommend it more highly.

Hotel 414 is a lovely, friendly small hotel. As a busy mom, I don't get to travel much for fun by myself, and I found this hotel to be just about perfect. This hotel is in a great location with comfortable rooms. I found the staff to be very genuine and helpful. I added a couple of activities to my plans that were suggested by staff members--and I was very glad that I did.

My wife and I had a nice stay at this hotel. The people were very friendly. They have a nice breakfast and also a nice wine and cheese every night between 5:30 and 7:00. It has a good location only 2.5 blocks from time square.

This was our second time back. Manhattan has so many huge hotels. Impersonal and wasting time traveling on elevators. I came to NYC to walk and see stuff, not spend time going up and down elevators with strangers. Not at the 414. A true walk up. We got a freshly painted room looking over the court yard below. Quiet in Hell's Kitchen meant a spacious space, fully outfitted bathroom outfitted with every you need, clean sheets, towels, etc. Breakfast is self serve and this ensures guests get what they want. Bagels, toast, cereals, eggs, fresh fruit, pastries, lots of coffee/tea, juices etc., Kitchenette open all day to get a cup of tea and warm up. Happy Hour: wines, cheese and crackers of course. Better yet Happy Hour gave us a chance to meet other guests, chat about our days, swap stories, tips, ideas, for NYC or about other cities and other places to travel. Terrific way to relax before heading out for dinner. Like I said, like going home without dealing with family you don't like! Susan and her staff provide a place that lets a guest feel welcome, safe, and included. We will be coming back for sure. Hope the 414 is not totally booked!

You know, to continue to keep this gem to myself. Alas, I must tell the truth about this wonderful boutique hotel in Hell's Kitchen just steps from Times Square.This was our second visit to 414 and it was even better than the last. We've recommended this hotel to friends and each one of them has come back with rave reviews too.This visit we were given a room that faced the courtyard and it was pin drop quiet. If you've stayed in NYC on the 3rd floor of anything you may think this is impossible Well my friends, not at the 414! Last time we stayed in a room that faced the street and even that was very quiet. Rooms are large with a comfortable bed with white duvet. Bathrooms are outfitted with toiletries that include: ear plugs, make up remover pads, hair dryer, etc. There is also a small fridge in the room.Breakfast was delicious with teas/coffee/oj, multigrain bread, hard boiled eggs, cereals, croissants, whole fruit and other pastries. Tea/Coffee was available any time of day. New: 5:30-7ish wine, cheese and whiskey bar. A nice spread of wine, cheese and various whiskeys were put out and guests helped themselves. It was so nice to have a glass of wine with other guests prior to heading out for dinner. It really gave everybody a chance to meet other people and hear about their adventures that day in NYC. Such a small simple gesture that upped their game even more than last visit.Susan was a lovely hostess who knew many guests by their first name, including me :) All that being said, we better get a room the next time we're in town! This place sells out fast. If you can score a room, seize the opportunity and book before your dates are sold out

I had a wonderful time at 414 Hotel. It felt more like visiting a friend than like staying at a hotel (except that none of my friends own brownstones in Manhattan). It's in a great location, 5 minutes from Broadway, Times Square, and the subway, with dozens of good restaurants along the way. My room was nice--it was large, with high ceilings, and it seemed more like a bedroom in a house rather than a hotel. Everyone on staff went out of their way to make sure the guests had everything they needed. Drew welcomed me warmly and invited me to the wine and cheese hour. During the evening social and during the continental breakfast each day, the staff and guests chatted as if we'd all known each other for years. I was very pleased with the variety and quality of the food. Everyone on staff performs concierge duties ably. They'll even print you a detailed map and directions to your destination. Jackie was especially knowledgeable. She could tell you about the different neighborhoods, which subways to take, and reviews of all the current Broadway shows. The morning I left, the car service was unable to get to the hotel because many roads were closed for a race. Susan gave me directions to use the subway and a bus to get to La Guardia, and she actually walked me to the subway in the rain to make sure I got to the airport on time.

We had a fabulous stay at 414. What great hosts are Susan and Andrew, and wonderful staff - drew, Jackie and Mary. We enjoyed the breakfasts and of course the wine and cheese in the evenings. It was lovely to meet other guests and chat about our experiences. The location is perfect for getting around either on the subway or by foot. Loads of great places to eat just around the corner. It was very quiet and we slept wellWill def return. Thanks Susan and Andrew and team.Xx

Coming to 414 felt like being welcomed as a guest in someone’s home. Lots of care are taken to let guests feel at home, even up to the point of the socials in what feels like a living room. Also at breakfast, it feels like both a hotel and like staying at friends. The staff is very friendly, the room perfect.

Well where do I start? This gorgeous hotel is unique and fantastic in every single way Right from the very start before we arrived in NYC the lovely staff answered my many e mail questions promptly and gave great advice. The lovely staff are genuinely friendly and helpful in every way.The rooms are spacious and clean and our room which overlooked the courtyard was very quiet.A lovely continental breakfast is served each day and coffee and tea always available to help yourself during the day. Each evening there was a cheese and wine evening which was great for relaxing and chatting to other guests.The 414 is very well located a short walk from all main attractions, example a 5 min walk to Times Square and a 10 min walk to the local subway.This lovely hotel is fabulous and we cannot recommend it highly enough.

5-10 minutes from Times Sq.,theaters, shopping, restaurants and still in a friendly, quiet neighborhood. Rooms and gathering area were pleasant and very reasonably priced. Breakfast was a basic continental in front of a cozy fire.

Until now, for us it's always been major brand corporate hotels in or around Times Square. Never again! I usually do all the planning, but this time round my wife found 414 on TripAdvisor, and said "That's it - that's where we're staying". After a week there, I now know that after 26 years I can finally trust her judgement ;) We really really enjoyed our stay there - from the first welcome to the last farewell. Great bedrooms, very comfortable bed, great bathrooms. But the heart of 414 is in the lobby - whether it's the wonderful Susan and her lovely staff, or the interaction with fellow guests, or the tasty light breakfast, or the happy hour wine, or simply that mug of coffee when you get back exhausted after pavement pounding. And the location is to die for - just a couple of blocks from Broadway, but in such a fun and pleasant neighbourhood - Hell's Kitchen is now a genuinely welcoming place with great restaurants and bars. We spent all week chatting and laughing, and when it finally came time to leave, the tears were in our eyes. This review will self destruct in 30 seconds, and you will forget all you read - 'cos we want to be able to get back to 414 again!!!

I will admit we were concerned that this was not going to be for us. We were wrong. You won't meet nicer hosts. Better than concierges at five star hotels, they had us at good local dining choices, found deals on some entertainment, suggested great lesser known attractions, fed us wine and cheese at happy hour each day, and made sure the coffee, fruit and bagels were ready to go each morning. Clean simple rooms, updated with everything needed. We will be back.

Why? Because of their excellent, outstanding service and their attention to every detail. It might not be the biggest hotel I have ever stayed in but it has the biggest heart, in terms of amazing people (Susan and Mary to mention but two), location (off 9th ave and 46th street) and inclusiveness of all hotel guests by having an amazing lobby, eta and coffee and wine and cheese in the afternoon. They thought of everything from the quality of the beds, to the quality of their breakfasts and a warm fire to come back to in the evening. AMAZING!!

Don't expect a glitzy lobby and shiny rooms. Do expect narrow squeaky stairs and a very warm welcome. The five stars reflect the top location in walking distance to the broadway shows and most of all the staff who really cares about you. Susan goes to great length to make sure the stay is a memorable one. In the last 15 years I have spent many weekends in several hotels close to times square, the 414 is unbeatable in price performance.

Greeted by a cute red door.. and instantly knew this was a different kind of hotel from the moment we arrived.. First we were greeted by Strawberry, a very caring and kind front desk employee, who told us about the hotel, their philosophy and about their wine and cheese get together each night as well as their coffee (rave reviews) and their delightful breakfast each day. We were a party of 4, there for a convention at the Javits Center. They put us all on the 4th floor together, which has 4 rooms. Immediately then, the owner, Susan, came out and greeted us and started carrying our bags up to our room for us. Susan is personable and really cares about each of her guests, getting to know each of them by name and does everything she can to make their stay pleasant. Really, after this experience, I know that next year when we return for our trade show, that we will definitely book in advance to be able to stay at this hotel again.Two things to point out.. It's NY, pay for the upgrade for the rooms that are in the back, not the rooms that face the front street.. much quieter. There are stairs, no elevator, it's a beautiful old building. They will help you with your bags both when you check in and when you leave.. My advice, if one of the employees is helping you take your bags up or down the stairs, remember to tip them, it's the nice thing to do. Thank you Susan and staff for a very rememberable stay in NY.

This week I stayed for my third time at 414 Hotel. My high expectations based on previous visits were exceeded. The staff just gets friendlier and the perks they have maintained or added are the icing on the cake: free wifi, complimentary wine and cheese in the evening, complimentary continental breakfast with the best coffee in town and the spot on help from employees. The rooms are big by NY standards and beds perfect. Bathrooms equipped with everything you need. I have stayed in a room facing the street, a room facing the courtyard and a room in the back building. All were the same high standard of comfort and cleanliness and none were noisy to me. I can not wait to return. Special thank you to Jackie (spelling?) for the info on getting to JFK via subway/airtrain.

Staff simply couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The cozy lobby with fireplace was a warm and welcome perk after walking in cold and snow. Comfortable beds, free WiFi. Nice breakfast (included) and good coffee. They even had GF options when they found out I had Celiac, at no extra charge. It's a great place not far from theater district, good food, and public transportation. I would stay here again.

Stayed at 414 for 4 nights in NY for NBA All Star Weekend. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. Even when we had a small room snafu, they bent over backwards to help us and myself and all of my friends were accommodated. The hotel is small but extremely comfortable with great rooms and comfy beds. The location is very close to Times Square and plenty of great restaurants, so that is a definite plus.Susan and her staff are the best. I will definitely be back later this year with my wife for another stay.

Last week we were on a business trip to Ny and we had the chance to stay at the 414 hotel. I can say it was beyond our expectations, specially because of the price. Has a great location, the room although kind of old has a very good size, excellent bed and pillows, everything is clean, the staff is incredible nice and atentive to meet all your requirements, it is like a good combination of a small boutique hotel and a bed & breakfast. It has no elevator so you have to carry your luggage but they are willing to help you. Breakfast is also very good, basic food but good enough, and in the afternoons they offer complimentary cheese and wine in front of the chimney which is very nice and you get to meet other guests. We had a room in the back building adn there was absolutely no noise at all. They really try hard to make you feel at home and they make it. I'm sure it will be a pleasure to stay again at this hotel.

Stayed for 4 nights in February 2015.Location - The hotel is located about 7-10 minutes from times square, so it's close but at the same time far enough from all the hustle and commotion of the times square area. there is a close by subway, and the hells kitchen area offers allot of good options for eating and drinking (try Ivan Ramen and The Pony Bar).Room And Facilities - stayed on the second building, room 305 facing the inner yard. perfectly quiet. the room was big and very very clean, the bathroom was in top shape. the room was warm enough (it was high winter), has a useful and operating safety-deposit box. Wi-Fi worked flawlessly, allowing even to stream video to my Ipad.Staff and hospitality - Very welcoming staff, willing to help and assist at all times. they set up this nice happy hour between 5-7 PM with wine and cheese for all the guests at the lobby.Price - paid about 239$ per night which a bit expensive as i was traveling alone, but for me it was well worth the money.In conclusion - i think this is a very good spot, especially for couples or people how want to enjoy the proximity to NYC center, but are worried about all the fuss and commotion. BR,Oded

Wonderful hotel in a great location in Manhattan. The night we arrived at 414 we were greeted by a friendly, warm gentleman who gave us some helpful information about the hotel and manhattan. The room is a reasonable size and simply decorated - some people have stated that it is small but I have stayed in much smaller rooms, particularly in Paris! The bathroom is quite large and the amenities are amazing. The bed was OK but I found the room quite warm at night and we were there in late Autumn. Despite the hotel being on a quieter street, there was quite a lot of noise from the building across the road (we never quite worked out what it was, a half way house or a church? Whatever it was, there was a constant flow of people in and out). Breakfast was ample - a good choice of cereal, bread and other savouries, fruit and yoghurt. There seemed to be a bit of an issue trying to accommodate a large number of people down in reception for breakfast. The wine and cheese was a great idea though we were never around the hotel to partake. The staff at this hotel are knowledgeable, extremely friendly and willing to go the extra mile for you. The location is amazing - right near restaurant row so finding somewhere to eat is easy! You are also close to Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue and much more. It was a great introduction to New York. Definitely would stay again.

We stayed at 414 Hotel for an overnighter in Manhattan. The location can't be beat. You are close to Broadway and Times Square, as well as Port Authority.Susan and the staff at 414 are so friendly. We were celebrating our anniversary and they had a bottle of suds waiting for us in our room. The room was the king room overlooking the courtyard. It was a decent size for an NYC room and quite clean.They have continental breakfast as well as wine and cheese in the evening. I'm sure this place is so beautiful in the spring, summer and fall.414 will definitely be our go to in future stays in Manhattan.

This quaint hotel is conveniently located in Hell's Kitchen neighborhood just a block and a half from Times Square theatre district. You call walk to Al the excitement. Tons of restaurants on the streets to choose from. The hotel offer a nice happy hour of free wine with cheese and crackers. The rooms are small but understand this is the norm for the area and most of NYC. The rate was great considering the location and hospitality. Don't think you can go wrong here!!!

What a blissful, joyful ambience this small boutique French Country Style NYC Hotel 414 exudes. Quite clean, welcoming hosts, fantastic early evening wine & cheese/cracker choices. Morning coffee & tea with juice and beautiful fruit, bread, hard boiled eggs. Walking distance to so many restaurants, Time Square, Theater District. Have we already arrived to heaven at Hotel 414? Generally stay in 4-5 star hotels of large groups--we were encouraged to stay here by friends & we accommodated to them initially reluctantly-so happy we cancelled our initial reservations & chose this gem of a hotel.

I've been looking for a great place to stay in the theater district and 414 Hotel is perfect! The rooms are comfy, quiet and very well appointed and the staff is super nice. The breakfast is tasty and plentiful and there is a really homey vibe to the common room in front of the fireplace. I met quite a few lovely people over my coffee and pastries every morning which was a great way to start a busy day of meetings. It truly felt like my home away from home. I can't recommend this hotel more highly. It is terrific and I will definitely be back!

We just returned from our second week-long stay at the 414 Hotel. Like our first stay, this visit was perfect: great location, good prices, lovely rooms, wonderful breakfast and happy hour, gracious service, friendly and helpful staff! The only difference this year was that we were already part of the “414 family” when we walked in: we were greeted as returning friends! To find such a welcoming, friendly hotel anywhere is very special. In Manhattan, it’s a miracle! Owners Susan and Andrew go out of their way to make guests feel at home, and they hire staff in the same mode-- Jacque and Drew were delightful and fun to talk to! Breakfast and happy hour gave us opportunities to chat with many interesting guests (from locations as diverse as Pittsburgh, Los Angeles, South Carolina, Chile, India, etc.). We are already looking forward to our next annual trip to NY and another stay at the 414. Thank you, Susan and Andrew, for helping to make our week in the City so special. You are the best!

My wife and i and her parents were vacationing back in sept and stayed here for the first time. We enjoyed it so much that we booked 2 nites for a business trip trade show at the javitz. The weather was cold and snowy. It was awesome to be greeted with a warm fire in the lounge and and a complimentary glass of wine. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is great. A small hotel with all the comfort of a friendly bed and breakfast atmosphere. We'll be back again.

We just returned from a 2-night visit to the 414 Hotel. It was my first time staying here and I picked it because of the Trip Advisor reviews that described it as homey. I totally agree. We arrived around 5 pm and walked into the cozy lobby with a nice fire and a few tables for two and a longer wood shared table for about 6. It was so inviting that after we checked in and dropped off our bags, we came right back down to settle in and have a glass of wine and cheese and crackers. We quickly met other visitors from the US, UK, and Tel Aviv. Wonderful! We had conversations with them and the terrific staff (Susan and Drew - love you both!). Breakfast was similar and happy hour again the next evening. So nice to see the same visitors and share what we were doing that day, how was the show you saw, etc. The location was excellent for me to attend the NY Gift Show at the Javitts (15 minute walk) as well as Mamma Mia show (10 minute walk) in Times Square. The room was comfortable and clean; the bed super comfortable. We had a great stay and will definitely stay again. Thanks again to Drew and Susan for your hospitality and warmth!

If you are planning a weekend getaway to the city, and you are looking for something different than the usual over-priced hotel chain options, this is the jewel you've been looking for. The staff are friendly, helpful and very tuned in to what is going on in the city, particularly helpful with information on what trains to take where, etc. At the end of a day of theater going or museum hopping, it is a wonderful feeling to walk back to the 414 Hotel located in a charming neighborhood and know that is where you'll be resting yourself for the evening! Can't wait to go back in the Spring and enjoy their sweet patio and mingle at their daily Happy Hour with other hotel guests! Oh, breakfast is included in your daily rate too!! :-) Nice touch. Thank you!!

My wife and I just returned from a biz/vacation stay at the 414 Hotel for 8 glorious nights. I was attending a medical conference that was held in a Times Square hotel and we chose the 414 for its convenience.We have been to another "boutique " hotel but the 414 hotel stay exceeded our other experience by far.I can only begin by saying that we began as guests and left as friends! From our initial greeting until our departure we were blown away by the quality of the accommodation (cleanliness) to the care of the property (service). Location and there was not a noise to be heard. The owner Susan and her staff epitomize the meaning of hospitality. Drew (staff) was a delight with recommendations for restaurants in the area as well as things to see and do. He also kept the conversations going at happy hour!! I also would like to thank the other 3 staff members for their suggestions but their names escape me at this time! Keep up the great work you are doing. This establishment should be #1 for hotels in NYC. As an aside, my wife and I booked for next year before we left!!! That is our unequivocal endorsement of this jem!,,,

This was the second time staying at the 414; and we wouldnt stay anywhere else in NYC. The staff and owners are wonderful; and the clientele are international and very interesting and well-traveled people whom you can get to know during the hotel's daily Happy Hour! We highly highly recommend.

We had a wonderful wonderful time. 414 Hotel's excellent location allowed us access to everything we wanted to experience. But the icing on the cake was the warmth, generosity and helpfulness of all in the 414 Hotel family who took care of us every day. I really appreciate how they all thoughtfully looked into every aspect of our stay: from our room, to the breakfast and happy hours, to restaurant recommendations, to a smooth check-in and check-out, to ensuring we got to our target locations correctly... We truly felt pampered and at home there. It would be for all of these that I would unhesitatingly stay with them again and recommend 414 Hotel to others visiting the City.

Hotel 414 really caters to those travelers who want more of a B&B feel to their trip. The staff is beyond helpful and caring, providing tips on where to go for walks, runs, restaurants, and sight seeing.

Great place with super comfortable beds and an awesome location! We were within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go. For the one time we wanted a taxi, they even offered to hail the taxi for us novices. But even greater than all that were the people! Susan and Drew totally made us feel like friends on our very first stay!!! Everyone was kind and helpful and I can't imagine having stayed anywhere else! LOVED IT!!!!!

My husbandand I stayed here in the first week of December 2014. We had a lovely big room at the top of the hotel which overlooked the courtyard at the back. I asked for a quiet room and it was. Very comfortable, nicely furnished and everything worked. Most of all we slept like logs in a very comfortable bed. The breakfasts were fab. Homemade bread and bagels to die for. Good selection of lovely fresh food. There was tea and coffee laid out for the afternoon and a Happy Hour in the early evening where we were able to meet the other guests. Susan was really great with all the information to explore NY. She had a list of nearby restaurants, advice about the subway but most of an enthusiasm of her city that she wanted us to see the best it had to offer. This made a big difference as we were there for only there for a few days.The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Times Square, within easy reach of the subway and in fact NY is so easy to find your way around because of it's grid layout.Great hotel. An oasis of calm in the great metropolis of NY. Thanks to Susan.....and of course her staff.
Great location, great stuff, clean and tidy.Nothing to claim at all.True!!Its not easy to believe but its true!Have a great vacation. :-)P.S.We will be back once we decide to go visit again.......

I absolutely enjoyed my stay at 414 Hotel. The Boutique is a couple of blocks from Times Square and it's in a nice quiet location. I like that they offer coffee throughout the day, breakfast, and wine and cheese in the afternoon. Staff are very friendly and helpful. It's an older hotel not remodeled but the rooms are spacious. I recommend this place and would stay there again!

Don't know where to begin! We booked this hotel for our 20th anniversary based on recommendations from Trip Advisor and it exceeded all our expectations. We loved every aspect of it - the room (courtyard view) was clean and well equipped and had daily "maid" service. Every morning we had a lovely continental breakfast with our fellow guests. In the afternoon we had wine/whiskey, cheese and crackers in the cozy community area next to the fireplace and had a chance to talk with the other guests from around the world. What a great experience. Then there are our hosts. Wow, it 's like having your own personal concierge. The owners were on vacation while we were there, but the staff couldn't have been more personable and helpful and made our trip so memorable. We were so pleasantly surprised on the day of our anniversary when we returned from our day and found in our room a bottle of champagne and chocolates and a personal note of congratulations. Each day the staff asked where we wanted to go, prepared a map, transit schedule and written directions as well as suggestions. They couldn't have been more helpful. When my husband and I travel, we consider our lodging choice as a integral part of our vacation experience so we are very careful to choose an inn that offers us a warm and personal kind of ambience. This one fits the bill perfectly.

I am in the middle of a spell of constant business travel I was in New York to work between December 29th 2014 and January 2nd 2015. I was not really looking foward to New Year's Eve. I had been seeking a place which would be far enough away from Times Square to be accessible but close enough to be feeling part of that scene. I booked 414 expecting to stay for one night, but stayed longer and expect to go back again. The owner and staff really enjoy their hotel, love to make their guests feel at home and want to find out about each other. We had a wonderful spontaneous New Year's Eve party with Samba dancing, stories from Ireland, Mexico, Croatia, Australia, Norway and Spain; several honeymoon couples sharing their travel experiences - friends being made, fun being had, and nothing is too much trouble....A rare gem and I am so glad I found it.

We loved the staff and everything about this cute little place. Evening wine and cheese and breakfast in the cozy lobby. We needed just one night down the street from our daughter's apartment during Christmas week and were warmly welcomed. We would highly recommend this hotel and will refer anybody who asks where to stay.

The staff at 414 Hotel were incredibly friendly, helpful and knowledgable. They constantly suggested sights or restaurants we might want to visit, and helped with travel and booking planning. The rooms were comfortable and well looked after, and the hotel provided wine and cheese every evening in the cosy lobby, which we really enjoyed. Overall, we could not recommend a better hotel for a stay in New York!!

I stayed here with a friend late august. It was "in a hurry" booking as the hotel we stayed on was full and we planned bad.When we came here we were met with a personel which showed interest in us as individual. This is somewhat unusal when you normally enter a hotel, but it really warmed. We were offered beverages and cookies and had a long chat after we arrived.As "first time new yorkers" there are to much to do, but again hard to figure out where to start except the ovbious places. Here at 414 we were giving alot of good information on were to eat, what to see/do etc.I'm very glad we ended up here. It could not have been any better.Sorry for my bad english.

WOW!!!!! This place is how small hotels should be. If you are interested in skyscraper hotels don't read anymore. If you are interested in having an unforgetable stay, book this hotel (but leave a room for next December so I can go back..). My wife and I stayed for 6 nights at mid december (first time in NY).1. The staff: Susan was out of town when we arrived (I promised her a photo) but she helped so much with my trip programm via mail that made me feel like I am going to relatives... Andrew (her husband) was exciting-make him tell you his story. All the other staff is really something else2. The location: 3 minute walk to Times Square and metro station. Really quite neighborhood just next to TS. Many (too many) restaurants within one breath distance3. The room: spacious, very clean, quite with comfortable beds and perfect temperature. Just remember there is no elevator4. Free Wifi, breakfast (don't expect a hudge buffet- it has everything you need for energy to keep you walking in NY). Don't miss the evening cheese and wine- We had a rather full schedule and could only be at one evening there but it was fantasticThe only negative is that I cannot rate it with 7 stars and that I couldn't stay any longer.....Definitely come back next year........

We had never been to New York before and arrived at 8.00pm and immediately was greeted with lovely happy and caring reception person. the hotel is warm inviting and on the most lovely street that is a quiet place in all the hassle and bustle. We were in room. 401 which is three flights of stairs up, which at first we found hard, however over time the cosiness and just the whole feel of the place made us not be concerned over the climb. Continental breakfast in morning and wine and cheese in evenings only added to the wonderful experience. fully recommended.

If you stay at this hotel you will really feel like you are living in NYC. Situated in an old house it has nice rooms, comfortable beds, and super friendly , helpful staff. Do not come if you have trouble with stairs as they are steep and you may need to climb 3 flights to your room. Rooms are small but nicely decorated We had a room at the back no problems with noise. The street outside, while busy during the day, became quiet at night and we did not hear any complaints from other guests about noise. Breakfast is simple but perfectly adequate unless you like cooked or want lots of cheese ham etc. nice coffee in large mugs. We enjoyed coming down and taking a mug back to our room. Breakfast area is a little small and right by the front entrance but has a nice fire to keep you warm when the door opens. Cheese and wine social was perfect as a pre theater snack. This is a nice small hotel with a great location, a good choice if you want to avoid chain hotel atmosphere.

This place left very warm taste towards my experience.the staff here are absoulty brilliant towards seevice and really feel quite passionate towards their work.it felt quite 5 star standard for a good price well for new york.the room was very warm and abit homey the bed and breakfast was alright althought i was not feeling with tea and coffee.The best thing about this place is the centre of location, it was very convienient to go to the places i need to get to.One of the thing i however did not like was lacking of an evelator, i did not enjoy climing up numbers of time every time i when out.But the is still a extremely devine and brilliant hotel to go.

We visited during cold December and the warmth of the staff (let alone the warmth of the hotel) was welcoming and comforting. The staff went over and beyond the call of duty making sure we have a fantastic experience. They were well informed, accommodating and genuinely decent people. The location of the hotel is perfect. Extremely closed to Times' Square, restaurants, New York connection - but at the same time quiet and cosy. Very reasonably priced for the area.We wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again and couldn't recommend it more highly to anyone.The only tiniest negative is the lack of a lift (elevator), but the staff were always willing to assist with luggage.

Just got back from a cracking 5 day stay in NY, whilst the NY experience was always going to make it a good trip this little gem of a hotel made it a great trip. The place was just to our taste, a small hotel with a personal touch, great staff ready to help and keen to create a lovely hotel atmosphere for all guests while giving you your own space. The hotel is in a great area, is comfortable, quiet and has a real charm about it and all at a reasonable rate for NY. All in all a great place if you like the smaller style hotel.

About two weeks ago, we went to NYC for a concert at Carnegie Hall (very good!). We were looking for a different place to stay and Ellen found a reference to the 414 Hotel on line. The price was very good; the location was very good for us since it is quite close to the Port Authority Bus Term and within easy walking distance to one of our increasingly favorite little restaurants on 51st St. and not far from Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center.Others describe 414 as a European style hotel and it is so! It feels like some small Parisian hotels we know and it is even friendlier by some. The owner, Susan, and the staff were uniformly open, friendly, helpful, both while making reservations and during our two day stay. There was coffee and some sweets available all the time, a very nice breakfast in the morning, and snacks and wine and other cordials in the evening before supper time.More than half of the people we met were from Europe, Mexico or South America and all seemed happy to be there.
