I did not hear one complaint. We had very good conversations with quite a few of the other residents.Our room was on the third floor - there is no elevator but it was not a problem for us, an easy walk up - in the back overlooking the courtyard and so street noise was blocked. We had en suite bath with nice amenities, a good bed also with good quality linens and blankets, plenty of room, easy to use TV and radio, safe in the closet. You know, all the stuff you need for a hotel stay.414 is definitely a strong recommend for anyone looking for an alternative to big, chain hotels in midtown on the West Side. We will return.

We rated 414 a five not because it's a five-star hotel (it's not), but because it provides exceptional service at a reasonable NY price.The owners have done a great job of making this 100+ year-old complex welcome and inviting. The rooms are larger than typical in NYC and are clean and functional. Nice bedding and linens, free wi-fi, and flat-screen TVs address our basic needs. It's not over-the-top, but it is comfortable. And if you score one of the courtyard rooms, you'll eliminate almost all of the NYC street noise.But what really separates 414 is the hospitality. The staff knew my name before I introduced myself. They were always quick to strike up a conversation and went out of their way to make us feel welcome.It has many elements of a B&B - morning breakfast and evening cocktails with wine & cheese. The common area is a bit small (but cozy), and we met terrific people from many parts of the world. The staff went out of their way to make everyone comfortable. None of this was forced - they just seemed to really enjoy being with guests. Good hotels have functional service, but we left 414 feeling like we made a lot of new friends. We'll definitely return.

We stayed at 414 for 09 nights and it was like being at home! The staff - specially Jackie and Drew - and the owners, Susan and Aviv are great, and treated us so well, like we were a family!The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the bathroom is big and has a good hot shower. The happy hour they offer everyday is very nice. The hotel is very safe, cozy and well located.I strongly recommend staying there!

I recommend 414 Hotel for all types of traveller. No matter if you are traveling solo, a couple or a family this hotel will meet your needs and more.I was traveling solo and found the location perfect for the Lincoln centre and Times square. Lots of choice for places to eat and or drink within 5mins walk.The staff at this hotel are exceptional and will do what ever they can to help make your stay perfect for you. Susan sussed me out within a day and worked out I enjoyed music, walking and cosy restaurants and bars. She was able to recommend the most perfect places such as the High Line walk and Chez Josephine restaurant.I liked my room a lot, it was clean and well equipped. The only thing I noticed was that the grouting in the bathroom needed replacing, but hey because this hotel excels in all other ways I still give it an Excellent rating.

I stayed at this property in June and returned for another stay in November. Susan & her staff are very friendly, knowledgeable about the area, & very accommodating. I will always stay here during trips to NYC. Hotel is within walking distance of theatres and good restaurants. Breakfast & happy hour are good times to chat with other friendly guests.

Excellent location, property is very clean and well run. Great continental breakfast and tea/coffee all day is an added bonus as well as happy hour. All members of the staff are amazing, so friendly and they cannot do enough for you. It feels really comfortable and safe. This hotel is close to everything and the neighborhood is very nice with many restaurants nearby. Close enough to time square but without the noise or as many tourists. Would stay here again for sure. Thank you from the Canadian girls!

414 Hotel is a truly lovely boutique hotel. It's my first experience with a hotel independently owned and operated and I loved it. The lobby is small but comfortable and warm (fireplace charm). The owner, Susan, works the hotel herself and is so accessible and friendly. She was knowledgeable about how to get around the city and offered us excellent tips and advice that really saved us time and trouble. It was also conveniently located, so it made it easy to get to the subway to get around when we chose not to take a taxi. There was plenty to do close by as well. We ate locally and enjoyed some of the nightlife right across the street at a great piano bar, Don't Tell Mama. Birdland is right around the corner. There is a pretty little courtyard out back of the main building for sitting and relaxing during warm weather too. The room was attractive, comfortable and very clean. We had pretty white linens, the bathroom was original and real porcelain. No tub surround here. There was a stocked refrigerator in the room. We didn't use it, but did keep our yogurt cold. And we had a very nice breakfast every day before we set out. Honestly, it was one of the nicest hotel stays I've stayed in and I've done the full complement from bad motels to the upscale chain. Frankly, it will be the first place I look to stay for my trips to NY from now on as long as Susan is in charge. This is a great place for the intelligent traveler. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Feels like home immediately. Coffee and tea throughout the day, breakfast and wifi complimentary. We were up on the fourth floor. Rooms are spacey and prices forMinibar items are super reasonable. Neighborhood is very nice and full of little restaurants. Would recommend and stay here again!

Everything about my stay at 414 Hotel was fantastic. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, the room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast was plentiful and filling, and the ambiance was chic and classy. I also couldn't believe how great the location is! It's minutes walking from Times Square and the theater district, but it really does feel like a different world from the hustle and bustle of Times Square – that area of 46th Street much quieter and more homey. How can you get better than a quiet, easygoing area that is minutes away from one of the most famous crossings in the world? I'm pretty familiar with the city, but I also overheard hotel staff giving detailed travel and tourism advice to several other guests – if you're looking for knowledgeable, personalized advice on how to see NYC in a short period of time, this is the place to go. Overall, I'm a huge fan of 414 – will definitely be looking them up again on my next overnight in Manhattan!

This is the best place to stay for a truly interactive experience with New York city, local people, visitors from the rest of the USA and tourists from other countries.The hotel is small and very welcoming, the staff are great with their friendliness and ideas on places to go, things to do and places to eat.The owners (Susan and Andrew) are 'hands on' with looking after the hotel and the guests.Several people said that they had stayed in many New York hotels but after 'finding' 414 hotel they would never stay anywhere else!Our stay in NY has been made ever better because of the 5 days we had in this hotel.We will be back soon.Katie and Peter GoodallSouthampton UK

My husband and I stayed at the 414 Hotel from 11/20/14 through 11/25/14. When we made the reservations on line, we received a prompt confirmation e-mail that described the room in detail. Upon our arrival, we were checked in by Drew, who was friendly, polite, professional and highly informative.The hotel lobby with the lit fireplace was quaint and cozy, making us feel right at home. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Most mornings we slept until 10:00 or 11:00 a.m., so our nights were very restful. The continental breakfast was much more than we expected. There was a selection of three different cold cereals, a variety of different flavored oatmeal, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, hot coco, muffins, bread, jams, peanut butter, and juice... I'm probably missing something, but that's all I remember. It was a particularly accommodating for the staff to keep the array of food out past 10:00 a.m., which NEVER would have happened at a big chain hotel.The evening wine and cheese offering was a big hit with the guests, ourselves included. We planned each evening around not missing this event. The hotel had a nice selection of cheeses and some excellent wines.We found the cleaning staff to be attentive, thorough and not loud or intrusive in the morning.The hotel owners, Andrew and Susan were outstanding hoteliers. Andrew missed dinner with his family one night just to stay and talk with us one evening. It was delightful listening to how he started his career and came to own the 414 Hotel. It was a pleasure talking with Susan in the morning. Prior to our checkout, she provided us with information about the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade which was very helpful.At checkout Jacque stood out in the rain to hail us a cab, then helped us with our luggage... Now that's CUSTOMER SERVICE.We are thankful to have found this hidden gem and look forward to staying at the 414 Hotel during our next trip to NYC.David & JayR from Las Vegas, NV

We've been to many hotels in NYC and this one takes the cake! Clean, warm & a convenient location and the service was by far the best we've ever received. They serve a wonderful breakfast and wine and cheese during a happy hour which are all complimentary. The owners are as helpful and friendly as can be. The staff was just wonderful as well. We've stayed in 5 star hotels that didn't have the special touches that this one did! We can't say enough about this hotel except that we know where we are staying the next time we return to NYC,

...will enjoy a room facing 46th street. I have stayed in a variety of Manhattan hotels over the past 40 years and have never spent a more miserable night (possible exception- a group of conventioneers partying all night in the room next to ours in the Marriott Marquis).We stayed one night and would not have stayed another. The highest floor rooms are on the fourth floor, and the sporadic trucks, horns, sirens, and people loudly conversing in the street on a night mid-week made sleep impossible. The windows do not block the sound from the street at all. Many hotels throughout the city have soundproof windows, and reasonably so. Based on other reviews I was surprised at our experience. I would not expect a guest to stay in one of the rooms facing 46th street without supplying earplugs and some sort of white noise machine- and even those measures might not work.The hotel is very clean, the bathrooms large, the staff friendly.The breakfast is unexceptional; you'll get better at one of Manhattan's many Marriotts.The location is very convenient to the theatre district without the Times Square crowds.I really wanted to like this hotel and we wanted to patronize a small non-chain hotel. At a cost of over $300 for the night, this was not a decision I will make again.

The Hotel 414 is a fabulous place to stay. The rooms are impeccably clean and beautifully decorated, the beds are super comfy and the staff are beyond belief. Susan the owner is the nicest person you will ever meet. She made us feel welcome from the moment we walked thru the door. I felt like I was staying with a very close friend who truly knew how to make her guests feel welcome. We were there to celebrate my Mom's 80th birthday and Susan went out her way to ensure our stay was PERFECT. The location is terrific, close to Time Square and the Broadway theatre district, and hundreds of excellent restaurants within a very short walking distance. This small boutique hotel is truly a hidden gem. I am an airline employee and have travelled the world over, I have never enjoyed a hotel more nor have I ever been treated so wonderfully. The courtyard between the two properties is like a little garden oasis in this bustling city. To be able to sit outside and read a book and sip on a glass of wine or share stories with other guests was a real treat. I can't wait for my next visit to the PERFECT Hotel 414. Selena W

Hotel 414 is an absolute joy. From the minute you walk in the door, Susan and her staff are doing everything they can to make your stay perfect. They are so helpful with tips on where to go and what to do, reservations for restaurants, theater, car etc. This hotel is a hidden gem - the most cosy, friendly, hospitable, homely, warm feeling in a hotel, that I have ever experienced. Situated just a short walk from Time Square and yet away from the overcrowded streets. The breakfast is lovely - sitting in front of the fireplace (or in the courtyard in the summer) with the other guests, sharing experiences of NYC. And even better is the daily Winehour, where you can enjoy a glas of wine or even whisky, and different cheeses. This is the most enjoyable time to relax after a day out in NYC and before going out for the evening.I can only say, that we know for sure where to stay for our next NYC trip.

We've been to New York many times but it was our first experience at the 414 Hotel and it was lovely. From the moment we opened the door, we were greeted with warmth and care from the staff. It's a small boutique hotel and we enjoyed the morning continental breakfast and the evening's wine and cheese reception...both included and a great way to meet other travelers, many from other countries. Outside you are right in the middle of Manhattan, near the theatre district, Times Square, and Fashion district with easy access to the subway. Our room was fresh, modern and clean. It's a walk up so just make sure you're okay with going up and down the stairs. For us, the 414 Hotel felt like home.

We just returned from a long weekend in the city where we stayed at 414 Hotel. I was looking forward to our stay after a flurry of e-mails between the owner and me about room location. She could not have been more accommodating or more welcoming. In fact, the entire staff extends itself to make sure each guest is known by name and is completely satisfied. We had so much fun at the happy hour each evening where guests and friends mingled and shared stories of High Line hikes and Broadway plays. This morning we had Susan's homemade challah bread at breakfast. I have never stayed at a hotel quite like this in any major city, but I am already making plans to return. The next time will feel like we are staying with good friends.

I stayed at the 414 for the first time Tuesday night, November 11, on a very quick business trip to New York. Having spent lots of time in New York over the years, I know the city pretty well and wanted a nice, comfortable, convenient place to stay without all the frills that run the per night prices up into the hundreds. The 414 turned out to be just that. It's a lovely, small, intimate hotel on a nice street with trees and with a charming little courtyard. My room was on the street side but was very quiet and with an extremely comfortable bed where I got a great night's sleep. Huge wall-mounted flat screen TV, Wi-Fi, large well-equipped bathroom, fridge in the room. It was really the largest, most pleasant reasonably-priced room I ever remember having in the city. The location in Hell's Kitchen is central and easy for midtown and downtown, short stroll to the theatre district, comfortably walkable to Central Park headed north and the end of the High Line headed south. The staff and owners are extremely knowledgeable, friendly and helpful; the atmosphere is like a European B&B with wine and cheese in the evening and breakfast in the morning. Great restaurant selection within a five-minute walk. I'll certainly recommend it to friends and family and stay there again my next trip to NYC.

Stayed 5 nights in October. Very quiet room in the "back" beyond the courtyard, no night noises. Comfortable, clean room. Good sized bathroom. Great location for theatre goers. Friendly, helpful staff. Only made it to 1 breakfast and 1 wine/cheese but definitely nice feature. One minor nit-picky negative, hardly worth mentioning, but the room decor is blah, boring, colorless. There is a nice, homey touch which I won't spoil for you. You'll notice it immediately upon entering your room.

I have stayed at 414 Hotel twice. Once was a romantic get away with my husband and the second time for a girls get away. Both stays surpassed my expectation. Rooms are cozy and clean. Susan her staff treated us like family. Wine and cheese provided us a great opportunity to mingle and meet new people. Location is fantastic. Looking forward to our next visit.

Hotel 414 is a great hotel at a great location. Walking distance to Javitz Conference Center, Times Square, Top og the Rock, Restaurant strip etc etc. We have stayed here twice and are very satisfied both times. Good and friendly staff, nice breakfast :) We will stay here again!

Absolutely we would stay here again.. Perfect location, 5 min to Times sq, fabulous food down the street.. Very clean room.. Shower pressure excellent and comfortable bed. I stay in a lot of hotels for work and I have to say this place is miles better that some of the big names. It was fabulous to be welcomed and remembered .What makes the difference with 414 is the service with a smile.. Susan and her team most definitely go above and beyond to make sure your stay is wonderful. They have complementary continental breakfast in the morning, and are always willing to help with direction's, tickets and your plans for the day.It was lovely to chat to Mary in the evenings sharing our daily story's, she is a credit to the team.By the end of our stay we didn't want t leave. We were always greeted with a smile nothing is to much trouble for them. In the most wonderful sense it was a home away from home..We would most definitely recommend this place and stay here again..Thank you..

Great location, very central, spotless, great ambiance, excellent service, but above all, the welcome you receive when arriving, to the warm and inviting complimentary cheese and wine served early evening, to the delicious breakfast and the personal attention is abundantly clear that these folk love what they do and their priority is making their guests feel welcome and at home. Nothing is too much trouble for Susan and her staff who are so helpful and cannot do enough for you. I have travelled all over the world and have stayed at many hotels but have never been made to feel so welcome as I did at this one. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and cannot wait to return!

Nice small comfortable hotel , centrally located, subway, walking distance to most of the great things New York has to offer.Susan and her staff were friendly, caring and easy to talk to. Always ready with helpful advice of places to visit, times to visit, current broadway shows and just helpful in allowing us to explore and enjoy New York.A very comfortable home away from our home.

Great location, very convenient to Times square, theatres and Central Park. Wonderful hospitality from Susan and her staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and will certainly return. So much better than an anonymous chain hotel.

This hotel is lovely and clean, but it is the staff who are the stars. Nothing is too much trouble whether it is helping you with your cases, printing off documents for you or helping you plan your day ahead with expert local knowledge. It really was like a home from home rather than a hotel.We were spoiled for choice each morning at breakfast and fueled up for a good portion of the day.The hotel was only three blocks from time square and very handy for the blue subway line that can take you to Greenwich Village, High Line Park and World Trade Center which we did. Both myself and my Mum thoroughly enjoyed our time at the hotel and would book again if we venture to New York again.

Hotel 414 is like a home away from home. Susan and her staff are so friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and each morning we were able to discuss with other guests and staff plans and recommendations for the day. The Hotel is in a great position - two blocks from Times Square and has excellent restuarants near by, "Becca is a must". We will be back to Hotel 414.

We found this wonderful hotel by TripAdvisor, and Thanks for that.This fantastic nice little hotel in the center of New York makes you feel more at home, than away. From the moment you step inside the door, you a welcomed as one of the family.All the staff is very very friendly, and takes very good care of you, and they are more than helpfull, in tips and what to do and see, when you are here. -A big BONUS: Winehour; every day, here is winehour in the sitting area/lobby, here they serve nice wine and cheese (for free), and it´s a time, where the guest sit down and talk, and share tips, and just talk to one another -Great !!!IT´s a highlight !!!The breakfast is served in the "lobby area", so once again you are sitting amongst the other guests and having your nice and fresh breakfast in the most cosy atmosphere. IT´s yet another higlight !!!We can only recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

The staff is very nice and warmhearted. Our Child was very happy to stay at This hotel. The rooms are clean and without noice. The location is good. You can walk to time square, rockfeller center and central park. A lot of restaurants are near the hotel.

We had such a great time in this hotel! the staff is really fiendly, the rooms are clean and nicely sized! The breakfast is great as well as the complimentary wine and cheese in the afternoon! I would love to come back again! We were able to get an very early check in and they offered to keep our luggage in the last day! And the price, compared to the other hotels was great as well!

Following a friend's recommendations, I spent a night at 414 this week--and could not get over how charming, warm, and civilized it was. The decor was simple and elegant; the rooms nicely sized, clean, and comfortable; the breakfast and wine and cheese wonderful. There is a really unusual emphasis on customer service and satisfaction here. It is a bit of the best of Europe right in midtown Manhattan.

This is the only neighborhood you'd want to stay in to experience all the great things New York has to offer. I lived 4 blocks north of this hotel on a similarly quaint, charming side street for ten years.When my condominium sold much sooner than expected recently, I decided to stay somewhere nearby for a few weeks to finish business.I wanted a small hotel with a personal touch that was not exorbitantly priced or in the middle of the touristy areas East of Ninth Avenue and especially East of Eighth. By walking around my neighborhood, I discovered this gem of a hotel with a its very welcoming presence. Behind its signature bright red door were capable employees and two extremely thoughtful owner/hosts who took care of their guests unlike anything I'd ever experienced. No kidding .. they understand how to make everyone feel comfortable.What I liked most, though, was meeting individuals and couples who were from all parts of the globe. I teach American and foreign university students in Manhattan so perhaps I'm a little more outgoing than most ... but I noticed something about the quality if the guests that I met at breakfast time and during the daily complementary wine and cheese get-togetherness in the afternoons that led to long conversations and in two cases, people I intend to visit overseas.I've written this because I believe in showing appreciation for hard work and professionalism, and because I believe that most people don't take the time to do so. You could ask for a better deal than Hotel 414.

My wife and I stayed here during an extended weekend trip to NYC. It was wonderful for our purposes. It backs right up to Restaurant Row, and is about a 15 minute walk to Broadway. The room was bigger then I expected, and was very clean. The front desk folks were always helpful and polite. Also, the complimentary breakfast was a good value. It is worth pointing out that there is no elevator on the premise, so the initial lugging of baggage up the stairs was a PITA, but only needs to be done twice lol. This will probably be the only place we stay when visiting the big city.

My partner and I were both very sad to be leaving New York a few days ago, obviously because of what a fantastic city it is, but also because we would miss the 414 Hotel and the lovely people who work there. Before I go into more detail, I'll start by staying that if you're looking for a welcoming, warm and charming B&B which is conveniently located for the subway then look no further! Just book the 414 Hotel. We stayed in a Queen Size room on the 3rd floor overlooking the inner courtyard and slept very well for the whole week. The 414 in general is peaceful and relaxing, but our room in particular was a delightful escape from the hustle and bustle of New York. I'm a light sleeper and slept like a dream throughout my stay! The room itself was incredibly spacious, very clean and the bed was comfortable. A safe was provided free of charge (always a bonus) and after a long day treading the streets of NYC, we would come back and relax for an hour or so, watch the indulgent flat screen TV (a great guilty pleasure) before having some cheese and wine with the other guests. Yes, the 414 provides free cheese and wine in the evenings! Such a lovely way to meet other guests.Each morning we'd look forward to heading downstairs and having breakfast. My partner is a coeliac and Susan went above and beyond to provide a gluten-free breakfast for him each morning (gluten free bread and granola, in addition to the yogurts and fruit that were available). This was such a thoughtful touch and we both very much appreciated it! I would indulge in a tasty, freshly baked bagel and the best cream cheese I've tasted. And the coffee is probably the best you'll find locally (I got a few takeaway coffees from delis in the are and the 414's coffee wins hands down).A couple of people have mentioned that the subway is not as conveniently located as it could have been however we did not find this to be the case - as mentioned below by Susan, we would daily use the subway and would walk approximately 5-7 minutes to the 44st entrance. To me, that is a close subway entrance! So please don't be put off by other reviews, the subway is close once you've found the best entrance/exit.Last, but definitely not least, are the people who work in the 414 Hotel. Everyone was friendly and welcoming, but a special mention has to go to Susan and Drew, Each morning Susan would greet us with a big smile and would go out of her way to ensure that everyone had what they needed. She would share her expert knowledge of the city to make sure we could make the most of our time in NYC and over breakfast she would listen to everyone's stories from the previous day. And Drew is one of the most welcoming and cheerful people I've met! Such a great person to welcome you into the hotel at the end of your day.So to sum up, we loved the 414 Hotel. It's in a good location, the rooms are spacious and clean, it's quiet and peaceful and the people are warm and friendly. The breakfast is a perfect start to the day and the cheese and wine each evening is a lovely touch. Just book it!Rach and Nick.

What a great place to stay -friendly helpful staff, breakfast in the morning and a wine and cheese happy hour in the afternoon. Our room was spacious, clean, and quiet. The 414's location in midtown is very convenient and walkable to theaters and fabulous restaurants. Subway stations are quite close making it a perfect spot for us on our first "real" trip to New York City. Susan, Andrew and staff are to be commended for their great service. I am already recommending the 414 Hotel to friends and relatives.

Great hospitality from the 2 principles. Good backup from staff. Happy hour was a feature with good wine and spirits served gratis. Only real negative was the distance from an underground station - right in between two.

so, to start the things you expect, the room was clean and spacious; air conditioner and working in october; very pretty good wifi; breakfast and then the afternoon cheese and wine (which was not what you expect and 414 Hotel is filled with these surprises); great location near everything and yet not in the middle of craziness; metro station quite near; lots of good food and bars nearby; friendly, helpful staff and then much more... susan and her crew just made a good stay with what you expect (or hope really) into an exceptional, most amazing stay. you get a friend, a friend you knows exactly what you would like and make great suggestions, and so because of susan a great trip to New York (cause well, really New York is just amazing) turned into something even better. I can't imagine anyone staying any place BUT in 414 Hotel, I mean if you are going to New York, then what you are looking for is 414 Hotel, may you be so lucky to find a room. The only downside is that I would be always looking for something similar any other place that I go and I would always miss 414 Hotel and Susan.

We 3 friends (2 new to NYC) all voted to choose 414 after the friendly reception on the phone, and willingness to accommodate us in one room for 10 days. The location, and warm staff reception upon arrival gave us a sense of ease after the cab ride from the airport. We looked forward to each day's morning breakfast (cereal, muffins, juice, coffee), and tried to make it home for evening's gathering (even better: wine, cheese, whiskey).Susan, the generous proprietor, offered us additional entertainment ideas (our list was already long), and so we were able to take in another play, and found a different classy world at Birdland Jazz (in the neighborhood) that we would have missed. The hotel provided a list of nearby restaurants that helped in our plan to eat in a different country every night. Mary and Drew were welcoming audiences when we chattered our way home at night, full of the day's story.The location and access to sites and subways were perfect. We walked the streets of NY, and could easily reconnoiter back to 414 at night (past midnight a few times). We went in for dinner at one of the many nearby restaurants at 10:30p, and had a snack run to a nearby deli after 11p (the guy behind the counter looked up and said "Oh, Hello!"). We found a nearby bar we thought of as our own by the end of our stay.Susan, Jacqui, Mary, Drew - they are so good at what they do. And the best part is they seem to enjoy it. Staying at the 414 gave us a comfortable home base for our NY adventure, and we will always tell our trip story with 414 as the centerpiece!

Great stay. If I had to be critical, it felt slightly like a b&b (like you were staying in a home) and therefore perhaps suited to an older traveller. Overall had a great stay, beautiful breakfasts, lovely rooms, quiet location - out of the tourist hustle of midtown -, super friendly staff.

I never review anything, but I have to let everyone know about 414. I stayed there recently for four nights and found it to be a welcoming, friendly oasis in one of the busiest cities in the world. Tucked in a quiet tree lined street just off the madness of the theatre district and right beside restaurant row, it somehow seems to be convenient no matter where you are. The rooms are sizeable, clean and attractive, the staff are charming, engaging, likeable and seemed genuinely interested in their guests- It's a wonderful combination. 414 makes every other hotel seem impersonal, like you're just a room number at breakfast, anonymous and unimportant. It's like staying at the house of a friend or relative you really like. Every night coming back from seeing the sights, it just felt like home.

Having just returned to NZ from a trip of a lifetime to NYC we are still buzzing...the experience we had at 414 was a huge part of that. Thanks must go to Susan, Jacqui, Mary and Drew who helped us with anything we needed and made us feel so welcome. Loved the courtesy happy hour cheese and wine time, and the cosy breakfast room that enabled us to meet up with many travellers from Canada, England, Australia and Norway! Our stay was for 7 nights, and we found the location ideal for all our experiences from visiting MOMA, walking the highline, Top of the Rock, Central Park, Shopping on 5th Ave and eating in the Hell's Kitchen area. We used the affordable week pass on the subway to get to places further afield Umbrellas were provided for guests....we needed them one day! The only negative was due to the noise from road construction when heavy steel plates were laid over the road at night, so ear plugs were necessary. Would certainly return though, but would ask for a room at the back. Our room was always clean and serviced well. It's a pretty hotel with high standards, in a pretty street with pretty awesome staff! Well done Susan and your team.

We just left New York today, and I felt compelled to write this review. It was the first time in New York for myself and my wife. We stayed at the 414 for four nights. What a beautiful little place. The room was nice and clean and the bed very comfortable. We had a room at the front , which as other people have said, could be a bit noisy, but the street is quiet. There was some construction going on during our stay and you could here cars driving over metal plates all night. Every night, there was a wine and cheese reception which was a great way to meet other travellers, and every morning there was a nice breakfast; a great way to start the day. Many restaurants are close by, and the hotel will recommend the better places. Convenient location to do almost anything. Susan was a gracious host and her staff are incredible. It felt like staying at a relative's place rather than a hotel. Very european feel. WE WILL BE BACK, when we return to New York. A great place

Managed to get our "old room" back ( 102). Actually I don't know if it is the best, but it works.This second visit was sort of like coming home, but it also gave some fresh impressions both positive and negative. Positive: Helpfull staff, free cheese-biscuit-wine treat in afternoon, comfortable bed, bath with good size. Neighbourhood excellent for food. Negative: Fan noise in back yard, breakfast very simple, especially after a few days (stayed 6).

This hotel is located on a charming residential street in Hell's Kitchen, one block from Restaurant Row, and just 2 blocks from Broadway. It consists of two apartment buildings with a pretty little courtyard in the middle. We were given a room in the back building. It was very quiet and we heard no noise throughout the night. A continental breakfast was even more delightful while sharing it with the other guests-comparing notes of what to do and what shows to see. Each evening at 5, they also offer a selection of cheese, wines and liqueurs-a nice respite between day and evening activities. The staff is delightful but we have to point out Drew who was extremely helpful and courteous. Good luck with your studies!! This hotel is much more like a Eurpoean B and B. If you are looking for a bit of charm in a large city, you could do no better than this hotel. We were able to walk everywhere-the location and staff can't be beat.

My wife and I stayed at 414 on the end of our NYC/New England trip. Everything was perfect. It was a pleasure to meet the inn keepers and socialize with the other guests. Our room was somewhat small, but clean, comfortable and quiet. The outside courtyard is great for relaxing in the good weather. Complementary breakfast, and wine and cocktails in the afternoon are great additions as well. The location is perfect for the theater and lots of great restaurant choices. It is a little walk to the subway, but not so far as to be limiting.They are very helpful in making reservations and airport travel arrangements.We would definitely recommend Hotel 414. This will be a place to stay next time we are in NYC (very soon I hope).

We loved hotel 414. If you want comfy rooms, healthy brekkie, friendly helpful staff, great location and an opportunity to chat with other travellers...this is the hotel for you. We loved Hotel 414. If you want comfy rooms, healthy brekkie, friendly and super helpful staff, great location and an opportunity to chat with other travellers at happy hour...this Manhattan hotel is for you.

We chose 414 based on previous TA reviews and could not have been more happy with our decision. Stayed 5 nights from 22 September after a cruise. Our requested room (courtyard level 2) was ready for our midday arrival and the warm greeting from Susan and Jackie was so reassuring. The room was adequately spacious, plenty of storage, clean and large bathroom. If only one criticism the aircon was rather noisy but at this time did not need it on all the time.The help and information provided by Susan and her staff was constant and relevant - maps, restaurant recommendations, tips on subway use and directions and Susan also got us a great deal on theatre tickets.Location? Absolutely perfect - 2 blocks from Times Sq In a very safe environment.Great continental breakfast and generous wine and cheese hour with guests every night made us feel so at home.To Susan, Jackie, Mary and Drew - thank you for making our NY experience all the richer - we hope we can return some day.

I stayed at 414 for my second time last week (mid September.) I travel to NYC five times a year and would pick 414 EVERY time but it is a favorite of others so is often booked. It is a very pretty, comfortable, clean and safe hotel. By NYC standards, the bedroom and bathroom is large and roomy, beds are very comfortable and general feel of the hotel is genteel and welcoming. There is continental breakfast in the morning (with the best coffee in town) and sometime a complimentary wine reception in the evening. (I missed that due to work but next time!!) Location is perfect. My work takes me to Times Square but I hate being in the thick of all that tourist traffic so 414 is the perfect strolling distance and set just outside the bustle. The best restaurants are in Hell's Kitchen so great food and drink are at the doorstep. Finally, with al the above perks you would think this is an expensive hotel but it is one of the most reasonably priced in the city without giving up a luxurious feel. Cheers to 414. See you again soon!

414 hotel is a find! Great location being close to all the great restaurant on 9th avenue. Rooms are lovely and well appointed. The owner and staff are attentive and so committed you having the best visit ever. The neighborhood is safe and close to public transportation. Each day breakfast and happy hour are served inside and weather permitting, outside. This place is a keeper.

We totally enjoyed our stay at the 414. We felt like we were staying at a friends house rather than a hotel. The staff is great, very helpful with anything you need. The location is great, easy walk to Time Square, subways, restaurants and more. Very clean, nice choice of light food for morning breakfast. We will stay there again if we ever get a chance to go back to New York.

Warm and friendly, a mix between hotel and B&B. avoid the front bedrooms if you can, street noise can be annoying. Growing up in jersey city made it less annoying :) very nice caring owners willing to go the extra mile if you need it. Very close to the action. a nice breakfast and b4 dinner drinks all on the house. A warm personal email thanking us for the visit. I'll be back. Thanks

At this point....I never have to call another hotel when traveling to NYC!! The 414 creates such a sociable environment, with casual breakfast and a swank happy hour. The patrons adopt the personality of the staff which creates a familia environment!! The rooms are adorable and modern. It's a bright ray of sunshine inside of what could be deemed a cold NYC. The location is surrounded by dozens of restaurants, the theater district and the garment district. Drew (midnight staffman) is super accommodating and so friendly!! I appreciate an owner that is accommodating!! But what a treasure it is to find staff that take such stock in there company!! Susan (owner). Has truly created a special special place in NYC!! Thanks a bunch!! See you soon!!

My wife and I just spent our 20th Anniversary at the 414 Hotel and everything about the stay was wonderful. Susan, Andrew, and the rest of the staff have raised the bar for customer service and making you feel at "home." They were helpful with finding parking, restaurant suggestions and reservations, and finding a location the sold a pair of shoes that my wife was looking for. The rooms are cozy and inviting; and don't miss out on Happy Hour and Breakfast as they are a great way to meet your fellow travelers and Susan and Andrew. Even though they did not have beer at Happy Hour, Andrew went out of his way to find one for me. I have travelled extensively both domestically and overseas, and would rate the 414 Hotel amongst my favorite places that I have ever stayed. We will definitely be back to see them again.

My wife and I stayed at 414 for a few days as a mini-honeymoon. This place is in the heart of Hell's kitchen, a few blocks from Times Sq and Broadway. we saw a great play literally 3 blocks away, found a great jazz/swing/"supper" club on the same street... yet, it was pretty quiet at night and we slept great.It is a 22 room hotel in a residential neighborhood and the place is a departure from the giant mega-hotels and features personal, friendly service. They had a chilled bottle of champagne in our room as we got there and couldn't be kinder or more helpful.By NYC prices, the place was hundreds of dollars cheaper than other places in the area. The room was small, but clean and neat. they don't have 50 inch wide screen TVs, but who goes to Hell's Kitchen and stays in their room anyway???It has the feel as if you actually lived in this neighborhood.We would absolutely stay here again.

What a wonderful hotel! Great staff, warm ambiance and super convenient location. The room and bathroom were a good size, nicley decorated, and very quiet. We enjoyed the breakfast that was offered every morning and the wine and cheese happy hours (on the house!) in the early evening - such a fun way to meet the other guests. The staff kindly left a bottle of bubbly and chocolates in our room when they learned we were celebrating our 25th anniversary. So thoughtful! Hotel 414 has loads of charm; we can't wait to go back! :D

We had an amazing stay at the 414 Hotel just off the main drag West of Times Square in Hells Kitchen, surrounded by the relative quiet of residential streets and close to the best restaurants in New York From the moment we arrived we sensed that nothing was too much bother for the staff at the 414, all were really helpful, welcoming and would go out of their way to help. They really seemed to have an intuitive understanding of what we needed – like breakfast at 5am on our day of departure for example! We really can't thank the staff enough. The 414 hotel is very unique. We felt very relaxed and able to do our own thing (self-service breakfast and tea and coffee whenever we needed) without feeling intruded upon, whilst still feeling supported with advice or help with whatever was needed. We loved the tranquillity of the square in the hotel, between the two main bits of the hotel, where we had our breakfast every morning, with just the birds for company! The 414 has a wonderful calm feeling about it and is the perfect retreat from the craziness of New York, whilst being a stone’s throw from all the action and some brilliant restaurants. Every day we sat out front of the 414 on the benches and watched the crazy world go by with fresh coffee. That is an experience in itself in New York! It felt to us like the 414 was designed for our type of people, which we have never had before. All the little things just seemed to be right and all added up to a break we will always remember – we will be back! Thanks 414

I reviewed the 414 Hotel back in April 2014, and gave it glowing marks. I was apprehensive about staying there a second time, thinking that it would not live up to its lofty standards. But I was wrong. We stayed there over Labor Day weekend and the location, staff, cleanliness, affordability all lived up to their previous high standards. This hotel is in a great location if you're staying in Midtown and want to be near the Theater District and Restaurant Row. Even Rockefeller Center is an easy stroll away. You're only two blocks away from Times Square, but when you walk outside, you could almost hear the birds chirping on the tree-lined street. The staff is excellent, Susan and Andrew are good people, run a great place and hire good people (that's you Mary and Zack). The place is immaculate and don't miss the back courtyard which is a quiet oasis. The hotel is reasonably priced for NYC and for what the hotel offers. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for quiet home away from home.

Hells Kitchen, New York just down from Times Square so position, position. This is a small boutique hotel whose staff go out of the way to ensure your stay is a great one. We arrived very early morning but that was no trouble. We were fully assisted with our baggage which was stored for us. Later in the afternoon when we returned to check in, it was all in our room. We were offered breakfast gratis because we probably looked frazzled after driving into New York but it was such a welcoming thing for them to do. Happy Hour or two is offered every night from 5.30 to 7.30 where you get to mingle with staff and guests and the owners are often there for a chat. Sue one of the owners also doubles as the Manager and if she is not one of the best hotel managers we have met she is close to it. And her wonderful staff are not far behind in offering a wonderful New York hotel experience. They all were pleased to offer us any assistance they could. If you have trouble climbing stairs ask for a room on lower floors and if you prefer a king bed there are rooms with two doubles. We had a queen bed which was adequate for us. Air conditioning is needed and works well. The outside noise from wonderful New York is muted. The value is excellent. We recommend this hotel highly. We will be back if we are lucky enough to get to New York again. Thank you 414 for a great stay.

Our stay in New York City was made fabulous by a tiny hotel tucked away in lovely neighborhood so very close to so many attractions. Beautiful tree lined street and clean neighborhood. What a little paradise! The wonderful touches added on by the staff made our stay very special. It felt like they were opening up their home to us. Their interest in us & our vacation was truly heartfelt. We thank you so very much for our 35th anniversary treat. We are & willl continue to recommend your little paradise to all we meet.

This was my 2nd stay at the 414 Hotel, I come to NY every 3 months and always struggled finding a decent place to stay.This was a different experience, warm and friendly staff, good sized rooms with great design and very comfortable beds (very important to me). My business associates came at happy hour and we had a great meeting out in the courtyard.Definitely coming back!

My husband and I stayed here for 6 days in August. Our stay here helped make this one of our favourite vacations ever! The hotel is located just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of a Times Square but close enough to all the great restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. The owners genuinely cared about our time at their hotel and were very informative about things to see and places to eat. The breakfast was a great way to start the day and the wine and cheese was a nice way to take a break. Rooms were clean and comfortable and very quiet. It was a great hideaway in the middle of a big city. I would stay here again and again. Thank you to Susan and Andrew for the amazing customer service.

There is not one thing bad I can say about this hotel. From the staff, to the rooms, to the cleanliness, to the location, to the overall experience, the 414 Hotel excelled them all! My husband and I stayed there this past weekend and loved it! We were accompanied by my parents who were equally satisfied. The staff were GENUINELY nice and really made you feel comfortable!! The rooms were actually spacious for a typical NY hotel and super clean! The breakfast and happy hour are a plus you do not find in most city hotels and allow you the chance to enjoy conversation with family or fellow visitors (especially in the beautiful courtyard!). Thank you 414 for everything this past weekend! We truly enjoyed it and will be back!

We just stayed three nights at Hotel 414 in New York City and the staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a renovated brownstone and has a great location on 46th St., near theatres, restaurants and two subway stations. The rooms are a good size and very clean. They are a little dated and the air conditioner is loud, but the owner told me that they were going to be starting a room renovation program the week after we left, so the hotel should be even better next time we visit. The manager's daily wine and cheese hour is also a very nice touch. You get all of the above at a very reasonable price. This is a very good hotel.

My son and I recently stayed at the 414, we love love love this hotel! The location is excellent, close to Times Square but far enough away to be quiet. Our twin bed room was spacious with a lovely big bathroom and an excellent shower. Breakfast was good and the Cheese and Wine each evening gave us a chance to chat to other guests and the staff, share what we had done that day and swap tips about restaurants, museums etc. All of this was great, but far and away the best thing about this small, boutique hotel was the staff. Susan, Andrew and the staff are always ready to help with reservations, travel advice or reccomend a good restaurant. Everyone who works here is, without exception, friendly, helpful and fabulous. Almost impossible to single anyone out for a special mention, however I must commend Jackie on her fantastic knowledge of the subway, her written instructions never failed to get us to our destination! And it was always a pleasure to return to Drew's big warm smile. It is Susan's warmth, friendliness and genuine manner that makes the 414 such a pleasure to stay in, she really wants you to love New York as much as she does. So would we stay at the 414 Hotel again? Abso-bloody-lutely!

A gem in the big city ..a home away from homeAviv and Susan are amazing.Lovely breakfast and happy hour with good wine and cheeseThe location is top notch And above all Susan that brings light to the placeBe blessed. we'll definitely be back again josh judith zilinsky

Conveniently located, especially for shows and restaurants. Great staff. Willing to help get a reservation or available tickets. Susan and Andrew (and for that matter the entire staff) make you feel right at home. Plan an annual visit and stay at 414Hotel!

I and a friend had the pleasure of being guests at 414 Hotel recently. We simply love it. From the moment we arrived until the day of departure everyone of the staff had always a friendly smile for us. Susan and Mary were so sweet even before our arrival, helping us by email to get tickets, transfers and so on.In the evenings they have a wine and cheese gathering where the guests can interact. It was soooo nice to listen the multitude of accents and languages. Like us, it seems everyone there was feeling at home!!!I believe every detail was thought to give us the best experience. They also have a good breakfast, and excellent location.We were trying to avoid the big and impersonal hotels and found the PERFECT one!Next time in NY? 414 HOTEL for sure!!!

My husband and I have just spent 4 days at the 414. Fantastic location only 5 minutes from Times Square and lots of great restaurants. If you want the personal touch then this is the place for you. Everyone was so helpful with advice for first time New Yorkers. It's not fancy but the rooms are clean and pleasant. Continental breakfast was ample including cereals, fruit, muffins, bagels etc. Also a very nice touch having some wine and a cheeseboard in the reception each evening. My one teeny tiny complaint would be that the air conditioning unit in our room was a bit noisy. Not a problem if you don't mind wearing ear plugs. We very much hope to go back to NYC again and would definitely stay at the 414,

We stayed here 1 night for our anniversary. Great location, easy walk to theater, restaurants, Times Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they even surprised us with a bottle of champagne. Would definitely recommend and return.

From the moment you spot the red door and distinctive awnings on W. 46th, you know you are about to enter your home-away-from-home. In the bustle of NYC, it is a comfort to cross the threshold of Hotel 414, and enter a place that provides comfort and inspiration. If you are in the mood for socializing and broadening your horizons, you can have ongoing interaction and gather information from the international staff and your fellow guests. Every aspect of this hotel is a bonus worth commenting on. The owners and staff will anticipate every need; if you require anything, they step in to get it provided. I have stayed here multiple times over the last 10 years and the fun is trying different rooms, and the global variety of your guest-mates. Most guests enjoy conviviality and fellowship. My first morning, this trip, I talked to a lady from Tasmania and a couple from Liechtenstein. Persons from Rome, Paris, Fiji, England, New Zealand, Australia, Quebec, B.C., Toronto, were all new acquaintances of mine by the end of my 6 night stay. We fellow Americans tend to have kids or other family members living in NYC, whom we regularly visit. Everyone is welcome at 414; it stands alone at the top of my NYC hotel list. I have stayed at no fewer than 6 other hotels, four in this same part of town - and my husband has stayed in even more of the NYC places. Nothing compares favorably.

This hotel is brilliant. It's in a good location, couple blocks from Times Square & Subway, quiet at night, and the rooms are very nice and modern with good aircon, comfortable beds, and free Wifi. Apart from that it's the hosts that make this place a five star choice for my wife and I. The staff cater and chat with guests over wine & cheese with crackers between 5.30 -7pm. Perfect solace after a long day out.The hosts provide invaluable time saving advice about where to go and how to do it, all with a ready smile. It's like staying with friends, only better!

My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, and the experience was awsome, the staff make you feel so welcome and they are so helpful, this is was our first time in New York and the owner was so nice by helping us with direction to where we needed to go. He even asked if we needed him to come with us to the subway so we could get lost. Wow they have continental breakfast and also an happy hour with very nice spirits and wine in the afternoon. I can't say enough about this hotel. Minutes from Time square and next to the restaurant row. This hotel is a plus and I will return for sure.

This is our 3rd year staying at 414 while in NYC to see theater. It is perfectly situated -- close to theaters but quiet. The rooms are huge by NY standards, staff is fabulous, breakfast plentiful. A+

I recently had the pleasure of spending four nights at the 414Hotel. Although a stone’s throw from the madness of Times Square, the hotel is an oasis of serenity that charms its guests with a European-like ambience.The location of the 414Hotel is perfect for the intrepid tourist, and I was able to easily walk out the front door to venues such as Central Park, the Upper West Side, Grand Central Terminal and Greenwich Village. Two nearby subway stops on Eight Avenue, at 42nd Street and 50th Street, enable you to pursue more distant adventures. If you're in New York City for the Broadway shows, it will take you only a few minutes to stroll to the theatre.Although a light sleeper, I had no problem at night in a quiet room that overlooked the pocket-sized courtyard. The bed was comfortable, and my accommodation, dutifully kept clean by housekeeping, had all the requisite amenities.The 414 Hotel staff is without exception kind and always helpful. At breakfast, you’re likely to meet Susan, the manager, whose warmth and enthusiasm will have you fighting the urge to take her home with you.The only problem you’ll likely to have at the 414Hotel is the reluctance to leave when it’s time to check out.

We had a business trip to NY and stayed at the 414 Hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable, (even the cots!) and the service was perfect. We enjoyed the quality toiletries and the television to relax. Susan and Andrew were wonderful hosts! We would definitely stay there again.

We needed a hotel close to Foxwoods Theatre where my daughter was taking a workshop for Drama teachers. Initially there were three of us going on the trip, then four.I had to phone the hotel to make the booking to see what kind of rooms we could get and again when we added another person. From the moment of my first contact I knew this was the place to stay. Susan, Jacqueline and Maria made you feel like your trip was important to them and and helped us with any request big or small. I needed distilled water for a CPAP machine; waiting for me in my room. My sister didn't feel well one day, order a delivery of chicken soup from the diner on the corner? No Problem! Beds are comfy, bathrooms clean and modern, so close to all the theatres, restaurants and shopping we walked everywhere unless we were tired. Just a super place to stay, morning breakfast simple but good, wine and cheese in the evening every night if you have time! Rooms look just like the pictures on the website. Our room faced the front street and we fell asleep easily, not too much street noise. I would stay here again definitely if I am ever back in New York!

If you're like me and saw the photos of this hotel online, hoping they'd live up to half of your expectations, you'll be glad to know that they fully exceeded mine. I travel to NYC a lot for work and found that one of the hardest parts is not feeling like you have a home to come back to after a long hard day. But not at 414 Hotel. They went out of their way to make sure I always felt comfortable and well taken care of. Every evening a staff member was there to greet me and offer me a glass of wine and cheese and guide me to the patio area where I could relax and unwind. It was remarkable how cozy this place could feel in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Hell's Kitchen, so close to Times Square and the Theater District. Not only was I able to get a very restful sleep in my surprisingly spacious room in the back, but there was always breakfast waiting downstairs when I woke up so I'd be ready for the day. The staff and guests were all friendly and polite, making my stay even more enjoyable. Susan and her staff go out of their way to make sure you are happy and comfortable. It felt like a family. I am already looking forward to my next stay. Thank you for such wonderful hospitality!

It feels like we just spent 3 days at a friend's beautiful town home...Susan and her crew really know how to do it right...from walking in the door and being greeted with a cool towel on a hot summer's day until the moment we checked out, we were spoiled by everything about this place...great food and drink, great conversations with the staff and other guests, great guest rooms, great location, great everything....a welcome change from anyplace we'd ever stayed at.

A perfect gem in the middle of a harsh city. Susan and Andrew are the perfect hosts. The beds are super comfy, towels super fluffy and the room was perfect. Although we did not stay for the Happy Hour which featured cheeses and wines, we could tell that everything was put together with love. It was our anniversary and upon returning to our room after a show, there was a handwritten note congratulating us and a bottle of champagne in the fridge. How fabulous is that?Susan, Andrew and their staff did everything right and we felt like we were home. A wonderful, unpretentious place. Close to all restaurants and Times Square. A very quiet residential street. We couldnt have stayed at a better place. Thank you Susan, Andrew and Staff.We will DEFINITELY be back

My father and I traveled over the July 4th weekend. I booked this hotel over the phone. We stayed in the Premiere Queen room overlooking the courtyard. The location is superb. It's a short walk to central park, times square, and the theatre district. There are many subway stations close, allowing full access to the rest of the city. Some of the reviews complained of the noise from the air conditioning units. I didn't find this to be distracting at all. They are window units, and the noise level is no different than that of my own bedroom at home. Susan definitely lives up to the reviews on here. She is gracious, courteous, and very welcoming. The hotel is well appointed. Even though it was listed as a boutique hotel I found the rooms to be quite spacious. My father and I have traveled to Europe and stayed in boutique hotels that were barely larger than a shoebox. The bathroom was large, and the provided toiletries were nicely fragranced. The only issue that we ran into was the price. I was quoted a much lower price on the phone than I was actually charged. The hotel never sent me a confirmation email, so I had no proof of this. The gentleman at the desk quickly honored the price I was quoted, and corrected the problem. I was completely blown away at how gracious and accommodating they were. I will definitely be staying here the next time I return to the city.

We stayed at the 414 for four nights in June at the start of our US summer tour. We had struggled to find a hotel that had a good location, was reasonably priced and included breakfast - however the 414 had all of these. A 10 minute walk from Times Square, 5th Avenue and Central Park - located on a quiet residential street within a few minutes walk from some nice restaurants and the subway. The room was in the 4th floor (no lift unfortunately, but you soon get used to that) - simple, well maintained and had aircon. There is free wifi throughout the hotel too. Susan - who I believe is either the owner or Manager is awesome - she's very friendly and welcoming and is full of local NYC knowledge and gave us some great tips on places to eat, transport and things to see and do. A lovey little find that I would definitely recommend

Perfect location, walking distance from Time Square. It's very enjoyable to be able to walk to your hotel after a feast of musical at Broadway, and the perfect location of 414 hotel enabled it for us. The room is clean and cozy. Very friendly and helpful staff.

We recently stayed at 414 and it was an amazing little hotel, with the kindest staff and guests. It was extremely clean, and I am one of those people that inspects every inch for bugs and stray hairs, and our room was lliterally spotless. The rooms are indeed small, this is to be expected when one stays in NYC. With that being said there was plenty of room for me and my husband for a weekend stay. The staff was very friendly as well as the owners. They offer a happy hour of wine and cheeses which was a great time to relax and get to know the other guests. The continental breakfast was good and another rare find in the city. The hotel is located on a fairly quiet street a few blocks from time square and the subway, i say fairly because afterall it is in very nearly the heartbeat of NYC. We heard nothing from our room. There is a lovely little garden in the back which was a nice surprise and view from our room. There are not the amenities of the large chain hotels, and it has a casual atmosphere. So if you are looking for huge rooms, a pool, and bellhop you might want to check out the chain hotels. However, if you want a clean, comfortable hotel that gives you an experience in addition to a place to lay your head then hotel 414 is it. We will definitely be back.

The 414 Hotel gets highest marks for its warm hospitality and sense of community created by Susan and staff. The early evening wine and cheese was much appreciated and provided opportunity for guests to interact and pause before dinner and theatre, also a great time to exchange travel stories. The bed was comfortable, the breakfast was convenient and sufficient, and the garden patio offered lovely refreshment in the heat of the day.The room was roomy and comfortable, if in need of a coat of paint, which is in the plans, I understand.The 414 is conveniently located within walking distance of Restaurant Row, theatres, the subway and Times Square. A very good value all around.

Stayed in 414 Hotel for just one night and absolutely enjoyed it. Located in the part of Manhattan full of restaurants and just 10 minutes walk from Times Square. Friendly and helpful stuff. They do care about the quality of the service an comfort of their guests. Definitely recommend.

In the midst of frenetic, noisy, midtown Manhattan, very handy to the theatre district, there is 414 Hotel, family run, friendly staffed. This homey little hotel, almost B&B in character, is centered around a little terraced courtyard. it felt like a quiet, friendly retreat at the end of a city day. There was always someone to greet you warmly when you came 'home', with wine and cheese waiting. My garden view room opened up onto a lovely little courtyard and there was a well staffed kitchen available. The staff were attentive but not intrustive, helpful when needed. I would recommend it to others, and would surely return myself. Barb from Albuquerque
user_location: Los Ranchos de Albuquerque, New Mexico

review_body: We stayed here for four nights in June 2014 and had absolutely no complaints. There are many positives. These are the main ones: 1. the staff, in particular hotel manager Susan, were friendly and helpful. 2. The room was well equipped and a decent size with plenty of storage for our clothes and space for our two large suitcases. 3. The location being close to Times Square yet in a *relatively* quiet street away from the skyscrapers, 4. cheese and wine in the evening, enjoyed in the front room or better still in the small courtyard out the back.For us location was important - we wanted somewhere in midtown, that felt safe and comfortable but not in the heart of the tall buildings. Nearby there are the theatres, Circle Line Cruises on W 42th, Restaurant Row and the excellent Press Lounge bar. We also got a simple take-away one night from round the corner and borrowed plates and cutlery from the hotel. To find that Susan and her colleagues were so welcoming was an added bonus to the good location, and made this feel a little like a home from home.Note the stairs are quite steep and there is no lift but you will get help with you luggage if you need it. The air conditioning was a little loud but it did the job.

Very friendly helpful staff. Good breakfast and nice coffee. Really appreciated the glass of wine and cheese in the evening. Stairs didn't get easier but they recommended that we left our bags in the room and they brought them down as we had an evening flight which was great. comfortable bed.

Nice little hotel located less than 10 minutes walk from time square.The staff was really nice and always looking to help. There is a quit terrace on the back which is nice with the cheese and wine at 5pm.The only down side is the room design are a bit fade. Tips to choose the room: ask for a room that is facing the garden on the back instead of the street.

This was such a nice place to stay. Great price and a great location. The owner Susan was just so nice an welcoming. The happy hour, or as we ended up doing, happy hours was great. Nice front lobby with the table and food and wine. Hard to go back to the room. Also great guest to sit down with and chat. We definitely will be back for another stay.

This was our third time staying at the 414. We love it there. Just walk out the front door & you are in the heart of NYC yet the surroundings inside the hotel are peacefull & quiet. The rooms are comfortable & well appointed. Great shower with lots of hot water. Breakfast was always fresh with a nice selection of breads, pastries & cereals. We particullary enjoyed the daily happy hour. It was a terrific opportunity to meet other travelers & pick up a few tips on the best plays to see & restaurants to dine at. Susan & her terrific staff could not have been any nicer or helpful. We look forward to our next stay at the 414.

Recently stayed at The 414 Hotel for an extended weekend with my sister and best friend. This was our first visit to New York. After reading great reviews about this hotel, I knew it would be perfect for our girls getaway. The service is outstanding! You feel like you are staying at a friends home. Every morning you could walk down stairs and have fresh coffee, tea, juice, sweet breads, bagels, fruit and yogurt. Feel free to take it back to your room or sit around the large dining table in the lobby and read the daily newspaper. Afternoons brought ice tea, ice water and a great selection of cheese and crackers with wine. The staff was so nice and personable. Great location with lots of restaurants right around the corner. Great place!

New York itself was a wonderful vacation especially for my wife who had never been any place so busy or vertical in her life. The trip was made significantly better by the hospitality of the staff at the 414. If you are coming to New York stop and stay with these wonderful people...The entire staff went the extra mile to make our stay comfortable and our excursions into their city simple to navigate. We had a wonderful time and we would not hesitate to return here each time we visit.

We stayed at Hotel 414 in June and we absolutely enjoyed this place.The owner Susan is warm and her admises are really wise.Actually, all the staff is very friendly. The hôtel is very well located, closed to the Hell's kitchen's restaurants and 10 minutes walking from Times square.the subway station very closed takes you through all Manhattan.The rooms are nice and quite big. one problem: the very noise air conditioning but it really should be changed.A little effort on the daily maid would be appreciated.We'll recommend this hôtel to our friends and will definitely return on a future stay.
user_location: Grand Case, St Martin / St Maarten

review_body: This is a rare, rare find. It's everything a small, city hotel should be: clean, quiet, near enough to everything ... affordable. And a few things most places are not: kind, thoughtful and human. Do yourself a favor and check in to 414.

Just had an amazing 2 weeks in NYC topped off by staying at 414. So close to many attractions and the subway, but a block away from all the hustle and bustle, which just added to to the perfect location. Travelling for the first time to NYC from Australia we were unsure about which area to stay in but this was just perfect for us. The light breakfast each morning was enough for us to start our day of walking and enjoying what NYC has to offer. The evening 'happy hour' of wine, cheese and crackers was great way to finish out day and perfect to start our nights. Plenty of restaurants in this area to ensure we enjoyed a different culture most nights. Thai, Balinese, Mexican, Italian just to name a few. We even lucky enough to enjoy a breakfast here at 414 with a celebrity. Very exciting and an enjoyable hour just chatting. Apart from all of this, the staff at 414 are all wonderful. Thank you Susan and Andrew for your wonderful hospitality. I can't wait to return.

Well located hotel for broadway shows, Lincoln Centre, Hell's Kitchen restaurants, yet tucked away in a residential setting in a low rise building with a private back courtyard.Breakfast is included.The lobby could use some updating and the coffee could be better but these are minor complaints.

A big thank you to Susan, Andrew and the rest of the team at 414 Hotel. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely pay you a visit when we get the chance to return to NYC. The location was great - close enough to Time Square that you could easily pop out to catch a show, but far enough out that you didn't get caught up in the crowds. We really appreciated all of the wonderful restaurant recommendations in the area along with the local advice for seeing sites.See you in the future!

414 is close to some good restaurants, Time Square/Midtown, and (in the other direction) the Hudson River (and the Circle Line Pier/USS Intrepid complex). I had a good sized, good value room with big screen tvs and enjoyed the evening 'happy hour' during which guests mingle over a glass of wine. But its owner Susan's genuine hospitality that means that I'll definitely be back :-)

After a search for information about hotel in NYC. We chose 414 hotel, and indeed we were not disappointed about that. Hotel is located in a good location, quite close to Times Square. The hotel's staff are friendly and attentive, they always smile. Room and bathroom is clean. Rooms have bright colors and very comfortable bed. It have strong and fast wifi. Breakfast in the courtyard is actually a good idea of ​​the property. We will be back in the next time

My husband and I stayed our first night in NYC at the 414 Hotel. It was a last minute business trip that we decided to extend into the weekend for a mini vacation. It was our first visit to the city, and to be fair, we were looking for the typical tourist hotel in Times Square - high rise, big city view, in the heart of the hustle & bustle. To get that effect, we had booked 3 nights in the Intercontinental. However, their Wed night rate was ridiculously high so we were forced to find an alternative for that first night. Well, I'm glad it turned out that way - as we stumbled across the 414 Hotel during our search on Trip Advisor.While just a few blocks apart, what a contrast between the two hotels! It seems like the 414 gives you the personal, more intimate experience of what it might be like to be “a local” New Yorker. Sitting on quiet, tree-lined west 46th St., it’s a block over from Restaurant Row, and right at the convergence of Hell’s Kitchen and the Theatre District – very walkable to many popular locations. For check in, we arrived a little late for the nightly ‘happy hour’ social gathering – but no matter! Susan welcomed us to come back down to the courtyard for complimentary cocktails and snacks once we settled into our room. We did just that – joining her and another couple visiting from South Carolina. It was a thoroughly pleasant evening, allowing us to shake off the day’s travels, and get a good primer on things to do from our fine company. Afterwards, the staff recommended we try Becco just a block down Restaurant Row for dinner. We took them up on the recommendation and it was a great dinner. Our room faced 46th street (other rooms face the courtyard), but it was so quiet that we enjoyed a great night’s sleep in an extremely comfortable king bed. The rooms are characteristically cozy for a historic building, but comfortable. There is a mini fridge/mini bar in the room, as well as a flat screen TV, both of which were an unexpected surprise in a boutique style hotel. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate, with yogurt, cereals, fruit, muffins, juice and great, strong coffee. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful - from stowing our bags for the day, to hailing a cab, to restaurant suggestions, to just making everything easy and pleasant! Bottom line? We would stay here again in a heartbeat. The folks are friendly and real – you’ll get no blank stares here - but you will bet genuine customer service, good room value and a great location. Thanks to Susan and the rest of the team for an enjoyable and memorable stay in the heart of the city at the 414 Hotel.

Wow! What a find! In the heart of Hell's Kitchen, Susan, Mary and the staff at this wonderful boutique hotel made our stay warm, safe, rewarding and comfortable.Location is ideal, HH is great, beds and amenities are comfortable. Breakfast in a very Euro style outdoor patio charming.Only issue is the lack of elevators, which may out some off, but that is quibling. Highly recommended. We will be back again and again!

For our anniversary getaway, we wanted something different from a typical chain hotel. This was it! As soon as we arrived, we were welcomed with smiles and offers of information for nearby restaurants and destinations. They even helped lug our bags up to our room!Each time we returned from an outing, whoever was working asked how it was, and we'd swap stories. Breakfast in the courtyard was a treat each morning.The room was spacious, clean and cozy. The location was steps away from interesting bars, pubs, and shops.When we return to NYC, THIS is absolutely where we will stay!

Had the best stay ever in the big apple. Forget the big hotels. 414 has a great location near all the best restaurants in the city.The stuff was warm and very helpfull, especialy Susan and her husbend ( the owners). You will get great breakfast and a fantastic happy hour between 5:30-7:00 pm ....great wine and french cheese.Best hotel in the city. Dont go anywhere else.

The 414 was great! The staff, especially Susan, couldn't have been more helpful and hospitable. It definitely has a homey feel and you get to know some of the other guests as well. It's not a fancy frilly place but you have everything you need and the warmth of the place and the staff more than makes up for that. The staff learns your names and chats and it is great! It is an easy walk to times square, the theatre district and a lot of great restaurants. I would definitely recommend it!!

Me and my girlfriend stayed at the 414 Hotel for a week in may 2014. We had a nice stay in NY and this hotel was a great find. The rooms were good and the beds were comfortable. Stable and fast wifi. Great personal service from staff. Nice breakfast. Good location. We already recommended this hotel to some friends going to NY in september.

Stayed 9 nights in this hotel. There is nothing extraordinary about the building; it is an average (nicely kept) structure, very well located near Time Square and the main theaters. The secret of this wonderful Hotel is Susan, her husband and her team that make all the difference. They are always available, very helpful, trying to make you feel at home.Breakfast is ok, do not expect ham and cheese at the European style, they have croissants, bagels, cream cheese, yogurts, bread, butter, cereals… More than enough.The street is very quiet; it is like an oasis in the middle of the crazy Theater District. They have a delicious patio, where you can have your breakfast or your wine in the late afternoon, courtesy of Susan.The only BUT (that is common to all New York) is the noise of the air conditioning machines. If you decide not to use the air con and sleep with your windows open, you will have for sure a lot of noise from your neighbors…In spite of this, I will strongly recommend this hotel.
