The feeling of peace that you breathe here is quite unique.

Susan was the perfect hostess at 414 Hotel for this newcomer to the Big Apple. The room was cosy and a welcome respite after long days, sightseeing. A particular highlight was 'Happy Hour' in the main reception where guests mingle over wine, cheese and crackers. My room was situated facing the street though I was rarely bothered by noise.I'll certainly be back at 414 - it really felt like my 'home away from home'.

I absolutely love this hotel! The staff, the service, the location, all amazing! Steps away from great restaurants, shows, shopping and Times Square, yet quiet and cozy to get much needed rest and meet great people from all over the world. I have stayed at this hotel several times and will continue to do so on my frequent business trips to NYC. Bravo Hotel 414!

We have been to the 414 many times over a number of years. Always very good, the new owners and staff have made it even more welcoming and comfortable. It is a gem in midtown. Wonderfully convenient to the theater district. We hope to stay there many more times.

The room was nice.The view from the hotel room was lovely.The hotel staff was nice and friendly.Breakfast was fine.The hotel has a very convenience location.It's really close subway station and tourist spots in NYC.I'd like to stay again.

Simple, refined place that makes you feel at home. The owners and staff set the tone and all the guests buy into it: peaceful and sociable. You can expect to have conversations with the staff and with other guests, whether it's at breakfast, the evening reception, or just when passing through.The location is spectacular. Just two blocks over is Times Square and all the Broadway shows, but you'd never know all that was just up the street because it's just so quiet at 414. There are also a myriad of fantastic restaurants right outside the hotel's door. (But I do recommend going a few blocks north and hitting BarBacon!)First on our list for all future stays in NYC.

We stayed one week with friends in this little hotel and we have nothing but praise for it! We already knew there was no elevator and the stairs looked daunting! But before I knew it, Susan had my bag up the 3 flights! Susan and Andrew and all of the staff were so warm and welcoming and after long days of walking this exciting city, we felt like we were coming home at the end of the day.Rooms are well appointed and very comfortable, breakfasts plentiful and the wine and cheese at the end of the day was always a treat! The courtyard provided a much needed break from the hustle and bustle of the city.We particularly enjoyed the congeniality around the table, Susan's and Andrew's assistance in procuring us with theatre and transit tickets and the ambiance in general! We have no qualms in recommending this gem of a hotel to anyone and would return there on our next trip to NYC!

Hotel was clean, room was cute, roomy for two, and location was fantastic for where we wanted to be. We did not want to be in the middle of Times Square and by a noisy area, this was the perfect spot, yet it is walking distance from Times Square, theatre distance, restaurant row, etc.... We live in Long Island and just wanted the ease of not having to travel back and forth to the City two days, so we booked this adorable Hotel. It was a perfect place and we plan to stay again. The Management (Susan) was very nice and professional. The staff was also very nice while we were there. I honestly can say I have never had a nicer stay at a Hotel. I almost wish I didn't live in NY, so I could stay at 414 more. I have been spreading the word around :-)

Having been born and raised in New York it was time for us to visit after living in California for 12 years. I picked 414 Hotel because of great reviews and a cute picture on a website. Little did I know what a great choice I made. From the moment we arrived, I knew I had found a gem, never before have stayed somewhere that made such a wonderful impression. Susan was truly "the hostess with mostest" and contributed to a nostalgic visit never to be forgotten, We hope to get back some day because where else can you feel like you are home in a big city like New York?

My daughter and I wanted this visit to NYC to "feel" different. We did not want to stay in a big New York City hotel and Hotel 414 was the perfect place! I cannot say enough great things about it....the location, the personal touches of Susan and her staff, the small comfortable homey feel of the B&B, the room size, the small quaint courtyard, the great coffee and continental breakfast, ....... It was everything that we had hoped for....we hated to leave. !!! Thank you Susan and everyone - from your new BIGGEST fans from Texas!! Monica & Elise

We arrived in New York 12 May and also spent a few days in Philadelphia. We needed a hotel for our last night. As soon as we set foot in the door we received a great welcome and felt comfortable, we both knew we would like it here. Our room was'nt ready but the staff looked after our luggage whist we went out. On our return the luggage was in the room. The room was lovely and comfortable , nicely decorated and had everything you needed in it. hair-dryer, iron, ironing board, tv etc. It was our 30th wedding anniversary and a bottle of champagne and some chocolates were placed in our room. I was overwhelmed as we were only there for a night!Happy hour was good fun and on a nice day you can take your drinks and snacks to the outside courtyard. Breakfast was really good and you can help yourself to hot drinks throughout the day...using proper mugs...not paper ones!The staff our always there to have a chat with you about where we had been during the day, it was like talking to my friends at home and work.I love that the hotel was in a tree lined street, it was the proper New York Experience.The location was excellent, not far from Restaurant Row , Times Square but if you turn left out of the hotel and carry on walking you will find Intrepid Sea Air and Space Museum at one of the Piers, this is well worth a visit.I can carry on but will only repeat what others have said. We loved New York and I know we will be back and I know where we will be staying....go to 414 Hotel it is great, you wont be disappointed!.

Location is the most important feature of this well handled hotel. Managing people have been very nice.The whole environment is really cosy.They have been four beautiful days and I hope to come back soon.

We were very happy to have chosen 414 Hotel. It is a small and cosy place very pleasant in NYC. Susan is really so nice, helpful, friendly. We appreciated the "wine and cheese" moment to share and meet people from everywhere. I will recommend the place!

People from the hotel were very nice, very helpful and always giving good advices.The location is perfect (5min walk from Times Square and Metro stations).The hotel is very quiet and calm (the court area is very peaceful).

A perfect place to stay in NY, 5 min away by foot from Times Square.I realy felt like home thanks to Susan and the 414Hotel team : you made my trip so nice!Just one thing : the noise of the fridge in my room - I had to stop it for the night.Thank you again, I'll comme back to the 414Hotel for sure for my next trip to Big Apple!

The breakfast and the Happy Hours were top notch, the staff was very helpful (Mary and Susan in particular), and the location was great for doing everything on foot. The area felt safe to a couple of small town westerners.

This was my first time at this hotel, and I love the 414 for a lot of reasons. I certainly will stay here whenever I come to NYC. But I must say that it may not be for everyone. It is not glitzy, it is not loud, it is not "modern chic," and it has no elevator. If you are still reading then you will probably love staying here, and here why...It is charming. It is truly like living in a NYC townhouse or brownstone. It is a real experience of what living in New York is like. The rooms are quiet, have luxury amenities, double sheets on the very comfortable beds, no bedbugs and flat screen TVs among other things. The hotel is actually two brownstone buildlngs with a Parisian-like central courtyard between them replete with cafe tables, chairs and umbrellas. I spent a number of hours sitting under one of the umbrellas reading. While it is a "walk up" above the first floor, the ever-helpful and pleasant staff will help you out. And every single person I met who works at the hotel was friendly, accommodating and fabulous. The owners Susan and Andrew are really caring, and told me they are going to be continually upgrading the hotel, including new carpeting, introducing Feng Shui (I may have spelled that incorrectly) into the decor, etc.The front desk staff of Jackie,Fernando, and Drew were all unbelievably friendly and helpful. Even the cleaning staff was always saying hello and smiling.I was upgraded complimentary to a first floor King room, and found it to be spacious, comfortable and quiet. I imagine their other rooms are probably decent sized for a NYC hotel.The hotel offers free wifi and a nice breakfast - yogurt, cereals, hared boiled eggs, coffee, bakery goods, etc.. I am gluten free and Susan even went out and got GF bread and fruit for me for breakfast. Plus, there's a social hour every late afternoon with wine, and when Andrew is there he brings out his special Scotches for tastings.The guests that I've met are literate, friendly and seem eager to socialize with each other.I was amazed at how much Hells Kitchen has changed (for the absolute better) and this hotel is just one part of that neighborhood upgrade - there are TONS of really nice restaurants within one or more blocks of the hotel.This hotel may not be for everyone but it certainly is for me. Yay!

Great location and value. But even better service! A bed and breakfast feel right in the city. Love the wine and cheese social and the great comfortable vibe. We travel to NYC frequently and now will not stay anywhere else!

Perfect small hotel, really good value for your money. Close to Theatre District/Times Square. Clean, quiet and spacious room. Sufficient breakfast in a genial but small breakfast room. Dedicated advice on restaurants and places to see. We' ll be back again for sure.

I had a great stay. Susan and her team were very nice and helpful. The location close to Times square made it easy and convenient to discover the city. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I loved the wine and cheese break in the afternoon, great moment to share and meet people from all around the world. Not compulsory of course but I really liked this initiative.

Spent a week in NYC seeing Broadway and this hotel was perfect. Very friendly staff and cute hotel. Easy access to subways and cabs. Felt like going home at the end of the day. Nice meeting others during included breakfast and wine and cheese happy hour. Will stay here again on yearly broadway trips.

This is a great small hotel in the Hell's Kitchen area. Our room was spacious by New York standards, and very clean. The room opened onto the courtyard which would have been a great place to sip a glass of wine had the weather cooperated. The best thing about this hotel, aside from the comfortable bed, clean room, great location, etc., is the customer service. Susan couldn't do enough for her guests. We enjoyed meeting and talking with her. She made us feel like family, as she did all guests. By the way, the continental breakfast is very good. The coffee is great. The wine in the evening, which was a surprise, was a delight. We would absolutely return.

Hotel 414 is a great boutique hotel on the west side on Manhattan. One block west of Restaurant Row and two blocks from Times Square. Easy access to taxis going uptown to attend Met performance. We will definitely stay there again!

My wife and I have had a couple of stays in 414 hotel starting in 2006 (I think), plus arranged for my daughter and son-in-law to stay. We all found it great value for money. The General Manager Sakina Karimi inspired confidence and was very helpful and hands-on in making our stay a pleasant and successful one. She knows the area and the city. She also made sure that our daughter got the pleasant quiet room off the courtyard which she had shown me on my visit. It is a smallish hotel so can get some personal attention if you want it. The atmosphere is very informal. A youngish clientele but not exclusively so. I don't remember any young children there - not set up for that.Help yourself to breakfast. Wifi and laptop available. It is handy for midtown west and theatreland, but still in a quiet area. A number of decent, affordable restaurants a short walk away (east) on the Avenue. Geoff (GB)

I travel to NYC every year and I just found this lovely hotel. In central Hells Kitchen you will find this totally adorable hotel. The staff was absolutely wonderful from booking to checking out, the hotel is quiet, clean and cozy. They do a little breakfast and wine&cheese hour in the afternoon which is so lovely. Anything you need the staff will help you and it has a community feel to it. There is a very sweet little court yard where you can sit and enjoy your resting time before heading out again. The rooms are of good size and I found the price very attractive. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay centrally but still enjoy the cozy and quiet streets - just blocks away from Times Square. The area is full of restaurants and bars so you will not struggle to find good places to eat. Do yourselves a favour and make your NY stay easy and pleasurable. Book 414!

My wife and I decided on a last minute trip to NYC to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I checked all of the big name hotels and the prices for a Saturday night were ridiculous. I stumbled upon 414 Hotel on line and what a great find!! It's a great little hotel that has almost a bed and breakfast type atmosphere. The staff couldn't have been more friendly, the room was comfortable, clean and quiet.They even offer a expanded continental breakfast which we enjoyed in the courtyard out back.The location on 46th St between 9th and 10th is perfect. It is an easy to walk to most theaters, Time Square and "Restaurant Row" not to mention dozens of good bars/pubs.I noted on the reservation that we would be celebrating our anniversary and when we arrived their was a bottle of Champagne waiting for us. Nice touch!I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Hotel is situated on a residential side street but only minutes away from Times Sqaure, Broadway, Hell's Kitchen area, shopping etc. The staff were all helpful, informative and genuinely taking care of guests needs. Our room faced the courtyard which was a nice relaxing place to sit for breakfast.

We recently stayed at 414 Hotel whilst exploring New York. For anyone doing a similar thing we really can't rate it highly enough. Only minutes away from the madness that is Times Square you would never we guess as you walk down the tree lined street towards the hotel. Inside is an oasis of calm! Our room was spacious and overlooked the delightful courtyard which sadly we did not have time to sit in and enjoy although we did pass through it each morning to go to breakfast. Breakfast was excellent. Lots of fresh fruit, bagels and coffee.....perfect!Susan and her staff were so helpful and knowledgable. Nothing was too much trouble for them. This would be an ideal base for a solo traveller or couple. Although it is in a quiet street it is within the vicinity of numerous restaurants covering all tastes. If we ever return, and I really hope we do, then we would book in here again without any hesitation.

We have just spent amazing week in New York ! One of the most important reasons for it was the choice of the Hotel 414 : as soon as we arrived the warm hospitality of the staff made us feel at home, the bedroom was good and most importantly: silent. The breakfast was excellent: Cinnamon bagels with cream cheese will never be the same for me! The location was perfect as well: close to Times Square, museums and the subway connections to explore the rest of the city, but as well in a less "tourist area", really giving you the feeling of living within the New Yorkers. We loved in particular returning to this charming place from a tiring day visiting. I would highly recommend this place and We will definitely come back here for our next visit!

Wifes birthday was noted on our reservation. when we arrived at our room, there was a mug, chocolates and a card for her - very nice treatment and unexpected. Hotel itself/our room could use some attention to detail. Quiet, very comfortable but the heat/air cond. units were rusted and somewhat noisy. Breakfast was nothing special. Overall a nice place and very accesible for theater goers and restaurant row.

We recently stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon, and had a great time. It is very centrally located to many of the main attractions but is on a nice street that is fairly quiet, and the staff cannot do enough to help you. The range of options for breakfast were good and the quality of the food was great, as was the complementary happy hour with cheese and wine that they offered each evening! Unfortunately I was not very well during our stay, but the owner Susan couldn't have been more helpful and kind which I very much appreciated. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel with a personal touch we cannot recommend it highly enough.

I have just spent with my daughter an amazing week in New York ! It was our first trip together and we choose to come here as a treat. The success of our trip was largely due to the choice of the Hotel 414 : since we arrived the warm hospitality of the staff made us feel at home, the bedroom in the courtyard was spacious, lovely decorated and most importantly silent. We could hear birds singing in the morning! The location was perfect as well: a good variety of restaurants, we were at walking distance to Central Park, museums and the subway connections to explore the rest of the city were great. We loved in particular returning to this charming place from a tiring day visiting. I would highly recommend this place and I will definitely come back here for my next visit!

We (two 40-something couples) have just returned from our first visit to NY and had a brilliant experience staying in this fantastic hotel. The location is great in Hells Kitchen, only 10 minutes walk to three subways stations and surrounded by numerous restaurants and bars. The hotel itself is small but perfectly forrmed; if you want "bling" this place is not for you, but if you want a home-from-home then this is perfect. The bedrooms were great with a good bed, pillows etc and a great shower. Everything was spotlessly clean.What really set the place apart though was Susan and her wonderful staff; whether it was bookng us restarants, chasing up tickets or just offering great advice they could not have been more friendly or helpful. If we are ever lucky enough to get the chance to return to NY we will definitely stay here again, it really was that good.

414 Hotel is ideallly situated for getting around Manhatten. A boutique hotel,(22 guest rooms) it offers distinctiveness, charm and a personalised touch, comparing favourably to the larger "Chain" options. Particulary welcoming is the very good continental breakfast, included in the price, which is not often the case with alternative hotels. The addition of a "happy Hour" between 5.30 - 7:00pm each evening, when wine, whiskey and cheese and biscuits are available, is also a welcome touch. This offered the chance to meet other guests (and catch up over breakfast!) a great addition for the solo traveller.414 is family-owned and the hosts were very welcoming and hospitable throughout the duration of my stay. The hotel consists of two buildings, linked by a terrace courtyard which provides an oasis of tranquility to sit out on a nice day. If you are a light sleeper, I would suggest that when booking, you ask, if possible, to book a room which doesn't look out onto the main road - West 46th Street - NY is a 24hr city - and the tranquility of the terrace courtyard was not matched, in my experience, in the early hours of the morning! However, this was my only criticism. The room and bed was very comfortable. I would definitely recommend it and would be happy to make it my choice to stay should I return to NY.

Thanks to Susan and her staff we had an amazing weekend at 414 Hotel! This was an unplanned visit to this amazingly warm and welcoming boutique hotel! We had rented an apt through a vacation rental website for the night and at the last minute the owner had told us that he was having his friends stay at the apt and he was going to put us up at the hotel for 1 night and then move us into his apt... We were less than pleased with him but Susan and her staff made us feel immediately at home, warm, and welcomed! There was a fire going in the fire place when we arrived, they invited us in for breakfast and let us keep our bags there while we went out and toured around. They gave us advice, introduced us to the other hotel guests who were all fun and fantastic as well! A great international crowd! It was really nice! The rooms were great for NYC as well! The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathrooms were spacious and had everything we needed! Housekeeping was amazing with a couple of extra towels.. And Drew, was there to greet us when we came in late at night! He was fun to talk with and we spent a few late night hours chatting it up with along with another guest! They have a great little happy hour in the evening as well for guests and Susan was so kind and even told me to invite one of my friends over who was staying in a near by hotel. We were supposed to change over to the the apt on the second night - and with all the inconvenience from the apt owner - when we got back late at night from a day of sightseeing and visiting friends.. and went up to find the apt was unacceptable with no warm water .. we called back to Drew at 414 Hotel and he found us a room... Everyone is amazing there and we will certainly be back. The neighborhood is in the perfect location - it's a quiet street but only a few blocks from Times square, and walking distance to everything.. you can always catch a cab if you want, and plenty of good restaurants close by. The staff is really good about making recommendations for sight seeing and eating as well (and reservations if you need them). This was one of our best stays ever in Manhattan! Highly recommend it! And we will be back on our next trip!!! Thank you Susan and everyone else!!! Including the guests for a wonderful weekend!

A two night stay in April. What was so striking was the helpfulness of the staff - and their award-winning friendliness. The room was beautiful, elegant even. We took our breakfast outside and enjoyed the serenity of the courtyard before heading to the many sites and sounds of the city. We look forward to staying again.

My wife and i stayed here for two nights. We liked everything about 414 and plan to return. First, it's centrally located to great restaurants, theaters, and public transport if you want to move around Manhattan. The hotel is family-owned and the owners and staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. They have a very nice breakfast and wine and cheese every evening. We met and talked to some interesting people from all over. If you want a nice neighborhood, and a very comfortable stay, 414 Hotel is ideal. I'm glad we found it and plan to stay there when we visit Manhattan, which is 3-4 times/year.

perfect location, perfect guest service, perfect room.hotel with breakfast included and free happy hour at 5pm.simply ... fantastic.room in the garden are very silent.With my heavy lugguage I miss the lift! close to time square but in a silent Street. Perfect STAY

My wife and I stayed there for two nights in mid-April 2014 and were thoroughly delighted. We found it via Trip Advisor and booked it thru booking.com. The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street on the west side, convenient to Restaurant Row and Times Square and the theater district. It has a European feel, complete with continental breakfast and small courtyard, and the manager and staff could not be more friendly. The rooms were well-appointed and spacious and the bath was relatively new. It even has windows that open! When you go, tell Susan the Jones' said Hi and that we'll be back soon.

I stayed at this hotel without knowing what to expect. The hotel is incredibly centrally located in Manhattan. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

From the moment we walked into 414 Hotel it felt welcoming. The manager asked for our first names and used them whenever she saw us. She extended every hospitality including allowing us to have a bite to eat from the breakfast upon arrival, calling for reservations, looking up directions, suggesting restaurants and museums, etc. Susan, made us feel like she truly wanted us to have the best time while we were there. The hotel itself is in a great location for the theater and Restaurant Row, as well as a short walk or subway ride to the rest of Manhattan. The rooms were beautifully decorated, with a comfy bed and duvet, and a spacious bathroom. The breakfast was fresh and of a good variety, happy hour was like a bunch of friends from around the globe meeting for cocktails. The hotel was great, but the staff made it a genuinely wonderful home away from home. We will be back.

My daughter and I stayed here 3 nights recently. Very well kept property with attentive innkeepers. Quiet residential street. Rooms were nice size and bathroom was spacious. Very convenient to theatres, Times Square, restaurants, shopping. Yummy breakfast. Great value, will bring my husband next time!

This little boutique hotel located in Hells Kitchen steps away from the theatre district is a gem in the middle of NYC. From the moment we arrived, we were attended to as if we were the personal guests of the hotel manager. We walked into a cute lobby with a fireplace going. As we checked in to the hotel the office manager introduced herself to us and asked us if we would like her to make dinner reservations. She came up with suggestions that suited our needs. She also had a discussion with us about our plans for the weekend and came up with some ideas that fit right into what we like to do. The rooms were modern and clean. Our other needs were accommodated, including a quiet room away from the street and a gluten free breakfast. We are highly likely to return when we need a place to stay in NYC.

I and 2 friends headed to NYC from Boston last Mar/22 for one night stay.We checked in at 414 Hotel by 11:30pm. We were impressed by the reception area, but when we opened the bedroom's door, wow!! What a pleasant surprise! How clean, neat and quiet place.The host went above and beyond to make us comfortable.The owners are really involved in their guest experience, socializing with them, giving advicesabout places to go and things to do around. It was a truly finding in the heart of Manhattan.

..In a brilliant location, right in the heart of town, walking distance from great attractions, fab lively local bars and delicious restaurants (5 Napkin Burger is an absolute must!). The hosts could not be more welcoming and from the moment you arrive, the team work tirelessly to make your stay as relaxed, comfortable and wonderful as possible. We had just got engaged when we visited the hotel and we were welcomed with a bottle of prosecco! Really charming and lovely touches to the hotel to create a warm and friendly atmosphere, including cheese & wine mixers in the evening so guests can share local experiences and knowledge. We would very happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York!

My wife and I stayed in Hotel 414 for five nights early march 2014. We chose the hotel after seeing all the great reviews on Tripadvisor. And the reviews are totally correct.The hotel is clean and nice, situated in a quiet street just two blocks from Times Square. Our room was not grand and fancy, but was big enough and included all we needed. The breakfast is simple, with toast, bagels, spreads, cereal and fruit.The hotel has few rooms, and a fantastic manager who remembers the names of all her guests. Every evening they have “happy hour” in the cozy lobby where the guests are offered red or white wine free of charge.The owner is very friendly, talks to all her guests and is more than happy to help out. We also have a couple of friends that stayed at the hotel at approximately the same time, and they are just as positive as us.All this for a price that was lower than all the other alternatives we considered. We have no hesitations to recommend this hotel, and will stay here again the next time we visit New York.

A part of me doesn't want to share this with you but I feel compelled to come clean...what a gem, a real find. I am particular to the little hotels and B&B's. They tend to be more inviting, social and the owners are very involved in their guest experience. This little hotel was no dissapointment. Sue and her team literally welcomed us with open arms. We knew we were going to like it before we even saw the room. What makes this place special. The people. The little touches such as wine and cheese and the lobby or the continental breakfast. Everyone was so accommodating. And the smiles last a life time. We will be back.! <3

I've been travelling to New York on business once a year for over 20 years, and have stayed in a different hotel each time. Earlier this week, I stayed for two nights at 414 Hotel, and now I don't think I'll ever stay anywhere else in the city. 414 W. 46th St. became my home away from home within minutes of walking through the door. Susan and her staff greeted me warmly, made me feel at home while my room was made ready (I was very early), and basically did everything within their power to make my stay easy and fun. They have created a Bed and Breakfast feel in the middle of the busiest city on earth. The breakfast and nightly happy hour is set up to make all the guests feel like a congenial little family. I had a courtyard facing room on the top floor, and was amazed to be able to hear birds chirping in the courtyard. Amazingly quiet for the city that never sleeps. My room was clean, large for New York, and very comfortable. The housekeeping staff are like ninjas...I never saw them, but when I left my room, they quickly put everything back in order. Breakfast had a nice selection of fresh fruits, oatmeal, cereal and local pastries. And, I loved that the coffee/tea service was out 24/7. Happy hour wine and cheese was top shelf, and it was the only Manager's Reception I've ever been to where the manager truly was the host, creating a camaraderie among guests through friendly conversation. The location is very convenient to Broadway and Times Square, as well as the subway. In my mind, I have already planned at least two girlfriends' weekend trips back here, and will certainly bring my family at some point in the future. Honestly, I can't wait to return!

Me and my friend had a great time in New York and the hotel was excellent to meet all of our needs. We were greeted each time we entered and asked about our day and I could always count on a smiling face and advice when I needed it. We loved the neighborhood feel that the 414 gave our experience unlike any other I have had the opportunity of experiencing. It was nice not being in an uppity hotel that can be miles away from the true feel of New York and its surrounding neighborhood. I will most definitely be staying here in the future when I visit New York again hopefully that will be sooner then later. I recommend this place to my friends and family now and in the future. This is of course due to the staff and Susan the general manager. I hear most rooms are pretty small and these rooms are of course not huge but who stays in there room while in NY, its about being out and about in the city so I thought the rooms were a fine size adequate enough for our needs and most peoples needs. Really take a chance on this place and you will be thoroughly satisfied.

Our 4-night stay at 414 (visiting from the UK) was extremely comfortable. We especially liked the location, which is great for central midtown but in a quiet street (our room in the rear block was serenely quiet), the informal and welcoming atmosphere, including use of a little kitchen off the lobby, and the comfort of the room - plenty of storage space and an amazingly comfortable mattress, though the shower pressure was on the low side. I agree with earlier reviews about the slightly scruffy decor of the rear block, but this wasn't a major problem for us. As another recent review says, this hotel will suit travellers looking for a small, quiet, unfussy place. It's not suitable for anyone wanting a wide range of facilities, or high-spec amenities. For UK travellers the price seemed high for what was provided: we would probably pay a lot less for a similar standard in most European cities. Buts we said: perfect for us. Thanks for a really pleasant stay. Barry & Dorothy

We loved this boutique hotel. The hotel owners -- Susan and Andrew -- are incredibly hospitable. They are willing to do whatever their guests need to have a enjoyable experience. And their staff, Maria and Drew were also wonderful. So helpful and friendly and pleasant. The morning breakfast, while simple, is served elegantly. Fantastic New York bagels with wonderful cream cheese, croissants, fresh fruit and an assortment of teas along with coffee and orange juice. The happy hour is delightful not just for the wonderful selection of wines and fine cheeses but also because Andrew and Susan personally host it and introduce the different guests to one another in order to share tips of sightseeing. The rooms are elegantly remodeled with comfortable beds, pillows and giant flat screen televisions. The bathroom was very clean and the amenities were nice also. The towels also were very plush. Though their is no elevator, it's not bad walking up a couple flights of stairs. We had a room facing the courtyard and it was very quiet and peaceful. We only wish we had been there closer to summer because the outdoor courtyard was so serene. We can't wait to come back and stay here again!

This hotel is brilliant. I couldn't recommend it more. The room was comfortable but what makes this place special is the people running it. Susan the general manager goes out of her way to make you feel welcome. She is the friendliest host and does everything possible to make your stay as good as it can be. Breakfast is delicious and restocked so often you're never short, the location is superb and when we were there, wine and cheese was dished out at 5.30 every afternoon. It's a sociable place, and I would return in a heartbeat. It's everything you want from a hotel: clean, comfortable, affordable, and run by the nicest people who make you feel like you're part of their family! Book now, don't wait!

My wife and I stayed here on a pit stop from a long flight from Ireland. The overall experience was great. This is more of a Bed & Breakfast than it is a hotel. The rooms are small, but cozy. The staff is courteous and treats you as if you were staying at their house. Thanks for the restful stay. Hopefully we can stay again the next time we are in NYC

My husband and I stayed at the 414 Hotel for 3 nights and could not have been more pleased with the charm of this hotel and the amazing service. We have traveled world wide, yet this is by far the best accomodation we have been to. Not only were the rooms very nice, spacious and clean, but the staff was out of this world. The owners make it a point to get to know you by name and are always very pleasant to chat with. They offer a fabulous and fresh continental breakfast (always with fresh orange juice, coffee, bagels, toast, cereal, fresh fruit, croissants, etc.) and are very helpful with planning activities in the city! They also offer a quaint wine & cheese every night for guests. Located in the heart of Restaurant Row, the hotel is surrounded by a large variety of cuisines. The hotel also has a list of ones they particularly like within walking distnace (and they tell you why they like them!). The personal touch that this hotel offers is unlike any we have every received, and for that reason, we will definitely return. You could not ask for a better situated hotel - even with its close proximity to major attractions, the hotel is situated in a quiet residential area only a few minutes from Times Square (despite being very pregnant at the time of our visit, my husband and I walked to Times Square within 5-8 minutes, and to Grand Central Station within 10-15. The Subway was only a few minutes walk away as well). Excellent hotel - highly recommended!

We stayed here for 2 nights using a Travelzoo voucher which pushed down the cost to just under $130 a night. At that price, any room in NYC would be a bargain, even the most run down. But although this place had its charms, you can't come looking for the typical hotel experience and if a Marriott is what you are looking for, you will be disappointed. We tend to like small, quirky places and stay in Europe at apartment rentals so this was just the type of place we enjoy. Our room was old (apparently this wing is yet to be upgraded) although very clean. It was like staying in the guest suite of a friend with a NY apartment. There was ample room (almost roomy by NYC standards) and it had everything you needed plus a few extras: a bathtub with ample hot water, nice toiletries, a Continental breakfast (free), wi-fi, and a wine (and scotch) and cheese happy hour. The mattress was more comfortable than the 4 star Boston hotel I stayed at a couple of weeks ago and the bed was made up with comfy white sheets and a nice duvet. The manager was delightful and I am sure she would have been helpful had we been first time visitors. We spent most of our time in Brooklyn with family and in the Chelsea/Soho area so the location was not great for us. But for those wanting to go to the theater and experience some of Manhattan's mid-town excitement, the location is perfect. Just a short walk to Times Square. Parking is on the next block and is discounted with a stamp from the hotel. In short, if you don't mind a small, Euro-type hotel with a bed and breakfast feel, this will seem like heaven to you. It is not luxurious, by any means, but clean, comfortable and welcoming. Our only regret was that the cold weather prevented us from enjoying the charming "pocket" garden between buildings. It reminded us of similar urban oases that one finds in Europe.

Coming to New York And the US for the first time ever, we didn't quite know what to expect from our hotel. We picked the 414 Hotel for these reasons: it had a good score on TripAdvisor, it was within our price range, it looked very European (I'll come back to what I mean by that), and they responded quickly and very nice to questions I sent in an email prior to booking. Still, it could back fire, right? Well, it didn't. From the moment we walked through the doors of 414, it felt like home. The staff was so welcoming, even though we were dead tired from the long trip, and surely had a lot of silly questions.The hotel is two apartment buildings remodeled into a 22-room hotel, connected by a nice back yard. (Would love to sit here having breakfast on a warm summer day).The interior and design reminds me of Paris hotels, the building is old and a bit quirky here and there, but we found it charming. It's located on 46th street, right off 9th ave. A five (or less) minute walk from pulsating Times Square, in the middle of Hell's Kitchen, in the heart of the city. The owners, Susan and Andrew, are so nice people! They made us feel so welcome, like visiting old friends. They are very service minded and professional, but it still feels heart felt when they offer directions, help to book tickets or just make plain conversation.  Our room was up stairs facing the back yard. I swear, we woke up to birds singing the next morning. Who would have guessed Manhattan cloud be that quiet? The hotel offers breakfast in the lobby for free. Fresh pastry, jam, cheese, orange juice, good strong coffee++. Great! And on afternoons they open up a bottle of wine (or Prosecco!) and offer you to join them for cheese and crackers. Other guests brought cake etc. to these early evening get togethers, and we got to meet so many nice people. From literally all over the world. The rooms were spacious, well decorated, clean, no bed bugs (and they take this matter impressively serious with inspections, bug-sniffing dogs and thorough precautions) and if you needed something - you just asked. We stayed five nights this time, and will definitely come back if we come to NYC again. I'm sure I've forgotten something I meant to put in this review, but I'll wrap up by saying this: we've stayed in many hotels in our days, but never felt this relaxed anywhere in the world. Never thought that would be the case in the city that never sleep. Recommended! Thank you, all at 414 Hotel!

Wonderfully staffed and maintained European style B & Bish Hotel located in Hell's Kitchen. A new experience for us in NYC as the 414 has but 22 Guest Rooms (I think). Here you will feel as you are a guest. Ample breakfast daily, Happy hour in the evening. Walking distance from Times Square, Broadway and the Subway. Thank you all for making our Anniversary get away special! We will return soon!

Having seen two good Broadway shows, visited the Morgan and the MoMa, and enjoyed some good food the two of us will most remember the two-night stay at the 414 Hotel as the more memorable part of the trip to NYC. We enjoyed the friendly exchange with other guests, the owner, and other staff members at the table and by the fire sharing breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese at evening time. We found the hotel comfortable and conveniently located. There was a large screen TV in our room and free wi-fi throughout. Don’t expect a spacious room, bath, or lobby. If you’re fine with basic comforts, you’ll be very pleased here. Richard

This isn't our first stay in the 414 (we stayed here a few years go) and am sure will not be our last :-)Great little hotel, easy walking distance to all the sights (only 2 or 3 blocks across from Times Square) but far enough away to feel give a neighboorhood feel.loads of great restaurants surrounding both along restaurant row and 9th. No elevators so could be a problem for some however great size rooms for the middle of NYC (plenty of room to spread yourself out!)We were in room 404 this time which was a quite noisy as right on the street - before I think we were in 201, only 1 flight of stairs from reception and super quiet! Includes breakfast and they have a wine and cheese 'mixer' between 5 and 7 for guests to mingle which we thought was nice touch. Reception staff overall couldn't have been more helpful. Will definitely continue to recommend this hotel and look forward to returning next time we visit :-)

My husband and I spent a week here, just returning yesterday. What a gem of a hotel! It's got everything going for it: location, service, fair prices, warmth, comfort. Each day when we'd return from playing tourist, it was like coming home. Susan, Andrea (sp?), and Jacqueline (?) greeted us warmly, offered refreshments (coffee, tea, wine, cheese/crackers, etc), helped us with restaurant recommendations, and generally made us feel most welcome. Our room (205) was just fine, and we particularly liked the fact that it had windows that opened (not always the case in NYC) and that we had cross ventilation (we like to sleep in a cool room). My only wish would have been for a chair in the room, as reading in bed is not always comfortable. (I solved that problem by taking my book to the lobby.) I also like that our room was in the back, beyond the small courtyard, so street noise was minimal. February weather doesn't encourage sitting outside (!), but I'm sure spring or summer breakfast in the courtyard would be just delightful. I will certainly recommend Hotel 414 to friends, and we will come here on our next trip east. Thank you.

I stayed for 2 nights in January and I loved it. I will try to stay here again. The location is perfect, close to Times Square but still in a quiet neighborhood setting. There are tons of restaurants and cafe's very close. In fact, 46th street is called "Restaurant Row". The lobby is stylish with a cozy fireplace and seating. Between 5-7 there is free wine and cheese guests. The free breakfast is very nice (pastries, fruit, cereal). And if you want something healthier there is a nice juice bar around the corner. The room is large (by NYC standards). Free wifi. There are 22 rooms. Some in the first brownstone type building. Then there is a courtyard in between (for guests to enjoy) then a second building with a few more rooms. I was in Room 402 which is very quiet. Friends were in Room 404 which they said was loud as it was on the street side. Note: there are no elevators if stairs are an issue for you. I thought this was a welcome change for the typical large chain hotels I have stayed at in NYC. Loved it.If you drive, be careful of parking. My friend had her car towed from in front of the hotel since she read the signs wrong. The hotel offers a discount at the garage on 45th street. I think they said it was $35 a day.The staff was excellent. Helpful when booking. Helpful at check in. And even helpful when the car was towed. Thank you!

Stayed 5 nights in January. Staff very friendly and helpful. Location amazing, 5minutes walk to time square, loads of restaurants/take-aways close by. (Be careful when ordering take away pizza they are massive!!)Hotel is very clean and free breakfast gives you a good start.We stayed in room 406, no lift but only 3 short flights of stairs and worth it cause room is slightly bigger.Felt very safe in the hotel and walking to/from it.HIGHLY recommend this hotel (so much so this is the first time I have wrote on trip advisor!!)

I stood in this hotel for a week a few years ago, and while planning to spend New Years' Eve at NYC, decided that I wanted to stay in the hotel once again, and I was not disappointed. The hotel offers everything you can imagine, from a good location a staff that, beyond friendly, helps you in every need. As a person who enjoyed the discounts offered in this time of the year, I had several boxes sent to the hotel, and everything arrived and was delivered without any problem (as opposed to what happens in big hotels). Also, the cozy atmosphere offered by the small (but not suffocating) property is a great plus when comparing to other hotels in NY. Breakfast is also a nice addition, but if you feel you want to eat something differently, there are plenty of options within a few steps.Would definitely stay here for a third time!!!

Stayed here for a long weekend in mid-December. Very pleased. Couldn't be more convenient to many good restaurants, very friendly staff and good continental breakfast. Small kitchen was a bit crowded at times, but that was the only negative. Stayed in the back building away from street noise. Rooms small but that's to be expected, and they were fine with large bathroom. Very happy and will stay again when we go back before Christmas next year.

Just returned from a wonderful week in New York...made even better by our stay at the cozy boutique Hotel 414!!The location is fabulous ...on restaurant row, close to theater district, Time Square and easy access to subway station.There is a warm homely feel as you walk in ...fireplace, Christmas tree, large family style dining table. The staff are friendly and very accommodating. The rooms are spacious and tidy and the bed was very comfortable! An added bonus is that complimentary continental breakfast served every morning.I felt very much "at home" at tis hotel and I would definitely stay here again!!!

My experience living there was good. I went to NYC to visit a friend and was living there for one night. It is a cozy and clean hotel, the staff working there were nice and friendly. Ｉwould like to recommend this hotel to others.

I came to New York with my daughter and even though it was freezing the whole week we were there it was always lovely to 'come home' to Hotel 414. The open fire and Christmas decorations made it feel like home. My daughter doesn't eat breakfast so I really enjoyed going down to breakfast in my 'sloppy' clothes having a leisurely breakfast whilst reading the newspaper. Breakfast included chocolate croissants and bagels. I really loved the spacious bathroom- a luxury in New York. Staff were very friendly and if you are travelling alone it would be a great place to stay as you would feel like you are at home.

So this was a mixed bag for us. I usually do a lot of research on Trip Advisor before I confirm any reservations & the reviews were pretty good for this place. Our experience was just ok. The location is great. Walking distance to time square & great places to eat & even a cool shopping area about 1 block away. We stayed on the 3rd floor away from the street. The room was clean but shabby. It looks worn & not up to date, drab. There is no view unless you count a brick wall a few feet away a view. We kept the shades down which added to the dreariness of the room. There was a young guy working the front desk most of the time & he was very friendly & helpful. I questioned the price when I registered. I hadn't remembered it was about $300.00/nt with tax. A woman told me its what I agreed to. She was very much in my face which I really didn't feel was necessary. Again, not what was said as much as how it was said. "Breakfast" is boxes of cereal & apples. There are great places to have breakfast in walking distance. That's what we did. I got up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night & when I put the light on a cockroach ran from the bathroom into the bed area. We go to NYC frequently & I've spent the same amount & had much better hotel rooms. Once was enough for us.

This little hotel was perfect for my daughter and I. Located close to the theater district and Times Square! Affordable, very clean and comfortable with a friendly and helpful staff! And they have a car service to transport you to and from the airport.

The hotel was tiny, but very nice. The room was fresh and looked renovated. Very helpful staff. The nextdoor neighbour was a very nice bar, where you also could smoke hooka (middle-eastern waterpipe with different fruit-flavours). On the downside; our room was facing the street, so there was a lot of traffic-noise during the night. Ask for a room facing the backyard! There's no elevator in the hotel.

I stayed 3 nights at the 414 Hotel, from Nov 10-13. I was in NYC to take a very important test, 8- hour long torture, so I was looking for a comfortable bed, quiet room, preferably smaller hotel to make for a more personalized stay and easy check-in and check-out. And that's exactly what I found at the 414 Hotel. First of all, I would like to express my commendations to all the staff of the hotel. They took into account my request for a quite room, were very considerate to ask me if I would prefer music in stead of TV when they saw me studying at the lobby, and even wished me good luck on my exam and asked about it when I came back! My room (205) was in mint conditions, there was a stuffed animal of The Muppets on my bed - sweet touch. The bed was very comfortable and I had a good night sleep. The bathroom was clean, and even large for NYC standards. The lobby is cozy, inviting, and has a beautiful fireplace behind a large table where I was able to study. Breakfast starts at 7, and when I was talking to the the front desk they offered to have something for me earlier than that if I needed to leave early on the day of my exam. Overall, this was a great hotel for my needs, I am so happy I found it and it surpassed my expectations. I would recommended it to anyone who is looking for a cozy, quiet, beautiful oasis in midtown Manhattan.

414 hotel is a very nice place to stay in New York. It's like you are in a friend's house. I stayed at the hotel in November with my daughter and we had a great surprise.The bedroom and the bathroom were a very good size, clean and comfortable.This hotel is located in a nice and quiet neighborhood besides being only three blocks of Broadway. There are good restaurants and a subway station in a short walk.The hotel also offers breakfast included in the roomprice and surprise! there is a little kitchen opened from 7am until 8/9pm where you can have tea or coffee for free every time you want!The front desk team is also nice and very helpful, mainly Jackie and Mary. They give you good tips and are always smiling and ready to help.There is only one aspect that one have to take in account: the hotel does not have elevator. So if you have problems to go up stairs, ask them to stay in the 1st floor or in the courtyard.If you are expecting a hotel with big crystal chandeliers, huge luxurious lobby, this is not your place. But if you want a nice place with helpful, friendly and welcome people, this is your place in NY.

I travel to NYC on business four to five times a year for four to six days each stay. I always add in time for theater and fun and usually try to stay in the midtown vicinity (no farther south 34th or north than 60th with 10th to 5th Avenues as the outer boundary.) When I started seeing reviews of 414 I decided to give it a try and will never stay anywhere else again unless the hotel is booked. The bedroom and bathroom were both surprisingly roomy for an NYC boutique hotel, very clean and very comfortable. Every staff member I encountered was super friendly. The location is just enough off the business to make you feel like you are residential but close enough to great restaurants and theaters to not be off-putting. The decor is bright and pleasant. The courtyard is adorable and the lobby, though small, is inviting. I certainly drank my share of the delicious coffee and enjoyed some breakfast nibbles as well.I felt so at home and safe here. I wish I had found this little gem sooner. For comparison, I have most recently stayed at: Hampton Inn North Times Square, New Yorker, Milford and the Edison. I have not really had a bad NYC hotel experience, it is just that 414 so exceeded my expectations and became more of a welcome place to return to than a hurry and get out hotel. I can not wait to be back.

We really loved staying at the Hotel 414. I had attempted to find a place for our Nov. stay way back in June. After about an hour (or 2!) of being very frustrated, I finally found the Hotel 414, I think on a B&B website. The great location, competitive price (Let's face it, everything in NYC is very high $.), & the amenities (Complimentary breakfast & internet were included.) were all better than anything I came across. Perhaps because the NYC Marathon had taken place that day, I got the last of the 22 rooms. The hotel went beyond meeting our expectations. Our room was very nicely decorated & furnished & included everything anyone would need. The fireplace in the dining area & the patio were an unexpected added touch. The only caution to which I would like to call attention is that there is no elevator & we were on the 4th floor. Actually we like to exercise (No, we were not there for the Marathon!) so this was a benefit to us, but it might not be to everyone. I think this hotel is a gem & would never stay anywhere else when in NYC.

I have stayed in fancier, more expensive, etc. hotels, but this visit was the most enjoyable ever! The 414 is reasonably priced (for Manhattan), our room was not just clean, but SPOTLESS, fresh fluffy towels and linen each day, breakfast each morning (which consisted of FRESH... ordered in each morning... croissants, pastries, cereal, muffins, juices, coffee, and tea). First hotel we have ever stayed in where we actually ate breakfast AT the hotel (due to the freshness and quality of the pastries!!) The kitchen was open each day until 7 PM with coffee or tea available and a microwave. I loved being able to come in from the cold, grab a cup of coffee and take it to our room. The hotel is only 2.5 blocks from Time Square so you can rest in your room a while before heading back out into the city. The subway is within walking distance, too, and NYC people are the best! The staff at the 414 is unbelievably helpful. They not only advised of attractions, etc. but got out a map and drew out subway routes and walking routes to direct us. This hotel is located in Hell's Kitchen. Eateries everywhere... ALL kinds. I worried about the noise and being able to sleep (and not being able to take my own pillow on a plane!) but I had TWO wonderful pillows (so did my husband) and about 11PM total quiet! We were in the front building by the street, 4th floor, and it was totally quiet at night. (The 414 is on a side street that appeared mostly residential). We both slept very well every night. The sheets are of a higher quality and thread count (and not scratchy) and we felt like we were in our own bed at home. (I have been known to take my own sheets... but on a plane with only carry on luggage, I skipped that this trip and I am so glad I did!) We had a cold day (room was was comfortable) and several warm days where we used the air conditioner... very cool and quiet. The carpet looked new (very clean).The bathroom was large in our room (403) and the water was hot. I say this because I read another review before I left that said it was not. The first night I agreed with the reviewer and remarked to my husband that I wished the water was hotter... he showed me how to set the lever (two separate levers.. one for water pressure, a smaller one for temperature) and voila!... All the hot water I wanted!! I think perhaps that reviewer did not discover that smaller lever... The water IS hot. The tub was large, shampoo, conditioner and lotion provided and even a shower cap which I appreciated (a lot of hotels now skip that!) A hair dryer was in the room, also. (I read another review that said there were no hair dryers but we had one IN our room). In the closet we found extra blankets (though with our fluffy comforter we didn't need any!), an ironing board and iron.There are two buildings... a front and back building with a charming courtyard in between. It was too chilly to use the courtyard while we were there but they had a lovely fire going each morning and tables to eat in the lobby... cozy and intimate. I have heard good about both buildings, and also about upstairs or downstairs. We were on the top floor (only 4 floors) but the staff took our luggage up for us the first day while we were out enjoying the city. They will store your luggage as soon as you arrive (labeling it and stowing it in a back room, which seemed VERY safe). They will also store it for you on the day of check out until you need to pick it up to head for the airport. VERY helpful. We were able to enjoy a whole extra day in the city and return late that night to pick up our luggage and head for the airport. They told us they would also carry our luggage back down... to let them know when we needed them but we carried it back down ourselves. (It is 4 flights, no elevator because of the older "brownstone" type building, but not bad at all). I am 58 and my husband is 62 and we managed without any difficulty. The steps are narrow and carpeted so be sure to hold the guardrail!They have nice red mugs with the 414 logo on the front for coffee and tea all day that they sell for 8.00 if you are interested in a memento of your stay. I fell in love with this hotel and would love to stay again, so I brought that cup home with me and I am enjoying drinking my morning coffee in it each day. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. We left a large tip for the maid which we have NEVR done, or felt led to do, if that tells you anything.... :) Thank you 414 for a wonderful, comfortable stay!

I stayed here for my first trip to NYC. Travelling solo, it was a safe area just 2.5 blocks from Times Square. It is in the restaurant area, so even walking at midnight I felt safe. There is a front building and a back building. I stayed in the back and it was really quiet. There are no elevators, so I carried my bag up three short flights of stairs - which is really no big deal as they'll help if you need it.Breakfast is a simple offering, but if you're like me you want to try the local foods or grab a Starbucks, so I often took an apple to start my day as I walked to my destinations. When you check out they'll hold your luggage if you want to do last minute sight seeing before leaving to the airport. I used Super Shuttle to an from the airports which dropped me directly to the hotel and picked me up - that was also a great and cheap option.Staff are friendly, althopugh I didn't have much to do with them and I chose not to get my room cleaned everyday so that I could keep everything out. But the rooms are generously sized from what I expected after reading reviews on the small rooms in NYC hotels. Seemed comparable to Australian hotel sized rooms. I definitely would stay here again as it was the best price I found at the time and a great location.

Rooms were small but comfy and large enough to store our luggage and still be able to move around. They were spotlessly clean and the bed was heavenly soft. We were in room 102 which was a little noisy as you could hear everyone come in and out but as my husband had a leg injury and couldn't get upstairs it sufficed. The proximity to everything was incredible. It was a 10 minute walk to Times Square and the same to the water. Some of the reception did make it feel like it was a inconvenience to give us guidance but on the whole we thought it was a great hotel at a terrific price. The breakfast was great and having tea and coffee in the afternoon was a treat.

A friend suggested this hotel because it was "off the beaten path" and less expensive than name brands in New York City-This place was PERFECT- their staff ROCKED- suggesting how to go where & when etc- Since we were traveling with 4 other couples, their staff suggested instead of getting 3 taxis everywhere we wanted to go to get a limo- sure enough we could all go together, and not lose a cab in traffic, and we'd all arrive at the same time etc- And less than cabs! Their continental breakfast was very nice, and the courtyard in the back was a nice reprieve- as well as the front porch to watch the happenings of the neighborhood! You could walk to little neighborhood bars and grocery stores, the rooms were comfortable, and nice!

We chose this hotel having trawled through many reviews for a number of hotels. We really wanted to stay in something other than a hotel and this just seemed to tick all the boxes!We arrived at 8am having travelled all the way from NZ!! I had already paid for the previous night's stay even though we were still en route as this was the only way to secure the rooms being available from the moment we arrived! Having travelled upright for almost 30 hours we were very grateful for the immediate opportunity to lay down!Both rooms were located on the first floor. The children's room overlooked the street, they were aware of the street noise throughout the night but it didn't seem to keep them awake. Our room was literally at the top of the first flight of stairs. At times it was noisy, but again it wash't too disruptive to our sleep. The rooms were small and basic (especially for the amount of luggage we had) but clean and functional. Breakfast was simple. We didn't have anything more than coffee, although the children did have cereal, juice and toast each morning. We enjoyed exploring all the other eating options which were all only a few minutes walk from the hotel.But truly, the best thing about 414 Hotel is it's location! Restaurants, Broadway, Times Square etc.

We found this hotel to be perfectly located, close to Times Square but in an area full of both restaurants and great bars. The hotel is smaller than most in NYC and I thought had a more European feel. We had a King Suite just off the courtyard and we were impressed by the size of the room, far bigger than others we stayed in NYC and we thought it was good value for the price we paid. Overall the hotel probably is quite basic but it was comfortable and we have no complaints about our room.We found the staff very helpful and were very accomodating when we made a mess of our reservation and they managed to squeeze us in for an extra night.Breakfast looked simple but we didn't try it as there are plenty of good choices only a short walk away at reasonable prices.If value and location are important to you, I would recommend this place highly. Don't expect too much glitz and glamour though...

414 hotel rooms are small an basic but very clean.we had flew in from Miami an when we arrived we were tired an needed to refresh but our room was not ready an also staff changed over so next member of staff had no idea if we were leaving or waiting to be checked in.Breakfast was included but we never ate here as basic.apart from this 414 hotel is so close to everything at time square we loved it ,just a few mins walk from everything ,yes i would recommend this Hotel if not looking anything other than a clean room for a few days that is handy to everything.

We were on 3rd floor in back room overlooked courtyard room small but able to accommodate roll away bed bed comfy room clean breakfast in am more of a snack would stay here again if prices remain reasonable

414 Hotel was picked out due to a really good online deal and excellent reviews from trip advisor clients. The hotel was easy enough to find, after getting off at 42nd street station from the greyhound we walked 4 blocks down and found hotel no problem. On arrival we were told a room was'nt available and that we could store our bags till later. After emptying my bags etc we were then told our room was ready. We were on the 4th floor so a porter came to assist with cases due to their being no lift. For those that struggle with stair ask for a low level room. Room was small but pleasant, clean and nice and airy and cool. View from window was bottom of courtyard area. Coffee/tea facilities were available till 6.30pm which was handy after a day sightseeing to grab a cuppa and then chill in courtyard. Did not use the breakfast facilities but always looked busy when walking out. The hotel is in Hells kitchen area so plenty to do and plenty of places to eat. Every type of food imaginable and most places open very late. About a ten min walk to times square area and less than that to local subway stations for transport. Could not fault hotel and would stay again.

We had a good experience staying here, and I'd be glad to stay here again. The hotel was nicely decorated and pleasant. It had a European feel to it. The light breakfasts were perfect for us.The location was great because we could walk to Central Park to run in the morning and it was quite close to the Times Square subway station. That station is a pretty big hub so most subway lines go there with minimal transferring. There are a lot of great restaurants nearby, but the 414 itself is on a quiet street.The stairs are narrow and steep. Anyone who isn't healthy enough to climb them comfortably may want to stay on a lower floor. We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking the courtyard (as advised on this website) and we liked it a lot.The internet service here was very spotty. It didn't matter much for us, but if I were travelling for work and depending on it, it would be a concern. It would occasionally be extremely slow, and occasionally not work (no matter which of the 2 wireless routers I tried).The staff was always professional and helpful, although we didn't demand much.

The location of this boutique hotel is perfect for a visit to NYC. Limited choice for breakfast, but it is included. Very good value for money!I will definitely stay here again and has already recommended it to others:)

Great little hotel in a very convenient location. European style with tidy, well-appointed rooms. Great little courtyard to take a coffee or breakfast. Located a few blocks from Times Square and most of the theatres. Rooms are on 4 levels, but there is no elevator, so if stairs are a challenge for you, make sure that you reserve a ground floor room. Courtyard rooms would be quieter than the street side, but our street side, 4th floor room was no problem for noise.

I stayed at the 414 Hotel this month (July) and could not have been more pleased. Its prime location made dinner, sight seeing, and getting around extremely convenient. The rooms are very clean . It gives the feeling of a brownstone buildng combined with a bed and breakfast type facility. Staff was very polite and quick to help. I highly reccomend the 414 Hotel for domestic and international travelers.

Hotel 414 is one of my new favorites among New York hotels. Be aware that it's small and there's no elevator. But the location is perfect for sightseeing and theatre, the beds are comfortable, my room was clean and quiet (in the back building facing the courtyard), there's free wi-fi, the breakfast is just right (good fresh breads, cereals, coffee and tea, yogurt). There's a fridge in the room, so I kept fruit there to supplement the breakfast items. I'm not usually a bed-and-breakfast person; I don't like feeling that I'm staying in someone's home. But the rooms at 414 are more like a boutique hotel than a B&B, and the staff is helpful and friendly without being intrusive. I will definitely stay there again.

Just spent 3 nights here with the July in the city special. Great location, only had to walk 11/2 blocks to both theaters that we went to. The bus stops are on either corner, subway 2 blocks down(super easy to take subway from JFK). We arrived at around 10am, just planning to drop off bags until check-in, told room would be ready within 20 min and to help ourselves to breakfast. I had requested a lower floor room since my back had gone out recently and facing courtyard which was recommended by other Trip advisors for quiet. Very pleased got room on first floor. Very comfortable sized room with large bathroom. There is no closet, but we had packed light for the hot weather and the clothes bar with hangers and dresser were enough for us. The room was very quiet, only had people talking in courtyard first evening, but with air conditioner and tv we drifted right to sleep. Staff was very nice. We also got a bottle of sparkling wine with our room, which was very nice, to have a glass every evening. Just bought fruit around corner to eat with croissants and bagels for breakfast. Nice quiet tree lined street. Lots of restaurants just down the street. Will definitely stay again. Intrepid just down the street as is Circle line cruises.

The location is perfect, located "deadsmack" in the middle of all the excitement. Staff is very helpful, friendly, specially the night guy Fernando. Was very helpful planning my night when my plans got cancelled, one phone call and he got my into club Pacha, right down the block from hotel, which was great.Cant really think of anything to complain about the 414, hotel is exatly how it is described online. Stayed in the second floor facing the streetside, a bit loud at night, but hey it was the weekend and plus its NYC!Will definetely recommend to my friends and becoming a repeat guest would not but dificult.

Ideally located between Hell's Kitchen and Times Square. Friendly and helpful staff. Quiet street. Free wifi and basic breakfast. Basically a converted townhouse on a residential street. Air condition worked well which was vital for the day I stayed. Decent sized room but no desk to work on. TV remote broken but I didn't really need it so didn't mention to staff until check out. Be aware that there is no elevator with rooms on 2nd and 3rd floor and stairway is narrow. I would stay here again when I need to be in this part of the city.

My girlfriend and I were there for a week in July.At first, we were not so happy about the Hotel, but we realized that the employee at the front desk was not really good. A bit too laid back.As the days passed, we found that the other employees were all very nice people.The room was ok for NYC. we went to see friends at another hotel and it was more or less the same thing, ie small room in the 200-250 $ range. We wouldn't have paid more for the Hotel. Our room was bigger though.On the plus side : the site. There are plenty of restaurants in Hell's Kitchen and you are at walking distance of a lot of places like Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue, etc.The breakfast was sober. Fruits would be appreciated and a bit more varieties. The coffee was great.Although it was not a problem for us, there are no elevator in the Hotel.

Nice hotel with light breakfast to start your day. Close to subways and close enough to walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Very helpful staff. Kinky Boots theater 1 block from hotel.Safe in room for valuables you don't want to carry with you.

I was very pleased with my stay in this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was quiet, which is hard to find in Manhattan, and the prices were reasonable by Manhattan standards. The bed was very comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast was nice. It is conveniently located a short walk away from Times Square, where my business was for the trip. It's surrounded by delicious restaurants ranging from fine dining to great-tasting, reasonably-priced meals. The internet was free and reasonably fast, although it was an insecure connection.My one minor quibble was that there was no desk in my room, which made it difficult to work on my laptop or eat in my room. There was, however, a cozy courtyard that guests could use.I would happily stay in this hotel again on a future visit to NYC.

We stayed at 414 Hotel for 5 nights on our last visit. It was convenient to the Broadway theaters (our main focus this trip), the Daily Show and Colbert Report studios, and to the subway. The hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable, the linen and towels very nice. They have breakfast food out until 10, consisting of coffee, cereal, some pastries (mainly croissants), bagels (not the NYC quality bagels, but fresh, I think), bread for toast, juice. It was good to have some food without having to go out for it.The street-side rooms are a bit noisy, even through closed windows. No lift, but we knew that when we booked it. All in all, I'd probably return.

Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, 42nd Street, Grand Central station; they’re all within walking distance of Hotel 414. A short walk to take a taxi or subway to the 9/11 Memorial or up to Harlem and with wonderful friendly and very helpful staff with clean and quiet surroundings this hotel was perfect for our needs.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during May and had a great time! Our room was a decent size and was very clean. We really like the continental style breakfast each morning and the free wifi was excellent. The courtyard was great for having breakfast when the weather was good. This hotel has a friendly relaxed atmosphere and the staff were very helpful. The location of this hotel is excellent, we had just finished a cruise on the Norwegian Breakaway and were able to walk from the port to the hotel in about 10 minutes with our suitcases. The location is also near times square & restaurant row. This hotel will also keep your luggage if you arrive early or have a late flight. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again.

Stayed for six nights in April 2013. We were super impressed with this little gem. We found the location to be within walking distance of most of the places we wanted to visit, and when a subway was required, there are two stations to choose from, servicing 11 lines. The staff were always friendly and helpfull, and the included breakfast was plentiful and a great start to they days activities. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great value hotel in a quiet central location.

With the hotel situated on a quiet tree-lined street, I felt like a real New Yorker each day as I departed and returned. The 414 is clean and neat with a European feel, close to the craziness of Times Square but far enough away to enjoy a down-to-earth genuine neighborhood experience, complete with a variety of affordable and tasty restaurants around the corner. The rooms are little and the stairs steep, but that adds to the charm. Breakfasts in the front room (coffee/tea, juice, croissants/bagels/bread, cereal and yogurt) and wine in the early evening in the back courtyard (complimentary on weekend evenings) was a wonderful start and finish to each day of exploring NYC. Overall an excellent experience.

Had a medical emergency ( we live outside washington dc )and was afraid we would have to cancel ,they bent over backwards to help us out . At the last minute , we were able to make the trip and the hotel stay was truly awesome . Super cool boutique hotel .Rooms very clean and modern( Kermit Frog greeted us on our pillow lol )big flat screen tv, check in desk person Mary (?) was so helpful ( she was super quick with check in so we could make David Letterman Show ), I think the manager's name is Jackie,was super nice as well( so understanding about emergency ) and I believe his name is Joshua went out of his way to helped us with our emergency and possible cancellation . All very professional . The thing I liked best was it has this really cool vibe in the hotel , I am no new ager, but it truly does ! It location is about a ten minute walk from Times Square , on a street called Restraunte Row , I believe .The breakfast was cool, (they had Fruit Loops cereal !) . Housekeeping were topnotch.The hotel was such a cool experience we didn't want to go back to our own homes . An awesome experience . Would definitly do the hotel again .

This little gem is located in the center of everything. The rooms are small but very clean. The bed was very comfortable and the staff were very helpful and courteous. You cannot beat the value of 414.When you really want to spend more time and money seeing the city instead of the inside of a hotel.

We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. We were looking for a quiet place near Times Square. This is a quiet place indeed. But it is also a little rundown, it is clean however and we had reasonable good size room, it is NYC after all. The people are welcoming and friendly. Breakfast is complementary. The service however, could be better, on a regular things like calling a Taxi for their guests.  And by writing this I am referring to a simple thing like organizing a taxi to a concert Hall in the evening. ( Lincon Center) The receptionist told us they could not order a regular yellow cab, but only a private car. We had tickets for a concert of the New York Philharmonic Orchestra and did not want to miss this, we decided to go for the private car option, the receptionist suggested. A "stretched Limo' appeared, and we were off. The price of the whole thing was not the problem, we knew this beforehand.
