But it was more the fact that a hotel like this one, was not able to book a simple normal taxi ride. I think any Hotel should be able to do this without a problem.This was certainly NOT our first time in NYC. We know NYC is full off transportation possibilities, but that is beside the point. We got to the airport, by Yellowcab which we organized ourselves.

I've stayed with my fiancee for only one night at the 414 hotel.Finding a good hotel with a reasonable price in the heart of NYC is not an easy task - but 414 may be the solution.414 is a really nice small hotel, close to Times Square, Port Authority Bus Terminal and Broadway Theaters, but in a quite calm part of the 46th Street.The room was spacious, new and really clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The only problem was the noise that came from the upper room and from the street at some moments. Not enough to ruin the night, but enough to not allowing me to give a 5 stars review.As other reviewers have already stated, there is no elevator in the hotel, so be prepared to carry your own luggage up and downstairs.If you are willing to stay in the region, probably you will not find a better option in this price range.

The 414 is a relatively small hotel, with a good location near Times Square with plenty of restaurants nearby. The rooms are ok but the bathrooms could do with some refurbishment.Since they do not have a restaurant, the breakfast is a bit basic.

The location, the staff, the breakfast, the bed, the loveliness! Was thrilled to find this place, its very well priced and so easy to be in. I was very happy here and didn't want to leave! It's right near the theatre district, Times Square and the major train stations. Just one hint, don't get Gray Line bus tours, they are just around the corner and made for a terrible experience (for me )

Hola all,We travelled to NYC and stayed for 4 nights at the 414 hotel. We stumbled upon a Groupon and booked a great deal. I had to email the hotel twice with questions and received a prompt reply each time.The hotel itself is close to the action and yet far from too much noise, a rare find in NYC. The room we stayed in was at the front of the hotel and faced the street. There was street noise however it was manageable and we slept solidly every night. The room was clean and spacious with down bedding and all the basic-necessity toiletries. Breakfast was a highlight each day. Each morning there was fresh bread, bagels, croissants and cereal. There was 3 types of juice, coffee and tea as well. The kitchen stayed open from 7-7 providing fresh coffee, tea, hot chocolate and ice. The day we departed we used the complimentary computer in the lobby to print our boarding passes. The hotel held our bags for the day (we had an evening flight) free of charge and hassle free. Book this hotel with confidence! A gem in the city!!!

Traveled to NY before a cruise. Great staff who were friendly knowledgeable and helpful. Coordinatec the travel to the cruise ship terminal for all six of us. We were traveling with a 89king year old mom and the staff was gracious and made everything easy. They gave great food recommendations and sight seeing tips. Rooms are clean and simple. Not super large but since we were not in the room much thus was not a problem. We will be back and recommend to friends.

I absolutely LOVED hotel 414. It was small and cute and i went in christmas time so it felt so cosy walking in after the rain and being greeted with a smile from the staff and a fire going.The room was cosy and very modern with a flat screen TV mounted on the wall and the Bathroom was delightful compared to some others i have seen! the room had an i-phone dock which was very convenient A basic breakfast of pastries and bagels was included in the morning which was great to just grab and get going. The location is fantastic, as it is about a 5 minute walk to times Square, it is also situated amongst a jungle of fantastic restaurant's and is tucked away from all the hustle and bustle of times square, but not too far. The only thing with the Hotel is that there is no elevator so you have to make sure you can carry your bags up the narrow stair case. Overall I would Highly recommend the 414 hotel!

I took my wife away for a spantenous night out in New York City. Early evening, we had dinner at Copacabana Restaurant and then planned to club out later in the night. My wife wanted to rest for a few hours before we dance the night away. So, I looked for a hotel in the area and found this chic hotel tucked in the quiet street just walking distance from the Broadway Theatre District.. The minute we walked in this beautiful hotel, we felt extremely welcomed. The small lobby offering fireplace along with bistro tables and potted fresh flowers was extremely warm and inviting. We had room 501 - Wow, what a charming spacious room wiht modern modern decor. The room has a nice view of high rise buildngs. The minute my wife laid on the bed, she was in heavan. The bed was felt rich/expensive, extremely comfortable with down pillows/duvet, felt as if we were staying in a 5-star hotel. We didn't plan to spend a night in the city, so we didn't have anything with us, but rest assured, the room offered an i-phone deck to charge our phones, the bathroom has all of our toiletry needs.The hotel, the room, the bed, the view, the decor felt so nice, so perfect that we decided to just stay in and romance the night away. We slept so well - It was the best night we had in a long long time. It didn't end there; the morning massage shower was a wonderful experience, the complimentary breakfast was so fresh, offering pasteries, bagels, variety of coffee and tea. It was nice to see other guests had packed up the lobby having breakfast by the fireplace. We ended having herbal tea, crossants and begals in the hotel's charming courtyard, situated just between the front building and the back.We truly had a better time than we have had at some of the 5-star hotels & without spending a fortune. It was an amazing one night - that we will never forget. The personal touch by the staff and management was so evident; it showed that they take pride in offering clean, comfortable, warm accommodations to the guests. The 414 Hotel is now the hotel of our choice; it is just perfect in all aspects.

I work at a Hotel in Philadelphia, and was introduced to this lovely hotel by a staff member who was attending a Bed & Breakfast.com meeting at our hotel. After my first stay, I love it and knew that I would be back. Everytime I have stayed here, the staff has been just wonderful, the rooms charming.The location is perfect, a rare find!!

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights from Feb 9-12. Check-In was quick, all staff members were friendly!The room was spacious, with a comfy bed. There was an issue with the toilet, as we were leaving for the day we let the front desk staff know, and it was fixed when we returned later that day. Great service!They have a continental breakfast from 7-10a.m. which was nice. it consisted of pastries, cereal, juice, yogurt.The hotel is a short 2 block walk to Times Square. There were many great restaurants in the area, easy access to subway stations.Would definitely stay here again.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights/5 days at the end of November/Beginning of December after thanksgiving. It was so cute tucked away in the middle of the street between houses and restaurants etc. We arrived late at night around 11pm and the lady on reception was really friendly check in was easy and it was nice and warm from the log fire burning compared to the freezing temperatures outside! Our room was in the building at the back so you had to walk through the small cute courtyard garden area to get to it, it was nice to not be on the street though and we had a view of this outside of our bedroom window. We had a room on the first floor next to the main door into the building so I though the noise of this would be annoying however crazy, long days in New York tire you out so think I could have slept though anything! The room was small however had everything you would need along with a very comfy bed and a flat screen tv which we would always use for the music channel. The bathroom too was small however was clean and had everything you would need in it. The breakfast in the hotel was served from 7.30 til 10am and was in the reception area of the hotel, it was a help yourself buffet but had everything you would need including cereals, pastries, bagels and bread, with plenty of spreads, juice, hot drinks etc. This had a nice cosy feel about it and you also got to chat to your fellow guests and see what people recommended etc. The kitchen area was also open from 7am til 7pm daily for you to help yourself to hot drinks and even had take away cups so you could make a hot drink for your walk into the main city perfect on cold winter mornings and a lovely perk of the hotel. The hotel was in a very good location called 'Hells Kitchen' so had a good range of restaurants to choose from, it was also only a 5 min walk from Broadway/Times Square and if I'm honest we walked to pretty much everywhere as I think its the easiest way to get around. We went to The Empire State Building, The Rockefeller Centre, Central Park by walking to them. The only day we did get a taxi was to the MET Museum only because the weather was so bad to walk in, but still this was quick and cheap and we also got the subway to Ground Zero, cheap and easy. We went just after the recent storms/hurricanes so unfortunately the Statue of Liberty and Zoo's weren't open and a few of the subways were still closed due to flooding which was sad to know. But we still loved our time there and there is so much to do, on a positive note we were there for the lighting of the Rockefeller tree and if any of you go at this time I really recommend watching this, the queues are crazy and we ended up standing in the freezing cold for about 4 hours but it was so worth it, the tree is so magical and you get a free music concert which included Mariah Carey, Cee Lo Green, Rod Stewart and Tony Bennett to name a few singing Christmas songs, loved it and it definitely got you into the Christmas Spirit! I loved this cute boutique hotel compared to all the high rise buildings and coming from London it was nice to get away from all that so I would recommend and would love to stay there again.

Hotel 414 was perfect for our business trip. My friend and I shared one room that was plenty large enough for the two of us. The bathroom was roomy and the shower was nice and hot with good water pressure. The bed was very comfy and the hotel was very quiet. The staff was very helpful and every morning there is a free continental breakfast with cereal, croissants, cereal, juices and coffee. There were plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. We particularly enjoyed Becco which was less than 1 block away. I would stay here again and it was a 15 minute walk to the Piers and the Javitts center.

Stayed here for a special birthday weekend January 2013. I used to live 2 blocks from this hotel and was familiar with it but had never stayed, but when I saw their Winter Wonderland special buy 3 nights get the 4th free I couldn't pass up such a great deal since I wanted to be in my old neighborhood during my stay. Nice touches before my stay like a welcome email reminding me of my dates and to let them know if there were any special requests let me know I was going to have an extra special stay. The staff couldn't have been more friendly, welcoming and helpful. My room was on the 4th floor with a view of 46th Street, Noise was minimal even though it is a busy street! No elevator so if you have alot of luggage or kids I wouldn't recommend this hotel. The room was spacious with a very comfortable queen bed, work desk, sitting chair, dresser and refrigerator. Big flat screen with basic channels was just fine. LOVED the bathroom, very large with nice tile and subway tiles in the shower, plenty of counter space. Housekeeping kept my room spotless during my stay. Nice breakfast every morning with coffee and tea service (coffee was delicious!) throughout the day and evening in a lovely lounge area with fireplace. I honestly found nothing but good things about this charming hotel and it will be my first choice when I come back to visit NYC. Thank you 414 Hotel for making my birthday weekend so extra special!

we had a great stay at this hotel, january 2013. central to time square, metro and subways. we had a room against the back yard with a king size bed. everything was clean and in order. continental breakfast included in the lobby :)

I recently stayed at Hotel 414 for a week. The location was perfect for walking to restaurants, shops, Central Park, theaters, subway stations - to name a few. My room was a good size with queen bed, large bathroom with all the amenities & was kept immaculately clean during my stay. A continental breakfast was available every morning & coffee & tea were available in the small kitchen until 8 PM. The staff was friendly & accommodating. I would suggest that a fruit option be made available at breakfast in addition to the breads & cereals. And, since this is an older building my room did not have a thermostat & was extremely hot. I had the windows wide open & the heating vent closed & it was the middle of January! I would stay at Hotel 414 again. It's a hidden gem in the big city!

Simple and comfortable. We had a nice stay there in december, but all is bad, when ends bad. We ask for the guy in the front desk to schedule a car to take us to the JFK on December, 30th at 3pm. But the guy forgot to do it and we did not know. We discover at 3pm that we did not have a car to pick us up. So we waited for a solution but the hotel didn't do anything to solve the problem. Our flight was 5pm and we didn't have any time to lose. At 3:20 the hotel manager asked us to walk to the 9th street to try to catch a cab by ourselves. So we had to walk with our 3 heavy bags. We didn't lose our flight because it was delayed. Thank God for that!The internet in the 414 hotel wasn't working. They have wi-fi, but you can't connect. So don't count on using it.

We had a pleasure of staying at 414 hotel at Christmas eve. This boutique hotel is very cozy and elegant. It is one of those places that you want to stay in your honeymoon. There is a cute court yard where we enjoyed our wine regardless of the cold weather of the city. Our room was furnished simply yet very modern. My 8 year old loved to find a stuffed animal that was placed in the room for us with the option of buying it. Of course we did.:) After all who would not like Gonzo! Breakfast area was nicely decorated for the holidays. Having the fire place where we had our breakfast was a big plus since we got cold and wet that night. Pastries were delicious and fresh. Having nice cup of hot chocolate made my morning. The location of the hotel is also ideal. Theater district, Broadway, Bryant park where my daughter ice skated with her friend, and THE Christmas tree were all walking distance from the hotel. The manager and the staff were friendly and very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

The only pro about this place was the convenient location to Times Square. The staff are all miserable and of no help, no common courtesy either, so unfriendly. Unless you get up for cereal and bread , which is what breakfast consists of, before 7am, then good luck getting a seat as there are about 6-8 seats maybe at most. My husband and I resorted to actually going to a breakfast buffet one morning and then eating in our room another morning. I've stayed at similar style places before with bigger rooms and better breakfasts. the rooms are very old and not only in need of updating but renovations as the walls look like they're crumbling in the bathrooms! I would never stay here again. the kicker was how they close the "kitchen" and you can't get ice or coffee after 7pm.

This hotel is in a great location. I was able to walk to such great locations from this place. I walked to the Theater District, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and The Met. I arrived at 9:30 p.m. at night. Being hungry, I was happy to see that there were some really yummy restaurants and bars across the street. The room was cute. I noticed that a stuffed animal muppet was already living in my room. It made my husband and me smile. I had to walk through the courtyard to get to my room. They kept the room really warm which was a plus since it was freezing outside. The bathroom was spacious. I loved the simple breakfast. I picked up a croissant and coffee. I would consider going back the next time that I'm in NYC.

Really enjoyed my stay here...cute place that I definitely hope to stay at again the next time I visit NYC. There's nothing specific i can pinpoint about the place as being uniquely/overly special, but overall you just get the feeling that the owners put a lot of care into the property...there's just a good vibe here and it's so much better than the average "corporate chain" hotel in anywhere USA. Good location convenient to Times Square & Theater District.

A nice place, at a few blocks from Times square, the bedroom are quiet, Quality of bedding is good. By some aspects, we are in a B&B ( sahred kitchen, style of the breakfast...)rooms are not really big but sufficient. Bathroom is not modern but is functionning :)

This is a small boutique hotel with a nice intimate homey atmosphere. It's actually 2 buildings with a really nice paved courtyard garden in between them, for a relaxing drink in the evening. The staff were very friendly and super-helpful, and the rooms were serviced really well.Breakfast is included, which is not always easy to find in a New York hotel, and there is a little kitchen with tea and coffee facilities which you can help yourself to, up until around 9pm. It looks like it's been renovated quite recently, as the decor is quite modern and nicely done. Really comfy bed too.It's located on a fairly quiet street, but you only have to walk about 7 or 8 minutes before you reach busy Times Square. There's a great flea market on Saturday mornings only a couple of blocks away (Hell's Kitchen Flea Market), worth a look if you're into all things vintage. Macy's is about a 20 minute walk, and Empire State Building about 30 minutes. Central Park is about 25-30 minutes walk too, in the other direction. You can catch the subway easily from Times Square down to Battery Park if you want to visit Lady Liberty.There are great restaurants around Times Square, and around the hotel too - you won't find it hard to get a nice meal. It's also very close to the theatre district - I saw Mary Poppins at the New Amsterdam (very cute).I really enjoyed my stay at the 414, and would definitely stay there again.

Probably overlooked by most tourists because it lies outside the Tourist world bounded by 8th Ave on the west yet quite close to Theatre District, Restuarant Row and reasonable walking distance from Rockefeller Center, the Diamond District (47th St.) and 5th Ave, sits a little gem of a hotel, the 414 Hotel on 46th St between 9th and 10th Ave. Comfortable, friendly staff and reasonably priced it makes a great alternative to the overpriced chain hotels or bare, drab motel-like properties of the Theatre District. Don't forget the free breakfast. Give it a try.Downside: small, spare rooms and as for an elevator, "Fuggedaboutit"

We excitedly booked the 414 Hotel for a long-planned weekend in NYC. Several friends had shared excellent personal reviews from their own stays, and were looking forward to it. Even with booking nearly three months in advance, we had the next to last vacancy for our 2nd set of date preferences. Think of the 414 Hotel as your personal, private brownstone apartment: the location is perfect, the room excellent (and quiet), the staff friendly and the advance communication prompt. We were welcomed warmly for an early arrival and spent one night before Hurricane Sandy stormed up the coast. As Jersey Shore residents, we needed to head home immediately on very short notice. The 414 Hotel was so understanding and immediately offered a refund of the unused nights. They gave their best wishes and said that the refund would appear within 48 hours -- and called a few hours after we left NYC to be sure that we'd arrived home in time. The refund was processed immediately and appeared well within the 48 hours and before our power was restored. Their staff and customer service --- and entire management team --- are stellar, and we look forward to returning!! Thank you--- and what a great place!

If you like small hotels on a good location at a reasonable price, this is the place to go. Good rooms with quite some space,, great diy breakfast, great location. I do miss the personal touch a bit...

Fab hotelClean cosy roomsFantastic locationFriendly helpful staffLovely breakfastThis is a great hotel at reasonable prices for NYC staff are super helpful and provide maps and local info on requestBreakfast is continental and tastyFree tea and coffee all day and microwave in kitchen availableThey also store your bags for free on the day you leaveA fantastic gem !!!!

We got 102 on ground floor. Room normal but with the unavoidable carpet. Room just big enough for couple with 2 suitcases. Bathroom surprisingly big, bright and clean. Very positiv. window facing back yard with 4 tables, this was October and still possible to enjoy breakfast outdoors. Had to, not enough space inside for all guests around 8 AM.Breakfast was like at home, people around the table making it easy to discuss matters with other guests. Very simple breakfast but ok. Very helpfull staff. Location very good.An unexpected pleasure in a big city.

414 Hotel : Cute little "red-brick" hotel (approx. 20 rooms) with great location (2 blocks from Times Square) and excellent service. People working there are really helpful and charming :-) !!!Spacious and clean rooms with confortable beds.Good and simple breakfast with different variety of breads, cereal, jams, yogourts, coffee, tea, chocolate, juices etc.We all enjoyed it and this will be the place where we will stay for our next trip to New York!PS to Mary : Thanks again for the "limo", the kids loved it :-))

The 414 Hotel is located in a super spot. Right on restaurant row. Easy walking to many good restaurants. Subway access is close. Street is a nice neighborhood and reasonably quiet. Staff are friendly, helpful. Breakfast offering is enough to get you going.

My daughter and I stayed for 6 days and thought it was in a great location ( Hells Kitchen ), I loved the bed, so comfy, and the entire place felt like home. I would stay here again. I wish that they had plugs by the side of the bed for cell phone plug in,( you could bring a short extension cord for this) and I wish that they had an elevator, but have stayed in the city many many times, and this time was the best. We were in room 301, and it was so quiet. The walk to Times Square is only about 8 minutes. Loved the charming breakfast they served. Free WIFI is also great. The only thing wrong with our room, was we could have used more pillows, and extra hangers since we stayed for almost a week, and they did not have either. It was a boutique hotel for sure. The staff was wonderful also. I loved the exercise of the steps since we ate so much in the city. I loved being in the back facing the courtyard also. The blinds were wonderful at keeping the morning sun out of our face. I agree about the price being a bit high, but everything in the city is pricey. I can't wait to stay here again. And will be sure to tell people about it. The showers do need to be re-grouted, but very clean and tidy.

We found this little gem on a Bed and Breakfast website even thought they don't serve a full continental breakfast, just rolls and cereal. The hotel is small and cozy. There is a courtyard separating two properties where you can sit and relax after a full day of sightseeing. We stayed in the back property, off the street and less stairs.The room is cozy, plenty of closet space and quiet and clean.I can't say enough about the location. There are 2 subway stations close by, close to supermarkets, wine stores, drug stores, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway and the best of all - restaurants. Dozens and Dozens of them. 46th Street between 8th and 9th is Restaurant Row - Chilean, Italian, Spanish, Russian restaurants. Just walk up one side of 9th Avenue and down the other and read the menus. The staff were friendly and always accomodating. Perfect!

Only ten minutes from times square, the 414 is in a great location. Rare to have breakfast included in an NYC hotel so we loved it! Walls could do with a tiny lick of paint and the air conditioning was quite noisy but in general the hotel is in great condition and the staff were all lovely. Would definitely recommend.

Stayed here last 2 nights. Booked queen room ... Was so small, could hardly get around the "double" bed. Room was downstairs which saved carting luggage up huge staircase, but windows faced directly onto back courtyard, so had to keep blinds down for privacy. Aircon was too noisy to have on and only about 4 feet away blowing directly into me head, so hardly got any sleep the first night as it was so stuffy. Managed to open window a little on 2nd night to allow bit of air in. Breakfast was included, very adequate, but not enough room to sit anywhere and eat - had to eat breaky in bedroom:(Position fantastic, but think bit too overpriced for what we got

Stayed here for three nights in August 2012. The location could not be better within an easy walk to Times Square and plenty of bars and restaurants near by. The hotel itself is quite small and one would describe it as 'boutique'. The rooms are quite well decorated but just starting to show signs of ware. We had a room on the 'street' side and did not find it noisy at all. Staff are excellent and helped us on numerous occasions with directions, taxi's etc. Breakfast is seld served in the entrance hall. I know it sounds strange but it works quite well and you always meet and get chatting to fellow guests. Free Wi-Fi which in my book these days is a MUST. My only criticism is that there is no lifts so if you are on the top floor as we were its three flights of stairs to get to your room. This did not bother us but if you are elderly it might be worth asking for a floor on the lower floors.

I stayed at the 414 Hotel over the Labor Day weekend. This is a lovely boutique hotel on a tree-lined street just a couple of blocks away from the hustle and bustle of Broadway and Times Square. It really is a hidden gem, but may not stay that way if these reviews are any indication.I had a Queen Room, which was spacious and clean. Amenities included a large flat-screen TV, a clock radio with an iPod dock (setting the alarm was a bit tricky though, so providing a nightstand card with directions might be a good idea), a mini fridge, and an in-room safe. Also worth noting is the generous sized 6-drawer bureau, which is handy for guests staying longer than a couple of nights. The air conditioning kept the room very cool on a weekend of 90+ degree temperatures. My room (304) faced the street, which had its share of noise from traffic (cars and horse-drawn carriages) and late night revelers. I was okay with it but if you are a light sleeper you’re better off getting a courtyard facing room. The small nitpicks on the room I have are the walls are full of scuff marks and could use a fresh coat of paint; and the tile surround in the tub/shower needs some regrouting – but these should not be considered dealbreakers by any stretch.The hotel has free wi-fi as well as a computer station in the lobby if you want to leave the laptop at home. There are no elevators, just stairs for the upper floors, so be sure to get a room on the 1st floor if accessibility is an issue.Outside the front entrance are a couple of benches where you can have a front seat to indulge in people watching. In the back, separating the 2 brownstones that make up Hotel 414, is a courtyard with several tables ideal for chilling out with a book or having breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, it is served every morning from 7-10 a.m. free of charge. It is the typical continental breakfast with bread, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit, juices, and coffee/tea. If you’re looking for something more substantial, the Galaxy Diner is down the street at 46th & 9th.The location really cannot be beat. The famous “Restaurant Row” is just one block away (but there are tons of restaurants in the surrounding blocks), with Times Square just a couple of blocks further. The Intrepid Museum and Circle Line Cruises are a 10 minute walk at best.If you’re looking for a clean, comfortable room in the heart of downtown that won’t break the bank then go to Hotel 414. I can’t recommend it enough.

A lovely place to stay whilst in NY. Definitely value for money. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The hotel has a lovely homely feeling about it, with the friendly staff adding to the experience. The courtyard is a great place to enjoy the complimentary breakfast. Also a great location, close enough to times square without being too close to the hustle and bustle. And the added advantage of free Wi-Fi.Very much recommend this hotel.

Just returned from 4 days in New York City at the 414. Great location and great staff. Our room was on the courtyard which I would recommend. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Easy walking to much of the city and easy access to public transit. The room was very clean and nicely furnished. We look forward to returning!

We are just back from NYC, spent 6 nights at 414. The location is great, we walked everywhere, the staff were really helpful - the rooms facing the front was a little noisy (according to my room-mate) however nothing that ear plugs won't fix. Definitely recommend this hotel for travelers who want a good base and spend most of their time out and about, also do a great breakfast!

We were very pleased with the relaxed and friendly feeling we had while staying here. Our room was off the courtyard in the brownstone in the back. Very quiet. We also had no smoke intrusion from the few smokers in the small courtyard. The room was very clean and well maintained. The cute little breakfast was just right and we got to meet other people from all over. Highly recommend this place. It is close to theaters, Chelsy Pier, lots of food, and it was very inexpensive.

Recently returned from a stay at this small boutique style hotel. Friendly & helpful staff who provided us with all manner of info upon request. Great location for Broadway, Times Square etc. The hotel consists of 2 buildings divided by a small courtyard terrace, great for having breakfast outside or just to take a breather from the frantic pace of NYC. Very comfy beds in perfectly adequate rooms. If your room is at the front of the hotel facing West 46th St, then be prepared for some noise late at night & early hours of following day. The usual sirens (inevitable in NYC), honking of horns (despite a $350.00 fine) if caught of course, by far the worst offenders are late night revellers who feel the need to scream & shout on the street without any consideration for residents or visitors, especially at the weekend.
room was extremely small and very noisy, however this could be overlooked if the staff were friendly and helpful. Most unpleasant experience.

I almost hate to add to the praises heaped on this place, because I'm afraid it will get priced out of my range. But my experience was great here. The location was wonderful, the staff was wonderful, the room was fine (trouble with TV channels, but I didn't care enough to ask for help), continental breakfast included good coffee so I was happy about that. Having morning coffee in the courtyard was fun; sitting on the front steps with a.m. coffee was fun, too. I had no trouble sleeping. Plus the area felt like a real neighborhood, which was a nice homey feeling after the ramped-up intensity of Liberty Island, Times Square, etc.

From arrival to leaving the service was excellent .When we arrived we were greeted with maps and useful local information and throughout our 3 night stay we were made to feel welcome . The room was clean ,tidy and surprisingly roomy.The Hotel itself was situated in a great spot close to Times Square, the subway and a healthy walk from the Lincoln arts centre, as well as there being a huge choice of restaurants just around the corner. I would seriously recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a holiday in New York.

We stayed at 414 hotel for 7 days. This was our first trip to New York and it was really great. The location of the hotel is just perfect, a real value for money. Even though several means of transportation where available near the hotel we used to walk around the big avenues and broadway theaters. Loved it!The hotel has no elevator but this is not a problem. You only have to carry you luggage twice, check in and check out, so it's ok. Consider that our room was at top floor.The breakfast of the Hotel was a little bit disappointing. We are Europeans and we are used to rich breakfasts, so this is probably why we didn't enjoy the variety. The stuff of the Hotel is polite and helpful. They were kind enough to provide us with a map and give us tips for what we have to see.414 is on our list for our next trip to NYC.

My partner and I recently completed a 10-night stay at 414 Hotel and what a very pleasant experience it was. When we arrived at the hotel after our long trans-Atlantic flight, we were properly greeted at the reception desk and were informed about the hotel's complementary breakfast and other features. Our room was very clean and comfortable during our entire stay. There is plenty of closet and drawer space in the room to hang and store clothing. The room also features an easy-to-operate safe for storing valuables as well as a docking station for an iPod. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I cannot recommend this hotel enough to anyone who is looking for a convenient location but does not want to spend a fortune. If you are planning to stay there, be sure to book early as the hotel does fill up very quickly!

From check in to check out this place was awesome. Perfect location to Times Square. The staff were lovely, always helpful and informative. Lots of restaurants a stones throw away. The only slight down side would be the street front rooms as they can be noisy. We stayed in room 304 on the street front for 6 nights, when we stay next time we'll ask for a back room although the sound of horses trotting past and the general hustle and bustle is what New York is all about!!!! The room was clean and tidy and the breakfast was sufficient for our needs.

I stayed here for 2 nights in April 2012, very nice reception friendly staff, I was in room 201 which is across the courtyard up to the left. The first night the neighbor had some kind of attitude problem but when he stopped yelling I went straight to sleep. The breakfast was great, everything tasty and adequate for the price in NY. Second night was better, great night sleep and again good breakfast. I will stay here in a couple of months again since I will travel for business to NYC frequently.

Stayed here for 6 nights in March with my wife, and we were very pleased. First of all, the location is just perfect: walking distance to many major attractions. And we were pleasantly surprised of how quiet the hotel was (at least in the courtyard building), The staff was also very helpfull. We are quite sure to return to this hotel on our next trip to NYC.

I stayed here recently with my husband for two nights. Nice boutique hotel within walking distance to Times Square,Broadway and Restaurants. The staff here were fantastic,very friendly and happy to answer questions. Breakfast is included as well as WiFi. Be prepared to carry your bags upstairs as there is no lift. The rooms were a good size and clean,awesome TV! Overall a very nice hotel,great location and staff. Our room was on the courtyard side and was very quiet, no street noise although when we were there we could hear people talking until the early hours which was slightly irritating. Would recommend this Hotel and would definitely stay again.

Quaint and Cozy I discovered a very nice hotel at the right price -- The 414 Hotel. Perfect location! Only four blocks from Times Square. Close to everything: subways, Broadway shows, and tons of great restaurants. The hotel has a cute building entrance, and I felt like I was coming home instead of an impersonable, crowded hotel. I found the hotel to have friendly service, and liked that they had free breakfast every morning for guest’s convenience. The rooms were clean, inviting, and WIFI was available. There was good water pressure in the shower, and most of all, the bed was incredibly comfortable – slept so good every night after wandering around NYC all day. Definitely recommend it.

This hotel is in a good location, near many restaurants and a 10 minute walk from Times Square and Theater District. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was clean. There is free wi-fi and a small refrigerator in the room which is a nice perk. I had a room on the streetside, it was very noisy in the middle of the night when the bars let out and the garbage trucks pick up the garbage several times at 3:00 am in the week that I stayed there. Fortunately I brought ear plugs with me. This room also was very warm, even my friend remarked how hot it was in the room. You have to go to the front desk to control the heat in the room. The continental breakfast is fine, coffee, tea, juice, milk, cereal, croissants, bagels and fruit. On the weekends they have yogurt. The kitchen area is nice, there is a microwave, dishes and glasses if you want to prepare a simple meal in the evening. It closes at 8:00 pm. We had to stand one morning at breakfast during the weekend since the table was full as well as the chairs by the front desk (only seating for 8). It will be great when they repaint and replace the carpet.

My friend and I cannot say anything but great things about this hotel. It is in a perfect location and the staff is very pleasant!! Along with that, the hotel and hotel room was very clean and good size. If you go to the city, the 414 hotel is a great place to stay!

With new carpet and paint, this place will be absolutely perfect. It's clean, well located (with a garage on the next block so you can drive in through the Lincoln Tunnel and dump the car within blocks!), staff is helpful and pleasant, and breakfast is more than adequate. So glad to find a reasonable and accessible place in NYC.

Well located European style inn in Hells Kitchen, a 10 minute walk to Broadway theaters, in a residential neighborhood. Would have been a 4 star review, but rooms and hallways need new carpet and a fresh coat of paint. The manager told me that is planned for this winter, so perhaps future reviews will be better. Rooms good sized and well priced for Manhattan.

Located in Manhattan's Hell Kitchen the 414 offers the best value for your money. The rooms are well equipped with 37"-Flatscreen and are spacious compared with other hotels in NYC. They are all clean and quiet, one the other hand the Times Square is only a five-minute-walk away.I was there for the New York Marathon and at the day before the race I found a complimentary race pack in the room with bottles of water and Gatorade as well as Energy Bar. On the race day the hotel offered a breakfast at 5 a.m.To describe the Hotel 414 in one word, I would choose "perfect"

We have stayed here on and off for the past decade plus. It was originally a B&B and very fun, charming and personal. The cost was less than area hotels. During the next 3-4 years it was sold and then appeared run down and yet was very expensive and manned by very unfriendly people. Then a year or two later it seemed to have new owners again. It was rehabbed and things were very nice (especially in the guest rooms), but the price was now even more than area hotels, although they do include a light continental breakfast. Now it seems a bit different again - some more upgrades. The staff is again very friendly as it was in the beginning and the price is still about the same as area hotels. It is right near the theatres, so very convenient.

We enjoyed staying here for 4 nights. It is on a street with several restaurants between it and Times Square, We had juice and muffins, croissants and fruit. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was a computer at the entrance. There is no elevator so you have to be able to carry your suitcases up stairs. Mary at the desk was very friendly.

When I go back to New York (let's hope it's sooner arther than later!!) I would certainly stay at the 414 again. The reasons are it's in a great location (2 blocks from Times Square and the Theatre District) and the staff were excellent, really friendly. The continental breakfast was great, and if you get a nice morning, you can sit out in their 'garden' to eat, which is what we did.The rooms are spacious, clean - my only gripe is that our particular room looked like it needed a lick of paint, and we could hear the noise from the street quite loudly until late a night. Overall, this is a very good hotel - very reasonable for the quality.

Very small, very intimate place. The guys who run it are very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are nice and have a boutique feel. You don't have all that extras that would come with a larger hotel, but that's okay. Wish it was a little less expensive. Nice, comfortable. Because it's so small there's a very nice personal and intimate quality to staying here that you wouldn't get anywhere else. It's one of a kind in NYC. Recommended.

After we got over the shock of the cost of hotels in NYC, we started looking for the most central location as we are not able to walk long distances anymore. The 414 is only minutes from times square,Broadway and restaurant row. The accommodations are simple but more than adequate and the breakfast provided is again simple but good. The rooms are well appointed and clean and the courtyard between the two bldgs is wonderful if the weather is good. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Keep in mind however that there is no elevator and if this is a problem you may want to stay on the lower floors.

We chose the hotel since it has been suggested by several friend.Good aspects: 10 min walking from Times Square/Theatres District, very close to a nice place to eat (City Sandwich), laundry shop just next door. Staff was friendly and room clean, however there are a few things that could be improved. The breakfast has not a big choice. The air conditioner is incredibly noisy. Our room was across the courtyard on ground level and it was a bit too dark and most of all it was kinda damp, some nights the sheets on the bed looked almost wet. On a night of huge rain, the water was entering the room from below the door (not too much, but it was). Considering it all, it is a little too expensive for the level of arrangement. But still we think we could come back due to the position and the staff, hoping to have a different room.

ThIs cute little property is in an ideal part of Midtown Manhattan, it has clean decent sized rooms that are more than acceptable. The Breakfast is a great way to start the day. Free WIFI and internet are all small things that make this property a winner.

Please note that my overall rating of "Good" has to be read in conjunction with the severequalifications stated below.The price is probably a bit over the top for the kind of hotel it is. The rooms are perfect - very boutique - but not matched by downstairs where the reception area competes for space with the kitchen and the dining area (not room!).Restructured from a residential property, past the reception area and up the stairs, one could be on the set of a 1940s film and meet Robert Mitchum, gun in hand, coming down.Beware that there is no lift. Rooms at the front of the hotel are also very noisy, but the area isperfect if you want to be near lots of restaurtants and have Times Square and the theatredistrict on your doorstep. Other than that it's not very far to walk to, say, St Patrick's, 5thAvenue, Rockefeller Centre, the park etc.It is also a pleasant mixed area.Do not book taxis through the hotel reception - they only book limos which charge twice as much as yellow cabs.

We were lucky to get a top floor room at the elegant and welcoming 414 in Manhattan this summer. It is the sort of place where you meet entertaining people at the "table d'hotes" breakfast and where you are directly in a cool neighbourhood that is central but not stuck in the horror-zone that is Times Square. Our room was tastefully decorated, and although we looked out on to the street, the noise was tolerable - the sound of New York City is always tolerable! Great place if a little pricey, but I would go back tomorrow!

Think about it. You are in New York City! What do you really need? A convenient location, a comfy bed, nice bathroom and Wifi. All of this and more may be had at the Hotel 414. My only issue is the size of the Queen rooms. Too small to really want to hang out in. Luckily there is a charming courtyard and nice "Lobby". Still, I would spring for a King room next time. Breakfast was a simple affair, mostly bread and cereal based. Would love a little fruit mixed in. We asked for a car pickup to the airport. Whoever they use was not dependable, though, and did not show up on time. Had to take a cab instead.

Granted, I made my reservations very late and my stay was at peak of fashion week, therefore the pickings were slim. Nevertheless the room that was assigned to me was probably the worst room in the whole hotel (Room 101). Situated between the reception area and the back yard (people were actually sitting by my window...) it was on the very small side (even for NYC standards) and noisy.On the positive side, the hotel was well priced and located on a relatively quiet street. Also the complimentary "do it yourself" breakfast was quite good with excellent coffee and tea selection, as well as fresh croissants, juices, cereal and bagels.

The 414 Hotel has much going for it: great location, especially for the theatre, perfect little terrace out the back, quiet rooms. We found it charming and restful in a way that larger hotels never quite manage. The staff were helpful in their recommendations for restaurants and try as I might I can't find fault with the place. Full marks 414!

I will definately return to 414. Location great for theatre going and 'Restaurant Row', and everyone working and staying at 414 was very friendly! The included breakfast was plentiful, courtyard area small but nice to have in NYC. Room was perfect for the two of us. I was in NY with my 9-year-old to see a show, and we were very happy with the room, and location to everything!

This is my third visit to 414 Hotel with my husband. The staff has been always very well informed/helpful with the happenings of New York. The rooms are elegant and simple. We enjoyed the continental breakfast and meeting with other guests while having our tea and coffees, and also comparing notes of hotels. If I could take something as a souvenir I would take Sakina with us! She was very helpful and always cheerful. Thank you for a memorable time.

Small b&b hotel on Restaurant Row & close to Broadway & the river (Intrepid Museum, cruises). We stayed a week. Most of the mid-city was within easy walking distance. We had a quiet, comfortable room overlooking the courtyard. Helpful staff when it was needed, but I felt some could have been more friendly. Breakfasts lacked variety for a long stay. Lack of a facility to boil (or even heat) water after 8.00pm prevented having a 'cuppa' in the hotel until breakfast (bring your own kettle).

My husband and I stayed in this charming boutique hotel, for 4 nights (8-12 June 2011). It's perfect located, 800 meters away from Time Square (6 minutes walking). Our room (206) was very confortable, located in the back building, away from the street noises. Every day we had breakfast at the nice backyard terrace. If you are looking for a place just to stay for the night, spending all day visiting the city, this is the right spot. The only not that good point is that the staff isn't as nice as we'd expect, but no big deal.

When researching New York hotels, we realised how expensive they all were. Hotel 414 seemed to be a good compromise. It took a couple of days to grow on us, but it proved to be a good place to stay. Its big plus is the location - just a few blocks from Times Square and lots of underground stations nearby. Nowhere takes long to get to. We always felt safe walking home, even quite late at night.The room was very well equipped, with iPod docking, a huge tele, big bed and clean en-suite. The decorations are quite minimal, and when we first arrived it seemed run-down rather than modern, but we grew to like it!Staff were consistently helpful and friendly, and the free internet access in the lobby was a big bonus for us.Breakfast was simple, but more than adequate, and we were pleased to be able to have this in the hotel rather than find somewhere every day.We requested a room facing the courtyard to minimise noise - which worked in terms of street noise, but failed in terms of noise of other guests, as we were on the ground floor. Not the other guests' fault, it is very difficult to walk past quietly due to noisy floors. We got used to this though, and it wasn't a big issue.Food-wise, we would highly recommend 5th Napkin and especially Shake Shack, both 5 mins walk.A recommended hotel, and a change from big chains.

Stayed at this wonderful hotel again (stayed here at least 4 times) just love it and it has been done up since I stayed there 3 years ago. Lovely, clean and quiet hotel in a brilliant part of the city perfect for getting around NY and Times Square and Restaurants. Hope to be back later this year.

Hotel 414 is an idyllic oasis in a very desirable location! Our son and daughter-in-law had a most elegant, intimate, Manhattan wedding that totaled 26 people and Hotel 414 was the absolute perfect setting for all of us to stay!Hotel 414 has more of a European bed and breakfast feel with an incredibly warm and attentive staff. At first sight, the porch was flowing with beautiful flowers and seating to watch the passersby, a favorite New York pastime. The lobby is well-appointed with an inviting communal table and adorable functional kitchen area for the guests to help themselves to the complimentary breakfast. Much of the charm of Hotel 414 is in its size, merely 22 rooms. The physical structure is two townhouses, front to back, separated by a lovely, tranquil courtyard/garden area complete with bistro tables and chairs. It is an ideal spot to enjoy breakfast and coffee or a quiet retreat to read. After our guests checked in and dressed for the occasion, we utilized the courtyard for a cocktail hour for both families to meet, greet and assemble before we boarded the limo-bus to shuttle us off to Central Park for the ceremony. Hotel 414’s staff that served couldn’t have been any more professional, discreet and solicitous.The accommodations were spacious and comfortable with most of our guests facing the courtyard. There was no hint of the bustling city action outside. The rooms were equipped with large flatscreen HD TV’s and iPOD adaptable radios, high-tech conveniences amidst Old World charm! And as a side note, our guests commented on how well they slept! They loved the beds! Many of our guests that awoke early enjoyed the croissants and coffee before we made our way to brunch. Hotel 414 was very accessible to all of our locations, Central Park, zipping crosstown to La Grenouille for dinner, then brunch at Marseilles the next morning, a short walk around the corner.Oddly enough, we didn’t realize how French the whole event would be and Hotel 414 couldn’t have been any more suitable for our memorable weekend!
The perfect little hotel for a stay in NYC!Perfect location!Rooms are a bit small but very nice.Especially nice were the breakfasts in the lobby which came close to a family breakfast. :-)

I just discovered this wonderful small hotel on the edge of the theatre district on a lovely tree lined street that is reminiscent of those quaint European hotels that offer personalized service, communal breakfasts, privacy and make you feel welcome and special. The rooms are large, nicely furnished with elegance and flair and do not have that cookie cutter hotel feel. There is a lovely court yard in the middle of this renovated 4 story mansion where you can rest or enjoy the gardens and quiet while you drink coffee or sip wine between your adventures and outings or before you go to bed at night. Convenient to subways, many fine restaurants around the corner and one next door and you can even have food delivered to your room. I was truly impressed and thrilled to have discovered this hotel, now my favorite hotel in Manhattan. I'm a New Yorker that has been living upstate for a couple of years and am in the process of returning here so I come into the city quite frequently both for business and personal matters. I am recommending this hotel to all my friends who live out of state.

We had 4 fabulous nights at 414 Hotel. Staff were wonderfully welcoming and helpful. Pleasant neighbourhood yet close to theatre district, transportation, restaurants, etc. It is described as a boutique hotel and it accomplishes that quietly and with charm. Small, intimate and friendly. Not cheap but you get what you pay for. We have travelled extensively in Europe and North America. This was one of our most positive hotel experiences.

We stayed here for one night on a weekend where pretty much every hotel neat times square was full. It was more expensive than we would normally pay ( nearly $300 with taxes), but because of a tight travel schedule we did not have much choice.This was the most we had ever paid for a hotel in NY and was also probably the worst room we've ever had. Rooms are small, but biggest problem was noise. All night we could hear thumping music from next door, in the morning we were trying to sleep in but could clearly hear conversations from people in next room, and a lot of noise from the hallway. Additionally every ten minutes the heating unit made a strange electric buzzing noise.On the plus side, the room was sufficiently clean, the bathroom was surprisingly large and updated and the location was decent.Not a terrible hotel, just not worth the price and too noisy.

We have stayed at the 414 Hotel for our annual weekend in New York City and have always liked it because of its small size, location, comfortable beds, included continental breakfast and if you got a room facing the courtyard, its quiet atmosphere for sleeping. Unfortunately, since we were there last year (2010) they have a new neighbour, a "hookah" bar/restaurant which plays loud music until 4:00 a.m. The constant thump, thump, thump makes it virtually impossible to sleep. If you plan on going there, when you get to your room, learn to operate the air conditioner, even in winter, as the fan hopefully will help to hide the noise (I was too tired to get up in the middle of the night to figure out the controls!), but not the vibration. I'm afraid we're going to have to find somewhere else to stay in the future.

This hotel is superb, simply a hidden gem. our good sized room had a large ensuit, large TV, and a good sized fridge. The reception has an endless siupply of coffee available from the buffet breakfast untill evening time.7 minutes and $10 Taxi fare from Penn Station got us to 414 west 46th street, after we had checked into our room, we had a look at the provided street map, got our barings, and headed of into the big apple.Turn right out of the hotel and you are on 'resturant row' a good varied choice of resturants, stay on 46th street for four blocks (5-10mins) onto Broadway, This is very central for everything, 10 min walk to subway on 50th st, 15 mins to Central park, and also 15 mins to Macy's and the Empire state building.fill your boots, it's is up to you........

As stated above, I found little to like about the 414 Hotel. From the time I arrived and throughout my stay I was amazed out how much deferred maintenance I saw. My room, 305, had a space heater as the sole source of heat. It didn't have a thermostat that worked so I would get very hot and dehydrated and then when I turned it off, I got cold. All of the outlets in the room were being used so I had to unplug things to charge my things. Lighting is abysmal with no light source near the desk. There was mold in the shower and peeling paint all over. Hall carpets were filthy. They have a 72 hour cancellation policy which makes comparison shopping really difficult. Rather that stay here I would recommend The Jewel Hotel near Rockefeller Center. Brand new, about the same price.

My daughter and I stayed here during our first visit to NYC. The room was bigger and more comfortable than I expected. The staff was very helpful - they allowed us to stow our luggage with them both before and after checkout so we could explore the city, and brought our bags down the stairs for us. The seating area in the lobby is small, but I have no complaints. It was easy enough for us to bring our breakfast upstairs, and I appreciate that they use real dishes. The location was another plus, as we could easily walk to Times Square and subway stations, yet it was quiet. We'd stay here again if we hopefully get back to NYC!

We enjoyed our stay at 414 Hotel. This is the best alternative tho the skyscraper-type of hotels in the area.Only two blocks away from Times Square, yet in a very pleasant neighborhood,where the hight of the buildings is limited and there are trees along the street.There are plenty of restaurants nearby. The room was clean, facing the little charming terrace on the back, hence no street noise. Breakfast was included, we sat at a rather small table with other guests.Sweats, doughnuts, coffee, tea, fruit juice, etc. No complains, this hotel was perfectly in line with what we paid for.

Was referred to this Hotel and could not have been happier with the choice. Two blocks from Times Square! Rooms were clean and tidy, beds were comfortable, daily breakfast was great and free access to the internet certainly made keeping up with news from home a breeze. Would have no hesitation in going back next time I visit the Big Apple.

Great place to stay. The rooms are super clean and good-sized. Breakfast is a wholesome affair. Nice to be able to talk to other visitors over bagels, orange-juice and coffee. Very quiet and very welcoming. Loved it and would definately come back. Can't wait to...

I really loved the place. Its very near of main atractions, situated in a street known as Restaurant Row. Great rooms, great queen size bed in our room, very very clean. The staff is the most charming and helpful I've ever found in a hotel. Just want to go back!

Okay, if I could afford the Mandarin or perhaps Crosby Street I would stay there, but I can’t! Pricing and availability of NYC hotel rooms can be shocking. Hence why for more than 7 years I have been staying here, and do so several times a year. The owners of the hotel are constantly reinvesting and adding better touches. It is brilliant value for money and I would highly recommend it. The rooms are spacious, very clean and if you get at the back of the hotel extremely quiet; rare for NYC! I love the location of Hells Kitchen; so many fab restaurants, bars, theatres and swift access to the metro (as well as Newark airport). So, unless you want to pay mega $$$ for a hotel product you can trust (meaning there are many expensive hotels that do not deliver value or even basic requirements) then you will not be disappointed by Hotel 414. I highly recommend it.

I lived in New York for 10 years and passed by this place a few times without knowing it was there. In my younger years I even hung out in the neighborhood unaware of this quaint place. I wish I had known, I could have recommended it to several friends and family over the years. Extremely well-maintained, nice size rooms, comfortable beds. The one draw back that people with disabilities or older persons should know is that it is a walk-up; no elevators or lifts. Stairs were a bit steep if you had to go past the 3rd or 4th floor, but sturdy railings and not overly narrow. Office staff is nice. Kitchen is small but stocked well. As someone who was looking for a good value in the neighborhood I found one. I would go back. It has an almost bed and breakfast type feel. My room was right by a stairwell however it was not noisy at all and I sometimes am a fairly light sleeper when sleeping away from home -- I had no problem. Though it was no frills, I was impressed with the free internet even though I didn't try it out. Lots of hotels in the area still charge. With all the problems of bed bugs and other problems associated with New York hotels, even posh spots, I was very pleased with my stay and felt that hotel took pride in itself and tried to offer a comfortable and clean experience for its guests. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in much of NY over the years, and this (although simple) was by far one of the better and enjoyable stays.

What a wonderful little Boutique Hotel this is. The location is fantastic, there are literally dozens of restaurants within a 2 block radius. The Hotel itself is 2 brownstones. We stayed in the rear building on the third floor. The room was spotless and very comfortable. It was quiet and very dark for sleeping. Every employee we came in contact with couldn't have been any nicer or more accommodating. The continental breakfast is served in the lobby every morning from 7 - 10 a.m. It saves you a few dollars and there is a communal dining table where you can meet and chat with other guests if you wish. There is a computer available for guests to use free of charge, which is nice and convenient. My teenage daughter inadvertently left an envelope filled with her hard earned cash on the dresser before we left for the day. When she realized it, she walked back to the hotel. The room had been made up and the cash was still in its envelope on the dresser, untouched. I was very impressed by the honesty of the housekeeper and I informed the Management. We discovered a wonderful Turkish restaurant on the next street called Smyrna. Please do yourself a favor and try it if you like delicious food and wonderful service. I guarantee you will love it. All in all, an excellent stay. We'll stay again next time.

I booked in at the 414 because I had tickets to a Broadway show in winter, and wanted to be able to walk to the theater in case the weather was bad. However, I didn't want to stay in a Times Sq. mega-hotel, so the 414 was perfect. It's just 2 blocks from all the theaters, but has the charm of a European city small hotel. The decor is contemporary, sheets & towels clean & soft, nice bathroom and comfortable bed. Continental breakfast featured delicious mini-bagels & croissants. We arrived well before check-in at 3:00, but the friendly & helpful staff let us store our luggage without a problem, and offered to call when our room was ready, which turned out to be 12:30. For $168/night, I would go back in a flash, but next time would request a room in their back building, which gives onto a quiet courtyard, and not the surprisingly busy W. 46th St. (looks quietly residential, but lots of horses in the morning!). Also, might not go back in dead of winter, as there was more heat than I needed (it's an all-or-nothing situation with the boiler), but this was in no way a deal-breaker. A great find!

This is our sixth trip to NYC and this year we found the best place to stay. We loved everything about this small hotel. The entire staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were decorated well and immaculate. The continental breakfast was included each morning and was excellent. The location was amazing because it was easy walking distance to the theaters and Times Square. We discovered some fabulous restaurants just around the corner. The hotel is located in the historic Hells Kitchen area but has been renovated and we felt safe at all times. We met people from several different countries and enjoyed sharing some time with them. There is a lovely courtyard to enjoy if you stay there during nice weather. Our room overlooked it and it was a very quiet location. We felt lucky to find such a great place to stay by using Trip Advisor.

This was my second stay at the 414 Hotel for a weekend trip to NYC. This has definitely become the hotel I will always stay in when I visit the city. Location is great with dozens of restaurant choices within walking distance. Short walk to Times Square/subway/Rockefeller Center/and other sights. They held our bags for us in the lobby after our checkout so that we could explore the city too. They accommodated us for a very late check-in the first night as well.I could hear doors closing and people walking overhead but it wasn't bad. Normal hotel noise. Ask for a room on a high floor if that bothers you, just remember that there is no elevator so you have to walk steep stairs to upper floors. No bed bug issues at this hotel either.One thing I noticed this time is that the free high speed wireless internet ran a little slow. It was faster for me to use the 3G on my phone instead of the internet. They may want to boost the speed in the future.Overall, another great stay. At less than $300 a night, I definitely recommend staying here.

We have just come back from a 4 night break in NYC and stayed in 414 Hotel and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location with only a few minutes walk from Time Square. Located on a quiet street with loads of restaurants and bars near by. The staff where very friendly and the facilities where excellent - docking station in the room, large flat screen TV, safe in the room, tea/coffee available throughout the day at reception and a free continental breakfast each morning! The room was clean and very comfortable, and quiet large - enough space for all the shopping bags! We had a lovely court yard where we could sit and have a coffee, plus free WIFI making planning the next days activities much easier - and so handy for staying in touch with friends and family back home! We would recommend this hotel to anyone either for business or leisure - we will be back!

In an area full of hotels large and small this is one that stands out. Located near to many eateries, attractions, Port Authority Bus Station - to and from Newark Liberty airport - and 42nd St subway station, our room was large by NYC standards with a good sized bathroom and a large flatscreen TV.  This is not a new build hotel and so doesn't have many of the features that are associated with modern chain hotels. But it does have charm. The lobby is well lit and an open fire greeted us on return at night. The staff are courteous but not intrusive (I was always greeted politely as I set out on my wanderings at half-past six each morning).Many rooms overlook the small but quiet courtyard and it wasn't the street noise but the sound of whistling staff at 4am (New York Time!) that woke me. Still it is reassuring to know that the hotel is really manned at night.There is no restaurant but there is a complimentary self-service continental breakfast that is taken in the lobby. Plenty of hot alternatives on can be found on 9th Avenue and in the general area. Evening meals can be had - well anywhere back along 46th Street, up and down 9th Avenue, with every taste and price range catered for.Tip: Be aware that there is no lift/elevator in this hotel so pack light!Tip: Complimentary internet service is available either from the terminal in the lobby or own computer. But like all hotels this can be slow and problematic. A charge is made for printing. Tip: No laundry service but plenty of wash and fold places in the area - including one a couple of doors away.Tip: Although the hotel and the area is safe, visitors should always take the normal safety precautions that they would in any city location - particularly if they venture towards 10th, 11th or 12th avenues in the hours of darkness.Stop Press: Having just read my review to my traveling partner she summed it up with 'I'd go back and stay there again!' So there you are.

I took my 70yr old mother up to see PeeWee Herman's opening night on Broadway and found this hotel via a friend. I travel a lot on business and have been to NYC many times since 1982. This is the 1st trip I actually enjoyed our accomodations!  My mom and I enjoyed a clean room w/ excellent service and the location is fantastic! The front desk help was great in every aspect. Even though we only had twin beds, they were very comfy & the room was spacious by NYC standards. Our 2nd floor room on 46th St was great for feeling the vibe of the city. We especially enjoyed walking up & down restaurant row, then over to Times Square! I highly recommend this hotel to business and leisure travelers!

This is a wonderful little hotel that is located in the heart of New York City. While the office area, sitting room and hallways are somewhat small; the rooms are very nicely sized. The rooms have all been updated with flat screen large televisions. The bathrooms are very large and nice. Having made our reservations online and not knowing what to expect, we were so pleasantly surprised. They also have a very lovely courtyard that you could sit and relax in.

If you are looking for a meticulously clean room and bathroom, a bed with kooshy comforter and pillows, a convenient location on a street with ginko trees along it, a courteous staff, a continental breakfast as well as hot beverages available all day, look no further. And check out the price compared to bigger hotels that operate at the same frantic pace as the City! Maybe the 414 isn't perfect, but it's very good.

This was the best place ever to stay in NYC. Quiet street and only 3 blocks from Times Square! Very very clean and being on the 4th floor was fantastic! We will be back! I have already recommended this place by adding it to my FaceBook!

Wow...what a GREAT LOCATION for our first time visit to NYC!! This quaint european-style hotel is where my Mom and I stayed for 5 nights. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly, our room was clean with great bedding and comfy beds, and the continental breakfast and delicious coffee was a great way to start our day! A few minutes walk to Times Square, Broadway and shopping..... not to mention fabulous pubs and/or restaurants everywhere in the surrounding blocks. We will definitely be back and look forward to our 2nd visit to the 414 Hotel!

I am right now in the 414 Hotel and VERY happy that I am here and that I didn't select one of New York's many, big, impersonal hotels for my first time visit. The 414 Hotel is close to all the amazing action on Time Square and the very reasonably priced and easy to comprehend New York subway system. 414 Hotel is on an attractive, relatively quiet, tree-lined street that contains well maintained tenement houses and small, intimate, quality but not overly pricey restaurants. Having our continental breakfast (included in the price) in the hotel courtyard is a very pleasant way to start the day. Our bedroom and bathroom is of a good size and is modern in its decor and, very importantly, the bed is very comfortable. There is also free internet in the lobby and wifi access throughout the hotel. There is a bit of a climb to our third floor but it is worth every step. I am almost hesitant to tell others about this lovely place but it was Tripadvisor that made me aware of it in the first place so it is only right that I now let others know about how nice and 'worth every cent' it is. I would definitely stay here again and am already telling my friends that their stay in New York must include this hotel. Our friends just finished their 3-night stay at a big New York hotel on 7th Avenue, directly across from Madison Square Gardens, paid far more than us and are VERY disappointed (TripAdvisor reviews on this run-down over-priced hotel are not wrong.) Don't risk it! 414 Hotel is wonderful. To stay elsewhere could be a big mistake.

This is the second time we have stayed at the 414 Hotel located conveniently on West 46th Street on Restaurant Row in the theatre district. The rooms are spacious and clean, with comfortable beds and nice bedding. Personnel are helpful and polite. This is billed as a Bed and Breakfast and since new ownership, they have done better with the breakfast selections, all continental. There is a table and chairs in the small lobby and also a very pretty garden area in back where you can sit and talk or have your breakfast. This hotel is reasonably-priced and well located.

The Hotel 414 was the perfect place to stay while taking in the rich culture and excitement of Manhatten. The breakfast at this boutique hotel was a bonus. The only downfall is that there is no elevator, therefore I'd recommend asking for a room on the lower floors.

I liked the fact that this hotel is not another anonymous concrete high rise building but rather something unique to the area ie Brownstones. The room was a little tired but it has everything you need, including a very efficient cooling system. As far as prices go and value for money we felt that Hotel 414 was an excellent deal.We were out the back in the courtyard part which was very quiet (unless other guests were sitting out in the courtyard area but they didn't stay out late) and it felt very safe.The location of the hotel is brilliant as you are so close to 'restaurant row', Broadway, Times Square and sightseeing tours. We loved the fact that we could just walk a couple of blocks to the Broadway show and buying food or drink is so easy - you are surrounded by places.There is a small kitchenette near the lobby which is open during the day (til 8pm) and it has a couple of microwaves, a jug, brewed coffee and assorted drinks available for guests and the breakfast in the mornings is also served in this lobby area. They serve croissants/muffins and cereals as well as fruit and juices.

We recently spent $787 (with taxes) for 3 nights at this hotel. I was not impressed with anything. The room was ok. The walls had some scuff marks and could have used a new paint job. The free breakfast was ok but there was no place to eat it. The staff was ok but when I commented on our room being less than perfect the staff person got very defensive and was less than friendly.The photos on the website made the place look better than it really was. I will not be staying there again but rather will stay at the hotel at times square on the same street .

This is really a great hotel in a perfect location. Only 2 blocks away from Times Square and right in the center of Restaurant Row.Rooms and bathrooms are roomy plus a flatscreen tv.Breakfast is fine and access to coffee, flavored coffee or tea at all times.Ok it doesn't have an elevator, but they bring your bags up to your room when you arrive.The only problem was with the wireless, but if you really need to use the internet they have a computer with free access in the lobby.I think you are just to far away from the source on the 3rd floor so it doesn't work well.All in all we'll come back for sure on our next trip.

Do not stay at the 414 Hotel. It is super dirty, smelly, small, you can hear right outside your door as well. It is like a college dorm room but worse. I recommend a Hilton hotel. The star rating system is not reliable, especially in NY. If you are the type that is picky about cleanliness and loudness, you are not gonna be happy here. We also tried The Roosevelt, which claimed it had 3.5 stars, but the bed was soooo uncomfortable and you could hear the people above us having sex.

We were given a room off the lobby, which meant there was a lot of noise both early in the morning (when people were getting breakfast) and late at night (when people returned after an evening out). It also didn't feel very safe, because the front door seemed to be open all the time. They said there was a concierge there 24 hrs but there were times we came back and didn't see anyone. The bed was definitely comfortable but it was hard to sleep with all the noise and the anxiety about being in Hell's Kitchen, right off the lobby, when anybody could just walk in.Our room was small (from talking to others there, I am guessing the other rooms on other floors were larger, but then you have to drag your luggage up those floors by yourself, so it's kind of a lose/lose proposition) and didn't seem very clean or well kept-up. There was no closet, just a hat tree kind of thing and a small rack, and the TV was pretty small and very close to the bed.Neither of us thought this hotel was worth what it cost us. Yes, May in New York is prime time, but even so, we could have had better hotels for the same price and took this one because of all the good reviews.

I used Trip Advisor to find this hotel for a visit to NY with my partner. The hotel is cozy and ideally located in midtown, very close to Times Square, making is convenient for walking or taking the subway to anywhere in Manhattan. There is a lovely inner courtyard and reception area, with a 24 hr pantry which is a welcome service. The recently renovated room was a good size, as well as the bathroom. Service in the hotel was friendly and efficient. It certainly lived up to expectations with excellent service provided by Sakina, the hotel manager, even before we arrived. We received a friendly welcome and she recommended restaurants, museums, Broadway shows and events going on in the city to make the best use of our time in New York. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a leisure trip and would certainly stay there again.

We picked this hotel after reading other guests reviews. We were not disappointed. Warm and welcoming (on a bitterly cold evening!!), room and bathroom very clean and spacious, just what we wanted. The complimentary breakfast set us up for the busy day ahead of sightseeing. The location of the hotel was superb, just 10 minutes from Times Square, in fact apart from hop on hop off bus tour we walked everywhere. Brilliant 5 days whole visit a real treat and we will definately be back to Hotel 414 and New York city.

If you want a good base to sightsee from that is clean and comfortable and wont blow your budget then this charming little place is for you. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was fine. We had to lug our bags a cple of flights but that was ok. All in all it was a lovely stay.

I'm so happy I found this hotel on TripAdvisor!! My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to stay for New Year's Eve and this was the perfect place. It's an older hotel that gave a European ambiance. It was clean, had modern decoration and the staff and other travelers were pleasant. It's location was perfect. We walked all around NYC from this hotel, taking the subway part of the time. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying here again for future NYC trips.
